title: Standard Rock film
text: The Rock plays the Rock and Ryan Reynolds plays Ryan Reynolds.A Sunday afternoon kind of movies. Not amazing but ok for tv.Imagine a sequel will be made.

title: Very Meh
text: Not as good as I was anticipating. A few good jokes and fight scenes, but the script was bland and the visuals looked fake. An all star cast but no substance to the story or characters.

title: Netflix has Money Burn
text: When Netflix has money to burn, it can afford to spend a fortune on A-listers for a movie that cranks out one liner's at the speed of a Gatling gun, in a high polish production with no other redeeming value. The costumes and sets were terrific, though.

title: What happens when you put three attractive & charismatic lead actors in a movie with a cookie-cutter plot?
text: Red Notice is an interesting experiment to see what happens when you put three attractive and charismatic lead actors in a movie with a cookie-cutter plot. As it turns out, it's pretty enjoyable. And while the twists and turns don't really make sense, I still found myself smirking at the jokes and allowing ridiculousness because I was having a good time. Red Notice doesn't break any new ground, but it's a safe bet if you're looking for an action comedy to pass the time.

title: Just have fun with it
text: Look, if you go into this hoping for Skyfall, ya you're gonna hate it. But come on, this thing is clever! It's got a good pace to it, beautiful set pieces, and true Hollywood star power. It's cool. Don't hate, just enjoy the thing for gods sake!

title: Unbelievable plot
text: There are far too many convenient events in the film, it is just not believable. It's one unlikely event after another, that it really challenges logic and reality. I didn't quite enjoy the film as a result.

title: fun, action, but annoying somehow
text:
Weird flick, even as it has a lot of action and funny moments still it wasn't really my thing.Dis I laugh yes sure I did especially with the car/motorbike chase and in some situations but the problem I had, the acting was well, how do I say. The main leads were all doing what they do best, and espescially with the Ryan jokes it reminded me a lot of Deadpool.It's not that the acting was bad, guess it's the script.So overall a family flick...typical netflixGore 0/5
Nudity 0/5
Effects 4/5
Story 2;5/5
Comedy 1,5/5.

title: Stupid but fun
text: This isn't going to win any awards but it was enjoyable and pretty dam funny. I love the cast which helps. Would watch a sequel quite happily. 7.5/10.

title: Midly entertaining
text: It is an Indiana Jones wannabe with the cultural -historical element to rob and, of course, the nazis once had it. It is funny but due to Ryan Reynolds's character being a projection of deadpool.The CGI is too noticeable and it bothers me.

title: A bland and charmless adventure romp
text: It's been a few days since I sat down and watched Red Notice, yet despite only mere hours passing in time I find myself struggling to recall anything of note in a film that fails to create a spark of imagination or excitement.Costing $200 million to make and starring some of the entertainment industries most well-liked stars, Notice is a flashy Netflix exclusive that recently became the streaming services biggest day one hit but despite its high quality coat of paint, Rawson Marshall Thurber's lifeless and charmless action/comedy romp is an instantly forgettable and an incessantly bland blockbuster that is merely coasting along at all times.Spanning a global collection of locales, that often are infused with a seriously distracting amount of poorly done green screen due to the film having to shoot through the Covid-19 pandemic, Notice should be a fun and frantic jaunt across the globe as we follow Dwayne Johnson's Interpol agent John Hartley (proving once more he loves a dress up more than anyone), Ryan Reynolds (wouldn't have guessed it) smart mouthed thief Nolan Booth and Wonder Woman herself Gal Gadot as the mysterious Bishop as the trio hunt down some priceless egg artefacts and try outsmart each other along the way.Utilising a well-trodden path that was experienced by cinema fans with the likes of the Indiana Jones and early The Mummy franchises, Notice sadly lacks any of the smarts or style those type of entertaining romps possessed as Thurber struggles to bring much to the table when it comes to the action stakes, with many set pieces looking like a glorified video game rather than a top notch cinematic production, while his cast can't salvage the film from the boredom it will induce with fairly pedestrian turns that do nothing to enhance their reputations as Hollywood heavyweights.Recently announcing his break from Hollywood for the foreseeable future after a number of years plying away busily in a number of productions, Notice marks a new low for the career trajectory of Ryan Reynolds in particular who has become a walking and talking caricature of his real life persona mixed with Deadpool's initially charming boundary pushing and wisecracks.Trying little too do anything he hasn't done in his last handful of big films, Reynolds seems content to sleepwalk through his roles of recent times and his lethargy in bringing the potentially entertaining Booth to life here is a key example of just how tiresome and unenthusiastic this heist/adventure is, with Reynolds lame turn but one component of a film that does nothing too distinguish itself from the pack and seems content with merely existing rather than finding a reason to make us care or wish for more of where this came from.Final Say -A sadly typical Netflix waste of money, Red Notice should be a mindlessly entertaining and exciting ride but it's nothing more than a tiresome and trite example of modern day blockbuster film-making, the type of film-making that may get nice numbers to report on in regards to streaming performances but does nothing else worth remembering.1 1/2 Vin Diesel audition tapes out of 5.

title: Very enjoyable...
text: Of course I had to sit down to watch the 2021 action crime comedy titled "Red Notice" given the three leading performers that starred in this movie. Had I heard about the movie prior to finding it on Netflix? Nope. But then again, I don't really bother keeping up with trailers and forthcoming releases.Writer and director Rawson Marshall Thurber definitely managed to put together a very entertaining and wholesome storyline and plot for "Red Notice". And it was a story that contains a good amount of action, comedy, thrills and plot twists. So yeah, I was certainly entertained from the very beginning and up to the end. And I must also admit that some of the plot twists were rather enjoyable and some that I hadn't foreseen coming.Needless to say that with a cast that includes Ryan Reynolds, Gal Gadot and Dwayne Johnson, then of course you are in for a stellar time with great performances. And the three lead performers definitely delivered. It should be noted that the performance from Chris Diamantopoulos and Daniel Bernhardt were also good, just wish that the latter had a bigger part to play in the movie."Red Notice" takes you all across the world in a wonderful heist adventure with interesting characters, fast paced action, good comedy and also good dialogue. And the fact that the movie was very dynamic in its cinematography definitely helped to sell the movie.You should certainly sit down to watch "Red Notice" if you get the chance.My rating of "Red Notice" lands on a very well-deserved eight out of ten stars.

title: Snappy-Paced Cheeky-Banter Escapism Theme Park Ride
text: Like a movie studio theme park ride, the sets and props are exactly as one would have imagined, as is the non-stop witty repertoire one would expect from the three stars [Reynolds, Johnson and Gadot].Borrowing heavily from Indiana Jones, National Treasure, and Jackie Chan films, this heist action film injects each star's individual movie trademark style throughout.Set design and photography quality are very good, however the story itself barely gets a passing D grade, and therefore the suspense element that one expects from an interesting heist/action film is completely missing.There is nothing new here, so Red Notice leans completely on the magnetic personalties of the three leads to keep your interest, and they indeed deliver the fun banter for which each star is known.Red Notice receives a "instant_palmer" overall barely passing C- grade and I can only recommend to view if you are ok with a film that rates well BELOW 'National Treasure', leaning on a marginal-at-best screenplay.

title: UNWORTHY
text: I don't understand when a movie gets a green light, signs big name actors to carry said movie, clearly not short of a decent budget - why in God's name do the producers f * * k this up with a mediocre, haphazard script ?That said this movie is NOT unwatchable, however it is very, VERY far from good.I wasn't angered or wanted to slit my wrist watching this, instead I spent 2 hours imagining how much better it could've been.It's the McDonald's version of movies.When you think of burgers last place you think about buying a decent burger from is Maccas - but at least ya know it's convenient, cheap and clean.That's what Netflix has become - "convenient & cheap"I've given this flick 4/10.Nuff said.

title: Ryan Reynolds carried the whole movie
text: The Rock and Gal Gadot are here with their boring acting. But Ryan Reynolds comic timing is good and made the whole movie enjoyable.I even think Rock isn't fit for the roll. However the movie is entertainment packed. Generic story line with some fight scenes.

title: I hated that i liked it
text: I was certain that i was going to hate this movie, in fact i wanted to. Just an one more pointless action more of the same, told myself. But somewhere in the process i started feeling guilty cause i thought ''how can i possibly enjoy this?''.Its way better than Dwaynes other recent films and similar movies of this kind in general. I think it had to do with the pacing and the simple plot. I mean they could so easily put in there a ''save the world scenario'' but im glad they choose not.

title: Average Globetrotting Caper
text: Three of today's mega stars come together to deliver a fairly ordinary action comedy. It looks nice for the most part (except for the CGI bull), and it generates some laughs from Reynolds and Johnson's banter, though mostly just Reynolds, but it's nothing new from any of the parties. The action is over the top, along with any believability.Just know that it leaves no lasting impression, and merely entertains for the moment.

title: Very good
text: Very funny old school adventure! Excellent cast for this kind of movie. Nice plot twist. Funny Ryan, not so funny Dwayne, always beautiful Gal Gadot. Realistic fight scenes. 7.5 out of ten from me.

title: We got bored
text: Three good actors with some comedy but zzzz. We checked email and surfed FB. Impossible twist after silly coincidence. Bored and uninspired. Just never came together.

title: Tedious
text: Most unoriginal crime/comedy, done a billion times before, not necessarily better, but with less pretentiousness. You know who the three leads are and two of them are sort of unbearable, Reynolds wisecracking non-stop without being funny in the least and Gadot as the coolest, sexiest (and most pretentious and unlikely) thief in the world. The Rock is playing it straighter, as the alleged FBI profiler pursuing criminals around the world, but I wouldn't consider it award-worthy.It is that type of movie where scenes take place all around the world, each geographical shift announced in large, red letters screaming LONDON, BALI, VALENCE or whatever, each location being only a pathetic excuse to drag the plot along a little more. Said plot should be about recovering three golden eggs that belonged to Cleopatra, but when I wrote that, I realized how stupid it sounds, because it is stupid. It could have been about recovering Plato's papyrus or Caesar's chessboard, anything just as absurd and stupid sounding...The movie played on Netflix until the end only because hubby watched it, while I played a videogame and wondered if Reynolds was ever going to shut up.

title: Funny action flick
text: Funny, entertaining, and somewhat clean. Was definitely a good watch. Don't believe all these negative reviews. It's a good watch. Ryan does his usual quick witted responses, rock is little bit more tame than his usual characters, and gadot was interesting seeing play an antagonist.

title: Forgettable and basic, but altogether not bad
text: Charming stars but a generic script- Red Notice feels too bland to be anything memorable, but does have its moments. First off, how can you not love the cast for this movie? Ryan Reynolds, Dwayne Johnson, Gal Gadot- clearly everyone knew that was going to be a win. The film has a lot of funny jokes spread throughout, and it's surprisingly shot very well. The action scenes are well choreographed, although familiar, and I will have to say in a technical aspect this film was really well done- as well as the visual designs, set pieces, and costumes throughout. As for the films story and screenplay though, I am far less thrilled. This film is just about the most generic action movie i've ever seen, like every heist film, Indiana Jones and James Bond had a baby- and it can be enjoyable at times, but it feels so empty all the same, and hardly makes for the potential a cast like this could have had in a film. The story is overdone, and there are so many formulaic and cliche attributes and twists that it can simply just be frustrating at times. It's quite baffling that a reported 200 million went into a film directed by the guy who did Rampage- by far one of the worst action films I can recall in recent memory- and yet it was done, and here it is? Do I think this film was worth the 200 million, absolutely not! Did it have its moments, sure. It's not a total bore, it had its fun parts, and it knew what its strengths were. In the end, Red Notice is not anything memorable or terrific. It could have been worse knowing what I have seen this director's previous works, but it just felt rather mediocre, in long of something special it never could quite grasp.My Rating: 4.6/10.

title: Plot from the 90s, humor from the 2020s.
text: It's a baby of plot from the 90s and humor of the 2020s.If you grew up in the 90s watching those movies, then you already know every twist, makes this movie extremely predictable. If you didn't, then it might be alright for you.For the rest, we just have to try to ignore that and it can be just okay for one time. Could be better without all these one-liners.

title: Just what i needed
text: It is fast,it is funny,it is action packed and it doesn't take itself seriously.The action set peices are good the cinematography is better and most of all it doesn't waste time. The chemistry between Dwayne Johnson and Ryan Reynolds is the best thing in the film with of course goddess itself.All around pretty decent action flick which we rarely get these days i enjoyed it thoroughly.

title: Red Notice
text: Director and writer Rawson Marshall Thurber makes a late bid to direct an Indiana Jones movie. A character even whistles the Indy theme.With the Rock in the cast, it even pays homage to James Cameron's True Lies. There is even sultry Tango dance scene.Red Notice is a caper movie. John Hartley (Dwayne Johnson) is a profiler who is after art thief Nolan Booth (Ryan Reynolds) over three ancient fabled jewelled eggs given to Cleopatra.Getting in their way is the world's most wanted art thief called The Bishop (Gal Gadot) who always seems to be one step ahead.After being framed, Hartley needs to team up with Booth to clear his name.This is a mismatched buddy movie. Reynolds is untrustworthy and quick with the wisecracks. The Rock is there for the action scenes although you might raise an eyebrow when he gets a beating from Gadot.It is high octane and a lot of mindless fun. I rather enjoyed it. The Nazi vehicle car chase is on the silly side. It does have plenty of CGI, mainly due to a lack of international location shooting because of Covid.

title: 3 of the biggest stars in the world can't quite create magic
text: This is pretty much what you'd expect given the stars and the Netflix tag. I am a bit disappointed that this film took the lamest, most cliched route to the ending, but it's a fairly fun and breezy film for the most part.Reynolds and Johnson are basically playing themselves as usual, which works pretty well as their banter keeps things humming along. There are plenty of twists and exotic locales. The running total on The Rock being in jungle-adjacent movies continues to climb. This film more than any thus far showcased how poor Gal Gadot's acting really is. She has a presence on film, but anything more than looking seductive seems to be a struggle for her.Red Notice will likely be one of the most watched films of they year and viewers should mostly get their money's worth.

title: Derivative but good fun
text: Starts out like Mission Impossible - including a Simon Pegg lookalike - then morphs into Raiders of the Lost Ark, including Nazi references. Some funny moments thanks to Ryan Reynolds.

title: An A-lister's excuse for a lavish holiday...
text: A soulless, superficial, hollow, corporate product, devoid of character, chemistry, warmth, charm or any semblance of personality.It's ironic that in a film which centres around the unhealthy, immoral consumption & accumulation of artwork (& how individuals fail to appreciate it for what it is - only caring about a piece's financial value), that same lack of artistry (& the prioritisation of needlessly gratuitous expenditure) is simultaneously reflected in the movie's filmmaking.

title: Worth the time
text: This movie is much better than Eternals. I mention the latter because the two films are currently in competition. In his third act, "Red Notice" is quite similar to Indiana Jones (2.3, even 4th). In some parts, the film is similar to Mission Impossible. And in its first two acts, it looks like Ocean's Eleven (12, etc.), but there's a lot of action as well as a lot of Ryan Reynolds humor. There are a few clever twists throughout the film, as well as at the end of the film. Definitely worth watching!

title: Third wheel
text: Or is it fifth wheel? I forget the saying - but it doesn't really matter because you only have three main characters here. If you don't count the woman chasing after Ryan Reynolds character. The movie overall seems quite straightforward. Odd choices by characters that don't make sense included - like things they do. I understand they are there to build suspense and tension, but they don't actually make sense.You'll understand once you've seen the movie. It is the type of movie that is overall "forgettable". In the sense that you probably won't think about it much - neither during watching it nor after having seen it. But the actors make it quite an enjoyable ride to take part of. Even Gal Gadot who I like and find quite attractive in general, but have not enjoyed acting wise as much, is quite fitting overall.Ryan Reynolds is his usual funny self - stealing the show if you allow the pun. Even though he wasn't a producer on this and only "acting" in this one. He said in interviews that it was quite freeing (a Free guy at last, sorry had to) - experience wise. Any fan of his will be more than excited watching the movie. Add the Rock as a spice and you can not do wrong. Lower your expectations and just go with the flow.

title: Just exactly what I expected
text: This is a plain fun adventure comedic action movie that boasts fun performances from Reynolds, Johnson and Gadot. Entertaining while it lasts, with enough twists along the way to keep you invested... And that's all. A formulatic fun and feel-good Netflix movie. While I have seen better ones (and this could have been better), it plays safe and never bores. Deserves a watch.

title: fun movie
text: First of all this an action comedy movie which isn't meant to be taken seriously. I like every movie Ryan Reynolds has been in. Dwayne Johnson is really good in this one. I really enjoyed this one. Good acting and writing. I give it a B rating.

title: So ridiculous, its Brilliant!
text: It's always a perfect pairing when you get the Rock and Ryan Reynolds in a movie together. Its as if someone said I have to stupidest idea for a movie but we have to make it, how can we possibly make this movie successful? Get the two action guys who, like not only can dwell in that stupidity but come out looking cool.This is not a stab at either The Rock or Reynolds, it's a compliment. While other action heroes have to play it cool and serious to try and make it work, these two never take it that seriously and are always in on the joke, which turns this movie around from the jump.Red Notice is a strange its not suppose to be funny but it is funny so go ahead and laugh at it, kind of thing for me and that just doubled my entertainment value.I was a little afraid for Gal Gadat who could have come off horrible between a Rock and a...Deadpool, but she held her own even better than she did in the first Wonder Woman film. The picture was obviously a buddy pic for the two beef cakes but every time Gadat was on the screen it was worth it and when she wasn't I wanted more.I'm very impress. Mr. Johnson spent a lot of time promoting this movie and Red Notice does stand up to his hype.

title: A Red-Hot Heist Thriller With Lots Of Action, Twists And Power-packed Entertainment.
text:
Red Notice (2021) :
Movie Review -Looking back at heist thrillers made in Hollywood, one can easily pick out best from recent franchise movies. Red Notice is a new attempt to glamorize those typical cliches and it definitely delivers what it promises from the trailer. It is not 'Mission Impossible' or 'Fast And Furious' Franchise Film but it makes a good combination of action packed entertainer and heist-thriller by altering many segments out of them. By the time we are going ahead with other franchise films and digital releases, Red Notice surely makes a fine popcorn entertainer for the weekend.An Interpol-issued red notice is a global alert to hunt and capture the world's most wanted. But when a daring heist brings together the FBI's top profiler John Hartley (Dwayne Johnson) and two rival criminals Nolan and Sarah (Ryan Reynolds and Gal Gadot), there's no telling what will happen. John is on the hunt while Nolan and Sarah are fighting to top each other. All this is just nothing in front of what film has to tell afterwards. Spoilers are strictly condemned here! Mouth shut. There are plenty of twists coming one after another, there's breathtaking action and then there is gripping screenplay. Those 90 minutes never look boring and that's the biggest triumph for Red Notice.When it comes to acting, these commercial potboilers aren't supposed to be tidy. Most of the people don't even care as far as they are enjoying explosive stuff. Red Notice is still decent there as Johnson looks pretty convincing as he carries his best suited macho image. Gadot sizzles in her Red Hot Avatar and in some scenes she beats out both the male forces. Compared to that, Reynold is quite a break as he succeeds to keep the humour alive. Talking about the action scenes and visuals, Red Notice gets a Green Signal. However, it is still red when it comes to using those old clinches. For instance, that smart heist in the beginning. You know how it's gonna happen and how it's gonna end cause all of it has been used hundreds of times before. We should be thankful to the action choreographer for literally taking away our breath a few times as well as the cameraman for those jittering close-up frames and superfast zooms.There isn't much to bash in this film but still if there's in anything, then it's stereotypes. Visually, it's a grand film and the production value is lavish too. Watching this film on Big-Screen will snatch away lot of shortcomings so it should be viewed accordingly. Action lovers have became used to all the tricks by now so, they won't be too harsh on Rawson Marshall Thurber, as a director. As a writer, he could have done better though. Summing up everything in short, Red Notice packs a solid punch of Action, Twists and Suprises in an old healthy heist drama.RATING - 6/10*

title: Exceeded expectations, but definitely a Netflix film.
text: Coming into watching this, learning it was going onto Netflix on Friday and paying for a cinema ticket, watching the trailer my expectations were low."Just another basic Dwayne Johnson action movie."My feelings after this were slightly surprised. The three main cast members nailed their roles. I felt like Ryan Reynolds made this, in a classic Ryan Reynolds way. The story was very basic, with lots of twists and turns, but kept me entertained until the very end. Lots of laughs, (again, thanks to Ryan Reynolds.) which makes it more great that it doesn't take it self too seriously but still has the seriousness when it needs to. I wouldn't recommend paying for cinema ticket, but watching it when it comes on Netflix. Definitely worth a watch.

title: Serviceable but unexceptional, Red Notice boasts a few entertaining set pieces but pales in comparison to its influences.
text: FBI agent John Hartley (Dwayne Johnson) working with INTERPOL's Inspector Das (Ritu Arya) hunt for art thief Nolan Booth (Ryan Reynolds) whose sights are set on one of a trio of bejewel eggs that were gifted to Cleopatra from Marc Anthony using intel obtained from another notorious thief known only as The Bishop. Following Booth's capture after Hartley and Das secure the egg, the egg is found to have been replaced with a fake and with planted clues involving Swiss bank accounts and forged documents, John soon finds himself framed for the theft and is sent to the same prison as Nolan. Eventually John and Nolan are visited by The Bishop (Gal Gadot) who reveals she used her connections to take out her completion with Nolan and her top pursuer with John, and makes an offer to Nolan for 10% of the score if he reveals the location of the final egg. Nolan refuses and The Bishop leaves them to secure the second egg with her expiring offer. Eventually John and Nolan are forced to team up with John after clearing his name and Nolan regaining the title of the world's #1 art thief.Announced in 2018, Writer/Director Rawson Marshall Thurber's buddy action-comedy Red Notice was acquired by Universal following a heated bidding war not unlike Thurber's previous film package Skyscraper which in 2016 was also considered a highly desired package. Following the somewhat tepid response to Skyscraper at the box office, Universal became apprehensive of Red Notice's $160 million price tag and the package was put into turnaround with Netflix acquiring the project as part of the slate of originals and when partway through filming like many productions in 2020 suspended production due to the COVD pandemic, eventually the film continued with readjustment in the final months of 2020 and was a harrowing experience for the cast and crew. There's certainly a lot of fun in Red Notice, but there's not much making Red Notice stand out.The film opens pretty strongly with a History Channel esque overview of the three bejeweled eggs which serve as our Macguffins for the movie which leads into a very strong opening chase in Rome with an elaborate museum heist, some really strong visual flourishes, and an elaborate action sequence involving collapsing scaffolds that's beautifully choreographed with graceful movements and nicely sets the stage for the playful action-comedy caper the movie strives for. The movie basically mixes a traditional buddy-action film set-up like 48 Hrs. Or Lethal Weapon, and mixes it with a bit of Dirty Rotten Scoundrels and maybe some National Treasure thrown in for good measure.While the movie has all the elements in place for high concept fun, the way they're assembled is unfortunately not to the level you'd hope for. Dwayne Johnson does well in the slightly acerbic hardscrabble action-hero even if admittedly it's very familiar territory calling to mind Johnson's stints in everything from Escape to Witch Mountain to even this year's Jungle Cruise but Johnson's such a charismatic presence he carries a lot of good will with him. Ryan Reynolds on the other hand I found really grating as a presence for much of the second act of the movie with the character seemingly trying to be a fast talking BSer, but instead comes off more like a petulant child who's acting out in ridiculous ways. I think maybe Reynolds was going for something along the lines of what Steve Martin did in Dirty Rotten Scoundrels where he's "successful" as a thief despite himself, but that type of character really only works when it has a grounded counterpoint that can give the character as good as he gets and Johnson never really attains that comedic friction with Reynolds more often looking like he's grumpy and trying to ignore Reynold's antics rather than react to them.And then we have Gal Gadot as our antagonist The Bishop and Gadot is unfortunately rather wasted here playing what basically amounts to an Amoral spin on Lara Croft (90s continuity, not the reboot) and aside from maybe a scene where she and Dwayne Johnson do a tango at an arms dealer's gala Gadot doesn't really have much presence as an antagonist coming off more as a minor obstacle more than anything else. The same is true of Ritu Arya's Inspector Das who despite her best efforts doesn't carry herself with much authority in the role of an Interpol agent and has even less presence than Gadot. Eventually after the rather flabby mid section of the movie the movie does pick up a lot in the third act with a fun sequence involving a bunker which leads into an underground car chase where multiple conflicting parties are all involved and the ending was twisty enough that I'm inclined to look upon my viewing experience in a mostly positive light, but I'm probably not going to be watering at the mouth for another adventure for these characters.Red Notice is an okay light action comedy with some impressive set pieces and a fun sense of adventure. The characters are unfortunately not on the level of other caper films that Red Notice aspires to be and Reynolds unfortunately comes off as pretty grating at certain points in the movie, but in terms of light hearted time killers you can certainly do worse.

title: I enjoyed it!
text: I've read the other reviews, and while I respect everyone's opinions, my partner and I actually enjoyed the movie! Ryan Reynolds's comedic timing is great, he delivers pretty hilarious one punch lines. I personally did not see the twists coming (maybe I'm not that intelligent) so I did let out a gasp or two. Gal Gadot is gorgeous in here as she's in everywhere. I actually kind of liked her accent in here compared to WW. I enjoyed the plot, the jokes, the twists. I think it's a great movie to watch even once.

title: Pure popcorn fun
text: Sometimes you just have to turn your mind off and enjoy the movie and this is it. I enjoyed the silliness and over the top gun of this film. I enjoyed all the three leads and I enjoyed the story. The cgi at times was bad but meh what can you do. I do hope they make a sequel cause I really enjoyed this action heist film.

title: A fun caper film
text: In the opening prologue we are told that Mark Anthony gave Cleopatra three jewel encrusted eggs as a wedding present. After their deaths the eggs were lost until two were discovered in 1907. One is in a Rome museum, one is owned by Sotto Voce, an arms dealer, and the other is still lost.After a tip off from an art thief known as 'The Bishop, 'FBI Profiler Special Agent John Hartley believes that rival art thief Nolan Booth is planning to steal the first egg so heads to Rome with Interpol agent Urvashi Das and a team of police to arrest him. The operation appears to go well but the egg disappears; Hartley is accused of being involved and finds himself in the same Russian jail cell as Booth. Hartley wants to clear his name and arrest the thieves but to do that he will have to form an unlikely alliance with Booth and seek the eggs. Before the adventure is over they will have visited several countries and faced various dangers. There will also be further twists.It must be stated that this is a fairly silly film that requires the viewer to suspend disbelief and enjoy the ride; if one can do that it is rather fun. There is a lot of action in a series of exciting set pieces; fights; chases, shooting and explosions but nobody is seen to be killed. There are plenty of laughs to be had; usually provided by the banter between Booth and Hartley. The three leads; Dwayne Johnson, Ryan Reynolds and Gal Godot put in solid and enjoyable performances as Hartley, Booth and The Bishop; other notable performances come from Ritu Arya as Urvashi Das and Chris Diamantopoulos as Sotto Voce. Overall I'd say this is well worth watching if you want a brain-in-neutral thrill ride with excitement and laughs but not much to cause offence.

title: Hard Skip
text: Such a shame to see this great cast wasted on such a shallow movie. Their attempted humour was more cringe and sad than anything else. I can assure everyone, that you've already seen this a thousand times before. Its like all the new movies. The special effects look fake as hell. Potential wasted, disappointing excuse for a movie.

title: You can easily avoid
text: I believe it is criminal waste of USD 160 Million. It is a failed attempt to create a movie similar to Indiana Jones Series.Actors are famous but their acting is worst . These type of action shots have been shown in so many movies that they look childish now.

title: Part "The Sting, part "Indiana Jones"
text: Ah thank you IMDB raters! Again, your rating algorithm worked miles ahead of Rotten Tomatoes. Had I listened to the critics I would not have spent a pleasant afternoon with just mindless fun. And that's what it is. Fun.This is a grift upon a grift upon a heist movie that knows what it is. It makes several references to knowing it's a movie (The MacGuffin) and still takes you on the ride with three very likable people. For those who are fatigued of Reynolds-ese, you will tire of him quickly. For the rest of us...it's still a lot of fun. And watching The Rock slow burn has always been hilarious. Yes, a ton of logic flaws. Such as the elaborate nature of the scheme. Dissecting it would aggravate you. Not me. The music tells you to leave that at the door. A fun ride.

title: Comedy and action was good
text: Ryan Reynolds humour is what the kept the movie going, Dwanye Johnson character was pretty much the same. The twist in the end was unexpected, However if they are planning for a part 2 it better be good.

title: Ryan Reynolds is fun, the geographical mistakes are terrible
text: Not an elaborated movie, but is fun to watch. Ryan Reynolds playing himself is always fun. They did some mistakes in every country they shown in the movie, like Argentina beind in the middle of Brazil, Italy being a place filled with fools and other things.In overall is a hollywood standard comedy.

title: 3 Eggs
text: Reynolds, Johnson and Gadot are a fun mix. Everyone is out for Cleopatara's 3 ancient eggs and it's cross after double cross. Reynolds is a master at the sarcastic throw aways.

title: I had plenty of fun
text: Ryan had me crackin up the entire time. Loved the twist too. I wasn't looking for it so I didn't see it coming. The Rock has uncanny charisma and I will give whatever he is in an honest viewing.

title: For what it is ,
text: It was a lot of fun ! Nothing really serious about this film , but combination of great actors , decent action and adventures in different countries made it definitely pleasurable one time week end watch !

title: Ladies & Gentlemen, I Implore you...
text: We've all seen this movie many times unless you're 13 and never watched a heist movie before. Good production values. Reynolds's is annoying. Dwayne is Dwayne. Gladot? Guess what. Terrible script. Lowest common denominator. I implore you to ask for more. Watch something better.

title: Here I was thinking we will never get a good Uncharted movie
text: While Sony is concocting what they think is Uncharted with some of the weirdest casting for beloved game characters, the real Uncharted movie had arrived!

title: Indiana Jones and the Temple of Deadpool
text: Campy, hokey and predictable as any movie in its genre, RED NOTICE brings nothing new or innovative to a genre made famous by franchises like Indiana Jones. But it's entertaining, charming and entertaining. And isn't that why we watch movies in the first place?

title: Bad, Terrible Actually
text: I gave 2 stars because I love Ryan Reynolds playing Ryan Reynolds. Otherwise, this movie would be completely trashy and unbearable. I spent the whole movie with my eyes rolling. The visual effects were bad, like seriously bad, cheap and poorly executed. Not even the acting was good. I believe the plot twist was supposed to be clever but I saw it coming within its first minutes. Surely this movie was made for kids or else, there is not another possible explanation.

title: The Three Eggs of Cleopatra
text: This film begins with a story about three jewel-encrusted, golden eggs presented to Cleopatra from Mark Antony before their deaths. Needless to say, they are quite valuable with the first being displayed at the Museo Nazionale di Castel Sant'Angelo in Rome, the second one owned by a private collector and the third having never been found. So, when the word goes out that a rich Egyptian billionaire will pay $300 million for all three of these eggs to present at his daughter's upcoming wedding, "Special Agent John Hartley" of the FBI immediately heads to Rome in anticipation of a heist. However, when he and Interpol agent "Urvashi Das" (Ritu Arya) arrive at the museum they discover that the egg has been stolen only minutes before by an infamous jewel thief named "Nolan Booth" (Ryan Reynolds). Naturally, a manhunt is immediately ordered but complicating matters is the fact than an even more notorious jewel thief by the name of "The Bishop" (Gal Gadot) also wants all three eggs and she is even better at this business than Nolan Booth. Now rather than reveal any more I will just say this was an enjoyable action film for the most part with some good comedy thrown into the mix as well. Admittedly, some of the action scenarios were a bit too far-fetched in my opinion, but all things being considered I found this to be an entertaining movie all the same and I have rated it accordingly. Slightly above average.

title: Thousand version of Jumanji meeting Free Guy and crashing the Wonder Woman party.
text: I have been waiting for this movie quite enthusiastically since the first poster came out. With a cast as strong as the Rock himself, I had a lot many expectations from this movie. It is a classic Now You See Me meets National Treasure and Indiana Jones to give a heist movie of this standard after a long time. With Gal Gadot and her amazing moves, the movie takes a lot of twists with history entwined to its very core. John Hartley played by Dwayne Johnson collaborates with Nolan Booth, a conman, played by our very charming Ryan Reynolds to catch the greatest art thief of the world, the absolute beautiful Gal Gadot herself. Now, if you go into the movie thinking you will have an out of the world experience and it will be something different, then you will surely be disappointed. It is like any other Police thief collaboration movie that you may have watched in the past with a pretty straightforward plot and almost expected twists at the end of movie. With a budget of two hundred million dollars and the tag of Netflix's costliest movie, it will just give you Dwayne, Reynolds and Gadot which, let's be honest, is why many of us decided to watch this movie in the first place.I give red Notice a solid 7.5 because it delivers an amazing bantership between Reynolds and Johnson as promised, lovely Gal Gadot and her moves and not so shocking twist towards the end of it. Although with a duration of one hour and fifty-five minutes, the movie does not seem like a stretch because of the action-packed scenes and Reynolds witty one liners. But if you have watched movies starring Dwayne Johnson, you will realize the character played by Dwayne is almost so similar in each of his movie, the tough guy who beats all odd and weirdly the same goes for Ryan Reynolds, funny guy with a lot of tricks up his sleeves and so help me God for Gal Gadot as well, a beautifully gorgeous lady with mind blowing fight moves and a sharp mind. These actors are so immortalized in their characters and they more or less play the same characters with the same trope that the movie really felt like a thousand version of Jumanji meeting Free Guy and crashing the Wonder Woman party.You can watch it for the action, comedy, Gal Gadot and for the marriage of convenience between Dwayne and Reynolds, our work wives. It is no doubt hilarious and delivers on the glamour and action packed party front and gives a not so subtle nod to a possible sequel that might be in the making. All in all, if you have two hours to spend and want to watch a comedy with action and glamour, this is your movie. Binge away folks.

title: Trying to combine Oceans Eleven, James Bond and Indiana Jones.
text: Entertaining action entertainment with three of the biggest stars on the planet - of course, everyone with a Netflix subscription will at least have a look. But it's not good. Like trying to combine Oceans Eleven, James Bond and Indiana Jones. The story is very weak in relation to the budget and really unimaginative. As always, Dwayne Johnson plays the usual character as you know him, Ryan Reynolds plays the funny Deadpool who seems unimaginative, and Gal Gadot tries to be serious but is not. A completely randomly composed film that is not worth the cost.

title: Don't buy into the negatives
text: It's a fun movie. Good action, comedy, and adventure. You gotta remember it's a movie. Everyone is so concerned with everything being realistic. It's so fun to step away from reality for 2 hours and enjoy these 3 stars play off of one another. Give it a watch!

title: Yawn.
text: Even the Rock looked like he did not want to be in this movie and he is literally the most jolly man on planet earth.. and planet fitness. The movie is boring and worst of all, not funny. I started scrolling my phone and upgraded this to a background bore. The Wonder Woman actress in this is hard to watch. She comes off as a new actress and she has been in over 5 major movies so far. Ryan Reynolds is just grabbing a paycheck and phones it in.

title: Much better than the Metacritic score led on.
text: After seeing the trailer for this movie on Ryan Reynolds' YouTube channel a while back I was quite hyped. A Netflix movie featuring some of my favorite actors and The Rock? Sign me up!Seeing the Metacritic score before release made me worried it was going to be terrible but after watching it I was glad to see that was not the case.Is it a must see movie that you should clear your schedule for immediately? No, it can wait.Is it a movie that when you choose to watch it you'll have a ton of fun and look back on fondly? Probably!Did I enjoy the hell out of it? Absolutely!Did you like Deadpool, The Hitman's Bodyguard, 6 Underground or any of the other fun action movies Reynolds was in? You'll probably like this too. If you didn't, this movie might just not be for you.Unless you are realllly into Gal Gadot, that is a good a reason as any to watch this movie. After all she plays a successful thief in this movie. A very good one, because she stole my heart <3.Please send help... 7.5/10!

title: Mostly Good.
text: Red notice is a movie with a basic premise of a hunter and hunted that team up to take down a bigger threat than we've seen all the time. But this movie threw in many plot twists and turns that the more they do the harder to believe they were. Although I must say for the most part I really enjoyed this film. The actors are on their A-game, entertaining and charismatic. The music doesn't stand out there was no amazing crescendo that most themes should have, but it gets the job done. It sets up a sequel that I'd honestly be down to see. I hope it gets greenlighted as I had a lot of fun overall.

title: Plain dumb
text: This has to be one of the dumbest movies that I've ever seen. What's the targeted audience? 10 year olds? Is this a comedy? No, because it will not bring even a smirk on your face. Is it a thriller? No, not a minute of suspense. Action? Plenty of it but no purpose as nobody ever gets killed. I will never understand the purpose of these goofy idiotic movies. Waste of talent.

title: seen it to many times
text: This is just average at best and Reynolds act has ran dry,tired of the cute smart ass character he seems to only play, its all the same every movie he does.

title: Generic, but funny and worth a watch
text: Over the top action sequences and poor CGI, with a generic plot, however its an entertaining film to switch off your brain and kill two hours. Ryan Reynolds is on typical comedic form which makes this a very funny, if a little ridiculous, film which is worth a watch.

title: Unoriginal but undoubtedly entertaining
text: We've all seen this film before, so if you're looking for originality you'll need to search elsewhere. You don't need to look very closely to recognise aspects of films like 'Raiders of the Lost Arc', 'National Treasure', 'True Lies', 'Hobbs & Shaw', etc. There's even some jokes in here that directly point out how generic the plot is, including a funny line where Booth, while looking for one of the eggs, says "Look for a box that says MacGuffin". It's that kind of movie. It's that kind of script. Although there are certainly way too many plot contrivances, I knew going in that this wasn't going to be the most intellectually stimulating film. This is one of those films that you're not supposed to think too hard about. 'Red Notice' is an action comedy. It wants you to just relax and enjoy the silliness, so that's exactly what I did.

title: Don't expect anything and you won't be disappointed.
text: Sometimes it's OK to put your brain into neutral and watch something silly. Indiana Jones meets Deadpool.This movie will never win any awards but is OK on a rainy Saturday. You wouldn't want to be paying to see it at the movies but it's fine to stream.

title: Its a fun movie
text: This movie is just a pleasant to watch it has very straight forward story, and the adventure begins along with laughter, some of the actions are illogical and physically impossible, but fortunately the fun jokes saved this move also the final twist plot was good. Ryan Reynolds is such a funny guy by his nature and Dewayne Johnson added a flavor to the movie with his charisma. Overall it was fun to watch.

title: Tedious
text: A badly acted film with twists for the sake of twists. You'll be glad once it has finished as it's just dumb. Save your time and effort and watch something else.

title: Great fun
text: Red Notice is great fun that's funny, fast paced and gleefully dumb. It's got plenty of twists (that are so obvious in some cases its kinda still impressive the film goes for them), globe trotting set pieces and so many jokes that may not be hilarious but are consistently chuckle worthy.Dwayne Johnson and Ryan Reynolds have excellent chemistry, building on what worked in their brief screen time in Hobbs & Shaw. Reynolds plays completely to his strengths but Johnson does actually go against type at points even if it's still unfortunately on his own terms. Gal Gadot is great effectively playing against type as a gleefully evil antagonist.Rawson Marshall Thurber's direction is fantastic, it's extremely well filmed and mobile courtesy of some of the better drone shots in a Netflix blockbuster. The CG is mostly solid with some bad moments (the bull scene in particular) and the music by Steve Jablonsky is really good, it's greatest strength is how unabashedly old fashioned it is.

title: Indiana Jones meets the DaVinci-Code
text: A fun movie to watch, a couple of unexpected plots (some were predictable but still fun to watch). The characters are mostly bland and stereotypical but the ongoing plot and the jokes hide that well. Some scenes were straight up copied from the Indiana Jones movies but it was nice to see a "remaking" of our childhood. The actors unfortunately don't seem to be showing new facets, playing roles they've played before, but the jokes and their actions give the movie a lightness and entertaining touch. It's a movie to watch on a family night or as a comfort movie. It's no new cinematic invention or a blockbuster but it's still good.

title: Seriously 6.7 for This?
text:
I'm being Generous with a 2.The Story was Thin at best,The Acting was Anorexic at Best and I've Discovered Ryan Reynolds (who I do like in Deapool) seems to be a one trick Pony with his Monotonous DEADPOOL Humour that he is allowed to use in literally any movie he's in and it's getting a bit Repetitive!! Actually No "IT IS REPETITIVE"
My opinion A Pay cheque for all 3 Actors and a Forgettable Movie.

title: For kids only?
text: If you are over 18 and enjoyed this movie your life should be and will go on being very hard. Even if it qualifies as having a plot, it has at least 25 holes. They didn't even bother to normalize the after-shot dubbing. Ridiculously third-rate.

title: A great adventure!
text: Would have been a much better movie if Ritu Arya and Gal Gadot switched roles... Gal is just the worst actress ever... thought it was only Wonder Woman at first but now I know she is a terrible actress in general and merely just a pretty face. Loved Ritu in the Umbrella Academy and she would have pulled off Gal's role a million times better! Ryan as always hilarious to watch and Dwayne plays along with his nonsense just right! All in all very entertaining with a Indiana Jones influenced vibe just a lil bit more extreme.

title: I loved it
text: I kinda get why there are so many negative reviews here, the movie is silly and cliched (except when it dodges said clichés), BUT that's sort of exactly what i was looking for. I found this very entertaining and most importantly; FUNNY. I laughed multiple times. Lots of self aware jokes. It has what is in my opinion one of the greatest jokes put on screen. It's at the end and involves everyone's favourite ginger with a guitar. It's incredibly self aware. This movie knows what it is guys you're not a genius for pointing out that it's stupid.Anyway don't listen to these fools, watch it if you want a good adventure.

title: Good action, good heist n sense of humour
text: Sarcastic characters are good on Ryan Reynolds. Nice heist plan, good and charm acting, lots of action, good twist and sense of humour. Feast for the eyes. A popcorn movie. And it is also nice in a movie to hear some jokes about movies and actors. When r u going to release the second one?

title: Not bad
text: First of all, it was a movie you could trust and watch because there were so many good actors in it. And I had quite a bit of fun. Overall, the atmosphere was bright and I think this was good. There was no boring part. However, there were a lot of parts that were not understood and there were a lot of absurd parts. There were so many reversals. I think it's a satisfying movie if you just have time to watch it without thinking about it.

title: "I'm Ed Sheeran B!tch!!!!"
text: Another big blockbuster flick with the usual performances you expect from the lead actors . Fun, entertaining and at times amusing. The movie works its way around each character in a search for which is lying. As a mindless view (not looking for mistake) it probably gets a 9 --it's fun and you'll enjoy it. If you want to knit pick then 6.6-7.1 out of 10 stars --a little drawn out in places but still fun and you'll enjoy it.

title: Nothing to write home about
text: With the budget and talent this should have been quicker, slicker and much more artfully writtenWeak, uninspiring dialogue. Flat humour. Action scenes leaving much to be desired. I think I saw Alfred Hitchcock in a wig playing the guitar.

title: Fun fun fun😊
text: Love Dwayne Johnson, love Ryan Reynolds, love Gal Gadot.. All of them together.., so much fun.. After a long time enjoyed a movie.. Like modern version of Indiana Jones.. I'm definitely going to watch it again..

title: Should This Film Be Noticed? Or Is It Red On Arrival?
text:
LIKES:Pace:
It's claiming to be action, crime and comedy, and to me that states a good pace that will be entertaining. They did not do me wrong, as Thurber's movie moves very well for the genre, making for fun, laughs, and the anticipated thrills that this combination promised. A simple story opening does little to draw out setting the stage, before the first sequence opens up for enjoyment and banter, doing little to go on tangents as they keep to the script. It's got plenty of connecting moments that help reset the faster intense stuff, and keeps that speed fairly even from start to finish, something difficult in this day and age.The Story:
It's simple, it's stupid, but it works with the promised cast and executes it well for a streaming movie, (that once was destined to come to theaters). Red Notice has some decent character insight for two of the major characters, and the third serves as a decent antagonist, allowing for three strong characters to follow. It's the crime element that I particularly enjoyed, not so much for the "hidden treasure" aspect, but more so in the game of cat and mouse they built. A proper foundation that served the comedy and action components, it was a success for me in the comedy crime film that again remained fun and entertaining.Twists:
The movie does a fairly good job with the twists, most of which I predicted and few I got most of the way, but not to the full extent. Thurber's writing managed to put these twists in naturally, not going out of its way to force a 90 degree turn, and never breaking the rules of the universe to do it. It's clever writing, it uses subtle gestures to lay the foundation, and then finds the right time to execute things in order to maximize the surprise. Should you be one who pays attention to the dialogue, you might find the hints obvious and giving you the pieces, but if you are a hear and forget, then get ready for some decent chess playing with this group. Overall, very happy with the script and story if you have not guessed.The Acting:
It works very well for the four people who are primarily in the film. Ritu Arya as the detective works for me, the strong woman leading the force, with her mind set on bringing justice. Her fluid international language is great, her style is amazing in the outfits, and she has the scowl very well for me. To the top billed cast, I'll start with Gal Gadot, who was not bad for me in this film, but it was also not my favorite performance. She has the cool and calm spy motif down, she's stylish in the clothes you expect of someone who is a master thief, and for the seductive parts of the movie we've proven her class in these moments with Wonder Woman. However, in comedy she still needs work, and I did not find her quite funny like others did. Her words seemed forced, her laughter seemed very fake, and her comedic delivery still has some fine tuning to get to the level I think she was going for. Ryan Reynolds executes his usually, over the top, die hard comedy role to an amazing level once again. Deadpool without the mask, swords, and skill, his mouth continues to be his strongest weapon and it works very well for much of the movie. Reynolds style meshes well with just about everyone in this film, and though its firing comedic bullets at rapid rate, most hit super well given the timing and balance with the other characters. Those who say he carries the movie, they are right to an extent about his jokes being the element to get most people into the film and keep them going. As for Dwayne Johnson, well the big guy is also comfortable in his usual role of the big, brawn, sarcastic hero who tries not to have vulnerabilities. Stereotypical, and stale, as it is, he makes it work and thanks to Reynolds, helps ground the ridiculous amounts of comedy and keep that stalwart good guy to conflict the bad guy. Regardless, the three of them play very well together, and I enjoyed the heck out of the chemistry they had during this film.The Nostalgia/nods:You know me and the movie geek I am, so naturally, was very happy with the success of sneaking in some fun homages and parodies to time honored movies. Red Notice takes a lot of motivation from the spy films of the past, and finds a way to sew them together to be present without overwhelming. Indiana Jones, James Bond, Spy Vs. Spy, and more are all ready for you to enjoy in the new pain they have. I had fun with the comedic use of these moments, and seeing how they formed the foundation for many of the scenes. And if you like to play games and tally what movies you can find, this serves as a good party game as well.DISLIKES:Some of the Writing:
It could be a sensitive me, but I felt there were times where the battle of the sexes got a little heavy handed when Gadot was involved. Red Notice has scenes that really seem to promote superiority and though some are in good fun, others are a little too agenda based for me if I'm being honest. Fortunately, those moments are few and far between, but they can derail a good moment that was building up, and I would like to continue to avoid these moments if at all possible.The Action:
It may be exciting and fun, but Red Notice's comedy stick gets a little in the way of what I like to see in my action scenes. The first scene offers a lot of promise at clever moves, fast chases, and comedy mixed together, and some of that promise is delivered. The second fight is not bad, but you start to see a major problem arising with the movie and how they handle the extras that I won't spoil, and has a few too many convenient things happen. However, the third fight made famous by viewing scenes on YouTube, it's okay and funny at times when I was watching it. However, the combat is stiff, the moves are very planned out, and the editing could only hide so much/change so much to be intense and satisfying. By the fourth and fifth action scenes, the momentum was starting to be lost and I never felt any close calls for our cast, so the action element is a little blander for people who like more suspenseful seasoning.Comedic fatigue:
The movie as I said is loaded with a lot of jokes, and sometimes that element gets a bit stiff and boring for almost two hours. Reynolds is funny, but without the Rock, his volume of comedy might have been a little too much for me given how they refused to change things up. Gadot as I said is not that funny for me and Johnson's sarcasm is the thing that seemed the most consistent and even paced in the movie for me. If you love your comedy filled with unrelenting jokes and jabs, then you are in good shape, but a little break could have gone a bit more for this film.More use of Arya:
Given the premise of the story, I would have liked a little more involvement, ingraining and planning with the use of Arya's character. She is a very good actress for me, and her character as the unyielding cop was an obstacle that could have helped further the chase and interactions of the film. Sadly, the cop has a few elements meant to be fun in her role as the tool, but never quite delivers the full justice I think she could have achieved with more time and planning.The Cameo At The End/Ending:
Just as the movie was finishing on a strong note and could have cut there, we had to go one step too far for the finale. Red Notice gets to the moment they are all talking about, and in this brief diversion, we had to force in a cameo from someone who has already proven to struggle with the camera. While there was some comedy factor for me in this person's inclusion, including a nod to the aforementioned flop, by this point it was sort of last minute tag on that felt off from the rest of the movie. And though it opened up for the ending and tying everything together into a neat little loop, there could have been something better or more imaginative given the creativity muscles flexed today.The VERDICT:
For a direct to stream movie on Netflix, Red Notice did not disappoint on many factors in terms of movie quality. Thurber's writing is clever and well-paced, allowing for the entertaining factor to ring strong in this film, and it's engaging simplistic story is worthy of the small screen. Comedy has loads of lines to choose from, and a cast of characters that plays very well together to make this crime/comedy piece a fun home viewing. Throw in the twists and turns, alongside the fun treasure hunt of references and again you check a lot of boxes for a fun film. However, the movie still suffers from overdoing the comedy at times, forcing it on to many scenes and sometimes giving away a little too much for the surprise factor. The action is okay, nothing special, but at keeps with the theme of fun this movie is going for, though again the convenient factors are a bit too much for viewers like me. Outside of the ending being a bit muddied, the movie is well worth viewing and having fun if you give it a try. My scores for this film are:Action/Crime/Comedy: 7.0
Movie Overall: 6.5.

title: As 'generic' as generic gets...
text: This movie is JUST like 'Fast and the Furious'.... it's just another generic action/adventure movie, made by a lifeless corporation, in order to turn over a profit.... the movie isn't made to teach the viewer anything.... it's not made to make the viewer see life differently, or to learn a life lesson.... the movie is LITERALLY just made to turn a profit. It's really the WORST kind of movie.... the script is cobbled together by an assembly-line of writers, and the cast isn't chosen because they are good actors or because they can bring the character on script to life.... no no.... the cast is chosen because they will bring in the most viewers, regardless of whether or not the movie is actually worth seeing.In summation, 'Red Notice' ISN'T worth seeing, and it brings you about as much enjoyment as any of the supremely generic 'Fast and the Furious' movies. Not recommended. 5/10.

title: Derivative, self aware, annoying but totally watchable.
text: Two thieves and a disgraced special agent find themselves thrown together to find Cleopatra's three bejeweled eggs.Director Rawson Marshall Thurbe delivers a never ending self aware, criminal comedy hi jinx and shenanigans part pink panther, part Indiana Jones, all twists and scores.Leads Dwayne Johnson, Ryan Reynolds and Gal Gadot are perfect in this mindlessly slick, fast-paced action thriller. Yes, it's derivative, laced with clichés pointless twists but it breezily skips along like the likes of The Mummy (1999), The Tourist, mixed with the National Treasure films. With a cameo and Ed Sheeran you know who this is aimed at. With music by Steve Jablonsky, reminiscent of a James Bond score, modern tracks are thrown in for good measure. As with the film itself it tries to tick every box and hit every demographic.Overall, fun, fast-paced and frequently amusing, Rawson offers a sickly sweet competent film, you'll either love it or hate it.

title: RED NOTICE - A good, dependable, fun time.
text: Is it a knock off of other, better movies? Yes. Is this the most engaging story with deep characters? No way. Is this a fun 2 hours to spend with the 3 biggest movie stars on the planet? Hell yeah it is! The Rock is great in this, Gal Gadot is having alot of fun, you can tell and Ryan Reynolds while his usual self, it gets a little annoying towards the end. The comedy is more hit than miss. Some lines made us laugh out loud, and there was some chuckles in my audience too. The action is directed quite well with a few sweeping drone shots, a standout starting museum escape and ending tunnel chase that reminded me of fast 4, but done better. It's self aware, it's fun and my wife and I had a blast.

title: Lovely Low IQ Treasure Hunt
text: Let's face it, you're considering putting on Red Notice - an adventurous heist movie played for laughs - for the three actors at the height of their career playing honest thiefs. This is what it is and what you'll get, and for that the film deserves kudoos, praise and, contrary to apparent popular opinion, a solid seven stars.Ryan Reynolds is the highlight of the film and is in tip-top shape. His comedic timing is second to none in Hollywood and it shines. In Red Notice he hides a versatile actor deftly behind childish jokes, acting with his eyes more than his overly foul mouth. It's simple really, if you don't like Reynolds, don't watch. I myself, love the guy.Dwayne Johnson may be the 'woods main actor right now, but he understands he plays second and third fiddle, apart of course for his athletic abilities, to Reynolds and Gadot.Speaking of Gal Gadot, her 'dame in the red dress' suits her well: cool and calculated calm, giving the film an intelligent sexiness, at least as far as can be expected for a low IQ heist flick like this. She's having fun and it shows.Quickly the rest: good shots (especially the opening shot), extremely clichéd spy music, a flimsy script, plot-holes the size of the Atlantic, tear-jerky character development, unlikely action scenes, surprisingly great custome design and plenty of clichés in the dialogue. Also Ritu Arya, playing the fourth main character, deserves special notice.It is what it is, so do yourself a favour, ignore reviews that don't take films like this at face value, grab some of Reynolds' Aviation Gin, and get ready for some stupidity, yet also stupidly well timed jokes. And in that primary goal, it succeeds.

title: a movie with a funny twist
text: I actually laughed so hard at this movie. The funny sayings. The exaggerated actions, but just funny. Another ending. It's just typical Ryan again.The rude humor, but somehow you take this from Ryan. Probably some find it annoying but you like it or not. I won't say more about it haha🙂💯 funny.

title: Okeyish
text: It is more like 6 but 7 from me because it is noticeable that the scriptwriter and production team was trying.But as the film director, Thurber could juice more from Rock and Reynolds.Also ending was weak and generic text to speech generator can play the role more believable than Gal Gadot.

title: Fun, Funny Action Adventure
text: I think people have been kind of unfair to this film. I think it's fun, funny, not very well-written, but nice escapism taken to the modern age. It's probably the first movie in the last 2 decades to capture the spirit of Indiana Jones since The Mummy.Good stars, good acting, particularly Ryan Reynolds is perfect in the role. Watch it if you're into fun adventures.

title: Moronic
text: Terrible casting...super annoying. I felt like this was a free movie script or an unused episode of Psych that they threw the Rock in and just made up terrible banter for each scene. It's really bad. Both of these actors need to take a break and stop saying yes to everything.

title: What's not to enjoy?!
text: It's interesting to see Dwayne Johnson and Ryan Reynolds working together - two talented people who seem to take pleasure in not taking themselves seriously, and who have funny schticks and great comedic timing. I also enjoyed this take on the genre, and I thought the story was engaging. Perfect viewing for a fun evening.

title: Pretty funny!
text: They did a great job together! There were a lot of Indiana Jones references in the movie and there were a lot of clues through out the film. I'm sure there are some truths to the story line , especially with the Hitler hidden treasures.

title: As standard and routine as you would expect...
text: Prepare for dozens of product placements: Coca Cola; Teremana Tequila; Alitalia; Russian Gulags. We get all the same hits we've seen before... Dwayne Johnson reprises his role as "The Rock". Gal Gadot being hot AF in sexy haute-couture, while throwing spears. Ryan Reynolds doing his rehashed smarmy, smug stand-up routine. This movie is the cinematic equivalent of a multi-vitamin - all of the ease, none of the nutrition. We even get treated to untouched 75-year-old Nazi vehicles starting up first time, only to be 'fast-and-furioused' through a well lit Amazonian mine shaft. Also, keep an eye out for the exhaustive double-cross endings. They will keep you on your toes while you try forget the details that chip away your suspension of disbelief.

title: Ryan Reynolds - The king of action comedy
text: Watch this if you like Ryan Reynolds. This movie is hilarious. I laughed atleast 10 times during the movie. Dwayne Johnson is an all time favorite. But Reynolds just steals the show. It reminds me so much of deadpool. Don't go into this expecting an action flick like mi fallout. This is an action and a big emphasis on comedy.

title: An extremely well-paced movie
text: The overall rythm of the movie is probably one its strongest points. Not much boring moments, the action and scenes are very well connected and the movie is constantly moving forwards.The trio of actors is probably second in line : Reynolds and Johnson, particularly, work very well together in my opinion. Gadot, well, you like or not - very easy on the eye, sorry for that, but her role wasnt extremely convincing. I felt like she has a bit too much of super-hero-ish set of skills and strenght, and she reminded me a bit too much of "Superwoman"...Indeed, lots of jokes are cheesy, dad jokes, but it's overall well-spirited and, well, it fits like a glove for Ryan and Dwayne and makes them quite lovable as usual. Still got a few very good laughs out of me.I've honestly enjoyed the movie, and I'm generally a bit of a grouch to say the least. Wont become a classic but certainly worth seeing for a decent moment of entertainment.

title: Very very dumb
text: Wow, ok I thought, the rock, Deadpool and Wonder Woman, this might be a fun movie. Not! It was really silly, really predictable, really not funny. No one was acting to their capacities (well Gal Gadot is meh as an actress anyway) OR their humor and the story was cheesy as hell. It would have been a good movie in the 40's with appropriate actors, but in 2021 it really falls flat. Dumb humor, over the top characters or under the table characters and the only one you liked is the Interpol policewoman. But of course it's also ruined with today's cultural stuff all through it, sad. All I can say is please do not make a Red Notice 2!

title: smooth but entertaining...
text: Is my main stigmata to this story of highbrow thefts of artifacts of ancient times. Its a globetrotting race in 70 miles per step speed, fetching t-water to the princess, or just for the convinience of it. Its also a hymn to convenient connections among thieves , 3 magpies vs the world eg forza italia and the fbi. Its also a test of the moral code in the criminal underworld, and it seems that the clue to solve all the problems is based on ''the doupt of a lie''its a nonstop action film mixed with loads of special effects and vfx, not all of them are perfect, but in the blur of speed any sidevision dissapear so it works anyway.the main male cast does a fine job, the rest is at an average and not so into the yolk-business as mr reynolds and mr johnson, cause joking around is a great part of the entertainment, and without it it wouldnt have been the same.Some glorious looking lightsetting work in the sunshine, and an editor that hasnt got the best load of shoots to digitize together do give some clue why some of the criticism to this film has risen. Also mr thurbers might and title appearances on the cac-list, gives you the feeling of a onemans egotrip tohit his the burnmark on the sphere of silverscreen horizon.But its high on show, and moves unbelievable fast, it has some adult comments that may not suit the youngest of the juvenile (not infants)viewers, otherwise low on blood and gore factor that may gain my wifes attention, the grumpy old man recommends...

title: Far fetched but fun
text: No need to be over critical, just take it for what it is - a couple of hours of entertainment with a pretty good story and plenty of action. Throw in Dwayne Johnson being himself, the excellent wise cracking Ryan Reynolds, Gal Gadot for eye candy and what else do you need. It's nothing special but an enjoyable watch with enough going for it to keep your interest.

title: More fun than expected
text: Reading the reviews, I approached this film with a lot of doubts. And maybe it was better that way, because I enjoyed the film a lot.The film belongs to multiple genres, but it feels much closer to an adventure film.It's a film that doesn't want to take itself seriously, in a succession of jokes that really made me laugh.The three main characters work very well together and create the right atmosphere.I enjoyed all the twists, locations and camera moves of some of the action scenes.Of course, I'm not saying this film is a masterpiece. But sometimes, after 10 hours in the office, I just want to sit on the sofa, watch muscular people hitting each other, hear some sacred jokes and see scenes of healthy entertainment.And this movie entertains you very well.It always depends on what you are looking for in a movie, I was looking for fun and this movie gave it to me.

title: Netflix caper film
text: Dwayne Johnson stars with Ryan Reynolds and Gal Gadot in "Red Notice" from 2021.Mark Antony gave Cleopatra three bejeweled eggs as a wedding gift. Think Faberge eggs on steroids. Johnson plays John Hartley, who works for the FBI, trying to catch a notorious jewel thief, Nolan Booth (Ryan Reynolds) before he manages to steal them.I've never seen a Dwayne Johnson movie. For me, this was a lot of fun, with great characters and dialogue, particularly Reynolds. "This is farm to table, right?" he asks a prison chef as slop is slapped into a bowl. He and Johnson are very funny together, and the action is non-stop. Gadot is gorgeous.I enjoyed all the clever escapes, the banter, the fights, the parties, the dancing, even the derivative Indiana Jones feel of the movie.Mindless fun - and sometimes that's just what the doctor ordered.

title: Too shallow
text: A failure in all categories. Not funny, not even remotely plausible. Just a mess. Gadot over plays the role in every angle and it shows her shallow acting experience. Johnson is playing a role best played by someone like Martin Short. Just forget it. I'm too tired.

title: Sweet.
text: Simple story, best comic timing, set-up totally fantastic.Anyone who loves to see movie's with its story not to define science etc. Will love this film.

title: Pretty bad
text: This movie was pretty awful. The insane amount of CGI, when it wasn't needed, was really bad. The Louvre doesn't need to be CGI, it's a real place, neither does a yacht or any of the other countless objects or places.The dialogue was bad, the writing was bad, and the countless twist endings were also really bad.If you are reading this and are deciding whether to watch the movie or not, don't.

title: Great for a Netflix original
text: This movie is surprisingly good and well produced for a Netflix original. It's entertaining and has some cool twists and turns and action. The downside is the fact The Rock and Ryan Reynolds are literally just the same actors in this that they are in everything. But regardless it's entertaining.

title: Not to be taken seriously. A fun romp
text:
I enjoyed it
Typical Ryan Reynolds quips and smart arsed come back from all 3 involvedGrab some snacks and a drink and enjoy without analysing it too much.

title: Thin Plot Held Up By Likeable Actors
text: Some actors just make a movie good by their mere presence in it. That is the case with Red Notice. Only this time its two actors. Ryan Reynolds and Dwayne Johnson.Reynolds is Booth, a master thief who is being pursued by Johnson's FBI agent, Hartley. Through a series of unfortunate events they both get arrested and wind up cell mates in an austere prison in Russia. Eventually, a third thief known as The Bishop (Gadot) joins in the fun as all three are looking for some mysterious golden eggs that once belonged to Queen Cleopatra.If you ignore the obvious plot holes, this flick is an enjoyable way to spend a few hours. There is a lot of witty banter between Reynolds and Johnson, as well as the obligatory explosions and action set pieces. Oddly, no one is shown dying in the movie, but its obvious some people get seriously maimed. Its all kind of a watered down Raiders of the Lost Ark without the great set ups. Still, Reynolds, Johnson and, to a lesser extent, Gadot, are charming and you can't help but enjoy them. It just felt like Gadot's character was tacked on once they found out the actress was available to star in the movie. She doesn't really bring anything to the film, but I guess she is lovely to look at.The plot twist at the end comes out of nowhere and makes no sense in light of the events of the movie. It doesn't ruin the movie for me, but it did take off some of the luster. Again, it felt tacked on just to provide a twist without any real set up during the events of the film.I gave this a 7 out of 10 because the three actors are just fun to watch.

title: Good, light hearted fun
text: Good, light-hearted fun...but who was the actor playing Das - it's like someone won a competition on the back of a cereal packet to be in a major Hollywood/Netflix movie!Agent Das aside, all the acting is spot on for this type of film . Reynolds, the Rock and Gadot are great together and, yes the plot is a little ridiculous but, honestly, if you are getting tied up in that you are watching the wrong movie and you probably need to lighten up a little. Maybe go be a professional movie critic as they all seem to continually struggle with the idea that a film could ever be made with the sole purpose of providing people with 90 odd minutes of harmless entertainment.

title: Top Flight Actors, Great Cinematography, Terrible Script
text: What a Flop! I can hardly remember a movie so bad, because I would never knowingly watch a movie this bad. Looks good, good actors, decent reviews on IMDb, checked all the boxes for stupid, enjoyable action-entertainment. But Uugghhhh! What a stinker of a script. Clearly written with these actors in mind, it turns their standard characters into pure cliche's of themselves. And hardly a funny line or moment of suspense. Just a bunch of stupid jerks running around saying lame one-liners and blowing things up. The only saving grace was Gal Gadot, who's at least pleasant to look at. For the same plot, with a much better script, try Team America, World Police.

title: Enjoyable, but too fast paced.
text: This film is definitely a really fun and enjoyable watch. Thanks to the charisma and acting of Gal, Ryan and Ritu (sorry Rock, your acting is so bland and flat ironically like a rock). If it weren't for those 3, the movie would have been a typical boring heist movie.
