Don't expect some deep ground-breaking story in this movie, but it's a fun and easy watch, and the twists and humour make it very enjoyable.The fight scenes are awesome and dare I say Gal's fight scenes were more epic and more Wonder Woman-like in this movie compared to both her actual Wonder Woman films. It was also great seeing her take on a villain role.

title: Top cast, good story... but still...
text: This movie had high profiled actors who really can make an impact for any movie they do. The story is also not a bad one with few twists which are unexpected.However, it feels like the same kind of a story which usually we can see in recent past. And the execution of the movie is not good. Over the top action scenes made this movie unbearable at some point.

title: The Definition of Mediocre
text: Yet another bland action film graces our screens. Yet another lifeless and emotionless story finds its way into production. That is what Red Notice is, a B class movie with some big name actors to beef it up a notch. Going in I had mixed feelings, I'm a fan of Dwayne and Ryan so was excited to see them together but I also watched the trailer which didn't excite me in any way. With Dwayne you know what you're getting, a big dude who brute forces his way through walls and people and sometimes has a quirky remark or two. With Ryan you get his quick wit and style of comedy that's made him hugely successful but even with all that it just seems so off. The "Jokes" feel forced and the action is cookie cutter predicable nonsense that feature no wow moments, atleast not for me. The story goes nowhere and other people mention "twists and turns" but I was so zoned out I couldn't care if it turned out the actual queen of Britain appeared in the film and she was the master thief. Overall a poor story, poor action and only barely saved by throwing in some decent actors. In my opinion it's a film you put on in the background while you sit on your phone.

title: Reynolds is funny. Rock is ok. Gadot is annoying
text: Lame script. Reynolds has some funny one liners. The Rock is underused. Gadot brings this movie down from a 7 to a 5.5Disappointing. It could have been more fun and better than just a reason for people to turn on Netflix.

title: Don't do the sequel, please!
text: A lot of scenes seen in other comedy action.... I have the feeling that I have watched this movie already. I think it's 4/10.Copy - paste.So, please don't do the sequel... 😃

title: It's fun BUT sprinkled with forced / needless humour
text:
Dear Ryan,
We get that you are Deadpool, THE Merc with a Mouth but can you please stop portraying the Thief with a Mouth, the Billionaire with a Mouth, the Whatever your role is With a Mouth? At first it is cool, hilarious and fun but it soon wears off.The movie is good, there is an adventurous treasure hunt feel, the action is cool and slick. Its definitely worth a watch.

title: Lighthearted comedy caper swings between entertaining and irritating
text: Check your brain at the door and grab some popcorn; Red Notice is an enjoyable action comedy. The formula is familiar: elaborate heists in interesting scenery, comedic banter between reluctant partners, plot twists and back stabbing, and some good ol' over-the-top action sequences. Reynolds and the Rock are having clearly having fun with this. This is the kind of lighthearted entertainment that we haven't had a lot of the past few years on the big screen.But Gal Gadot... something about the Bishop just rubbed me the wrong way. Her character is an unadulterated Mary Sue, and she irritated me to no end. And unlike the other leads, her performance is lackluster and lacking chemistry. Not sure if it's the result of the writing or the casting, or perhaps an unfortunate combination of both, but after a while I inadvertently cringed every time she appeared on screen. Too bad, because this movie could actually have been good with a better Bishop.

title: Fun Friday night movie...
text: If you want a good movie go watch Shankshaw Redemption. This was fun, perfect Friday night movie. What I was expecting! There's action, good and fun jokes, good looking Gal 👌🏼.I'm not sure about the budget, where did all the money go to? Anyways. Not bad. Well, I did have some Teremana super cold with it, so yeah!

title: Had low expectations and goodthing...
text: I thought I wasn't even going to finish Red Notice before even watching expecting another typical silly The Rock action/bad acting film. But to my surprise I had a little fun watching this all thanks to Ryan Reynold's cheeky humor. Despite it being predictable and an elementary written story, it was a watchable and vaguely entertaining Netflix film.

title: I fell asleep half way through this mess.
text: Sadly, I was awakened because of my snoring, and I had to finish this predictable and boring disaster. I cared nothing about the characters. The plot was a rehashing of some many cheesy action films. Nothing new here. Nothing interesting.

title: Lovely
text: This goes to all the complainers who are no longer able to distinguish between good and bad films because they watch ten films a day.This film brings all the joy, humour and good vibes you could expect from the trailer. And it does so in a very charming way, highlighted by special actors! I loved a lot of scenes and I hope this story goes on :)Thank you for about two ours of good time :)

title: Indiana Jones meets National Treasure!
text:
So this is the Netflix's most expensive film... A highly amusing movie for a weekend with your family. This is a very entertaining film that really delivers on what it promises. Red Notice is a mix of Indiana Jones and Mission Impossible! It has an extremely likeable cast! Dwayne Johnson is good, He plays a cool and funy character as always. Gal Gadot is absolutely gorgeous in this film. But the real standout here is Ryan
Reynolds , He is absolutely hilarious in this film!The overall story is surprisingly quite unpredictable to be honest.There are plenty of twists, turns and reveals to keep you hooked.The action is big and very entertaining. The choice of locations are also good. There are so many scenes in the movie that DO NOT make any sense but come on!! It is just a comedy-action movie!

title: What a crock of nonsensical product placement.
text: It's just not good.Reynolds is doing his usual schtick for the umpteenth time.Dwayne is doing his usual schtick for the umpteenth time.Gal Gadot is playing cliche 'hot chick' like has been on umpteen movies.Shove it on in the background whilst doing something else, it's not worth focusing on, if you do focus on it, you'll notice Reynolds trying to flog his gin.

title: Honest review
text: It's exactly what you can expect. An action film with The Rock and R. Reinolds playing their funny action roles, and Gal Gadot being boring, with no expression what so ever, as she always is. But it's good enough to have a couple of hours of fun time with zero thinking needed for it. It's like watching Sonic.

title: Not amazing, but still fun
text: Despite obvious problems with the screenplay and actually too many twists - some of which were obvious - it's still a fun watch with good laughs and action scenes. Gal Gadot chews scenery better than I've ever seen her do before.

title: Entertaining enough to kill time. No high expectations
text: (I watched because its got my fav actors), Not a brilliant script, definitely one you can laugh at. Still engaging despite B grade props and settings. Its got amusing scenes and lines.

title: The trio we didn't know we want but needed.
text: They basically play as themselves, and they smashed it. Also, this movie probably has one of the best trailers and teasers I have ever seen. Much credit and love to the production team. Hopefully they come up with a part 2 as great as the first one.

title: Very tongue in cheek and entertaining to boot!
text: Ryan Reynolds is, as usual, funny and flippant, and the rest of the cast does a great job keeping this fun action flick rolling along. You won't have to think too much, just laugh and enjoy the ride.

title: Meh.
text: Disappointing and forgettable. By the numbers, lazy cash grab for the three stars. The script is so weak it probably took just a week or two to write. I give it 3 stars for the charm of the trio and for some nice locations.

title: Enjoyable
text: Unrealistic physics and stupid scenes but the important thing is that I enjoyed it . So I give this a 8/10. Using popular actors surely made the movie famous but I don't see anything wrong with that as long as the movie is good. Lot of plot twists were included but they were kinda predictable . Too jokes on serious scenes . But made the movie funnier . The movie actually shouldn't be categorized as crime tho . Its basically a comedy . And that's why i love it . You might love it too if you like comedy. Not recommended if you expect to see a serious crime based movie.

title: Worst acting ever
text: This was purely the worst acting by some of my favorite actors, but Gal Gadot is simply the worst underrated actress of all time, she is over acting as usualThe film is very predictable, too much money was thrown for no reason except to make the movie look big.

title: Not bad, not good
text: It's just fun to have Ryan and Dwayne on screen together again in a full movie. There's nothing ground breaking that's going to fling your popcorn in the air, but if you enjoy the actors then you'll enjoy the movie.

title: Boring, written by, and for, children
text: $160 million for this? A poor hybrid of Oceans 12 and Raiders of the Lost Ark.So many plot conveniences, such a predictable plot, so many bad fight scenes, so much teleporting all over the planet to serve a terrible plot and sooooo long.This is the one movie when Ryan Reynolds started to bug me by being always 'on'. Very disappointing but children might find it fun.

title: Fun!
text: Dont understand why so many bad ratings. The movie is not very original, and full of cliches, but its a solid comedy and theres a few good laughs. Better than the great majority of netflix productionsFun 7, looking for a follow through.

title: Average
text: The movie, though quite fun,is your generic Indiana Jones/Oceans(insert number here)/action movie with a switcheroo. A fun popcorn flick to watch but very predictable plot,some funny dialogue between characters and predictable ending.

title: Chemistry on point
text: Perfectly balanced. Little bit of comedy, little bit of thrills and good characters. It is fun and entertaining. If there is going to be a sequel, great why not.

title: A good enough movie.
text: It is not the best movie of the year, but you will get your dose of Ryan Reynolds' charisma. It is the kind of movie to leave on the screen while doing something else and have a few nice laughs. SFX quality is all over the place. Sometimes they are ok, others are almost like a low budget Bollywood movie. Plot is somewhat forced and basic but has some Indiana Jones vibes.

title: Fast and Furious meets Ocean's 11
text:
Good laugh and action.Alot of Ryan R witty dialogue and goo
d banter between the main characters.Cool twists at the end and definitely left wife open for nr 2.

title: Disapointing
text: I quit watching after an hour in, the plot was predictable and the movie got too boring. Rather disappointing considering the stars. Reynolds and Gala where not enough to overcome the lack of entertainment. Got bored watched the rest second half was a bit better.Hope the sequel is better.

title: Netflix thrash
text: Overall the film goes nowhere.An Interpol-issued red notice is a global alert to hunt and capture the world's most wanted. But when a daring heist brings together the FBI's top profiler John Hartley (Dwayne Johnson) and two rival criminals Nolan and Sarah (Ryan Reynolds and Gal Gadot), there's no telling what will happen. There are plenty of twists coming one after another, there's breathtaking action and then there is gripping screenplay. The 90 minutes never look boring and that's the biggest triumph for Red Notice.Netflix will make you watch it , so no way I can stop you.

title: Entertaining Enough for the Entire Family
text: Around the Holidays, I always get asked to recommend a film "Good for the Entire Family", something that the kids as well as the adults - including Gramma and Grampa - can enjoy.For Thanksgiving, 2021 (and beyond) the answer is simple - look no further than the Netflix film RED NOTICE starring Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson, Gal Gadot and Ryan Reynolds.Written and Directed by frequent "The Rock" collaborator, Rawson Marshall Thurber, RED NOTICE pits the 3 stars each other as Master Thieves and the Law Enforcement Agent that is chasing them. It is a light-hearted, fun, action, adventure treasure hunt film reminiscent of the Nicholas Cage NATIONAL TREASURE movies.Don't be expecting hard-hitting, gritty action in this one. Instead, expect light-hearted action with fast banter, faster cars and bullets that - to no one's surprise - fails to land in any human being. Automobiles, equipment and buildings are destroyed - but humans...? Not so much. They just pick themselves up, dust themselves off and start all over again.The acting in this is "as expected". The Rock is tough, muscular and charming. Ryan Reynolds is fast-talking, conniving and charming. Gal Gadot is mysterious, tougher-than-she-looks and charming. They play off together well and add a little higher level of quality to this film than it probably deserves.That's because the script, plot machinations, twists, turns, double-crosses and banter are all pretty much run-of-the-mill. It is not anything special, but nor is it bad. It is "fine" and with these 3 talented performers at the forefront of this, it lifts itself to "better than fine", it's a good family film that all can enjoy.The Direction and Action sequences by Thurber are just as pedestrian and run-of-the-mill but just as entertaining none-the-less. I think the charm of this film is it's predictability. It's like putting on an old pair of sweatpants. Your'e not going to wear them to the Oscars, but for sitting on the couch after a full family dinner on Thanksgiving, it fills the bill very well.The film is light enough for kids (though they do drop the "f-bomb" once or twice). It's just edgy enough for tweens/teens (hence the "f-bombs") and a rollicking good time for the adults with enough self-awareness of what they are doing that the actors (first and foremost Reynolds) almost looks like they are going to address the camera to comment on what's going on at any moment.And that, too, is part of it's charm.Letter Grade A- (it's probably a B+, but since it is my answer for "Family Film of the Holidays", I'll give it an A-).8 stars (out of 10) and you can take that to the Bank(ofMarquis)

title: Very good comedy, a mixup of their previous characters
text: As we all know, Reynolds, Rock, and Gal Gadot already had their emblematic character and speciality, they mixed this with a good spy kids plot (that rolls kinda dumb then an amazing plot twist at the end), so, Deadpool is hilarious, downy is amazing making cringe scenes and gal is too good in fighting scenes, that way of using legs with a spear is fantastic, all that with a touch of mission impossible with old fashion 007, enjoyable, funny and most of, entertaining, a worth watch and a close 7.5/10.

title: Fun but Cliched and Derivative
text: "Red Notice" is a film that I had been waiting to see for some time, so I had somewhat elevated expectations. Unfortunately, after finally viewing it I am somewhat disappointed. The whole film is so tongue in cheek that it is almost a spoof; I was not expecting that. While there is action and globetrotting afoot, the plot and character development are lacking with coherence taking a backseat to convenience, especially toward the end. I couldn't even tell you the characters names as it's all so superficial, stilted, and underdeveloped. Though we do learn the two male characters have father issues. That seems to be the theme of the film -- a rotten father can spoil a son's future.Though this film is aware of its own silliness and frequently points it out while poking fun at it. However this self-referential teasing does not excuse the aforementioned weaknesses. There are also way too many cultural references made, and the now all too common meta schtick of self-awareness by an art-form has grown tiresome. Too much of this film is snippets borrowed from other better films such as: Gladiator, Jurassic Park, Indiana Jones (all of them), Fast and Furious (4 and 5 especially), and some scaffolding stunt-work we've seen better done in Quantum of Solace and some Jackie Chan movies. And the three main characters remain ill-defined to me and are little more than stock characters which each actor and actress has already played now in several movies. The Reynolds wise-cracking schtick also gets tiresome.However, I do understand that there is nothing new under the sun as Solomon once said, but there just wasn't enough meat here for me to get excited about. Nevertheless it is a mildly entertaining ride, even if somewhat long and incoherent. I rate it a 4/10.

title: Ryan Reynolds once again plays... Ryan Reynolds
text: The latest episode of "hi, I'm Ryan Reynolds", the same cheeky smart arse from the previous episode.People say it's the same character as Deadpool. But when did you ever see him play a different character... sometimes he underplays it, sometimes he overplays it but it is always essentially the same character.If you like watching Ryan Reynolds play Ryan Reynolds, you will probably enjoy this.

title: Highly entertaining and humorous antventure to have some nice time!
text: Action movie / adventure. This is another film about a heist of valuables, in this case the legendary golden eggs of Cleopatra. As with most films in the genre, it has plenty of action and adventure, very good direction and scenery in luxury houses, in the jungle, in old abandoned basements, etc., with an unusual trinity, the classic cool character of adventure "The Rock", the charming but also very smart and powerful 'Wonder Woman' and the comic athyrostomus "Deadpool" in an ancient treasure hunt! Despite the opposing interests and the conflicts between them, eventually either the two of them or all three of them will be forced to cooperate and the cooperation will be followed by betrayal and change of side with pot twists. A film that does not want to become as serious as the classic Indiana Jones or other films of the genre, the athyrostomy of "Deadpool" could have been excluded though, as well as the excessive humorous element in from time to time, as the adventure alone was more than enough to earn the interest of the watchers. Nice recommendation to spend some relaxed time and enjoy, but due to the athyrostomy of the never serious Reynolds is not recommended for families or young children.

title: Good enough
text: Enjoyable, but very predictable. It's a by the numbers heist movie with no surprises. I would not go see it in theaters, but it's good for Netflix. Ryan Renolds steals the show like always.

title: Star cast
text: The biggest plus point of the movie is star cast. The plot and story is simple but have twist angle that suprise me, and locations are pretty much good,its a good time pass movie.

title: Average film but great chemistry
text: The "story" is something that's been seen many times before. The jokes are ok, supporting cast are ok, locations, camera work are all ok. Nothing exceptional.I would have given this a 5/10 but the presence of Dwayne Johnson and Ryan Reynolds elevates this to a 7.Gal Gadot looks nice and tries her best, but she just doesn't have the chemistry or the comedic timing - So no marks added or deducted for her presence.

title: A comedic heist!
text: Dwayne Johnson, Ryan Reynolds, and Gal Gadot. You can't get any better than that. I'm going to say this now, this film was way better than I ever anticipated! I love action movies, especially heist movies, and this film is Indiana Jones, Mission Impossible and James Bond mixed into one. When Ryan Reynolds is present, of course there's going to be comedy. The writer did a great job because I feel like the comedy lasted from start to finish. I've noticed with other films that there may be a couple funny scenes and that it, but Red Notice has it throughout. Not only was the comedy great, but the fight/chase sequences were amazing! I was smiling the whole way through, just blown away by how the filmmakers accomplished everything. Also, there are many twists that you probably won't except, so beware. The cinematography was great, the whole film looks beautiful. The VFX overall was great, however some shots in the mineshaft scene looked a little fake. Other than that, very well done. So if you want to be entertained for two hours straight with action and comedy, Red Notice is the film for you.

title: Not bad
text: Not a bad movie. Gal Gadot is playing again wonder woman, but with thives (I dont think she can play another role), The Rock is The Rock, Reynolds was a fresh character with the jokes and the sociopathic behaviour.

title: A dumpster fire of a movie!
text: One would think that Ryan Reynolds would have learnt his lessons from the shambolic mess that was the Hitman's Wife's Bodyguard (2021), in that a great cast doesn't not necessarily equate to a well-received film unless it is backed up by good writing.Three of the biggest global superstars combine in 'Red Notice', Netflix's biggest production till date. Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson stars as an FBI profile tracking down Ryan Reynolds' character, one of the most wanted art thieves in the world. 'Wonder Woman' Gal Gadot features as the mysterious 'Bishop' a legendary art thief who is considered a myth created law enforcement officers to hide their incompetence.Unfortunately, rather that gelling well together, the three superstars get in each other's way consistently. Ryan Reynolds does deliver some good laughs with his witty dialogues in the first half, but the jokes wear thin in the second portion and completely fizzle out by the climax. The 'Tango & Cash' dynamic the director was trying to construct between him and Johnson fall apart due to poor, one dimensional dialogues given for the Rock's character and a lack of imagination with regards to physical comedy.Buddy-cop movies like Central Intelligence (2016) and Hobbs & Shaw (2019) worked primarily because the characters had well-written back-stories that the audience can buy into, backed up with witty writing and well thought-out and expansive physical comedy. Unfortunately, Red Notice falters on all three fronts.The character back stories and motivations are flat and uninventive and make only a superficial impact on the audience. The McGuffin effect the 'artifact' they are chasing throughout the movie creates is laughable at best, such is the ease with which they track the 'clues' and finally get to it. Gal Gadot is criminally underutilized and hits every 'femme fatale' trope to a tee.British-Indian actress Ritu Arya plays the classic bungling, inept Interpol officer chasing these dreaded art thieves across all the fancy locales in the world one can think of. There is also a surprise cameo that makes you feel for the celebrity rather than take you by surprise.And ultimately that is the true failure of 'Red Notice'. It completely fails to catch the audience by surprise at any portion in the tedious 1 hour and 58 minutes spent sitting through this dumpster fire.It is a travesty that three of the biggest names in action were brought together only to achieve such disastrous results. Not recommended!

title: Funny and entertaining
text: Each star is used in their best way. Ryan Reynolds with his quick one liners, The Rock as the Rock and the lovely Gal Gadot who shows off comedic talent and timing to match her beauty. This extravagant production is grand for the small screen and unfortunately due to pandemic, most saw it on Netflix only not the cinema. I liked the story that was clever and funny with laugh out loud moments in a rather overdone genre it still provided a fresh feel. The fight scene in the villa was memorable.

title: Ryan Reynolds makes the film
text: Ryan Reynolds is hilarious. His lines had me laughing hysterically. Without him this movie would be no more than a 5. If you like your action movie to make you laugh, then this is a good one. But if you like a tight story with smart action, then you could skip this one.

title: Resist watching at all cost
text: Most of us could never smell what the Rock was cooking and what he serves here, like food without aroma, is expectedly unpalatable. Dwayne has been a functional actor for most roles he has played but here we simply see the wrestler who could raise his eyebrows. The dialogue in this film despite its star studded cast is unbelievably bad, its like the cast is practising to read their lines infront of a mirror in their bathrooms.Ryan since the success of Deadpool has been stuck in a loop where every character he plays is just another deadpool wannabe. Gal is simply here for her pretty face but with no nude scenes her presence is pointless.Ritu Arya and Chris Diamantopoulos put up a commendable performance but are let down by the script and execution of this mess.

title: World tour frame richness saves the whole thing
text: The whole flick is uplifted due to the world tour type which provide rich landscapes and backgrounds which saves the movie upto an extent with its richness. Ryan Reynold's fun thief and Gal Gadot's seductress thief are the only factors to cherish in the movie despite the good action sequences. Trio Fight sequence and Climax action sequences are the main highlight of the whole movie.Red Notice is dragged back due to its unwanted plot twists which seems just like silly fan service to satisfy fans and make an unwanted new franchise. The second last twist was the worst of all that makes the whole movie meh.In the end, A one time watchable average flickRating:59/100.

title: Good for a few solid laughs
text: Sure movies like this would do much better as rated R but for a PG-13 film it's not bad by any stretch. I really can't see why it got blasted so hard by critics. I'm on par with the rest of the reviewers and would give this one a solid 65.

title: Funny
text: Entertaining and amusing if you not take it seriously. Reynolds is funny as usual, Dwain Johnson looks stupid as always. They don't match together , but it's kinda cute. But Gal Gadot just ruins the movie with hers terrible similarity of acting, accompanied with horrible mimics. I don't know what they find in her. She looks soft , long but x-curved legs, big ugly head with this nose of hers . There is no place for her in whatever kind of movie.

title: Over the top yet not enough
text: With these 3 big stars I expected awesome but it was ...okay.My biggest complaint was that Ryan Reynolds was too jokey. Normally I find him very funny but it seemed forced this time. Not a bad movie for a cold November day just not what I was hoping for.

title: American (A+ Movie) My Ratings 8 /10
text: Red Notice has never pitched itself as anything other than a fun treasure hunt put together by pals. It's an easy, non-taxing watch. It isn't particularly memorable though.

title: Good ol cheezy silly action movie
text:
About what I expected I guess
Not bad but not amazing either
It's fun and has good moments even if it fails apart a bit near the end I think .Not a masterpiece by any means but enjoyable enough to throw on and see for 2 hrs .

title: This is for kids? Terrible acting and story...
text: This is for kids. Terrible acting and story...The over the top acting from Gal Gadot is painful.Dialogue is terrible.Storyline is not realistic.Most jokes were flat and cheesy.Ryan Renolds was too much deadpool.I do not recommend and want my time back!

title: A live-action cartoon. What's wrong with that?
text: Red Notice plays like a cartoon. It's supposed to make some sense on its own terms but not by the standards of real life. Apparently, like Roger Rabbit and his fellow toons, the characters can't be killed by any amount of pummeling or plummeting and a moment later they'll be cracking jokes. Nothing wrong with that, as long as the disconnect from reality is deliberate and clear. Sadly, another disconnect is that apparently a stunt double is doing all the athletic work for Gal Gadot in the fight scenes. I hope it's just age and caution that's sidelined Gadot and not her accumulation of injuries.

title: A fun timekiller
text: I never thought I would see these particular actors in a movie togheder and I loved it. There were some interesting twists and my god Gal Gadot is amazing.

title: Gadot CANNOT act. Enough already!
text: Other than a charming smile she absoulety has nothing, no charisma whatsoever.She ruins almost every scence in every movie with her forced acting.The rock also is not an actor, but he has charisma and fame that somehow make up for it.I don't know about the movie itself. I was distracted by the awfulness of Gadot.

title: It's a movie....
text: Nothing else to say. Netflix found the three most hottest actors of our time, gave them a half decent no effort possibly AI generated script and every beat of the story was made predictable.Watchable but not something for avid film buffs to enjoy but for people who watch movies now abd then.

title: A good laugh - worth a watch
text: A high speed, high octane, highly funny action comedy romp that's like a tongue in cheek Dan Brown novel meets Fast & the Furious meets Indiana Jones meets Ocean's 11.Yes, the Rock plays the Rock. And Ryan Reynolds plays Ryan Reynolds. And Gal Gadot is in it. And there's some other characters including Chris Diamantopoulos's cringey Sotto Voce. And the plot is, well, a bit far fetched and has a few holes.But it is genuinely a good laugh, and worth a couple hours of your time when you're done watching tv about dancing or cake baking or C list celebs eating bugs.

title: Weird, but entertaining
text: I cannot say I disliked this movie. It has a certain entertainment value that you would expect from that kind of movie and after all, it was an entertaining and fun-to-watch film.The movie still didn't quite manage to catch me because the effects were pretty laughably bad and the movie seemed like it was made for children. What I mean by that is that, although it contained gunfire and swearing, it seemed like the movie tried really hard to be harmless in a way that seemed weird and awkward to me.So all in all, I would recommend this movie for a pleasant Sunday afternoon (as another reviewer here said) - maybe even with your children if they are 12+ - but not more. Dont expect much, then you'll be happy.6/10.

title: Is This Movie the Flagship for a new Hallmark Channel?
text: The Hallmark Thriller Channel?Serious question.Whenever my wife and I visited my mother for Thanksgiving it was simply a reality to deal with that the Hallmark Christmas Channel would be on the TV AT LEAST 12 hours out of the day. There is a Hallmark Christmas Channel, right? Because that's ALL that was on 24-hours a day.Did it start before Thanksgiving or on Thanksgiving or were they able to RESIST the commercialization of the Christmas Holiday we all must endure beginning just prior to Halloween? I don't know. All know is every movie at Christmastime is the EXACT SAME STORY told with different (white, upperclass) characters living comfortable lifestyles in different places all over the country but always somewhere that it always snows BEFORE Christmas.My point? Every story is exactly the same. And THAT'S what Hallmark viewers want.And that's EACTLY what this movie reminded me of. A Hallmark Channel Original Movie that tells the exact same story every, single time, just with different characters.There is a real market for such movies and this movie could well be the Premier Offering for such a channel.It's not that the story is bad. It's not.It's not that the acting needed to tell the story is subpar. It's not. With Ryan Reynolds and The Rock playing Ryan Reynolds and The Rock the acting is wonderfully O. K.And it's not that the story doesn't have enough twists, turns, and reversals to keep the plot plotting. It does.The chase scenes, the fight scenes, the jokes and humor... it's all there!And that's what a large enough number of people want that made it financially worthwhile to produce this movie and tuck away a tidy profit for everyone.Who am I to criticize?So, hey! Six Stars. And if that's not enough of a warning for you, you deserve what you get if you don't enjoy it. I wash my hands.

title: Fully Enjoyable
text: My son and I watch this together and he loved it as far as the action goes it really kept your interest until the end. Not sure how it just came out today but there are reviews on here from weeks ago (Ya'll suck) but whatever. I especially loved the chemistry between Reynolds and Johnson. They played off one another that was very memorable. The jokes were great too, but I am already a big Reynolds fan so anything he does says makes me laugh.I am not sure why but I thought Sofia V. Was in this movie. The lead woman was not bad but also not as memorable as her counterpart male leads. It is had to find movie now a days with a ending you cannot predict like "The invisible guest" but this one was good, I didn't see the twist coming at all!Cannot wait to see the next part to this movie. If you love fast paced action movies that are a thing of digital beauty then this one will be enjoyable.

title: Entertaining, but...
text: It's an entertaining movie, but for me it basically ended when they discover the hidden Nazi treasure. From that poin on I was like, who cares about the g.d. Eggs.

title: deadpool in a suit...
text: An ok movie with a lot of deadpool jokes in it -- good jokes though (well not all of them) . And of course it s preferable to see Ryan Reynolds' face..

title: cemturc already said it all
text:
"Awful
cemturc13 November 2021
Terrible acting. Terrible writing... Terrible story... Terrible dialogues... Terrible scenes."I couldn't stand more than 15 minutes to watch myself turning into a moron, so I just quit in time. This is one of the most ridiculous, shallow, absurd and totally unnecessary productions. title: It's exactly what you'd expect
text: This movie is a solid 7. It has action, humor, romance, bromance and a tiny bit of emotion. Perfect movie to spend time.All 3 leading actors known for their narrow acting range do it to perfection. Gal Gadot is adorable in pretty much every scene she is in. She is cute, charming and aces the action scenes. Ryan still has that Deadpool acting glued to him. If that's what you want, you won't be disappointed. The Rock is same old same old.Watch the movie knowing what you are getting into and you will have a good time.

title: Meets expectations!
text:
Ryan Reynolds was Ryan Renolds, The Rock was The Rock.It was fun and funny. I'm not going to write home about it.The jokes worked, and overall it was better than a lot of Hollywood films I've seen lately.This is one of the few films I've watched where I think the IMDB rating is spot on. This movies is decidedly a 6.They seem to have set it up to allow a sequel.I would not go out of my way to see a sequel, but I might opt for it if I wanted something light and wasn't inspired by much else.******
I don't know why IMDB hates short pithy reviews so much. I should work on my ascii art game.

title: It's fine
text: Reasonable watch without being a classic. Ryan Reynolds is funny and makes it worth your time. The visuals/CGI are bearable without being OTT.Not sure it's worthy of Netflix most watched film but meh, watch it, have fun and move on.

title: Red notice is fun
text: What it is: Red Notice is light hearted caper movie that takes not so subtle inspiration from classic genre movies and blends them into a fun popcorn movie. The Rock and Ryan Reynolds have a lot of chemistry together and elevate this movie from being something bland to something that is really fun to watch. Yes, it's pretty predictable, so don't expect to be blown away by the plot or any of the twists. But then again, it's not that type of movie.Who should watch it: If you're looking for a movie you can watch with your family - bowl of popcorn in lap - that anyone age 10 to 99 can enjoy, this is the one for you. It looks slick with globe spanning settings, there's great chemistry between the actors and it has got tons of humor.

title: Entertaining, Funny with good story.
text: I enjoyed it and was entertained from start to finish and that is what movies are made for. Two of my favourite actors who have made lots of box office hit in the past. I am glad it was on Netflix as due to covid going to theaters are not possible. 10/10.

title: Gave Me A Headache
text: Just pure crap. Right from the start a million generic looking law enforcement and some annoying ugly woman who is yelling and acting in charge, of what I don't know, an egg I think.The Rocks head is very weird looking and deformed, melted almost, to the point that it's uncomfortable to look at, like nails on a chalkboard uncomfortable.Ryan Reynolds's is playing the same exact character for the millionth time and I'm sick of it, and this from someone who really enjoyed The Hitman's Wife's Bodyguard.

title: Fun view, great entertainment
text: It's always fun to see the Rock and Ryan Reynolds in a film, throw in Gal Gadot and its definitely worth the view. I caught this on Netflix and very much enjoyed it. I won't give any spoilers, just its a fun watch. The Rock and Ryan Reynolds have a great chemisty, and lots of good humor in the movie. Its a little bit of a formula movie. The Rock plays the same role he nearly always plays, as does Ryan Reynolds. Now if you enjoy them doing that--which I do--than its a good thing, I guess if you want to see something different from them then this wouldnt be for you. Its a light hearted action movie with plenty of comedy.

title: Recycled and predictable
text: The most appealing aspect of the movie is its starpower. It relies of Ryan Reynolds being himself. He plays the same character in every movie and does so here as well. The movie is fun and watchable. Its major plots are predictable. The Rock (Dwayne Johnson) is playing the same character as he normally plays as well.It has a few plot twists, but none that are not predictable. I honestly just enjoyed watching Ryan Raynolds annoy the Rock.It is a heist movie and sees the chasts attempt to seal 3 eggs. The police are attempting to stop the criminals.It iw watchable but felt recycled.Nevertheless, it is probably one of the best things we have to pic from currently playing in the cinema. It os an action comedy.The chemistry between Dwayne and Ryan is easily noticeable and one of the best parts of the movie.

title: Please don't waste time
text: Waste of time! Useless! They just take it too far. Only good thing is Ryan Reynolds! Gal I am starting to agree cant act and in this movie doesn't look great too. So disappointing!

title: Could have been better
text: There were a ton of funny moments. But the plot had a lot of holes in it and they tried too hard with Gal Gadot. I like the actress but her character in here was very unbelievable. And the scene where she fights the 2 of them was VERY stupid. I'm all for women being strong but at least make it believable.

title: Dirty Rotten Scoundrels re-make
text: If you've ever wished for a reboot of "Dirty Rotten Scoundrels"... this is it.This film is pretty much a vehicle for Ryan Reynolds to show his stuff. All of his old cliches from "Waiting" and "Deadpool" are right here.

title: If your in the mood
text: Buddy comedy/action modern day Lethal Weapon style flick with a lot of digital special effects. What's good about this movie is you know what your getting with some humorous quips and lines and a slight twist you I'll likely see coming. What's great about this movie is that it is free from any politics, social agendas or casting diversity, there is no virtual signaling/messaging and it's refreshing! Ryan Reynolds is the driving force in this movie and the cast plays beautifully with him - its well acted and directed which is needed in these type of stories with far fetched premises...

title: Get real
text: OMG people take life why to serious anymore. Relax and just enjoy the movie. For Pete's sake ! Yes, this movie can be somewhat predictable, but not entirely. Aren't most movies now ? Stop looking for the best movie ever written and just grab your popcorn and sit back and chill out for a while.

title: Red Notice is a fun, somewhat charming, heist movie that doesn't take itself too seriously.
text: If you're going into this movie with unbelievably high expectations, thinking this movie will be up there in the Hall of Fame of cinema, right next to Pulp Fiction, Fight Club, and Dora the Explorer 2019, you're going to be sorely disappointed. It's a movie with a ton of plot holes, funky looking CGI, and last-minute twists that are more shocking than your wife cheating on you with Dave from accounting. But... at the end of the day, it was a fun ride beginning to end. The action sequences were pretty well done, and the physical sets were so beautiful that it makes you forgive the special effects, as obvious as they may be for some scenes; not to mention the fact that The Rock and Ryan Reynolds have a natural chemistry that it's impossible not to care for their budding bromance in this movie. My advice? Suspend your disbelief for this one. Bury it deep in your grandmother's backyard, next to the bones of your pet goldfish who died when you were 7. Do all that and trust me, you'll have a good time.

title: Carried by the Cast
text: Red Notice is a film about the second greatest art thief, Nolan Booth (Ryan Reynolds), and his attempt to steal Cleopatra's (entirely fictional) three eggs. Nolan Booth is, of course, pursued by the intrepid FBI profiler John Hartley (Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson). And somewhere in the middle is the first greatest art thief known only as "The Bishop" (Gal Gadot) who tries to steal the eggs out from under the guys' noses.The Bishop frames Hartley making the international police believe he is not actually a FBI agent but actually an art thief himself, which then lands Harltey in a Russian prison alongside Booth. This is where things get moderately confusing in terms of the narrative. Hartley is forced to work with Booth to not only escape this Russian prison, but to also work together to steal Cleopatra's other two eggs. Why a devoted FBI agent decides to work with a career criminal, and time and time again decide to side with Booth instead of the police is not really explained, or at least not very well, in the movie.Confusing motivational narrative aside, it is a fun enough movie with lots of plans within plans within plans, and flashbacks from different perspectives which are pretty amusing. It is definitely a "star movie" where Ryan Reynolds plays Ryan Reynolds, Dwayne Johnson plays Dwayne Johnson, and Gal Godot plays Gal Godot. So if you are not a fan of any of these actors' antics from other movies then I would recommend you steer clear from this movie. I don't hate these actors so I managed to have a fun time watching Reynolds and Johnson play off each other throughout the movie.The writer-director Rawson Marshall Thurber, who worked with Dwayne Johnson at least two times previous in his films "Skyscraper" and "Central Intelligence," managed to weave a relatively complex narrative with lots of overlapping plans and timelines into a film that is easy to follow. I enjoyed how all the little things said and done earlier turn out to be significant later on in the film. There were more than a few references to previous classic films similar to this heist genre. I especially liked the underground car chase which was clearly inspired by "Raiders of the Lost Ark."I'm not sure there was a lot more to the movie aside from some funny chemistry between the main three cast members put into different locales. There were certainly some twists and turns throughout, but by the time we got to the final two or three twists I wasn't all that surprised. I have no idea why Hartley "needs" to join up with Booth to steal the eggs, no clue why the eggs "need" to be stolen for this mysterious Egyption family in the first place nor do we know anything about this family aside from a throw away 1.5 minutes near the end. It's a funny movie made funny by the heavyweight actors but there was never any real sense of danger or surprise. If the cast was made up by less confident (or less famous) people I don't think I would remember anything about the movie.

title: Meh
text: I really want to like this movie. My main issue is Ryan Reynolds. Can't be portray anything else other than Van Wilder? He's the same in every single movie he does.Tired.

title: It was just OK
text: Sort of fun. Had some twists. A lot of Ryan Reynolds doing his perpetual Van Wilder schtick. Gets tiresome after awhile. Fun movie otherwise. Seems like a vaguely planned filler movie to make money.

title: Parts are dedicated as homáge to a few Indiana Jones movies
text: Some parts are dedicated as homáge to old and new Indiana Jones movies and their storylines. The movie not hiding this, even giving to our attention. Other side, at the fighting scene on the scaffold: if the joints of those rods are really so easy to open, the work on their platforms should be a survival game.

title: Globetrotting for no compelling reasons
text: No-brainer action comedy which did globetrotting for no compelling reasons. Marshall Thurber still provided every 'action movie' elements with very predictable plot. Johnson-Reynolds-Gadot's infuriating characters tried to outfox each other in foolish ways.

title: It's basically the movie version of UNCHARTED
text: Don't take the movie too seriously like a lot of these one star reviewers did, mad at things that are virtually nitpicks like incompetent security and prisoner guards, saying "well, real guards don't act like that." Well, duh, Einstein, it's called a movie for a reason.Don't be like those people. Just sit back and enjoy the film. Enjoy the action and the comedy. Enjoy the little nod and easter eggs to the adventure genre.

title: Red Notice (2021) Review
text: Pros:Cons:

title: It's as you'd expect...really bad
text: So this is what it's come to. Bad Netflix movies over and over again. I'm going to save you the misery of wasting any more time on this movie by cutting this review short. Don't waste your time. It's as bad as it gets. The age of great, consistent Hollywood movies are over. Netflix has done to movies what American Idol did to music for at least a couple of generations. Thank god for classics.

title: Gee, reviews from two weeks before release?
text:
This is an awesome movie!The cast nails it!Outstanding cinematography and action.How do I know? Because 30 people reviewed it while watching on Netflix and it hasn't even come out yet....
11/12 release...

title: Fun movie!
text: Don't take it too seriously, this is a fun ride for sure.The dancing scene brought back memories of True Lies.Interaction between leads: Dwayne and Gosling is cool.You are in for a great, relaxing movie.Ignore the bad reviews, pop a beer or a wine and just enjoy and smile.These corona times are bad enough, so enjoy an escape.

title: Action + comedy, nothing spectacular
text: Good starring trio of Dwayne Johnson, Ryan Reynolds and Gal Gadot in Red Notice, a generic action comedy that meets the goal of entertaining and amusing.

title: Saved by Mr Reynolds
text: Fun movie with the normal Dwayne Johnson wooden performance thankfully saved by Ryan Reynolds wit and charm. I'm sure with the ending there's a Red Notice 2 in the pipe line coming very soon !

title: Fun action flick
text: If you don't expect too much then this is an entertaining film. From start to finish the Rock, Reynolds and Gal Gadot steal the show. They have good chemistry and it is very action packed. I honestly thought the Interpol person was the other Bishop so I like the twist and didn't see that coming. Overall it's easy and fun viewing. If you can get over the plot conveniences then its not all bad. I see they tried to leave the door open for a sequel and I would watch it if it got made.

title: Very decent
text: If you like Reynolds in hitmans bodyguard, and the rock in any of his movies. Then you'll enjoy this movie, it's a fun over the top action, heist , treasure hunting movie that mixes Jackie Chan action, mission impossible and all sorts of other movies into one. Sure it's not original at all and the twists are predictable but it's fun and entertaining. Worth the watch a good family action movie... Not for young kids really though no blood in action scenes.

title: Why the harsh reviews?
text: I found the movie entertaining! It seems like all people want are stupid super hero movies. Chill out peeps! The movie was good with Gray acting and a surprise twist.

title: Good fun!
text: When the jokes are good, you wont hear me complaining!The good: excellent jokes, excellent timing and great actors performing at their comical best. Tons of action. Lighthearted, fastpaced, riveting story. Great dialogues. This is comedy at it's best.Not any bad? It's completely silly and that is how it is suppose to be. It's a mix of James Bond and Mission Impossible, but then way more SILLIER.I loved it. Entertainment for the entire family. Young and old could love this. A perfect holiday movie blockbuster.

title: What a disappointment with such an amazing cast
text: This was awful, no nice way to say it. Maybe a movie for kids? Zero substance, some of the most forced character development I've ever seen. The story was ridiculous and full of plot holes. There are a few funny moments, and a lot of over the top action scenes.

title: A good fun romp
text: Oh for goodness sake - all you budding "film critics" who gave this a low rating should stick to very deep flicks. This was never meant to be a serious film with a deep plot; it excelled at exactly what it was made to be, a really easy, fun watch. Some people should perhaps watch films that have a possibility of meeting their expectations as they sip on nasty red wine!I loved it, every minute and look forward to seeing the two paired up again.

title: Comic Action
text: Fun stuff. Don't take it seriously. The action scenes are not realistic or overly violent. They're like a choreographed dance, so if you go into it knowing that, enjoy the fun of it. Ryan Reynolds plays everything very deadpan which gets a little old by the end, and The Rock plays The Rock, and Gal Gadot plays a slinky, flirty, fighting badass female. A fun combo.

title: More Millennial Drivel..... Yawn !!
text: The industry seems pump a lot of this garbage out lately, giving movies a bad name... so many laughable, cringeworthy points like when the rock gets hit by a bull... not to mention the script.... make it stop !!

title: Switch your brain off fun
text: Nothing new from the rock or Ryan reynolds. Both playing the same character they always play. But nothing wrong with that. It's silly and predictable, action packed and good fun. As long as you're not expecting to much from this film I think you will enjoy it.

title: Silly, Fun, Bad, Some Bad Green Srceen, Enough Acting, Bad Story and so on :)
text:
Despite its multiple logical errors, the movie was entertaining. If you whached the trailer, It was clear that it would be a fun but bad movie
The movie was a bad movie, and bad although I had fun and I obviously liked it. There may be a sequel to the movie, if the second one comes, I'll watch it, really.Anyway, watch it, have fun.

title: A cool, simple movie
text:
I sat down today, wanting a relaxing light hearted movie...
And that's what i got.Great acting by reynolds. The rock was decent. I was a little disappointed with Gal Gadot.But overall, a well put together film with some nice twists.

title: Plot could have been better but it's entertaining.
text: If you're just looking for something easy to watch, with a lot of action, some mild humor, and with actors that did a decent job Red Notice might be the movie you're looking for. Don't expect a very plausible story though, because there are a lot of scenes that would just never happen in real life, scenes that are far fetched, but this is exactly what you get in this genre of movies. The Rock, or Dwayne Johnson isn't the greatest actor ever, but he seems to have found his genre of movies where he performs the best, that is action/comedy. I wasn't a fan of him when he was a wrestler but in this genre he's actually doing good. Ryan Reynolds also does the best in this genre, so in combination with The Rock it works perfectly. Gal Gadot is like always eye candy. Nothing bad to say about the acting. The only minor negative thing about Red Notice is the plot, but it isn't that bad if you're not too picky. It's a good popcorn movie, the kind where you leave your brain cells outside.

title: It Is Not Remotely Like An Indiana Jones Story Or Theme. Its All Comedy Crime Caper!
text: I don't know why so many people have tied this down as an Indiana Jones style tale/film because, the only similarity is the involvement of ancient Egyptian artifacts; Gold bejeweled Eggs that were a gift from Marc Antony to Cleopatra. What it is though is a non stop fun around the world with lots of laughs and, a twist that you just DON'T SEE coming EVER!Dwayne Johnson is -as ever- very comfortable doing comedy films, he's a natural. The teaming of him with Ryan Reynolds works immensely good (reminds me of the old classic comedy duos like Bing Crosby & Bob Hope, Dean martin & Jerry Lewis etc, etc). Its plainly obvious by films end that a sequel will be following and I'm very much looking forward to it (I just hope I'll still be around as I am quite advanced in age at this time)! I am not a fan of Cal Gadot as up to present day, 2021, I think she is no better than a mediocre actress; I definitely do not think she is a 'Hollywood Glam Star'...I honestly would walk right by her without any recognition whatsoever! She does not bring much to the table in this -IMHO- and there are far, far better suited comedy actresses out there for good looking, 'Femme Fatale' roles.If you want to see a very funny film that will give you a lot of old style fun and entertainment, then you will do well to see this...its a damn good piece of fun!

title: A bit disappointing
text: The start was great but after that it went down the road and becomes generic and a bit boring.Reynolds as much as I like him is one of the problems as he plays the same character as usual which doesn't fit here. Also the twist at the end is beyond belief.In the end it's a solid entertaining movie, which wasted its potential.There are so many movies like this out there so spending 200 million dollars on this is really a waste of money.

title: awful
text: Corporate junk with a predictable overdone plot. Forced diversity with mediocre acting from all of the "big names" gotten just for the sake of big names attracting attention, even though we all know they just did it for a check because netflix can throw a bag at anyone they please. This movie was extremely hard to sit through.

title: Good old school fun
text: I cannot believe that this is a Netflix movie. There was no gay/trans/black/empowered women character, no woke at all. The story was pretty good with unexpected plot twists and we got good old set of characters - funny guy, righteous muscle and something nice to look at.It was a silly, quite forgettable movie but I really enjoyed watching it. Dialogues were good and funny I could see chemistry between characters and I wasn't able to predict the ending. Time well spent.

title: The art thief, the cop and the gal
text:
This movie is a roller coaster ride in which an art thief
( Ryan Reynolds) tries to get hold of antique pieces in the shape of large sized eggs belonging to the times of Cleopatra. He is joined by a cop ( Dwayne Johnson) who is there to clear his name. Gal Gadot is also after it and a cat and mouse game ensues as both Dwayne and Ryan travel to some exotic places of the world like Rome, Bali, Valencia, Cairo, Argentina, Sardinia and London. There is excitement at every corner and one liners fly thick and fast between them as they tackle high technology security systems and hefty mean looking guards. There is the mandatory prison break too with the getaway chopper strategically placed in the vicinity. There is a secret underground cave right in the midst of a jungle in Spain and while escaping both face bulls in the fighting ring .What keeps viewers gripped are the mind boggling special effects, the excellent cinematography, and the pulsating music. All three main actors are on familiar terrain as they have done similar roles in the past in previous movies. Think " Fast and furious " and both Gal Gadot and Dwayne have done similar stuff. Ryan impresses as the smooth talking, happy go lucky art thief.However, to be fair, the movie is a few notches below movies of this genre. While the action appears to be on par, the barbs and the one liners don't really match up. Also you have seen it all in earlier movies and there is nothing new in the plot or action. At 1 hour 58 minutes, the movie appears a bit too long and even the action gets repetitive and tiresome at places. A sense of deja vu hits us in most sequences.

title: How and where is Argentina?
text: Everything is wrong about maps and places. This movie is a nice comedy, a instable action movie, almost worth the view. Although the movie was no background research and facts cronology.

title: Good, entertaining, one time watch
text: Red notice is good and enjoyable to watch once. It has twists and turns which goes quite predictable sometimes but it hooks up good the audience till last.The chemistry of Ryan areynolds and Dwayne Johnson is hillarously good!Good for it guys...

title: A feeling of dejavu.
text: This film was loaded with every heist movie and James Bond score all up in it. From The Temple of Doom, National Treasure to Ocean's Eleven. And the score was super similar to all of the James Bond films. Definitely great popcorn but I couldn't help having the feeling of dejavu while watching it. A great one time watch.

title: Great!
text: I don't understand why people didn't like this movie? It's great! The acting and casting is perfect! I thought this movie was funny with amazing action scenes and a shocking twist!

title: Entertainment (Period)
text: Over what one would say money well spent movie. Though, the starting was a bit dry and u might be thinking of the movie being too predictable. But as it moves, it is not and makes you stick with your screen.Word of advice, do watch on a TV, if want some entertainment.Rest the cast is known to all and they are playing what they are very good at it.Gal Gadot, lessor screen time, but perhaps for the better.Looking forward for its sequel, would be fine.A good weekend watch.

title: One Of The Most Entertaining Films Of The Year
text: The first act of Red Notice might not be really work but it slowly really turn me on until the end of the movie and boy do i think this movie is just very very enjoyable, Red Notice is a pure action comedy that works perfectly, and without Ryan Reynolds the movie is not gonna be what it is, Dwayne Johnson was always perfect as a partner guy, Gal Gadot is just always mesmerising, and Ryan Reynolds is not only good, he is the real key in this movie, he was absolutely funny, the movie also fills with a great action and the most impressive was the cinematography, it's hilarious and it's fun, overall, Red Notice is one of the most entertaining films of the year.

title: A decent movie if you have nothing else to watch
text: I hate to say this but I've seen these three actors in much better movies. Some of you may be thinking that the whole time you're watching this movie. It's not awful, I think Gal, Dwayne and Ryan just set themselves up by being in many good movies, or at least massive blockbusters. That's the general expectation when any of them are the leading role in an action or comedy.This movie is what you'd generally expect from most Netflix, action movies. It's in that odd place where it's a budget much bigger than a TV-movie but obviously much smaller than a Superhero or large franchise film. Many of the scenes, even the action sequences, are clearly shot on a soundstage in front of loads of green screen. All the side-characters are ridiculous caricatures or mindless goons (the kind that can't aim) for the three main leads to either manipulate or beat up. It's nothing we haven't seen in literally every action movie.All the best scenes were in the trailers because of course they were. So, like always, going in blind will give you the best experience. There are so many call-backs to similar movies that Ryan breaks the fourth-wall and makes a pop culture reference to Indiana Jones and other movie tropes throughout...because this movie is filled with them. The soundtrack and background music sounds like royalty free music you'd pull from "generic action film".There are elements that hold it together. If it isn't obvious, Ryan Reynolds, Dwayne Johnson and Gal Gadot is probably the reason most of us would bother watching this. They gave Ryan a surprisingly good amount of comedic lines; he's basically playing the kind of character you'd expect. Gal and Dwayne seamlessly pull off their action sequences. And I think there's enough eye candy for everyone; but I would argue the actors are better eye candy than the shoddy CGI.The story isn't anything spectacular. You could probably do your laundry while watching and still follow along. This is good if you want to eat up 2-hours on a plane or long car ride.

title: funny
text: A nice movie to watch. It had many lol moments , and ryan reynolds just delivers everytime. Full of action and twists so be prepared for an enjoyable ride. The trio had alot of chemistry between them and hope many will come in the future. I don't understand the negative reviews for the movie was good. Watch it yourself and you be the judge.

title: Fun and light movie
text:
The movie is fun, lots of action and very light
It's not an excellent top of the chart movie but we had a great time watching it and understanding all the Easter eggs in it.Perfect movie to watch after a beer 🍻

title: Hollywood crisis
text: Ever wondered what will happen if an unfinished AI make a movie? Well, watch and find out. They seem to have hired actors that came out on the first page when you googled actor. None of the performance is impressive, Ryan Reynolds is as expected playing Ryan Reynolds. The Rock being an absolute rock, he just freeze there with charisma not knowing exactly what to do. And Gal Gadot is like a gorgeous wooden door, she is beautiful but she has no personality whatsoever, actually none of the characters have personality. The whole thing is basically famous actors running around and shooting and dodging bullets. It's forgettable, boring, and predictable even with all the twist they put in. And of course the ending sets up for another movie.

title: Dumb action movie
text: Yeah the title says it all. That's just it, a dumb action movie. Do you want to shut your brain off and mildly enjoy some action scenes devoid of any logic or physics for 2 hours? This is the movie for you. You get Ryan Reynolds being Ryan Reynolds as well.

title: Jolly good fun
text: Yes it's formulaic, no it's nothing new but it was fun to watch. Some the effects were fab, but the cgi bull wasn't one of those, resembling moving Lego.Overall, an easy to watch, fun film with great characters.

title: Why all the negative reviews?
text:
This Movie is exactly What you expect. You are Not in for an Oscar winning Movie. But you are entertained all the Way to the end.Great cast.Action was allright
Plot and twists was okey.Humour was good, specially the funny references ( you know What i mean when you Get there )

title: Let's separate from the world and have some fun.
text: The three of Dwayne Johnson, Rayan Reynolds and Gal Gadot were extremely amazing. I didn't expect to enjoy it that much, but they gave us an action movie in a very funny way.I don't want to spoil it, so I just want to say I recommend it very much, and have a good time watching this piece of art.

title: Reynolds' comedy carries another
text: Yeah, not bad, light, slight adventure... The Rock is always the same Muppet. But Reynolds really appeals to the cynics!Way better than that recent James Bond debacle.

title: Why? Just.. why?
text: It's so bad. I don't know who the intended target audience is but it's too edgy for children and too cheesy for adults. There's absolutely nothing original about the entire plot and every scene is so clearly fake/ green screen. I would be embarrassed if I was a top tier actor and had this on my resume. Just a complete waste of 2 hours.

title: A fantabulous experience
text: Red Notice is an awesome action comedy that brings the fun talent with Dwayne Johnson, Ryan Reynolds, and Gal Gadot. Taking these characters into an action packed ride with a side of laughs.The film is action packed. And a lot of fun seeing Ryan Reynolds and Dwayne Johnson banter at each other throughout. Johnson being a brute and Reynolds being the wise cracking talker. And Gal being a skilled fighter. The film is fast paced. Lots of fun set pieces. And humor.Director Rawson Marshall Thurber knows how to handle the action sequences. Taking these characters into a fun Indiana Jones mixed with a bit of National Treasure ride. Great cast ensemble. The film does have a twist that is fun and entertaining. Which leaves you wanting more after it ends. I would love to see a sequel.Overall, Red Notice is a lot of fun, fast, action packed with some humor.

title: Arya stopped this from rating higher.
text: In the omnipresent need to make women the bosses/heroes, the head of the Interpol team is a woman. Again.Her speaking voice/accent diminished what little cred her casting had.Very enjoyable movie other than that.

title: gal gadot is so bad at acting
text: The movie as a whole is so bad with a very bad choice of events and even worse twist and a below average casting crew with only the rock worth mentioning and rayan reynolds not good but typical of him and Gal Gadot is the biggest example of "good look wins over great work" cause she can't act for $hit and that's a fact not an opinion.

title: Fun nonsense
text: Preposterous but passes the time entertaingly... Nice locations too. A bit laboured at times but good fun with a few happy twists and some good gags. Enjoy. Looks like it's ready for a sequel too.

title: Good mindless Saturday evening amusement
text: This is a movie we all have seen before, in its entirety or in parts; nevertheless, it's still enjoyable, even if all the known clichés and all the expected twists are there waiting for us. It's just that you don't mind, as long as (another reviewer said it in a review here) you park your brain before watching the movie.

title: fun if you turn off your entire brain, otherwise laughable at best, humor is hit or miss, or all hit if you're a teenager
text: Again, big Ryan Reynolds fan, but it's starting to wear thin. All of his roles are the same, and the whole "every other sentence is a joke or pun" gets old fast; in this movie, it's 90% of his dialogue. So, sure, the script writing required no high school diploma, but admittedly some of the jokes landed for me, and the Rock continues to be entertaining, despite his frequent monotony. Gal Gadot, who I don't normally care for, actually had the most personality of anyone in the movie, so that can be applauded. The predictability was hilariously bad up until the end, which I'll give credit where it's due. Action and suspense is so run of the mill and reliant on "Hollywood convenience" that it makes me think either they weren't trying at all or they were genuinely striving for a brainless flick. Either way, a success!

title: Good chemistry
text: Dumb but fun hiest capper movie with surprisingly good chemistry between Johnson and Reynolds. ( Johnson gets top billing in this movie! Really!? Is he a bigger star than Ryan Reynolds? ) Ryan Reynolds plays Ryan Reynolds while Dwayne Johnson is the straight man and although Gal Gadot is fine it's the leading men who carry the movie. It's nice to see a Netflix production which doesn't lecture the audience for a change and I wouldn't mind more of the same in future.

title: Unexpected!
text: It was a fun watching this film, you can't expect the next move, the humer was pretty good and funny. The twisted way the film was demonstrating the action was fun, never felt bored even 1 second. It worth every amount I spent to Netflix.

title: u seen this movie before but u don't know where
text: So the performance is ok,action is goodCgi was actually Excellent,some people might find this movie funnyI didn't laugh at all but i kinda Enjoyed itThis movie could've been betterif u like Ryan reynolds or the rock this is for youMy Rate: 7.4 out 10.

title: Imagine
text:
Imagine no possessions
I wonder if you can.Unless, that is, you're an incredibly privileged individual whining about how "hard" things are.Hollywood doesn't even try to be original anymore. I can't believe people get paid so much to do so little.

title: Great Movie
text: This movie was really great and great actors for the movie as well. Hope they do more of these.I really like all of Ryan Reynolds's movies having the rock in the movie with him really added the touch to it as well.

title: Fun film
text: Plenty of action with big budget special effects, Ryan Reynolds has some funny lines which make you laugh and the rock and Gal Gadot were good as well.Good light hearted entertainment.

title: GIVE IT NOTICE
text: Yet another low in the CGI Neverland, totally devoid of originality, insulting to anyone of average intelligence. Gal Gadot is the only thing with the slightest distinction.

title: It was fun!
text: Forget Gal Gadot and Dwayne Johnson, this was Ryan Reynolds once again, selling manure to a farmer.Dwayne plays the usual role, hardened, sophisticated and Gal plays again the usual role, beautiful, temptress.Ryan Reynolds however is the X factor for this film, jokes, quips, and laughs.I didn't see the twist, but I was half a bottle of JD in at the time, but the laughs kept coming.Give it a watch, it's fun and captivating, you won't be disappointed.

title: It's exactly what it appears to be, a don't miss!
text: The bad reviews are from the trolls who don't know any better and couldn't express it if they did. This isn't supposed to be Citizen Kane. It's supposed to be a fun, action packed flick with a top notch leading cast. You wouldn't be disappointed if you watched for the cast alone, but stay for the thrills.

title: Fun Entertainment.
text: I did not have high expectations going in but I do like Ryan Reynolds' comedy. He's a brilliant comedian. The Rock can do comedy too when he is paired up with someone like Ryan. You pair these two guys with the absolutely stunning Gal Gadot 🍆 in a low-cut red dress and give her some pretty funny lines and she holds her own weight among these two men. If you had a difficult week and could use a couple of good chuckles, this film will be what the doctor ordered. Just go in expecting a comedy first and an action thriller second; not the reverse order. This is a light hearted film inspired by Steven Spielberg's Indiana Jones - Raiders of the Lost Ark.

title: So fun! Everything you could want in a film
text: It's nice to forget when the world is crumbling. Most of the time I don't want to watch some heavy serious show or film. If you like Indiana Jones, True Lies, National Treasure, James Bond and heist movies you'll love this! We had such a great time! It's a comedy/adventure movie and really well done! Give it a shot!

title: Entertaining adventure thriller
text: Action, adventure,suspense and comedy mixed in an entertaining Saturday movie.Beautiful places around the globe with a very intriguing story and funny jokes at times.Don't take all seriously, it's just a film and you will enjoy it. Sequel is already clear to come.6/10.

title: Silly and boring
text: The movie is full of plot holes and logical problems. People just show up without any knowledge of how to get there. Green screens galore, and jokes that falls flat to the ground.A movie for 10 years olds, that tries to be a movie for grown ups.

title: A Fun Silly Romp.
text: It's what films used to be - sheer entertainment. It does that very well. It's not profound or the stuff of dreams are made of; but, it's fun and very enjoyable. These days we need more films like this one.

title: Fun and entertaining, despite unrealistic premises (as action comedies normally have)
text: Ryan Reynolds has many really funny lines, The Rock and Reynolds have very good anti-buddy chemistry, and the blockbuster action is a lot of fun (albeit not very realistic) :-)

title: Unbelievable cost
text: Unbelievable that this cost Netflix $200 million to make because you wouldn't know it from watching. An utterly bland and generic scavenger hunt film, in which a trio travel the world, hunting for Cleopatra's faberge eggs (a made up plot point for the movie). Lots of exotic locations and money spent on the CGI dominated action typically involving fires and explosions, but made with a 12 certificate so very family orientated, lacking the crucial bite of a Bond or Bourne. The Rock is a little bland, Gal Gadot limited, and a wisecracking Ryan Reynolds the only mildly entertaining part of this. As for the cameo at the climax - no thanks!

title: Hijinks and banter
text: Whether you watched this movie for Ryan Reynolds (adorable wisecracks), Gal Godoy (Beautiful fight sequences) or Dwayne Johnson (Action Adventure), you will find them here. No surprises, just hijinks and banter. I give this film a 7 (good) out of 10. {Action Adventure}

title: Red Notice....A Fun Weekend Watch Movie
text: "Red Notice" starring Dwayne Johnson, Gal Gadot & Ryan Reynolds in lead roles..... Released on Netflix on 12th November 21Directed by Rawson Marshall ThurberVerdict: One Time Watchable Movie...Plot of the Movie:Story begins showing history wherein cleopatra was being gifted 3 bejeweled eggs by Mark Anthony on their wedding day as a symbol of his undying devotion of love...Centuries crossed, its being realised that one egg is somewhere missing but its their anywhere in this world & for this the most intellectual art thief Booth played by Rynald Reylonds is on a mission to grab it & to nab him officer John Hartley played by Dwanye Johnson is behind him and their journey forms the rest part of the movie.....Analysis of the Movie.....1) It was engaging throughout the movie.....2) Gal Gadot as of clever cunning con women is convincing.... But still i love her to see as Wonder Woman...3) Ryan Reynolds from his Deadpool character deviated himself and made a presentable role of a an art thief.....4) Dwanye Johnson is always classic when it comes to action....5) Flaw where it was observed was,a) Climax was predictable....b)There could have been little more action as expectations from Dwanye Johnson movie is always action action & action.....c) VFX could have been betterOver all a Timepass weekend watch.

title: Red Notice might be imperfect, but it is definitely enjoyable with its mega-star cast and grand adventure.
text: Red Notice is a fun adventure film with the biggest stars, beautiful locations, and spectacular effects while missing the mark in a few places. Still, it is an entertaining movie that is wildly enjoyable if you don't take it too seriously. With a cast boasting three of the most sought-after A-Listers of its day, Red Notice wisely focuses on these characters giving each actor a chance to grace the screen with their unique charm. The movie advances rapidly from action set piece to action set piece. The moments in between are filled with Reynolds and Johnson's playful banter that is funny but not as natural as Kevin Hart's chemistry with Dwayne Johnson. Ryan Reynolds does a great job playing his character that fits his strengths, but there are times when Johnson and Gadot's characters start to venture into Batman and Robin levels of cheesiness. Yes, Red Notice has flaws, but it really is an enjoyable film, and I look forward to its sequels.

title: A lot of fun
text: Sort of a cross between an Indiana Jones movie and the Pink Panther. Lots of comedic lines. Lots of references to other movies. Very entertaining and family-friendly.

title: Trope and Cliche Filled but Still Kind of Fun
text: This is a somewhat decent film that unfortunately appears to be based on a horrible script. It's made mildly entertaining by the performances of its leading cast. Without Johnson and Reynolds (both of whom I normally enjoy immensely,) this film is DOA. The writing and plot are so amateurish, it's surprising the writer/director got the three leads to sign on the first place.The story is a hodgepodge of set pieces from other, better films, including James Bond and Indiana Jones. Even the music cues are similar. And this is obviously not by accident since the Easter Eggs contained in the film directly reference those other franchises.This could have a great film if the plot had been revised with another pass by a more proficient writer.That said, it's not horrible, just completely forgettable ten minutes after watching it.

title: are they men or are they muppets?
text: Apparently this film had the biggest-ever Netflix budget. I'm guessing most of it went on the stars' pay, because in other respects this feels like what it is - essentially a TV movie. It had already put us in mind of Muppets Most Wanted even before it reached the Gulag (a comparison entirely to this film's disadvantage) and, unless I'm very much mistaken the bullfighting scene was modelled on an old Bugs Bunny cartoon. Gal Gadot demonstrates that she doesn't really have leading lady charisma; the lads do their best, working their personas hard, and the script isn't awful; but what's missing is any sense that any of it matters in the slightest to anyone.The action-comedy genre is hard to pull off. Comparing this with a successful example, Hobson & Shaw, yes, you need good stars, good banter, and fancy locations don't hurt. To that point, Red Notice does okay. But you also need plenty of convincing action, and a reason for the action that makes sense and that the audience cares about; and you need not to rely too much on CGI rather than real stunts and location shooting. Those are the things where it falls short.(If those comments about locations sound contradictory, put it this way: in this case the cameras have been to some nice locations, but I'm not sure that the stars went with them.)

title: Fun ride
text: Red Notice is great fun that's funny, fast paced and gleefully dumb. Dwayne Johnson and Ryan Reynolds are both great with excellent chemistry, playing completely to their strengths. Gal Gadot is also great but effectively playing against type as a gleefully evil antagonist. Rawson Marshall Thurber's direction is fantastic, it's extremely well filmed and mobile. The CG is mostly solid with some bad moments and the music by Steve Jablonsky is really good.

title: Fun movie, what was everyone expecting
text:
