I liked this movie. It didn't take itself seriously. I thought Ryan's character was hysterical and I was surprised at the twist at the end. There are a lot of action scenes, which are not my favorite. They were well done but too much for my taste. Ryan's nonstop banter was priceless. And the Rock did what he does best. The nice teddy bear guy..until...
First time seeing Gal onscreen and I was pleasantly surprised. She played the villain with a wink and some awesome fight moves. The remaining characters were just filler. The selling point was the dialog between Ryan and Dwayne.Overall just a lighthearted fun heist movie.

title: Meh, another "fast and furious" like crap
text: It's definitely not funny, the action is crap on a level of fast and furious, the rock is shatty actor, always was and always will be. Gal gadot is old news that got old, the story line...is missing. In short, keep watching the show you were watching and don't bother with this one.

title: Fun movie !
text:
Great movie, good action and even greater comedy with top actors
Definitely worth a watch.Couple of a very good twists ,especially the end a good, good end to a movie.

title: Bland, But A Good Passtime
text: The plot of this movie is very simple and has been used countless times. There is a big prize out there, and there are multiple people looking to get their hands on it, and it all comes down to who can outsmart the other, and grab it first. I would say that this movie was most enjoyable because I got to see some of my favorite actors in it, mainly Ryan Reynolds and Gal Gadot. There is some action and a little comedy that takes place, but not nearly enough to make you feel that the time spent watching the movie was justified. This movie is a good past time if you're just looking for something to watch.

title: Absolutely loved the banter and the wonderful sets and costumes.
text:
The best part of this film is the banter between Ryan Reynolds and The Rock (aka Dwayne Johnson), they have amazing chemistry. I already loved both Ryan Reynolds and Dwayne Johnson separately and on their own merit...but together they were cinematic gold. For me Gal Gadot was just fluff, completely unnecessary for the film...except I appreciated the chess plot twist of which she was integral. I also appreciate that they have set us up for a sequel...which I would watch.Lush foreign settings for this con artist caper, along with a decent soundtrack, make this a complete adventure package. I am sticking with the fact that I appreciated the humor and the many instances where I laughed out-loud."Step 3- Rock Jenga"-Ryan"We're not friends!"-The Rock
"Best Friends!"-Ryan"Resting failure face."-RyanHighly recommend. Pure fun for the whole family.

title: Funny, action, lighthearted, a great watch
text: I really don't understand all the negative reviews, this film was great!Everyone should know by now to expect a lighthearted film that absolutely will not take itself seriously from Ryan Reynolds and that's exactly what this is.The chemistry between him and the Rock was very believable and its just an all round good action film.If you pressed play hoping for a documentary or Bafta winner then I'm afraid you're in the wrong place.

title: Mindless fun
text: Gal Gadot throws the egg, and a nice catch from The Rock, but he drops the egg. That's a fumble, and oh my god an egg-cellent recover from Ryan Reynolds.A new action comedy on Netflix with an exciting trio as the main cast. This was a pretty enjoyable movie. The action scenes were handled well, especially the museum and the car chase scenes. The comedy cracked me up many times, especially from Ryan Reynolds, even though this was nowhere as funny as Hitman's Bodyguard's Wife.The duo between Ryan Reynolds and The Rock was decent, and it's mostly Ryan Reynolds that carried the relationship. Gal Gadot was beautiful as always, but she didn't have as much to do in the movie as she should.Plot wise, everything was predictable. It was so obvious when Gal Gadot's character would show up. However, the big twist caught me off guard.Overall, a fun and enjoyable movie. 7.5/10.

title: entertaining, solid and funny heist movie
text: Finally a good Netflix feature film that does not rely on the new agenda of political correctness in terms of message control. Besides the only two mentionable black actors (one being a singer in Italy and the other is a pilot appearing for a few seconds), the racial boxes have been checked and there is no political message ruining the plot. Well I was disappointed by the bull fight in Rome and people screaming "vamonos". It's like, oh the Americans, still aren't aware of European cultures. But hey, given the humor of this film I guess this was an intentional prank on stereotypes?Actually some good old 80s clichés have been baked in this cake of entertainment. I enjoyed the incredible fight scenes and the slapstick comedy. Ryan Reynolds got on-point comments and one-liners to cheer up the story. The nods to the Indiana Jones franchise reach their climax only by the theme being whistled. The story is quite smart for today's standards and there are some twists placed and timed carefully. Also the character development works perfectly by the book. The soundtrack from acclaimed Steve Jablonsky is a bit generic and the resemblance to the Bond theme is quite boring.According to the trivia page this is the fourth cinema movie collaboration of Dwayne Johnson and Gal Gadot. The pair previously have both appeared in three theatrical feature films - all from the 'Fast & Furious' franchise - they being 'Fast Five' (2011), 'Fast & Furious 6' (2013) and 'Furious 7' (2015).

title: Hostile stereotypes
text: This film is a series of bad jokes and constant remarks about incredibly negative male stereotypes. I don't understand how this film got past the Netflix woke barrier, how is it ok to constantly undermine a man's entire human worth based on their physical attributes? Sickening.

title: Surprisingly ok
text: In my opinion Ryan cannot act to save his life and that is why all the characters he performs as are exactly the same. Gadot simply cannot act any emotion so do not expect much from these two. With that said and not being an action movie fanatic this was actually quite enjoyable. Gadot and Ryan's characters should have been replaced with other actors to make this a hit with actually action fans. My partner doesn't care for Ryan or Dwayne but since Gadot can't carry any scene they fell asleep within 30 mins :/There was a decent amount of dialogue giving you more background on some characters than most action movies provide allowing you to connect a bit with character.

title: A solid roller coaster ride, if you can overlook all the cliches and plot holes
text: I kinda had meh expectation for this movie because many big star Netflix flicks have been flops. This one, fortunately, was well worth the time if you can overlook its flaws.And its flaws are plenty. The plot cannot hold ANY water as it's full of holes. The characters' personalities flip-flops to fit into the storyline, and there are TONS of cliches and plot twists that again, makes little sense except for the sake of having plot twists.Look beyond all those though, the movie is actually a lot of FUN. The plot unfolds quickly and smoothly, and the pace is fast. For all its flaws, at least you never feel bored. Gal Gadot looks stunning in this movie, Ryan Reynolds is hilarious and the Rock is the Rock. All I looked for was a fun roller coaster ride and for that it sure delivered.No this isn't a movie that's gonna make you think about the meaning of life, nor is it one that make you laugh so hard you fall off your chair, but it is a fun 2 hours roller coaster ride action adventure movie, and I sure don't mind if Netflix keeps making movies like this.

title: Really fun and exiting movie!
text: This movie was extremely funny and that is thanks to the chemistry between The Rock and Ryan Reynolds. And the acting is really good by everyone in this movie. This is a movie you need to watch and you will love it. I really want to see more and I hope they can make a sequel.

title: Brainless fun but forgettable
text: You get what you want here - big budget slick heist movie, the strength of Dwayne Johnson, the van wilder/Deadpool/every other RR movie humor and the sex appeal of Gal Gadot.Out of the 3 I enjoyed mostly RR's Humor even though some jokes missed the mark. The action was well made but the story as predicted was far fetched and brainless.

title: Super
text: Good and enjoyable. Good action and cinematography. And good twist in the end.gal gadot is really nice in acting.nothing to say about rock. Ryan is just superberb as usual.

title: Nothing new but fun nonetheless
text: The rock and Reynolds are good together. Not sure Gadot was the right casting choice for the female lead though. Would've made a difference with someone that could pull off a more humor styled approach. Entertaining but not adding anything new to the genre.

title: An entire movie of overdone and far fetched scenes
text:
Total missed opportunity.. they should've gone for a more Indiana Jones or Romancing the Stone plot.. the whole art thief and fbi profiler is odd.My biggest issue:
The movie is rated PG13 yet it's so unrealistic it's impossible to suspend reality because it's literally every scene. They should've made this some sort of alternate universe where prisons are on mountain tops surrounded by nothing yet 2 guys can escape by throwing a snowball. I mean it's just ridiculous and I can take some over top because that's most movies now with CGI but there needs to be some realistic scenes in a movie for adults. Now if it was PG tans geared towards kids I'd get it.As for the acting, I don't think it's bad at all. I know some people don't like it but given the script I think they did the best they could.There are some funny scenes , usually by Ryan R characters.It's watchable but don't expect much.. it's the kind of movie you have in the background while cleaning .

title: Better than expected
text: Very enjoyable romp. I didn't expect much from this movie but I was unexpectly entertained. I did give it an extra star to counteract the 1 star trolls.

title: It only matters what they think you've done...
text:
Here's The 4K Lowedown on "Red Notice" (PG-13 - 2021 - Netflix)Genre: Action/Heist
My Score: 7.4Cast=7 Acting=5 Plot=7 Ending=8 Story=6
Violent=7 Pace=9 F/X=8 Heist=10 Chemistry=7An FBI profiler teams with Interpol to capture the #2 art thief in the world. But when the #1 art thief frames him for a theft, he must join forces with the very man he put away."It doesn't matter what you do, only matters what they think you've done." I got a definite Indiana Jones vibe as I watched this and you get a good cast...but they play the same characters they have always played. The good news is I wasn't looking for Oscar worthy performances...would have been nice to have it a little less predictable, though. This turned out to be a solid offering from Netflix.

title: RED NOTICE should be billed as DIRE WARNING
text: I have one burning question, who in hell, keeps giving Gal Gadot movie roles, she should be given acting lessons. The same thing should be held true for Wayne (Pebbles) Johnson, but he invested money in the movie so he actually paid himself for his movie role. The movie is billed as a comedy, I'm still waiting to see what's funny about this movie, Ryan Reynolds is the same in every movie he's in sorta like a mini Jim Carey. The lead female role for me was screaming for Angelina Jolie, other than that, this is just another turkey that can't fly. I guess Hollywood is thinking about expanding the franchise, building movies around, DUMB, DUMMER and Just DUMB!

title: Noticeable
text:
After all the woke and feminist rubbish I have seen on Netflix of late, I really wanted to enjoy this .With smart arse smile and self gratitude, I was hating it but then even I had to laugh at some of the jokes
Watchable but how can the bad guys be allowed to get away with it ?

title: You guys are too serious! This was a fun movie!
text: Sheesh! The reviews take this movie way too serious. Yes. Everyone played the "characters" we most know them for but I'll tell ya, I enjoyed this movie. It was entertaining and made me giggle and smile.

title: Silly but fun.
text: This movie is one of those ridiculously silly but quite fun movies. It is a movie that makes no pretense other than to be entertaining.The movie is a mixture of art heist thriller, Indiana Jones inspired treasure hunts and fast and furious chase action. All served with a large dose of humor.I have to confess one thing right away. Ryan Reynolds grated on me. I guess he was chosen to provide most of the comic relief and, to me, he is over the top silly not to mention dishonest (most of the time) in a way that was not really my cup of tea.Luckily Dwayne Johnson largely compensated for that. I have not yet seen a movie with Dwayne Johnson in that I felt was really bad. Also, sorry to all the Gal Gadot haters out there, I did like her in this movie but then, as guy, maybe I am a wee bit biased on that, you know what I mean.The story is bordering on the ludicrous with, mostly predictable, twists around every corner but then it is just there to tie the action sequences and jokes together so it is good enough.This is a movie that you watch for the silly action, even sillier jokes and, for me at least, because Dwayne Johnson is in it. It has a single purpose and that is to entertain. No bullsh.. preaching, no finger pointing and no pretense to provide food for your brain.I liked it. It allowed me to spend two hours together with my oldest son just being entertained.Oh, one more proof that it is a movie worthwhile to watch is of course the woke crappy tomatoes score. Note the discrepancy between their far left woke "critics" and the actual audience. Even that bullsh.. of separating the audience in "verified" and others couldn't hide the fact that their "critics" are totally out of sync with the audience.

title: Rock
text: It's like every Rock movie just have fun with it and turn your brain off while watching it weak writing the movie could have been way better but still fun.

title: Mindless levity
text: If you don't want to think too much and just want a light-hearted ride, this is the movie. For that purpose, it is well done, well enacted, and just enough special effects to drive it home.

title: No notice of its own predictable and messy sides.
text: Red Notice is a new crime comedy written, written and partly produced by Rawson Marshall Thurber, the director of Central Intelligence and Skyscraper.In the film, FBI agent John Hartley (Dwayne Johnson) is put on a case by Interpol to track down and arrest art thief Nolan Booth (Ryan Reynolds). When Hartley nearly gets hold of Booth, he has a conspiracy theory known as The Bishop (Gal Gadot). For example, he can team up with Booth in trouble and seems to get out of it on his own with Booth's help, but the question is they can work together.This movie will first hit theaters, but thanks to the Corona, several movie studios have let go of buying the movie rights, eventually starting at Netflix. Thus, this has become the most expensive Netflix original film for now.Rawson Marshall Thurber has designed this film somewhat like a crime comedy, which you often saw in the 90s. The film comes across as a mix between Indiana Jones and the Ocean's Eleven movies, but with some more comedy elements. Because the movie comes across as a 90's movie, not all elements in the movie work, want to make something look outdated or unbelievable. Furthermore, the director has written the story a bit too simple and too directed. So on the one hand it comes to look at what it can be on the far-fetched side. So can come down to it, they aren't so funny anymore. The many plot twists make the story difficult to follow, or unbelievable.They have the film in several places, which can be mentioned in the film, but unfortunately the corona pandemic were unable to portray every place. That's why they brought out these scenes in the movie studio and with a green screen the backgrounds of these places. That these moments are not really local on screen, unfortunately they are on when you can see them again. Some random shots are via FPV drone. This is the first film in which this way of filming is used.The acting is well done by the film cast. The three major stars portray their roles well, but do this a lot in their familiar way. They seem a bit standard in this film compared to their roles in other films. Dwayne Johnson and Ryan Reynolds play nice together. Yet they come across more as people who are obliged to work together. The film tries to portray them as people who start to care more and more about each other during their collaboration, but they do not really achieve this status in the film and continue to come across as a duo that is forced to work together. Gal Gadot also does well in the film, but comes out more in the middle of the film, to do something with her role.

title: Common Setup, Good Twist, Great Acting.
text: A great heist film? No. A good comedy action movie? Yes!!!! And also, great casts can make improvement from decent to good. All good except the CGI and Settings Places. The green screen background CGI is really bad and annoying. But you can forget about it. Because all actors are good and they carried the whole story. Thats all.

title: Watchable Netflix Film...
text: Red Notice is an american Netflix action movie about the hunt of three, expensive and rare golden eggs, that several people are after. The plot in this film is easy to understand, even if the start is a little weird to understand, but later everything falls on the right place. My first thought of this was: That was the sound of Netflix. You know when Netflix are making action movies, it is so predictable, always epic near-death situations, epic action angles and big, massive explosions. So if you are watching for entertainment, this could be a full star rating. Becuase I focus on more, I have some pros, and some cons. So the action was good. The Netflix concept of action is predictable, but I have to admit I liked it a little. Creative action sequences and some fun jokes, with very good plot twists from time to time, made this movie a great entertainment. Dwayne Johnson did play as always in his manly, funny, ironic way, with always that fun face, that always gives the smile. Some of the cons is that the start was a little confusing, but later of course it got better. The second was the originality. This could be a better planned story, and could put more deep into the characters. And of course the russians are the villains, that is so predictable. So besides predictableness and the story could be better made, it still got some fun Netflix entertainment, this is more of a movie you can just put on if you got to put on something on your watchlist.

title: Netflix was scammed to pay out 200 mil for a 35 mil movie. This failure is covered with subscription fee hike.
text: Netflix, this is the absolute last price hike before your downfall. I will not tolerate another. New streaming platforms available are hosting their own content, removing it from your platform. While your service continues to offer less content of questionable quality you dare to charge more money.Meanwhile we observe you carelessly waste our subscriber money. What justification could you possibly have spending 200 mil for a Ryan Reynolds action comedy? A movie that in the industry costs 35-45 million. Overpaying 5-6 times the market rate for a movie is pure fraud.$200 mil is a budget of a huge blockbuster movie: The Avengers, Avatar and Titanic. Movies that extensively used CGI and featured a large cast of A-list actors.Netflix instead paid three nobodies a $20 million salary each. A compensation that the very best A-list Hollywood actors would ask for. Netflix instead paid it to B-list Ryan Reynolds, B-list Dwayne Johnson and Z-list Gal Gadot who's an awful actress and never ever was paid anywhere near this much.Dwayne Johnson and Gal Gadot are both actors hired only for their physical appearance. Neither one is needed in this movie. Dwayne plays the straight man to Ryan's comedy and Gal plays a character without any specific traits other than being incredible off screen.There's no justification for either to be in this movie. There are countless talented actors that would deliver a better performance without the ridiculous compensation.

title: Three amigos, three eggs
text: This action packed comedy brings boots to arse charisma with the unlikely duo of (Dwayne Johnson) as John Hartley and (Ryan Reynolds) as Nolan Booth, add a woman into the mix in the name of (Gal Gadot) the bishop to create a star studded formula of explosive capacity. The chemistry between Dwayne and Ryan works well for me; however sometime the dialogue can be a bit too silly. Although I don't see Dwayne is an outstanding actor I do feel he is at his best when he bounces off a comedic counterpart like Reynolds. Gal Gadot brings a red dress, along with a little more of herself into this. I feel with regards to playfulness and not taking things too serious this role works wonders for her. Shades of True Lies seems to be prominent in the dance scene between Johnson and Gadot, possibly a homage. What is most clear to me is this film takes us on an adventure to find three eggs in an Indiana Jones style action comedy; whilst it would have to go a long way to be considered into that bracket of film making, it does have many merits of its own. Pretty sure Reynolds even whistles the Indiana theme at some point to further the influence Indy had on this. The story has bit too many twists that in turn make it seem one step too far although I can accept it knowing the type of genre I'm viewing. It's far from perfect, for one I can't for the life of me see the John Hartley character as a legit cop because there is too much banter between him and Reynolds. If he is a cop he is very unreliable as well as making deals with the theft he embraces partnership on more than one occasion. This makes it very unlikely that he would've ever been taken on as a cop in the first place. The bishop (Gal Gadot) would be more believable as a cop as the stunts she pulls; I mean where exactly was she trained or did I not get the memo? Very little is told of the bishops background. Yet this is a film where we suspense belief allowing all logic to be thrown out the window. Overall it is an entertaining watch due to the fact our three amigos do a good job charismatically of bouncing off one another in a very natural warming way. At the moment these three are bringing in big bucks, not down to being outstanding or versatile still they are likeable and good investment. I must say I like all three actors in this, they each suit the role they have been given however I'd have probably had the three pair up as the conflict seems daft at times especially when we see how it all turns out.

title: 3 great lead actors in just a good film
text: Dwayne Johnson, Gal Gadot & Ryan Reynolds make this movie worth a watch but you can't help thinking how it could have been much better.With 3 very entertaining & talented actors who can give you a comedic twist & action at the same time, the possibilities are endless & really with a much better script this could have been a 9 out of 10 if not 10 out of 10 movie.Unfortunately the script is a bit too weak, obvious in the most part & by the end you don't find it clever ( you just are glad a decent film has finished but you can't help enjoying Dwayne & Ryan's humour & comedy line delivery ).As a fan of the 3 stars as Gal Gadot did the best with the script she was given also, I did find myself enjoying the film & wanting to give it 7 stars because of their performances however (1) will I watch this movie again ( most likely no... = lose a star ), (2) Is the plot really engaging ( well it is average = lose a star ), (3) Is it thought provoking or hilarious throughout ( well no it is not... = lose a star ) as it's a B movie saved by 3 super stars!If they had a much better script writer & director this could have been something really special, but at least it is still worth watching once.

title: Action, Adventure, Comedy and 90's Fluff
text: I missed this type of movie, it doesn't have a big blockbuster budget, but enough production value and cast charisma that makes this movie a fun ride.It's not a visually poor movie. On the contrary. There are wonderful views of scenes from all corners of the world.And yes. There are many narrative conveniences in each scene. But in the grand scheme of things, it doesn't matter.Red Notice, fulfills its function without any pretension.The Rock and Reynolds make an excellent duo, Gal Gadot is charming and also has a lot of funny moments.It's notorious that the entire cast had a lot of fun making this movie. And I, as a spectator, had fun with them.A decent escapist movie that shouldn't be taken seriously. I was surprised. Hope they make a sequel.

title: An exciting and thrilling heist movie!
text: Hollywood / Streaming has all produced many different heist and adventure films. Considerably, each one creating the suspension, and engagement within the plot and the action scenes.It is also interesting that this type of "blockbuster" is one of the biggest on streaming services, and should create a trend, in the near future, for new Action Franchises..Red Notice is a mixture of both genres (heist and adventure) and a creative addition to Action productions. The film plays a lot with combining several aspects of consolidated franchises, such as Indiana Jones, 007 , and Fast and Furious.What is crazier about all of this, is the gathering of huge names such as: Ryan Reynolds, Dwayne Johnson and Gal Gadot, on a massive streaming production. They all contribute with their chemistry (including the comedy relief of their interaction, especially, Dwayne and Ryan) and their performance on every single action sequences, which is fluid and natural. Gal Gadot, is stunning and steals all the thunder for herslef. Additionally to an amazing performance, the construction and development of her character, is cleary potentialized by her acting and passionate action scenes. Ryan, and Dwayne are also incredible!Moreover, the fim has a concise and linear perspective throughout the motive of the characters and narrative. However, it still lacks a little bit of detail within some of the character's "decisions" (screenplay) or establishment of a particular setting for the story. Although this gathers up for many unanswered questions, the film is pretty objective and understanding of the intention to portray the action sequences on a simple and straightforward heist movie.Consequently, my main problem with this film is some of the screenplay decisions, that seem to be completely misleading under the purposes of the main characters, especially in the third act and in the climax of the movie.Therefore, in overall, the movie is great, with amazing action sequences, great chemistry between the characters, inviting and family friendly.Ps: this type of blockbuster provided by streaming services, with no special requirements (photography, or screen need) is one of the reasons people are preferably not going to see it on the big screen (Cinema).

title: Fun fun fun fun fun
text: Typical hilarious Ryan, Rock always fun and adds that adventure and Gal is just perfect for this role and sexy as hell. This was such a fun movie. My favorite movie of 2021 probably. Just watch it.

title: Bad Cartoon.
text: I confess I didn't even watched the whole movie, but the beginning of this crap was very dumb stupid I can't expect anything good for the rest.The part when they chased Jack Ryan was utterly dumb and cliche. Their attemp to create scene like Jackie Chan or Indiana Jones chasing was failed terribly. Jackie Chan's show off about his gymnastic or Indy's antics was witty and fit, but in this movie they were just plain bad, dull and stupid. I don't understand why they even doing that. Not even a slight tension or urgency, it's ike watching cartoon, a bad cartoon.I have to take note to myself never watching movie by this director or writer again (Turned out it was directed and written by the same person, no wonder).I can really tell that the writer is not the brightest tool in the shed.

title: Thoroughly enjoyed it. Exactly what I expected and hope for
text: It is fun and full of action. No one going into this expecting a deep movie to remember by, but it is exactly what it is for the genre and it was thoroughly enjoyable. It is a really interesting mix of actors but it works for me. If you want to kick back and enjoy a movie you don't have to think too much about, this is it.

title: Not a good movie
text: It's a cookie-cutter movie that fizzles out from the beginning. The story isn't interesting and you can almost hear the cast laughing at how bad this movie is. They're just there for a paycheck. This completely feels like a Netflix film. Can't they hire good writers? You just want the movie to end as quickly as possible. It's a collection of horrible jokes. At the end of the film you don't care what happens because none of it makes sense. What was the point of the Interpol agent?

title: digestable
text: Its certainly not a difficult movie. This is the type of movie you would watch when you have absolutely no energy to do anything after a long day. Making a easy movie is an art on its own. So all in all, no this is not a 'good' movie, doesn't mean you can't enjoy it.5/10: not good, but has its purpose.

title: I've seen worse, but ive seen better, these actors need to stop with the money grabs
text:
A little cheesy for the premise To be that a thief steals a gold egg in front of everyone by replacing it with a fake gold eggHe knocked the gun out of the rocks super human grip with his back pack ? Come onThere's definitely some cool action
A little Aladdin at times tho, jumping off roofs and bouncing off roofsRyan Reynolds drinking his own gin
ClassyIt was shot very cool with the camera following the vehicles or a running actorRyan Reynolds knows how to make a bomb out of two ingredients in a jail, yet no one has ever figured it out?I'm sure
CheesyRyan Reynolds pulls a rock out of the prison wall and it collapses ?Ok
Cheesy againThe part when the rock breaks the glass case with his elbow then rye try's to do the same but hurts his elbow was pretty funnyThe part in the tunnel with the cars is pretty cgi heavy
And also cheesyOverall the movie had some laughs and action
Obviously there's a door for #2
Just cut back on the cheesiness and it will be more than a 6/10.

title: Should bee hood
text:
I like the movie but one problem da part movie.Is
Style indiana Jones. I don't like da part the indiana Jones. I like all acter. But the style indiana Jones i don't.

title: Argentina is not in Brazil....
text: And the rainforest is not in that coordinate either. Millions of dolars in production and not a single person to Google South América map. That is my review.

title: Classic Ryan renolds movie
text: Lots of jokes and badmouthing and a really funny rock, i must admit that Im. A huge Ryan renolds fan, so i was expecting this.I just want more of this.

title: Just a basic movie, but it was good
text: The plot of the movie was nice, it was just like every action, treasure hunt movie. The storyline was nice, basic. The characters were well-developed, they were very interesting and very likeable (especially, the main three protagonists). The casting was really good, acting too. Dwayne Johnson and Ryan Reynolds were an amazing and a very funny duo. Gal Gadot was stunning as always. There were many intense scenes, action-filled. The idea of the film, of Cleopatra's stolen eggs was just nice. Overall, it was a nice movie, nothing new, but I enjoyed it! I don't think a sequel is needed, but I'm gonna definitely watch it. Also, there were some very funny scenes.

title: Dreadful
text: Pathetic, totally uninteresting...the only minuscule good is Ryan Reynolds...everything's disappointing. Plot not engaging, didn't fancy the so called twists.

title: Ryan Reynolds is the Bob Hope of this generation
text: Bob Hope basically just played himself in every single last one of his films. Ryan Reynolds is no different. And neither is The Rock. Looks like Gal Gadot is falling into that category of non-serious but top-billing actors as well. They're just playing themselves and cashing checks I every single movie they make. But somehow they continue to get the big action films, because these popcorn money makers are 100% formulaic - and certain actors slot nicely into the formula. Red Notice is not a bad film. In fact, it's a fun waste of time. It has a decent script, some good stunts and action sequences, and that reliable, predictable, familiar Ryan Reynolds/Dwayne Johnson brand of humor that carries a big chunk of the film. Don't expect to feel anything more emotionally than a chuckle, and awe at the CG toro.

title: Keep expectations low and have fun
text: I didn't know what to expect when I sat down to watch this with my friends, seeing as how this is a comedy, and I'm glad. The writing for the story was very good and the scenario almost constantly kept me interested, there are also some very nice one-liners but most of the jokes are cringy at best. I did however appreciate the pop culture references, like Booth whistling the Raiders of the Ark theme when entering a treasure cave. Lastly, what I really didn't expect was the historical accuracy. Even for a very tiny part of the film that has WW2 history, it's impressive to see that the writers did their research and actually based the scenario on real history. Also the equipment used in those parts is suprisingly accurate as well!Overall, a nice movie to watch with your friends/S. O and relax in a Saturday evening.

title: $200 million well spent!
text: Ryan Reynolds is as aggravating as always. Gal Gadot is not the greatest actress (I'm being nice). And The Rock just does his usual thing. This film is a travesty, and the two male leads should be embarrassed, but instead they're laughing all the way to the bank. All that money spent, and still utterly worthless.

title: Fun Throwback
text: This is the type of movie used to get made a lot in the 90s. Basic plot with few surprises and charismatic leads. Honestly? What's to hate really.Is it good? Well not especially. But also yes.You can tell the actors are having all kinds of fun. Ryan Reynolds plays...Ryan Reynolds. The Rock honestly puts on, in my opinion, one of his better performances. He works very well as a straight man who doesn't need to carry the entire comedic load. Gal Gadot is sexy. She's sexy. Really, really sexy.The plot is...there. The action is fasted paced, and fluid. The movie never slows down too much to give you time to think out it.It's not a strong recommendation. If you skip it, you're not missing out on some grand experience. It is kind of nice to see a movie that doesn't get made much today. No superheroes. No licensed characters. No pre-planned franchise or cinematic universe. Just actors chewing scenery and having a ball doing it.

title: I had a lot of laughs
text:
Great movie, I liked it, I had a lot of laughs. I thought R. Reynolds contributed, but no.I liked very much the scenery changes.It was ridiculous so many bullets not finding the target.Many gags (I don't want to give any spoilers)
Bad ending, leaving a "so and so" aftertaste.I recommend it however. I had a great time.

title: Hmm
text: Very fun! However... the annoying pointless, un appoligetic stupid cgi are way much. Tooo many pointless cgi scenes that add no value and ruin any good plot which was very slim. Too mich crammed in one movie really.

title: Predictable But Fun Heist Movie
text: Red Notice isn't going to surprise you in any way - it's probably the least amount of acting the 3 main actors have ever had to do - they basically play their same usual selves from 99% of their other movies. I'd be lying if I said that I didn't see the big plot twist coming as well.All that aside though, Red Notice delivers as a fun, comedic action movie that feels like a blend of National Treasure, Indiana Jones, and The Thomas Crown Affair. It wants to be sleek, sexy, and not take itself too seriously - and it does just that.Pros: scenery, humor, never gets boringIt doesn't rewrite the prototypical heist movie script, but who doesn't love a good heist movie?!Verdict: Watch.

title: Light funny action movie.
text: People who gave this bad reviews were maybe looking for a different kind of movie? This movie is not a work of art or believable. It's not that kind of movie. But it was a lot of fun! Pleasant way to spend an evening and very entertaining. Ryan Reynolds is hilarious.

title: A usual storyline but an enjoyable ride!
text: Ryan Reynolds a new sensation in Hollywood, his acting and his attitude mind blown. Dwayne Johnson is always a best pick for any role. Gal gadot the wonder woman just nailed it with her acting and expressions. A typical storyline but very enjoyable till the end. A one time watchable for sure!

title: Good, fun, action.
text: I'm not a big fan of Reynolds or The Rock, however this movie is some good, light hearted fun.General flick that flows nicely with some decent laughs and good action. Reynolds isn't too annoying like he normally is and The Rock plays the less important character well and puts his ego to the side.Gal Gadot is overrated and her acting is quite poor in this.Other that that, no real negatives in this one. Just simple, basic, fun that is executed well. No complaints from me. Just watch and enjoy but don't expect a masterpiece or any thought provoking material.Much worse ways to spend 2 hours of your time so if you're bored and can't find anything to watch, this will fill your time well.

title: Hot Mess
text: I'm trying to figure out why and how so many people are enjoying this. I have tried twice now to get through it. I finally gave up when size zero Gal Gadot, after beating the crap out of Ryan Reynolds (almost believable) and the ROCK (who are you kidding) AT THE SAME TIME, literally lifted THE ROCK UP AND THREW HIM...... yes this really happened. No it's not a superhero movie. The acting was subpar, the writing was subpar. I just don't get it.

title: Mindless entertainment done well
text: This is a pretty enjoyable flick, elements of Indiana Jones combined with National Treasure. This is fast paced fun with a good rapport between Reynolds and the Rock. This is an easy watch if you are prepared to ignore the plot holes. Gal Gadot is also pretty good in this.

title: Fun, fun, fun....
text: This film was a pleasant surprise.A really good cast working well together, a decent script, a decent plot, lots of laughs, action and a good few genre references (Raiders of the Lost Ark included), finishing off with a twist or two.Suspend reality for a while, sit back and just enjoy the ride.

title: Fun ride!
text: Maybe it was just the mood I was in, but really enjoyed this movie. Ryan and Dwayne were adorable with their bro-mance! And I liked the twists and turns and bad ass lady bosses!Didn't have to think too deep and just enjoyed the show! I actually would like to see a second movie bc Ryan was quite funny.The action sequences were fun to watch BC of all the close calls, crazy jumps and lots of speed! Could almost feel the wind in my hair!I highly recommend watching if you just want to escape reality without thinking too much! Seven out of Ten from me. Yep. Words words words words words words.

title: If you don't like what it says on the box then don't open it ...
text: I'm glad that people still make movies that are simply intended to be lighthearted entertaining fun - and Red Notice accomplishes this with some gusto, providing entertaining twists and turns and comedic fun along the way.What could possibly go wrong? Well the cast may not be up for the challenge, the direction and technical prowess required to pull off the ambition may not be up to snuff and the script could be a dud - but that's not the case here.Red Notice is a good old fashioned romp. Leave your disbelief at the door and go along for the ride. The cast and crew are well up for their job. It's mischievous, rude, implausible, funny, conceals some of its punches quite well, has high and slick production values and enough locations for a story that ducks and weaves to be unpretentious good entertainment - which is what it sets out to be.It's exactly what it says on the box - a Johnson, Reynolds and Gadot roller-coaster of fun - made for your amusement. A solid 7.5.

title: A fun 7.5
text: Enjoyable action heist/adventure comedy. Some weak CGI here and there and cringy deus ex machina moments, but the banter, humor, and fun dynamic between the characters make up for it.

title: Funny one-time thing
text: The funniest moment is the episode when the Russian prison guard pushing likes for naked Putin's photos on Instagram. Actually, this is the most realistic scene in this movie.At the rest it is more or less funny and easy going one-time film. Why not?

title: NOOOOOOO
text: Please, someone, stop hiring the Rock to "act". He should always appear in films grunting and nodding his head. To ask him to emote or actually deliver a line is utterly pointless.We have a hundred years of cinema behind us and an awful lot of gimmicky heist films to choose from.Don't choose this one.

title: Ooooozing Chemistry
text: If you are a fan of action, comedy, drama, the thrill of the chase & Gal Gadot ... YOU GET WHAT YOU CAME FOR!The chemistry between Dwayne, Ryan & Gal oozed. Their acting was phenomenal & they nailed their performances to the T.A lot of twists & funny moments courtesy of Dwayne. Plus, Ryan delivers his comedic lines punctually.In addition, Gal Gadot - being the charmful delight as well as the elegant Goddess that she is - delivers a lot of intense fight scenes as well as cute moments.It is definitely worth a watch since this film is family-friendly & extremely entertaining.

title: Just for fun 👍
text: What people need today is the comedy, in simple daily life. The whole story goes on with small unexpected funny incidents, that's the point I love the most. Thanks.

title: RED CARD FOR ALL INVOLVED
text: With a cast like this, how was it possible to produce such crap. All I can think is.... There are now too many streaming channels, so to fill the schedules, they churn out whatever rubbish they can. Film making is now at an all time low in my opinion.1/10.

title: Formula with no real depth
text: Everyone did what they were expected to do and it was all bells and whistles but there was no moment that I actually believed anything that was happening. Dwayne Johnson still doesn't convince me as any type of cop or detective, Gal Gadot was not her usual charming self and Ryan Reynolds, whom I have always thought to be strong in a variety of acting elements, was phoning it in. The budget would have been better spent on story and making new stars instead of staying safe and betting on the obvious picks. Sad, it had potential but I never felt the pay off.

title: Entertaining...just
text: Suspend all belief and just go with it! This movie has had the most unbelievable moments....and by that I mean...moments that are so silly you won't believe they put it in the movie. A few good laughs in this Indiana Jones style good cop bad cop tromp. Just sit back....relax....

title: Typecasting For A Fun Adventure Plot
text: A fun heist caper which is entertaining to watch but not without its flaws. Johnson plays the character he has played in pretty much every film he's in since he got into acting, and Reynolds too sticks to his well known witty repertoire. Gadot completes the trio and plays her part well, however the part is somewhat insufferable.Whilst everything comes together oh so well for the finale, that doesn't mean that perceived inconsistencies or coincidences that happen during the film aren't irritating at the time. Remove the con-man context and this plot could have been tweaked to make a great Indiana Jones film, it is an adventure and historical additions make a nice touch.Success in the dialogue does depend on Reynolds as the Rock is simply cast as the Rock. That said, if you enjoy Reynolds' or Johnson's films, you certainly won't be disappointed with Red Notice.

title: It helps if you're a Gal or Rock fan...
text: Any time Gal is on my screen I consider myself fortunate! The Rock is plenty cool too. The other guy is a one-note actor and dragged things down, unfortunately.The script was also a drag, as it was really just a mash-up of various films we've seen before. Where it needed to shine was with the character's dynamic, which just didn't work.But perhaps the main problem with the film was you didn't know who to cheer for. You might cheer for someone only to find out the film stomped on your dreams. You'll just not win people over if you insult them...

title: Enjoyable!
text: The most annoying thing which kept irritating me while watching the movie was Gal's accent which was a real copycat to Salma Hayek's accent.That was really disturbing!

title: Another hollywood action film
text: This was just another classic Hollywood action movie featuring famous actors: Ryan Reynolds, Gal Gadot, and Dwayne Johnson (always in jungle movies). This movie is highly recommended for people that enjoy action scenes. Reynold's comedy lines implemented throughout the film also complement the excitement of the movie. The film does not have any great themes that the audience has to think deeply about; it is rather a good way to kill time and enjoy good screenplay. Overall, I enjoyed the film, but it wasn't really special.

title: So Bad and Boring it Rates a Short
text: Review. I got the distinct impression that two of the stars were mouthing their dialogue, reading it straight from the script. I have no doubt that the movie will make millions because its perfectly suitable for teenagers but that's about it No more Rock shows please.

title: Great !
text: Very easy to watch with lots of twists! Acting was great and there were some very funny lines. Definitely worth a watch.Great movie to watch with the family.

title: Red hot !
text: Red Notice certainly lives up to its $ 200 million production budget, as far as visuals, star-power and location sets go. Ryan Reynolds steals the show, playing the funny man/action hero while grabbing the best lines in the movie. Despite all the hype, one can't help but feel that the story and action scenes are at best, derivative - the most blatant ripoff being that Raiders of the Lost Ark chase scene.

title: For Devout Johnson & Reynolds Fans Only
text: This film is a payday for Johnson & Reynolds. An absurd script with mediocre direction. It is dominated by stunts and exotic locations. Johnson & Reynolds phoned it in and collected huge paychecks. We, however, were not amused.

title: Really funny
text: Hardly high art but the laughs are there. Ryan Reynolds plays Ryan Reynolds, Dwyane Johnson plays Dwayne Johnson. Gal Gadot is hot. All is right with the world.

title: Product placement
text: Lots of jumping and running and funny one liners, alos, lots and lots of in your face product placement, anybody for a Aviation Gin or Teremana tequila?

title: Unsubtle Cliche Driven Popcorn entertainment But....Still Enjoyable
text:
After a long week dealing with the detritus of Life as we know it in the real World...What better than to come home after a long week, switch off, and switch on and settle down to something entertaining which doesn't require too much brainpower..
Yes.. the movie with three megastars, and maybe a fourth albeit brief cameo, all involved in a Vanity project with nods to all the heist movies , adventure escapism etc etc.Thank you for giving me ample distraction to wind down 7/10.

title: A missed opportunity
text: With the trio of actors and actress acting together in a film that is somewhat a mix of the genres that made them famous in their various films, from Ryan Reynolds's crude humour, Dwayne Johnson's muscles, and Gal Gadot's kickass fighting skills, it leaves one to wonder... What could possibly go wrong?Unfortunately, quite a bit. While I would say the chemistry between the cast was decent, it was not outstanding by any means. Furthermore, though there were many scenes that were obviously done for humour, it was simply not funny. In each of their own films, they masterfully carry out their character's vibes. But together, it feels a little forced.Still, despite its faults, it was still a great watch. Though a predictable storyline, it was still a decent one at that. It really is something that could have been so much better than it turned out to be.

title: Triple threat
text: Ryan Reynolds holds it down as always with good performances from Johnson and Gadot. Could use some polish on a few parts as some lines come off chessy especially for the main bad, couldn't take em seriously. Great twists as a heist movie so anyone looking for fun or missing the Ocean's movies should check thus out and find out what a "Red Notice" is.

title: Story is not stronger than Star Cast
text: A comedy drama between crook and cop. Ryan Reynolds character has been so good. Such a terrific role for him in this movie. God Gal Gadot the beauty and one can feel that ROCK is getting old in this movie. Its a medium speed roller coaster ride with a bit of betrayal and emotions. The movie is engaging throughout. The movie is not so good as the star cast but it's definitely worth watching.

title: Oh hell, noooo
text: It's frightening to see how lowbrow Hollywood has become when it comes to producing comedies - and how easily an audience seems to approve of this crap. Although the rating here has dropped from 6.9 to 6.5 within a short time, this rating still screams to heaven. "Red Notice" has holes in its logic that are unfathomable. Quick cuts don't change the fact that you sometimes wonder whether the screenwriter and director have even noticed what kind of nonsense they are shooting here. In addition, there are the usual gay references in a buddy movie, which I find embarrassing, inaccuracies in everything that is not set in the USA, such as tango music at a party of a rich snob in Valencia. The main thing is that they sing in Spanish, or what? And finally - even though I find Dwayne Johnson likeable and Ryan Reynolds sexy - the former is not an actor and the latter should stop adopting bad scripts with lousy dialogue. Oh yes, then there's Gal Gadot, who is actually just sexy and sneaky, so the usual female cliché in a film that was enough for a single tired grin on my part, but otherwise rather tempted me to check my mobile phone more and more frequently to see if someone hadn't sent me a message. That's how "gripping" this action comedy was.

title: Good fun all the way
text: Slick, fun and entertaining. Surely that is what a film of this genre should be. Everyone plays their part well and the storyline is easy to follow. Would recommend for an evening's entertainment.

title: Entertaining but a total cheese fest
text: Let me say, I love all 3 of these actors so I was excited for this movie but everything about it was majorly cheesy with awful dialogue. Ryan Reynolds was funny, as always playable the same sarcastic wise ass just like Deadpool. But Gal Gadot, who has blown me away in Wonder Woman to become one of my favorite actresses, felt like the wrong woman for this role. Every line and entrance had me rolling my eyes, either predictable or just the worst dialogue. I guess if you're bored, this was fairly entertaining but I've seen way better from these actors and Netflix.

title: Trite, derivative and needed new writers!
text: I get what they were trying to do, but the writer/director tried to do way too much, so it got lost. He wanted The Saint, mixed with Oceans 11 with a taste of Raiders of the Lost Ark with a Jumanji chaser, which clearly should not have been tried. This was messy and silly, and worse, boring. I fell asleep 3 times and didn't even want to go back to see what I missed because the thought of doing so made me almost as tired as this film was. The overuse of Reynolds as a clown made it all the more tedious.It truly is not worth trying to explain anything further about it. Another waste of pretty, talented people and a whole lot of money. All Directors, even the good ones, cannot necessarily write as we learned with Patty Jenkins in Wonder Woman 1984, and they ought to know the difference and surrender the script to professionals, so they can do their job even better.Better to pick a genre and a skill and stick with it, apparently. This film had to cost way too much money to ultimately end up this bad, truly.

title: It was okay... I guess
text: It was fine not something I would watch again tho. Ryan Reynolds was great and Dwayne Johnson was surprisingly good as well but I was kind of dissatisfied with gals performance it was kinda meh.

title: Silly adventure romp
text: Red Notice concerns itself with Nolan Booth - notorious and highly wanted art thief as he goes on a quest to steal the golden eggs of Cleopatra. Hot on his heels is tough and persistant FBI agent John Hartley, played by the Rock. However, when Booth is caught and Hartley is framed as his accomplice by myserious rival thief 'Bishop', they must work together to clear Hartley's name and take down Bishop.I must say I quite enjoyed this. Ryan Reynolds just basically plays himself, but the banter between him and the Rock is just a non stop riot. The film has lots of action, some great sets and is highly entertaining as the duo bumble their way through this adventure. The finale let it down though, with a twist that although I didn't see coming, was kinda annoying. And speaking of annoying, I just didn't like Gal Gadot's Bishop character at all. I get that it's maybe a love to hate thing, but every time she appeared I just groaned. Still, it's a decent watch, even if for just Reynolds' non-stop comedy alone...

title: Star Power and A Couple of Fun Twists Help Red Notice get a Passable Grade
text: The first thing that's going to get you to press play on Red Notice is the cast, we've got 3 legitimate stars (Gadot to a lesser extent but she still qualifies) leading the movie and that kind of mix is exciting. I was actually pretty disappointed with Dwayne in this, I blame the script though instead of his performance. His character refuses to cut loose and it's kind of a hallmark of Thurber's previous movies that if there's dual protagonists, only 1 of them gets to be funny and the other guy is there to occupy space and give the other someone to bounce off of. I didn't think Dwayne failed but minus the fight scenes, his sizable charisma is oddly bottled up. I had kind of an odd realization watching Gal Gadot in this, I like watching her on screen and she does have a charm/presence that makes her likeable. I've been one of the people defending her in the past but this movie made me realize that while she's fun to watch, she's just not a strong actor. She just couldn't get in sync with Reynolds and Johnson and while she's not awful, I had to re-evaluate a little bit. Reynolds repeatedly has to save this movie from itself, there are long stretches where there's just nothing going on except his banter. I wouldn't put his performance in the Deadpool tier but he is pretty funny in this and I had to appreciate it because if you take him out of the movie, Red Notice is DOA. Ritu Arya and Chris Diamantopolous are both solid if unspectacular in their respective supporting partsI have kind of a love/hate opinion on Rawson Marshall Thurber (he's pulling both screenwriting and director duties here). But through Red Notice, I achieved some clarity. I want to start with the positive, I don't mind Rawson Marshall Thurber as a director. The action scenes in this aren't great but they're absolutely passable, the locations are captured in a decent manner and the movie moves along at a decent clip (minus the scenes in prison which do drag). He also let Reynolds do his thing which as I mentioned above, he kept the movie going when there wasn't any urgency in the plot. So, I'm going to credit his work as the director in Red Notice, he got the job done.On the other hand, I just don't like Rawson Marshall Thurber the writer. His only real success as a screenwriter is Dodgeball and that was in 2004. This movie has all the generic and problematic elements of Central Intelligence and Skyscraper did, the plot is lazy, implausible and without any unique features. The character development feels so forced, John Hartley's profiling is sprinkled in but it doesn't gel or have any real bearing on anything and the whole daddy issues subplot could have been tossed. Where I will give him, a little slack is the ending twists, they aren't ground breaking but they did make me perk up. They also justify Dwayne and Gal's inclusion in the movie, you needed 2 actors/actresses with their charisma to lend credence to it so at least there's that. I'm not trying to attack him personally; it just seems like the screenwriting is the weaker part of his game (just like how Robert Rodriguez and Zack Snyder are better cinematographers than actual directors).I also left this movie a little worried about the globe trotting/adventure genre as a whole. Red Notice wears its Indiana Jones influence on its sleeves and it can't even touch that level. I don't blame Red Notice for that, that's a high bar to clear and many have tried and failed. Without just rambling about the Indy franchise (minus Crystal Skull), people can't determine what elements made those movies special. But I keep holding my breath that someone is going to find some of that magic and I feel like every movie that tries just can't figure out the recipe (I have heard good things about Jungle Cruise, maybe that romp is more satisfying).Red Notice is a fun enough couple of hours and for me, it's right on the line of whether to recommend or skip. Despite the movie wasting Dwayne Johnson, Ryan Reynolds does the heavy lifting and while the plot is pretty rote, the ending was just enough to reignite my interest. I still can't shake the feeling that this should have been much better than what was delivered, the big action scenes, this cast and an experienced enough director should have made this a home run. Setting aside expectations, there's just enough here to recommend it to less demanding audiences. It grades out as a 6.5/10 but I'm rounding down because of wasted potential. If you're looking for something like this, I'd actually recommend The Hitman's Bodyguard first (the original, I haven't seen the sequel), the story is just as cliché but Reynolds, Jackson and Hayek are much funnier as a team and the action scenes are about on the same level. My recommendation is if they decide to do a sequel, maybe bring in a new screenwriter to punch things up a little more.

title: RED BROMANCE
text: Solid, run of the mill mismatched partner adventure, heist comedy caper. All pretty formulaic but fun all the same. The Rock, Gadot and and Reynolds are competent and perform as one would expect without effort.An entertaining watch.

title: Everything you would expect
text: Ryan Reynolds and the Rock. Don't expect a high level of intelligence mystery action movie. A lot of cliché jokes, puns and oneliner set in a oceans 11 meets national treasure with a die hard sauce ambiance. Pure entertainment and fast paced. Great score. Wonderfull direction of photography. Acting performance is as expected. So, I have to say I loved it. Even better than I expected actually.

title: Great Flik
text: I enjoy any movie with Ryan Reynolds. Love his humor and camp demeanor; always a good pick for entertainment. Not much of a fan of Johnson; but the movie was funny and the end was unexpected, good! Netflix needs to keep using Ryan Reynolds. I will always watch him!

title: Art thieves
text: I had a good time with this movie. It was funny, it had great action scenes and stunts, and the acting is really good in the situations and places they go to.Dwayne Johnson, Ryan Reynolds, and Gal Gadot are funny and are cool watching in their fight scenes, even in the chase scenes and action scenes around the globe.A funny cameo from a well known song artist, jokes about other movies, and I liked the ending. Just one more thing I want to say is the doublecrossing moments can be funny and surprising.(I won't spoil anything) This is just a fun action adventure movie with good actors and action, if you like that then you will like this.

title: Stop making junk expensive movies
text: Trying to fool its audience with turn twist instead of focusing on good script this is like an wasted opportunity with 200 million budget.just another way for rock to fool its audiences and make money of them by saying I did very hard work but audience know y u doing this junk roles.

title: Fun action comedy
text: I can't believe some people actually gave this a bad review because a few things in the plot weren't believable or realistic. Do you say the same about Indiana Jones movies or Lord of the Rings or Marvel or Star Wars? This is the whole POINT! I loved this first of all because it doesn't take itself seriously and is obviously meant to be sheer entertainment, which it is! Plus, in case you don't understand that, the story and the dialogue keep dropping hints about how the whole thing is a tribute to movie entertainment from the past. I won't list them here but you can tell the writers had a ball writing this stuff. It's almost like a catalogue of movie tropes wrapped in comedy and parody almost, but done in such a way that we're in on the joke, which I found very respectful of the viewers, unlike some people seemed to imply. I laughed quite a few times, never at the movie but with the movie, which seemed to be laughing with me. The movie worked for me from beginning to end, I instantly knew what this was going to be like and wasn't disappointed. Kudos and thank you to anyone involved in making this. Come on folks, relax and be entertained.

title: Exceptionally average. And dumb.
text: What to say about this movie... Ryan Reynolds is funny, Dwayne is an average actor, Gal Gadot is fine. The story is average, the plot is full of holes, this feels like a Netflix movie. Fine to stick on in the background and kill two hours, but don't expect anything special. Ryan is the best part of the movie.

title: Red Notice struggles to be NOTICED...
text: As the title implies, this movie truly is unremarkable in any of the typically categories for rating-movies.While sounding negative, there is actually nothing overtly negative about this movie.It is safe to watch with all family members, together, or separately.We all accurately predicted most of this movie within a few minutes, but all were surprised with some of the twists.The Acting (+8), Script (+7) and Production Quality (+9) were all spot-on given the caliber of the Cast.This isn't a Sequel or Remake of other films, though you may find the movie feeling "familiar"; they have borrowed-heavily from other major successful movies. (as mentioned by others).Would definitely recommend for a Family Movie night, or if you haven't got much else going on.Don't miss it.But don't rush out to see it.

title: GREAT ACTION & FUN, BUT GOES TOO FAR
text: Loved the characters! The dynamics between them are fun and engaging, the plot has some twists and turns that keep it fresh, the fights, the shooting is all well executed and fun. The pacing is well done, gets you invested in what's going on. It's not perfect, sometimes seems like a movie for kids, and they could have dropped a few fantasy action sequences that made the movie a little too much. There are far too many convenient events in the film, it's all explained at the end but still, I felt they went too far with those.

title: Just a decent action funny movie
text: Don't ascpect a lot, it is just a funny action movie with terrible jokes. Funny, oké, easy to watch.Just watch it with your girlfriend or friend on a dry day night if you have nothing better to do!

title: Really wanted to like this but just not good
text: I really wanted to like this movie since I love Dwayne Johnson and Gal Gadot, but the script, dialog and acting was dumb. Also I really just don't like anything Ryan Reynolds is in. This movie dragged on all around the world with one dumb situation after another, by the end I didn't care. I hear they already want to make a second one. Maybe it will be better.

title: Pure cheese - I love it
text: Sometimes you just watch films for the fun and entertainment.... And this film delivers due to the absolute presence of the leads. Don't expect anything more than this and you'll be fine.

title: Funny but illogical
text: This movie manages to be fun at first, but then it gets tedious.In the first half of the movie there are jokes that work and there are times when you don't take the movie seriously, which makes it funnier, but there is a point where there are a lot of implausible things that just don't work and spoil how funny it can be. The script is full of conveniences and things that do not have much logic, such as the plot twist that I did not find convincing. The special effects are sometimes good but sometimes they are very false, the editing in the action scenes can seem very bad, the performances are decent as well as the production design.Full of cliches and predictable things, this movie manages to be fun, but in the long run it is tedious to watch, you do not see the large investment that was made to make this movie.

title: Good weekend watch
text: Well,it's just another heist movie to be honest. But the casting is really why you want to watch it. Simple storytelling,easy going movie. Will be worth your time if you just want to sit on the weekend relax and have a good time with family. Don't expect too much from the movie.

title: Utter garbage
text: Ham acting, the corniest of scripts, and absolutely loads of fun. Perfect for when you just want to watch a brain dead action/crime film. It's rubbish, but when rubbish is this good it's called entertainment.

title: Very enjoyable
text: There are some reviews I don't understand ... this movie is perfect for a Sunday afternoon when it's cloudy and cold outside! It's a comedi, it has all classic ingredients and yes the 3 main characters stay in their comfort zone but it's very enjoyable to watch. The door is open for a sequel and it may be a good idea!

title: Typical action blockbuster writing, but fun to watch
text: Red Notice brings nothing new to the action movie genre, but that's not always a bad thing. Sometimes you just want a fun escape with enjoyable actors and witty banter, and in that respect this movie delivers. It won't change your life, but it also won't ruin your faith in god. It's just fun, fast-paced entertainment, and that's okay.

title: Deadpool meets Indiana Jones
text: The movie doesn't deserve it's bad ratings. It's exactly what it's supposed to be: an entertaining comedy full of jokes and fast paced adventure. Kept me in my seat without losing my attention. I'd love to see a sequel.

title: Fun movie but no chance of an oscar
text: This is a fun movie and was great to watch with the kids until that one scene with the F word in it. To be honest, the movie could of done without that scene with the F word and replace it with fudge.All three actors are exactly what you expect. They have been type cast.Ryan Reynolds plays the same character in every movie. The fun quick funny responsive character that can't stop talking, pretty much Donkey from Shrek.Rock, plays the big strong character exact same character in Fast furious and all his other movies.Gal Gadot, plays the similar fiesty strong willed women.There isn't anything wrong with the movie as long as you don't expect oscar winning performances. Its just a movie that will meet what exactly you will expect.Some of the backgrounds in the scenes you can tell they were shot in the LOTs. Just ignore those poor site locations. Just watch it without a brain and enjoy the jokes and you will like it.Its target audience is for teenagers.

title: I can't....
text: How do they still get away with these "good on the eyes but bad taste in the mouth" movies? I don't know.This was hands down one of their most predictable, most plot hole filled, most uninspired movies of this year. Actually of this century. This is the type of movie that looks good in trailers and has a bunch of those actors you love to see but none of the depth and imagination you know you won't get.Trust me when I say this. You seen it once, you've seen it a million times. Hard skip. I was laughing at the movie the entire time from how bad it is. If you like to do that, than watch the movie.

title: A good movie for a Sunday night before sleep.
text: The movie was good. Funny scenes. Ryan Reynolds mocking the rock and vice versa. I think they paired good. The movie starts just like I expeded, with tons of action. Gal galdot is simply a gorgeous woman. Watch it with your family.Good overall.

title: Not bad
text: To be fair Ryan Reynolds was way funnier in this movie than Free Guy.The Rock is the same in every role.Gal stole the show.I had fun watching this one.

title: Illogical movie!
text: I can't describe how silly and predictable this movie is! Was like watching scenes from a 1920 ridiculous movie! Very bad production! Very bad acting.

title: MEH ALL BEEN DONE BEFORE ......6/10
text: Just because they put three of the biggest movie stars in the world in a film together doesn't automatically make it a great film , that's not to say red notice is bad because it isn't it's actually ok but all been done before ....!!!

title: A Mildly Enjoyable Action Comedy with Enjoyable Leads
text: It has been decades since films were released and garnered attention simply due to who was in them. Yes, every now and then a film comes out that nobody has heard of and ends up making money because of the stars, but it seems so few and far between these days. Netflix's Red Notice is the prime example of a generic action-comedy that's clearly banking on its leading performers. I'm a big fan of Dwayne Johnson, Ryan Reynolds, and Gal Gadot has really grown on me as an actress too but based solely on the premise, I pretty much knew what to expect with this movie, and I was right. There is some fun to be had with Red Notice, but I'll probably forget I watched it a few months from now.Working for the BAU, detective John Hartley (Dwayne Johnson)is in pursuit of the most wanted art thief in the world, Nolan Booth (Ryan Reynolds). After Booth is captured and Hartley is double-crossed and ends up in prison with him, they eventually begin to work together to take down an even bigger thief in "The Bishop" (Gal Gadot). After a certain point, this film just started writing itself. I found myself rolling my eyes at the dumb stunts they were pulling off and all of the one-liners that you would expect from all of them. Yes, this cast has a lot of charisma with each other, but it wasn't enough to make it stand out from any other time I've ever seen them before.Red Notice is a film that honestly has about an hour of story to tell, but the film really lets these performers do their thing, a lot. There were multiple times where scenes drag on and I firmly believe it was all improv. This was both equally enjoyable and annoying. I laughed consistently throughout the movie, but also while scratching my head and cringing. It was almost a frustrating watch at times, even though I still fall on the positive side of the movie overall.Director Rawson Marshall Thurber, who also wrote the film, has always made films that ride the line of being both ridiculous and enjoyable, for the most part. I have a blast watching Dodgeball and We're the Millers and I've even enjoyed his work with Johnson on other projects like Central Intelligence or Skyscraper, but his films never take the extra step. Red Notice is by far his most ambitious film to date, I just think it's also the most he has ever had faith in his performers to run with the material however they like. As I said, I enjoyed myself, it's just riddled with soo many issues/inconsistencies.In the end, Red Notice is one of the biggest films Netflix has ever released as an original film and while I'm all for them continuing to do big-budget movies like this, I also feel like they just see a big name and say yes to a project. This is why there are very few Netflix original films that end up being great. For those of you who like action, comedy, or any of these performers in general, I recommend checking out Red Notice but also try to go in knowing it's nothing special and you'll probably have a disposable good time as I did. There are far better films currently out, but if you open Netflix and start streaming this one, I'm sure you'll at least find some mild enjoyment in certain scenes at the very least. Red Notice is now streaming on Netflix.

title: An unoriginal BLAST of a film
text: I was really excited for this movie, largely because I'm a huge fan of The Rock, Ryan Reynolds and Gal Gadot, and to see this unlikely trio form in a high-budget action film was a treat to say the least.I want to start off by saying that this isn't an original film by any means, we've seen this before many times. The Rock is of course throwing guys around like ragdolls as always, Ryan Reynolds is of course cracking his typical but admittedly hilarious jokes while still having some action to do, and Gal Gadot (while being new to this sort of role) still feels like something we've seen before. But unoriginality doesn't mean it's crazily bad. The trio all do incredibly, and they all work very well together; particularly Reynolds and The Rock, but we did kinda get a taste of their dynamic in Hobbs and Shaw (2019), while Reynolds only had a small role. It's nice to see Dwayne Johnson work so well with an actor that isn't Kevin Hart. And the camera work is actually very well done; you can always tell what's happening in a fight scene which is always a plus. The action, while unrealistic but not quite on a Fast and Furious level, is really entertaining. I think my favourite action scene has to be this on-foot chase at the beginning of the film, it was really creative. The comedy as well, worked really nicely in my opinion, too, which is great as I was sceptical whether or not it would work or if it would feel forced or not. I'd also like to mention a hilarious but unexpected cameo that takes place near the end of the movie, which I thoroughly enjoyed.However, I'm not sure if this film will stick with me a huge amount (not on the level of a generic action film but still not as much as expected) and that's largely because we've seen a huge amount of the film before in others like it. But like I said, I don't find it a huge problem. I did find the film to be quite predictable at some parts, but nothing too distracting. And that's really all I can think of that I didn't like about the film.Overall, Red Notice is a well-filmed, action packed blast with an incredible cast who all share great chemistry and dynamics. It's a must watch for people in need for a comedic action movie. The fun present in the film makes it very rewatchable, at least in my view after watching it once. Definitely one of my favourite Netflix original movies I've ever watched.

title: Laughed quite a bit. Anticipating the sequel.
text: I thought this film was very good and laughed a lot. Ryan Reynolds is hilarious and the Rock works well with him. Almost as well as with Kevin Hart. Did not see the twist coming, though. Great acting and solid story with plenty of clever easter eggs. Definitely would recommend to anyone old enough to see Deadpool.

title: Fun!
text: I feel like this is more of a parody of a 'good' heist movie than it is a serious attempt and doesn't pretend to be, and lots of people are missing that...You wouldn't watch 'The Other Guys' and comment on how it's not a believable police movie.😂 Jeeesh. I think Covid might have sucked the fun out of everyone this last year.I liked that Ryan Reynolds repeatedly takes the p*ss out of Dwayne Johnson...He says the word 'Rock' a number of times in different sentences and at one point says 'You're welcome'... with an sing-song tone. It did not fall on deaf ears. Lol. They work well together.Very similar to Hitman's wife's Bodyguard which has Salma Hayek in it instead of Gal Gadot and Sam Jackson instead of The Rock, all playing similar roles. If you like that you'll love this and vice versa.It was a silly and fun, high budget action with lots of explosions and choreographed fights, and LOVELY outfits (Gadot)😍All in all a decent Friday night action comedy.

title: Gawd, this is so bad!
text: Predictable, check, check and double check. No story, no chemistry and a lot of money wasted. People who rate this film have never seen a good movie and have incredibly low expectations. If you are going to watch this then turn it on in the background while your attention is elsewhere because you will miss nothing by being distracted.

title: I enjoyed it!
text: In all honesty, what does make a good film? For me, it's one that keeps me off my phone and keeps me entertained. This film did both of those things! It was funny, with a pretty good storyline and actors I enjoy watching. It was a Saturday night popcorn film that does what you want it to. It won't win any awards, but I know I will watch it again and I'll enjoy it.....again.

title: Folks wishing that it was an Interstellar are fools of highest order !
text: Its an over the top action comedy and u have to accept it for what it is ! Don't think much and u will enjoy it ! Its not made to make u think. Stop with ur pessimism already..

title: Name suggests u stay far away from this movie
text: One of the boring movies I have seen in recent time. One would say that the star power would be enough to drive this movie forward, but they would be wrong. Even the short interaction between RR and the Rock in Hobbs and Shaw was better than this entire movie. Gal Gadot is all charm and no substance at all. Other two are her two sidekicks as they have nothing else to do. Don't waste ur time on this.

title: Irony, but it is not
text: If you think that the ending scene made no sense, then that's the half of the story. The irony is an Egyptian bride's father was taken into a custody for possessing a gift given to special Egyptian woman by the interpol. "It is what it is," some might say. But the truth is all of Iraqis' and Africans' ancient remains which are presented in the louvre museum and in other museums except for the countries of origin are stolen from there people.

title: Not as clever as it thinks it is
text: Like a McChicken from McDonalds, the idea is far more appealing than the end result. Ryan Reynolds' quips and other assorted one-liners are always good, but usually aren't as distracting; Johnson's beefy action star moves are usually good, but also not usually as wooden; and Gal Gadot? Well, I THINK I've seen her act but it wasn't here.
