I've only just finished watching this maybe 2 hours ago but, looking back, I can't remember much outside of the 'subtle' nods to the likes of Indiana Jones & Bugs Bunny, the chess/bishop mistake, too many Wilhelm Screams (seriously, can we get a new scream sound effect already?), and Ryan Reynolds being Deadpool but without the suit.A decent popcorn movie if you're not expecting much of it to stick in your memory, or if you want some background noise to keep the silence at bay, but otherwise not really worth it.

title: Fun movie and Gal Gadot is so beautiful
text: Movie wise there is nothing new but it was fun and Gal Gadot is so beautiful. Action scenes were good and all three characters were good enough. Routine stuff though.

title: More twists and turns than a twisty turnie thing.....
text: Knowing that it would be good with the caliber of people in this is a given. But the enjoyment I personally got from this well made, very matter of fact film. 9/10 . Thank you for not wasting my time like a lot of modern rubbish does......

title: Entertaining.
text: Decent entertainment, a brainless popcorn movie made better by the lead actors but the actress playing inspector das just cant act. Decent overall but could have been much better.

title: Low expectations met
text: This was one cliché, trite, average, underwhelming movie, that's it's been done a million times before. The plot was super thin, the characters were also caricatures. Zero originality. Even the CGI, in particular the bull in arena, was average.The only good thing about this movie was that no intellectual or emotional energy were spent. Only time was wasted.

title: I have thoroughly enjoyed this.
text: I loved the jokes. I loved the acting. The pacing of the film was right. This film has everything I look for in a comedy. Just watch it without any prejudices and you will have a lot of fun.

title: Hobblingly mainstream, yet fairly fun.
text: 'Red Notice (2021)' is a generic blockbuster that somehow cost $200 million (thanks, in large part, to the $20 million price tag of each of its leads). The investment seems to have paid off, though; it's now Netflix's biggest original movie, having been watched for 364 million hours within in its first month alone. I'm not entirely sure how profits are calculated when it comes to straight-to-streaming titles, since there's no real way to tell if someone subscribed to, or didn't unsubscribe from, a streaming service just to watch a specific movie. Netflix has deemed it worth at least one sequel, though, so I suppose that tells you all you need to know. The film focuses on Dwayne Johnson's too-big-for-a-tux FBI analyst as he does a ridiculous amount of fieldwork in an effort to catch a master art thief played by Netflix's new golden boy Ryan Reynolds (he's in three of their biggest original movies). The thing really kicks into gear when Johnson's character is framed for a theft he swears he didn't commit, which forces him to work together with Reynold's as-annoying-as-usual rogue in order to bring down Gadot's elusive and alluring criminal mastermind before she finds all three of the plot's physically shiny yet narratively dull MacGuffins. It's pretty much what you'd expect given its cast and concept, a predictable and toothless action adventure that pays a bit too much homage to the Indiana Jones movies. It's the type of movie that has title cards for its exotic locales (most of which were apparently shot in Georgia, likely due to the state's generous tax incentives) but just teleports its characters to where they need to be regardless of if they'd actually be able to get there. It's also the sort of film that slows to a crawl every now and then so that its stars can improvise a bit of stale banter. Yet, the relationship between the duo at the heart of the feature is actually surprisingly easy to get invested in. It's not as if Johnson and Reynolds have oodles of chemistry (although they do have infinitely more than Johnson and Gadot), it's just that the former's bland bluntness offsets the latter's grinning annoyance and vice versa. They make for a relatively compelling pair, barely breaking a sweat for their ludicrously high pay checks. Still, the film feels as though it has a B-list cast, despite the fact that its three leads are some of the biggest stars in Hollywood. Without these stars, though, the flick wouldn't be, well, anything. It's as generic as they come and actually has very little value, the sort of thing you throw on because you have Netflix but can't decide what you actually want to watch on it. To be honest, it's hobblingly mainstream; the number of risks it takes is pretty much zero. Don't get me wrong, it's decent enough for what it is. It's actually quite a bit better than I expected it to be. The action is fairly fun, featuring fairly strong choreography and mostly clean cinematography, and some aspects of the plot are enjoyably goofy. It's almost comical how nobody actually dies in this, despite the very real weaponry they come up against (the most egregious sequence involves a group of prison guards being unloaded upon by a helicopter's minigun without receiving so much as a wrinkle on their uniforms). Alongside its derivative nature and general contrivances, the narrative has a couple of more prominent problems. Though the piece knows who its protagonist is (Johnson), it often struggles to decide on an antagonist. Who is the hero supposed to be triumphing over? Is it Gadot's glamourous globetrotting thief, Reynold's double-dealing sarcasm machine, Arya's always-one-step-behind Interpol agent, or even Diamantopoulos's weak-chinned arms dealer who speaks as if he's constantly doing an impression of Richard Harris' Dumbledore? Yes, the picture is purposefully elusive and features plenty of double-crosses and fake-outs, but the issue is one of audience alignment and is prominent regardless of the characters' intentionally dubious nature. Another issue with the film is its exhausting ending. Not only does the climax completely undercut the emotional heart of the picture, it also (very minor spoilers) removes the cop/crook team-up dynamic from the sequel it inevitably teases. It also features one of the absolute worst and most unnecessary cameos of recent years. Despite its issues, though, the affair is relatively entertaining. Though it is a bit long, it moves at a decent pace and has a handful of genuinely good sequences. Most of it is just fine, of course, but the overall experience averages out as, for lack of a better term, above average. It's the sort of thing you'll forget almost as soon as you've seen, but it's an inoffensive and fairly fun way to pass the time. Come to think of it, maybe it was watched for so many hours because most people forgot they'd seen it and accidentally put it on a second time. 6/10.

title: not fun
text: Clearly the makers of this movie were aiming for the sort of parodic, tongue-in-cheek, playful humor of the James Bond and Indiana Jones flicks.They missed.Whereas those movies were frothy and light-hearted, this effort comes across as mean-spirited and vicious. What little humor there is seems very forced. Unlike the Bond & Jones flicks, which were obviously put-ons from start to finish, one feels that a viewer could almost take this one at face value.Characters are always cardboard cutouts in this type of movie, but they have to be likable, including the villains, in a perverse sort of way. No one in this movie is likable. The worst is Ryan Reynolds' character, who has got to be one of the most annoying jerks ever portrayed on celluloid. Gal Gadot's Bishop is too nasty to be funny, and. Dwayne Johnson's. John Hartley seems to be phoning it in, delivering his forced-humor quips woodenly.I suppose I really shouldn't be reviewing this at all, because about halfway through I realized I didn't care what happened to anyone on screen, nor how it ended, so I stopped watching.

title: Uhhh it's okay I guess, Acting ain't great
text: This a Netflix caper movie, about thievery, double crossing and travelling all around the world to exotic locations to find treasure.I was going to stop watching halfway through till I read the top review saying to watch to the end and all the silliness makes sense. Did it? Kinda. Am I happy I watched it to the end? Kinda.Stock standard really. A stock standard soundtrack with surprises but none that surprise you THAT much.The acting is disappointing here, Reynolds seems less to be playing himself and more to be imitating someone playing himself. His lines don't hit in this movie, maybe his schtick is just getting tired. The rock is okay. But Gal Gadot woah she's bad.If you want further proof that Hollywood is discriminatory look at how they've moved Gal Gadot onto equal footing with The Rock and Ryan Reynolds...she's beautiful but I don't know if people follow movies to watch her like they would Dwayne Johnson or Ryan Reynolds... she was Actually solid in Wonder Woman, and she's trying in this film... I feel she has a few expressions which she overdoes. But potentially it's her character, which is the weakest in the film which is saying something because none of the characters are particularly likeable or interesting. Which might be its greatest flaw.You could do worse with your time than watch this. It's entertaining enough and also with a decent celebrity cameo.

title: Mediocre entertaining fun
text: A fun and entertaining heist adventure which ends up being mediocre and could have been punchier. It has all the right ingredients for a great heist movie and is somewhat funny, but it doesn't quite have the flair and feels a bit flat at times. The cast and sequence of events is good, but the plot is nothing special and it gets a bit too silly towards the end.

title: Fun, mindless nod to popular films
text: I see many reviews calling it a caper but it's more of a spoof film. There are numerous nods to classic spy and action films such as True Lies, Mission Impossible, and Where Eagles Dare. There is a nod to Raiders of the Lost Ark as far as seeking Egyptian artifacts. It's well-paced with attention to detail and enough action and humor to keep you engaged with some interesting twists. I have no complaints.

title: Hitmans Bodyguard meets slightly less intelligent Italian Job, with a touch or Indiana Jones.
text: Yes the action scenes are a bit clunky, the bullets never run out or hit anything, and you can feel the twists coming.But the laughs are there, and its worth the time.RR bounces off DJ well, and GG really adds to the mix with a somewhat convincing but likeable villan.Nice product placement from ( and who would have guessed this one) Aviation Gin, and Porsche.

title: Another Dwayne The Rock Johnson Cash Grab
text: Complete throw away of film. The Rock at this point is higher paid Steven Segal. He's recycling former cast mates and does not understand his success is based around existing IP's. The plot twist you can see coming from a Mile away.It's clear The Rock wants to be Will Smith (not sure about the personal life) at this stage chasing a check. He needs to accept the fact he's a supporting actor. Ryan is funny, but he's over saturating himself again like it's Van Wilder days. This would've worked in the Mid to Late 2000's during Mr & Misses Smith with ACTUAL stars. The Hollywood Star is dead as of 2008 writers strike and it's not coming back, especially with Big Budget VOD / DVD Netflix. This needs to be sitting is a DVD bin at Walmart.All money ain't good money and that is the legacy of all of films involving the Rock wanting to secretly be the Lead. Gal is proof this industry is not about talent.

title: I enjoyed it
text: This movie popped up on Netflix so I watched it and glad I did. It was better than I was thinking it would be 👍🏻 Hope they make a part 2. If not I enjoyed it anyways.

title: Product Placement Notice
text: This poor excuse for an action movie is nothing more than a poorly written story with three box office draws and a BUNCH of product placement.So much B roll that actors time on screen is about the same as a 30 minute sitcom.

title: Really good watch.
text: As I've seen pretty much ever Dwayne Johnson and Ryan Reynolds film going I knew this wouldn't disappoint! Great film, funny, loads of action and brilliant twists and turns along the way! Definitely worth a watch!

title: Entertaining but a little boring
text: This movie is not the best but it's funny. I like the acts but i don't like the lack of the scenario, sometime scenes get little boring and too many shortcuts for the villain to get the eggs.

title: Pack your bags
text: Your sense of reality can pack it bags and go on holidays, because you won't be needing it for this movie. The plot is chasing around the world for a golden egg. Don't over think it, that's it. Now this film has a feel that everyone on the set had a great time and at the end of the day some nice memories were made and everyone got paid. Great work if you can find it. Its just a shame no one cared about the actual movie, because its only going on Netflix so what the heck. Gal Godat has been working on getting a stronger American accent and possibly her acting skills. The rock is special guest as the rock and plays the same character you've known from any movie he has ever made. He just looks older, but is clearly relaxed and already working out in his mind how he is going to spend the pay cheque. Lots of situations are created for Ryan Reynolds to try out his ab lib skills as there is no script to speak of and its a chance for most of the production crew to get a long lunch while he has fun with his friends on Netflix's dollar. Gal's breast size changes depending on how revealing the outfit, which honestly is the best practical effect in the movie. Speakng of effects the 3D ones are awful and a lot of the green screen work is also very obvious. Still everyone had such a great time they are expecting to make a sequel, which means the writer (you really don't need two) are going to need a new table napkin to write the next movies story line and script on. Can someone please go to the Netflix head office and organise the transfer of the money. Thanks.

title: Just stop these two people from performing together
text: An Interpol agent teams up with art thieves to find thieves whose talents are much better. They work together to find the most precious treasure before it falls into the hands of the thief.Red Notice is a comedy crime film that I don't think is very good. Featuring three major actors ranging from Ryan Reynolds, Gal Gadot and Dwayne Johnson, the film becomes unattractive as well known top artists. Red Notice has a lot of jokes in every scene. The seemingly comedic scenes are forced to make this film bland and unfocused in building the story. I think the comedic elements in this film are less interesting and don't have a good level of cuteness. Red Notice has an unflattering and long-winded story premise. Supported by dialogue that is widely conversational but full of atmosphere. It has no satisfactory conflict. The conflict between Hartley and Booth is like a child. The film is good by a series of cool action scenes, but less in terms of story. Red Notice has an unsatisfactory ending. For some reason, every time I see Dwayne Johnson playing, the movie seems to belong to Dwayne himself which is too many frames for him. Too much accentuate the heroic side tasked with saving someone. I don't deny that Gal Gadot has her charm here. Gal Gadot looks beautiful and charming. For Ryan Reynolds a lot of comedic dialogue that for me is less suitable and less able to.

title: Are you a top or a bottom?
text: The negative reviews here are spot on. "Dreadful," "Worst ever..." "Seen it all before" etc, etc. It's a silly pointless movie, and in my opinion just what we need to tune-out the world and it's current problems for a couple of hours. Yeh, it's "bad" but it's a "good bad."

title: Average Entertainment
text: This movie is corny, but it is entertaining.Ryan Reynolds is great as Deadpool. I look forward to him expanding to other characters. One. Day. It definitely does not work for me in this film.Dwayne Johnson is great. Per usual.The plot unfolds well. The pace is solid. And the twists, though expected, are well executed.The gore is low, and the film is campy enough to be a family film.Not my type of film, but I will watch the sequel.

title: Very Entertaining
text: A fast and fun action comedy with twists and turns. It won't win an Oscar, but it will entertain you from start to finish. Ryan Reynolds never disappoints and with Johnson and Gadot the film zooms along leaving you wanting more. A sequel is surely on the cards. If you want some light entertainment then this 2 hour spectacular ticks all the boxes!

title: Predictable
text: On the downside, the CGI sucks, and the plot is predictable. However, it's a fun ride with no need to think. Ryan Reynolds is always enjoyable to watch, as is Johnson. Just sit back and relax and let your mind go free.

title: Red Notice Review- Red Alert for the Viewers
text:
Well, Red Notice is so bad that Tom Cruise's The Mummy is a Schindler's List to it. It is so pathetic that Matt Damon's The Great Wall will appear to be The Pianist when you compare the two. The only reason I watched this on its first day of being aired in India is nothing but Gal Gadot and when the end credits were rolling, I made myself accountable for ruining two precious hours of my life even after plenty of Gadot moments in it.This movie is a killer. It is a murderer of the genre called 'Comedy'. It serially kills the 'Thriller' genre. It actually murders everything including the reputation of its stars. Normally while reviewing a movie, I do discuss the technical aspects. But here I am going go spare you of that pain as it actually scores nothing from any aspect of movie making. Even the VFX which usually gets a high-octane value in these types of movies is buffoonery and what we are left with is a big zero. Even the perpetually petite Gadot looks old in this horror show.Is it a buddy movie? Well, you may have a break up with your best pal if you insist him or her to watch this joke. If you are planning to buy a ticket and watch it, perhaps you are making the biggest mistake of your life. If you are planning to watch it on Netflix, listen to the advice of someone who knows the world better than you. Skip the plan.I do not know how it has managed to get a score of 6.8 on IMDB but I am sure very soon it will get a place in the list of the worst 250 movies ever made. It has high chances of finishing the race with the Champion's Trophy.Sorry Gal. Looks like you spend more time on your Insta account than on honing your acting skills. Dwayne Johnson and Ryan Reynolds do not deserve even a word of discussion.Are they planning for a sequel? I will rather inflict on myself the pain of hearing the news that Netflix is coming up with the next series of 'Zoo'.My Rating 1.5 out of 10
Available on- Netflix.

title: Really enjoyable watch
text: What can I say say, Ryan Reynolds in form, Gal Gadot as beautiful as ever and The Rock being The Rock. Loved this movie as it doesn't pretend to be anything it's not. It's just good fun, good humour and a good plot. Easy viewing, very enjoyable and 2 hours well spent.

title: It's what you expect
text: The title kind of says it all for me. It's exactly what you expect from this film. Some good action scenes, an easy plot to follow and classic Ryan Reynolds humour.I will say what was impressive was the clear on set chemistry the actors had. Really added to the humour and the jokes weren't constant either so it didn't feel like overkill.I was impressed with the twist towards the end also, genuinely didn't see it coming whatsoever. The plot itself is really easy to follow and not challenging at all. Which may put some off. Beyond that twist however it's quite predictable and almost too simple. But, overall it's an easy Friday night watch with some good action scenes which I'm sure will appeal to some. It also kept my attention for the whole 2 hours which is a difficult thing to do, so they did something right!There are some negatives however. For such a high budget film, some of the CGI (mainly background stuff) was poor at times and really noticeable. I found the Interpol woman agent really jarring and just wound me up every time she was on screen. Acting was neither here or there so if you're wanting to see some amazing performances then look elsewhere.But yeah there's not much else to say really. It's a non-challenging action film, it'll make you laugh here and there and overall it's a bit of fun. 6/10 from me today, just a little better than average.

title: Boring. Generic.
text: Poorest acting for these actors.Boring action.Generic direction.Lackluster writing. Waste of time, money, and effort.Please put Gal Gadot in a good script. I dare you. Please.

title: Celebrity Feature Action Comedy
text: It is exactly what you expected out of this movie, you're here to see them in a movie doing action comedy scenes together. No more, no less. The movie knows what it is, and does it fine. Unlike NTTD, which spuns into an identity crisis.Zero calorie entertainment, but somewhat entertaining nonethelss.

title: It's like a Kraft Single....
text: Sometimes you want a grilled cheese. So you grab a Kraft Single or two, slap them between two pieces of Wonder Bread, a little butter and a frying pan and you have a grilled cheese sandwich. Dunk it in some Campbell's Tomato Soup and now it's a meal.That is this movie. Cheesy as all get out, but when you get to the end, pretty darn satisfying after a few twists and turns. You just have to be in the mood for grilled cheese, not caviar.

title: Not boring because of the cast and production... missed opportunity
text:
RATED 7/10
Language: English
Source: NetflixEverything is good but still something is missing throughout the movie... may be because of pathetic dialogs and shabby action sequences.... Another bad thing about this movie is that its predictable and so illogical at most of the places....
The good thing about the movie is that it is not boring and the cast makes this movie as eye candy....
One time watchable for the cast and production values... this is sure missed opportunity.

title: Not a masterpiece, but still worth your time.
text: Red Notice will certainly have its critics. But I can find value in these types of popcorn flicks. The star power in the cast alone makes this movie worth it, but I found it very entertaining at times. It also needs to be said that Gal Gadot is the most beautiful woman on the planet. I'll go a step further, the most beautiful living thing on the planet. More importantly she continues to improve as an actress and I enjoy all of her work. I think she would have struggled in this role a few years ago, but now it's right in her comfort zone.Dwayne Johnson is pretty much the same guy in everything and I'm a little irritated with him lately. His work in Red Notice has a bit of a change, but mostly It's the same old Rock. The same could be said for Ryan Reynolds. I don't blame these three for doing this movie. It was an easy paycheck. It's set up for a sequel and maybe they will do it again for easy money. Whatever they decide, I'm in.

title: "You can have excuses or results, not both"
text: This movie was great, fresh, funny, witty, Free Guy was having a ball on his new heist mission, the Scorpion King travels back to his roots, and Diana Prince frocked up for a Wonderful party. But then it turned into Indiana Jones & The Overused Nazi Bunker Cliches and, it's hard to beat a classic. But it was the most-watched film on Netflix with back-to-back sequels currently in development.

title: Love a good heist movie
text: I love a good heist movie and I honestly watch anything with Ryan Reynolds in it and this did not disappoint. There are some obvious twists and some not so obvious ones. You get the usual quick witted dialogue you'd expect from a Reynolds performance . All in all, a thoroughly enjoyable movies.

title: No brainer pop corn flick
text: An FBI agent entangles himself with two notorious art thieves to recover a missing artefact.Typical Dwayne Johnson movie which is not a bad thing. The locations were amazing and some of the one liners made me laugh out loud. The movie kept you guessing and wondering who to trust but you don't really care much for the plot, it's a movie that you just go along with.Dwayne johnson was Dwayne Johnson, gal gadot held her own and Ryan Reynolds had the sarcasm of Deadpool, which is becoming a common thing but I don't want to say anything bad in case they read this review and come after me so I'll say the acting was immense.If you're looking for a easy watch then it's worth tuning in to watch this movie.

title: Ryan Reynolds Charm Has Expired.
text: When the trailers for this rolled around I initially thought this was yet another advert for Dubai which uses famous faces surrounded by expensive looking stuff us mortals will never see in real life.Then it dawned on me this was an actual movie.The three leads are stars in their own right however something about this gave the appearance of a committee meeting that concluded that Ryan, Gal and Dwayne co-starring would be box office gold.The problem was my initial reaction was "no not another film with him...or her...or him!". At the moment you can't seem to escape any of these actors at the Cinema and its becoming wearing.This feeling of fatigue is mainly driven by Ryans now irritating smart guy dialogue. In this movie its absolutely grating. Deadpool was one thing but its just incessant and needs to stop. He is basically playing the same person in all of these movies.The film itself if standard glossy rich people drama with a few twists and turns, some average action scenes and a cast which frankly bores. None of the characters are likeable.While it seems to be set for a sequel I am not sure the audience would welcome one based on this movie.It appears these actors and starting to believe their own hype, Dwayne thinks he would make a great James Bond. This movie may just bring them back to earth with a bump.

title: Everything you hoped it would be!
text: Putting these A list goliaths in a film together was going to need a great story, script & chemistry, this delivers on all levels. Gal Gadot reportedly got paid as much for this film as her male co stars & rightly so as she holds her own between them, delivering some great lines & kicking just as much ass as them too. Dwayne Johnson is his reliable self in his role & Ryan Reynolds has rarely been funnier. By far the best big budget film that Netflix have produced so far.

title: Unoriginal
text: While I'll admit that there were 2-3 moments in the movie that I didn't see coming, most of it was unapologetically predictable and cliché that only Hollywood's greatest can get away with. Or can they?From the tube that happened to be right underneath Ryan Reynolds when he needed to jump off a high building, to the scenes with the Dwayne Johnson that couldn't help but remind you of the Hobbs & Shaw movie, I don't think I will be watching the sequel.The Russians, as always are the villains. The cop always appears in the scene screaming and waving the gun around. Also, terrible, I mean terrible CGI.

title: Insult to the audience
text: Movie doesn't make any sense, it's just full of cliché sequences.I saw an interview where The Rock said he was convinced to do this movie because it had "such an unbelievable twist ending". What a joke.The people who made this must assume the audience has no intelligence.Terrible and a waste of time.

title: Entertaining but had potential for much more
text: This movie was definitely enjoyable with lots of action and quirky one liners in an almost believable storyline. However, the Midas touch was missing for an action comedy. They should have involved Jackie Chan The King of Action Comedy and his crew of stuntmen who would have made the action sequences more real and believable. While I love the talented and lovely Gal Gadot but sadly she struggled to add the much needed spark. The role of The Bishop should have gone to Angelina Jolie (it was a role custom made for her I feel) who would have added the much needed icing on the cake. Overall, you'll still get your money's worth with all the spectacular scenes cinematography and screenplay.

title: Great funny heist movie well done
text: This was a great heist movie. Kept me laughing the whole time with the one liners. All 3 were outstanding. Great acting great action great comedy. A must see. And some great twists that I never saw coming. Can't wait for part two.

title: Way better than Bond.
text: Great cast, action scenes,, wit and a twist. I watched No Time to Die a few days ago and it was arduous. This was a surprise redemption of an action movie. Now that Daniel Craig has been retired, why not a smartass like Ryan Reynolds as the next Bond?

title: Super entertaining!
text: Not the best story ever, but it was entertaining and the humor was excellent. The Rock and Ryan Reynolds had great chemistry together, and once Gal Gadot came in, she added the extra spice with more than just her stunning good looks. She fit perfectly with the two men. This movie is definitely worth a watch if you want a good laugh and some half decent action.

title: Pay less to the 3 thieves and invest more in authenticity!
text: "Red Notice" is a movie meant to be watched. It's meant for you to sit down and enjoy what you're watching because you like these actors and you want to see them on a globe-trotting adventure. Red Notice is meant to be played, paused and re-played. Knowing that almost 50% of producing the movie went to the three protagonists, John Hartley (Dwayne Johnson, an FBI profiler with a background in art and antiquities, Nolan Booth (Ryan Reynolds), who is tracking down Cleopatra's Eggs and The Bishop (Gal Gadot), who also wants the Eggs and needs Hartley and Booth out of the way, you know that there has been some cost cutting. And the cost cutting, with obvious CGI (opening looks like you are in a video game) has been at the expense of the authenticity of the movie. You cannot compare this one with the likes of with Indiana Jones. The latter or way better. However it is nice to watch a movie without thinking about the plot and twists, characters and dialogues (dialogues were in fact outstanding). And it even has a nice twist coming. Watchable just get used to the CGI.

title: American Jackie Chan like
text: Reminded me of Jackie Chana adventure movies. The actions from big bangs to fight scenes everything had reminded me of Jackie Chan style. Overall very well made movie.

title: Is NF hiring people to give 10/10 rating ?
text:
This is really weird! Random profiles rating the movie 10/10 with similar reviews ?Really ? This movie was poorly Domenic I think j they did it over a weekend or 2
Sorry for Ryan but apart from him the rest of the movie is a joke.

title: A very entertaining watch
text: In the spirit of "6 Underground", this action packed super sleuth left me entertained.A bit predictable at times, twists and turns still are present.The "one step ahead of the stereotypical law enforcement officer" bit wore a bit thin by mid-film. Reynolds and Johnson work well together actually. One will not be disappointed by the Reynolds sarcastic banter. Always a fan!I'd certainly like to see a sequel.

title: Quite Enjoyable, Not The Worst I've Seen
text: Red Notice was actually quite the entertaining watch i must say, as a person who really enjoys Ryan Reynolds' peformances i thought this was funny, not his best work but still a comedic film, Ryan never seems to disappoint (I have yet to see Green Lantern) but until that day!I'm not exactly a fan of Dwayne Johnson, he's not really my type of actor, although he did make me laugh at certain points in the movie. The story itself was a very engaging one, keeping you engrossed in the story throughout, i was really interested in where the story went so in that sense i was not disappointed in the slightest.All in all this is a great watch to catch, Now on Netflix!Recommending this one for all of you :)

title: A likeable cast playing unlikeable characters.
text: I don't know what Netflix was thinking but all three of these very likeable actors are playing completely horrible characters.It is hard to cheer for them when you think all three should be in jail. Betrayal at any and every opportunity. Generic backstories and motivations. The only thing this film has going for it, is that it looks good.

title: Interestingly fast paced
text: Dont bother about the few plot holes and illogical escapes. What this movie focuses is on comedy and action which is entertaining and that's enough.A family entertainer do give it a watch and enjoy.

title: Ritu Arya Was The Biggest Miss Fit
text: Ryan and Rock and wounder women perfect in the acting.Ritu Arya over acting Like Ritu Arya In car alone and 3 theives including rock is afraid of her. Seriously.Without Ritu Arya movie could be 8 star.If CBI officer could be a stroger character than Ritu Arya that would have made it interesting.

title: Hmmmmmm......... lot''s of awesome, so why is it so MEH??????
text:
Here goes:Action - 10
Cast - 9 (good ole Commie-Loving Dwayne takes it down a notch)
Story - 4 (dialogue ruins the story which could have been an 8)
Dialogue - 3
Acting - 3 (Dwayne was terrible)
Cinematography - 9Don't get me wrong. I would see any movie that Gal Gadot is in. And Ryan Reynolds is another great fave. Dwayne Johnson, other than the fact that he hates his own country, is pretty great in MOST action movies - but the dude just can't act anymore. He was much better in older movies when he entertained for ALL, and not just his favorites ethnic groups. The dude has gotten so race-driven and political it's ridiculous, and for some reason his acting has poignantly gotten worse. Know who would have done it better?? Jamie Foxx or Chris Hemsworth. Shoot..... John Cho would have been awesome!The overall story is pretty good, but the nitty-gritty dialogue is blasé! How can you write a good story and then put in B dialogue???? Stupid. The dialogue ruins the story.Am I glad I saw it? Yup. It was okay. Will I watch it again? NO. Waste of time. Will I buy it? NO. WASTE OF MONEY. Glad I didn't pay to see it the first time.Ryan Reynolds and Gal Gadot just need to be in better written movies with real Actors. The big Movie Production companies are sell-outs, Netflix and Amazon are producing B stuff. Stick with the good writers guys - and stories that are not just entertaining, but actually MEAN something, and explore the human spirit, nature, and Truth. This movie was so over produced and lacked so much substance it was like a Peanut Butter and Jelly Sandwich with $30 Peanut Butter, $50 fruit preserves, and gourmet fresh baked bread - BUT IT'S STILL JUST A PBJ..... not Filet Mignon with a nice Caesar Salad, Sashimi, 12 year old Single Malt Scotch, Crème Brûlée, an excellent Red Wine, and Buttered Herb-cooked Baby Potatoes.Go for quality people..... your time and your money is worth more than this kind of movie.

title: It's enjoyable movie I like it very simple and nice.
text: It's enjoyable movie I like it very simple and nice.and funny, it's a family friendly movie.no sex and beautiful locations. It's enjoyable movie I like it very simple and nice.and funny, it's a family friendly movie.no sex and beautiful locations.

title: Good no brainer movie
text: Me and my boys enjoyed it. Good little movie for entertainment. You get exactly what it says on the tin.The only people who won't like it is the ones who thought Dune was amazing.

title: Entertainer !
text: Interpol's "Red Notice'd" "Ryan Reynolds" team'ed with FBI's top ranked profiler "Dwayne Johnson" to catch the most wanted art thief "The Bishop" (Gal Gadot).

title: Great movie no killing !
text: It was so nice to watch an action movie with no killing of human beings ! We take it to lightly what damage it does to us seeing all the killing that goes on in movies these days ! I give koodos to all involved in creating this awesome movie....thank you !

title: Red Notice...
text: ... is a wannabe Raiders of the Lost Ark. Plenty of action, humorous scenes, exotic locations and a long lost treasure.Dwayne Johnson is his usual self in this film as well but Ryan Reynolds steals every scene whereas Gal Gadot spoils scenes. Bottom line is that Red Notice is lots of fun to watch.

title: Annoying and Terrible script - even with 3 stars. Forgettable Notice
text: This was a film I was very exciting to watch esp with 3 huge stars. Sure it has some nice scenes around the world and it's a basic cross of National Treasure meets Fast/Furiious which one would think should work but unfortunately the writing is so childish and cliche that it just ends up making it less enjoyable and almost annoying. It's like watching Ryan in Deadpool with endless same silly jokes with Rock as a side kick being his usual role but it just gets dull and repetitive where you almost wish they would shut up. The writer could have done so much more but this sophomoric humor might entertain a few but it's not really creative or anything new or entertaining. Thankfully it's free on Dumbflicks ...Netflixs who will pay for anything these days.Maybe Red Notice 2 will be better yet seriously doubt it.4 stars for the actors who must have loved the huge paychecks.

title: We can do soulless and superficial just as Hollywood
text: What makes the film so maddening, along with many, many other reasons, is that it's the most boringly indistinctive patchwork job I've seen for a long while, a beige piece of committee-approved product that slums from point A to point B to who cares. Like an increasing number of the streamer's mass-market offerings, the overriding message appears to be: see, we can make films just as badly as everyone else!

title: Simple and aware of itself
text: The combination of Dwayne Johnson and Ryan Reynolds is all an audience needs to set expectations going into this movie. It never tries to be too smart or serious, and it has strong pacing for a 2 hour run time. This is a fun spy flick with some twists and turns that anyone can enjoy.

title: The cast carried off a relatively so-so script
text: Gal, Dwayne, and Ryan are the reason this movie worked well. Their banter, charisma, and chemistry really brought this film to life. The script and storyline is pretty mediocre and forgettable on its own. But it was still with the watch for what this talented trio brought to the table.

title: Silly but ok
text: It's silly nonsense but it's a fine way to pass a couple of hours. It's not trying to win an Oscar it's just trying to entertain and it does most of the time.

title: By the numbers - but good fun
text: An international art thief is tracked down by a detective who has been hunting him for...Actually it really doesn't matter.People jump of things, climb up things, punch each other, drive cars, things blow up, they fly around the world, trek through the jungle etc. Etc.None of this really matters as it all pretty much falls in to place when needed.This movie is good fun with lots of action interspersed with bits of witty banter.The trio of family-friendly action stars can play these characters in their sleep - and sometimes it looks like they do, but that doesn't really matter.This is a great fluff piece and more than adequate to burn a few hours and put a smile on your face.In some respects this movie should be a 10 as it sets out exactly what it wanted to do and the people who are big fans of this sort of thing will love it - power to them.This is not really my cup of tea so I only give it a 6 but recommend it if you want a bit of over the top action.

title: Enjoyable Simple Romp to While Away 2 Hours!
text: The world has obviously got far too serious if you spend your time reviewing a film and giving constructive criticism that contains Reynolds and Johnson.You know what you are going to get and it delivers on that front. Mildly humorous quips, good level of action, good character interaction and many many cringe moments.What do you expect? For that reason, it gets a 10. I knew what to expect, I got what I wanted and it passed 2 hours with a healthy grin on my face and little brain power.

title: Checc it out.
text: Better than what i expected, the plot twist at the end was a good one. Can't go wrong with a cast that consist of The Rocc, Gal Gadot and Blake Lively Husband.

title: Don't expect to get your brain tickled
text: Red notice is filled with action-comedy clichés, and doesn't fulfill it's potential. Clearly, a lot of money has gone into production of this movie. Beautiful scenery and locations aswell as CGI. However, every character is imensely shallow, and does not leave the viewer with more than a bunch of awkward one-liners. With more clever writing, and character work, this movie could be a whole lot better.

title: Entertaining and fun
text: Awesome cast in a movie filled with fun, thrills, twists and good action. Great chemistry between the three charismatic lead actors: Johnson, Reynolds and the mesmerizing Gadot. I had a great time watching this movie, and that's what I wanted.

title: So happy to see a movie about a movie...
text: This movie seriously deserves to be watched because I have never seen 200 million dollars wasted on script the size of a napkin.I am so thrilled to see Ryan Raynolds, Dwayne Johnson and Gal Gadot play every single role that Ryan Raynolds, Dwayne Johnson and Gal Gadot are known heavily to play at.Seriously I would like to know all three of them write this script or they just met a massive fan in the writing room who wanted to write a fanfiction about all 3 of them in a movie together- because that is exactly what this movie feels like.And don't take this as hate criticism, everyone else in this movie did a great job, from the actors to the production, everyone did a pretty great job. Too bad that the script came out of a algorithm.

title: A waste of talent
text: I love the actors but not the movie. I believe Ryan, Dwayne, Gal Gadot and Ritu Arya worked to the best of their ability...but even this talented crew could not save this stinker of a movie.Usually a movie such as this...over the top unbelievable stunts, lack of reality, tons of action etc. Is just what I enjoy watching at a week's end. However, you still need a storyline and this movie does not have one...at least not a good or enjoyable one.

title: Not bad nor great but definitely enjoyable
text:
At end of the day liked more than disliked. Visually its great, really entertaining and up to standard action-mega-movie par however...
the *script* had me flinch couple of times and think "okeeey". I was just expecting.. better. Mainly Gadots lines, but also Johnsons (and usually not apposed either in right setting) but these were not good enough. Reynolds saved it in this aspect. Without his comedic flare & wit, personally, I think it would have been too bad to handle.It had lot of potential, and still really is through and through pleasing for the eye and story line is entertaining.There definitely is other action movies significantly better, but when/if a sequel comes around, I won't mind putting it on a lazy weekend when wanting some comedic action that is entertaining and easy to watch with the right amount of twists and turns.

title: Not bad
text: It's okay.Not as good as I thought it would be.Good actors and directing for sure though.It's now the highest viewers movies on Netflix which is interesting.Must be due to the popularity of the actors.

title: Solid heist-comedy-movie
text: "Red Notice" is exactly what you expect of an action comedy movie with Ryan Reynolds and Dwayne Johnson. If you like those two you will like the movie; if you're tired of seeing them playing the exact same role over and over again you probably will not like it.But because this point is very clear and obvious for everybody you get exactly what you expect and wanted to see when you decided to watch "Red notice". It entertained me and I had fun watching it.

title: Funny and light, fast and easy.
text: Couldn't believe how nuanced and nimble this Ryan G. Can be.This movie doesn't try to be too serious and it succeeded very well like this.Rather perfect in fact as a good looking, unpredictable, fun quick escape.

title: I Wanted to Like I it More
text: Three Big Stars make a Heist movie. Each Actor with a unique personality and body type. Sounds fun! Not, It was almost sad. The most unexpected criticism is that Ryan seemed unnatural and scripted. His funny "Bon Mots" weren't spontaneous. I really wanted to like this. The Rock was his expected all American brainless muscle and Gal was, as usual, active and attractive. This was definitely a disappointment. You should watch it so you can see what an Actor will do for money.

title: Uninteresting Movie
text: Too much of publicity and a great star cast but a dud story and a usual script has left not only its viewers disappointed but also disillusioned , these James Bond genres have a very special audience may be it fit their palate but for us it's useless.

title: I loved it
text: It lived up to my expectations. I was so pleasantly surprised how clean the language was...and it was still great (take notes Apple TV and Hollywood)I loved the Indiana Jones Easter eggsA sequel would be great if they can deliver this level of quality again.

title: Same old thing
text: Yeah, uh, I saw this same movie about 25 years ago. It was called Entrapment with Sean Connery and Catherine ZJ. Come on Hollywood try to be original some of the time.

title: Mediocre
text:
Nothing but the unexpected action packed, Reynolds veing the same deadpool character, dumb plots and yeah, nothing really exceptional
Watch it for the action scenes which arent really that great either!

title: An all right movie.
text: Very generic. Good movie but nothing special about it.The twist was a bit unexpected but for some reason it didn't make me jump out of my chair.Overall a good movie if you have nothing better to watch . 6/10.

title: Only for ryan
text: I was very excited to watch red notice as all the three lead actors are my favorite. I didn't have much expectations regarding the story and script just expecting it to be decent and harmless.The only saving grace was ryan reynolds who carried the whole film on his shoulders. What disappointed me the most was the lack of chemistry between rock and ryan. Either rock deliberately underplayed his role for ryan to shine or got nervous seeing ryan's energy. Rock had such an awesome chemistry with kevin hart in central intelligence and jason statham in hobbs and shaw. But with ryan, that was missing. Also another aspect was that none of the action sequences impressed me except the parker chase scene between rock and ryan in the beginning.On the whole, i expected red notice to be a tacobell movie but ended up as just a one time watch.

title: A movie by numbers
text: Somewhere some exec or studio head or Netflix algorithm said we want a big budget movie with big actors that's a bit like a heist movie but also a spy like movie but also like Indiana Jones and where the police are just one step behind.Then someone went and wrote a script for The Rock and Gal Gadot and let Ryan Renold improv his one liners all the way through.Nothing here is original but heck you could do worse.Fun but completely forgettable fun.If only they through in Zombies and a kitchen sink.

title: Entertaining
text: If you are looking for entertainment...just go for it.... You will enjoy at the end...dwayne, ryan and gal Gadot delivered the best fun ride for this year😃😃

title: I watched it and I'm struggling to even remember half of the movie.
text: This is the kind of movie you put on when a few friends come over to visit on Friday night.It's not overly offensive and you can have a conversation and no one really cares that they are missing the plot. Best of all you can do it again in six months and no one will remember that they saw it before.

title: Worse than expected
text:
I knew it wasn't going to be amazing, I expected a silly easy movie. However this was incredibly stupid. I love Ryan Reynolds but he is playing the same character as always - cracking way too many jokes that aren't funny. Only a few jokes made me giggle.It felt like a children's
Movie to be honest.There was also a lot of CGI/green screen that looked way too fake.

title: this movie is amazing
text: Not sure why the rating is so low at 6.4, this movie is amazing lots of action great actors, funny etc.I went in not expecting much after reading some bad reviews and i was pleasantly surprised.

title: Its an action movie
text: Damn entertaining film but it is a Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson film so you kinda know what you are getting. A paper thin plot with charismatic actors and a lot of action. This is just that. Plus Dwayne and Ryan Reynolds (and by this point you should also know what to expect with his movies as well) have hella chemistry.

title: No excuses just results!
text: Red Notice deliverers a comical action-filled adventure, featuring three prominent actors: Dwayne The Rock, Ryan Reynolds, and Gal Godot, all delivering an enjoyable performance.The plot follows an unplanned partnership between an art thief and an FBI agent as they scramble to find priceless art in a race with another elegant art thief (Gal Godot). Many unpredictable actions by the characters occur that made me chuckle or question what was going on? Including a subtle plot twist towards the end, you may find it very predictable if you pay enough attention to the exchange between characters. Don't fret; the film does an adequate job of explaining what happened if you missed, by showing the cleverness of these thieves.This movie is a bit outrageous because it isn't logical, but are you watching this film for its logic? Or for a good laugh? I picked the latter.The pacing engaged me with various comical dialogue between Ryan Reynolds's character and whoever he speaks to. With Reynolds's character delivering his usual sporadic unfiltered thoughts, it refocused my attention on the film.Verdict: It's clear to see this formula has been reciprocated before, Ryan Reynolds another actor or two, comedy and action. Cough cough " A Hitmans Wife BodyGuard" nevertheless, a funny film more than anything. Part two coming?Does this take me to paradise? Laughing on the way but not there yet! If you haven't noticed I am a Reynolds fan!Rating 3/5.

title: Overhyped but Watch Worthy
text: Like many of Netflix's releases with big time stars, the film was well overhyped. That being said, it still was quite enjoyable, not to mention having some of Reynold's humor sprinkled in always helps. Not good enough for a 7, but even to consider it for this genre of film is a compliment, at least in my opinion.

title: Surprising Ending
text: Good plot with a surprising ending. The cast is very good. There are just about 3 main characters, some good fighting scenes and some good jokes. Nothing very suspenseful, but entertaining.

title: Ok - not the worst way to spend 2 hours
text: A cross between a James Bond flick and raiders of the lost arc - but not nearly as good. Over the top action and dialog. Suspend all believability and you can enjoy this movie. This is a situation where 3 actors that I like combined to be pretty bad together.

title: Classic Spy Movie
text: Anyone who is voting 8 or below is crazy in the head. This movie with a stellar cast including Ryan Reynolds, Dwayne Johnson, and Gal Gadot is just too good to hate. Smartly written with a touch of humor. This is one of my all-time favorite movies. Hoping for a Red Notice 2! They set it up as a possibility so we'll see. Well done.

title: Pretty good
text: Like Hobbs and Shaw but with added Ryan Reynolds. It's IMDB so expect the usual usual reviews: "it's not the best film ever made so it's a rating of 1" or "don't agree with the low average so will rate it a 10", why do people do this? Numbers do exist between 1 and 10 people. Rant over. The film's enjoyable. The Rock and Reynolds on top form. It's a bit National Treasure and as an added bonus - Gal Gadot. Easily a strong 7. Not a 10. Certainly not a 1. But a 7. One of those between 1 and 10 numbers :)

title: Three Stooges
text:
It took some balls to make this one...And the recipe was:1. Throw in plenty of Ryan Reynold's typical annoyance
2. Mix it with Gal Gadot's lost in the woods play
3. Put Rock on top, pray the pyramid holds, somehowAs for the story, there isn't any, there are only giant golden balls, which evidently inspired someone to create this nonsense. Except they got the colors wrong, they should have been blue, not gold, because the only thing that could have saved this movie is a threesome, but never happened.

title: Action packed and funny. What more do you want?!
text: I laughed quite a bit throughout this movie AND I was surprised! It's just a fun movie, period. I don't understand how some cranky people could rate this movie low. It's what a movie like this should be: Action packed, funny and fun. Hopefully there will be a Red Notice 2 :)

title: Dumb plot but amusing... like most of old hollywood
text: I am simply baffled by a huge number of professional reviewers lamenting the death of Hollywood with this specific film. Why? Because I watch lots of old movies. And have you ever heard the term B-movie? Yeah. They filled the time between good (A) movies, with less-great B movies in the schedule. You were supposed to spend half the day, once a week, at the theater.Big big stars were in hilariously low budget movies of all sorts. Some were good, worked with what they had but some were NOT. Even dumb action and war movies that are really glaringly bad. With great stars doing sometimes good work, sometimes notThis is-and yes this is damning with faith praise-a movie in the tradition of old Hollywood. Charming characters doing okay-ish with each other but mostly playing their stereotypes. A dumb plot. A lazy story. And... it's fine when bored and you need something to watch not very hard in the afternoon with a headache, for example.It's fine. I will never watch it again, but have no regrets and when you need time wasting bubblegum and your brain can't do smart stuff or put words on a page together, this will do nicely.

title: It is packed with ACTION-COMEDY
text: The story isn't that great or unique but the main reason why many people including me are drawn to this movie is because of it's alluring casting. The movie has Ryan Reynolds, Dwyane "The Rock" Johnson and Gal Gadot. The star cast is more than enough reason for me to watch the movie. Although it may not be the case for everyone, the story is a bit washed out but the comedic duo Ryan-Dwyane did a fantastic job especially Ryan with his witty and sarcastic remarks.The movie is enjoyable and it is a great entertainment if you want to kill some time in the weekends. I really didn't expect much from the movie. I honestly watched because of Ryan Reynolds but the Rock and Gal Gadot did not entirely disappointment me. It was a decent movie and I would totally recommend it if you are into action-comedy and not a story stickler.

title: pleasant to see.... nothing more
text: The movie have some good moments: funny, action scenes some surprises in some characters intention (even if i found it pretty predictable in my opinion). But the movie remain prety classic and dont have anything more than some gooc action scenes and funny moments. We also want to know how it will finish wnd what will happen at the end. Good anyway. I love also how they record the action scenes: it felt pretty dynamic and pleasant to see. I found Gal Gadot pretty stupid really and her acting felt overexaggerated even if i found her pretty hot and enjoyed her work in Wonder Woman. But here she looks very too much and ijdidnt enjoyed her acting. The story with the eggs was pretty interesting because it have some historical context but thats it. Nothing more.

title: Expensive Scenes, Cheap Plot
text: The plot felt like Indiana Jones, but poorer writing one. The twist ending was good but got buried on the simple escapes from each settings. I could see it, if a student written the plot then it could get a B-

title: Gal you ruined it
text: Nice light action comedy movie with a weak script. Short dialogues were the worst and Gal Gadot is a woman who makes you wonder how she became an actress or win a beauty contest? If there is a below zero rating, she will be the lowest infinity.

title: Movie of the year
text: How am I seeing so many bad reviews? Netflix's biggest movie brings the big screen experience from sitting at home on the sofa with a fun action packed feeling.Reynolds and Johnson is the duo I've been waiting for, classic love/hate relationship reminds me of Hobbs and shaw. Ignore all the negativity, this movie definitely deserves a watch.Well done Netflix.

title: Funny but flawed.
text: The jokes are so-so but Gal Gadot ruins every movie she's in, yet people keep hiring her for her looks and not much more. The movie could have been saved if they had gotten a funnier or more suave actress. She should stick to modeling.

title: I REALLY LOVED THIS MOVIE!
text: Its weird reading a lot of these reviews. I feel like some of the wrong people watched this film.This film isn't supposed to be some cinematic art piece but instead a cinematic adventure that keeps you guessing until the very end. Its a hyperactive buddy comedy that opens up a fun new world. I was worried when I saw this trailer that it would be like another "6 Underground" (which I thought was lackluster) but instead I was met with a modern day Indiana Jones.This film was a roller coaster. It had my attention and excitement from start to finish. PLEASE NETFLIX... TRUST RAWSON MARSHALL THURBER!!!!! KEEP MAKING MOVIES THAT THIS DUDE LIKES!!!! I MEAN THE GUY MAD FREAKING DODGEBALL!!!!! He knows what he's doing.With that said, I haven't wanted to re-watch many Netflix Original Films which makes me sad. This film will be re-watched many times in the future.GREAT JOB RAWSON AND YOUR FULL PRODUCTION TEAM!!!!! KEEP UP THE GREAT WORK!!!!!Instagram: @darrick.

title: An evident flaw!
text:
How did the ICPO get their cars inside the Nazi's treasure tunnel?? The entrance is so narrow and even the characters themselves said the old model car was ported from the other side of the mine tunnel and then sealed it...When you think about it, and think about it, makes the whole chase&catch scene meaningless...
Red Notice is a 2021 American action comedy film written and directed by Rawson Marshall Thurber starring Dwayne Johnson alongside Ryan Reynolds and Gal Gadot and Ritu Arya. It marks the third collaboration between Thurber and Johnson, following Central Intelligence (2016) and Skyscraper (2018). In the film, an FBI agent reluctantly teams up with a renowned art robber in order to catch an even more notorious robber.

title: EXPECTED MORE
text: I was looking forward to watch this movie, but i was really disappointed after seeing it.There is nothing new to say about this film, its a routine action movie, nothing special.

title: ENTERTAINING
text: Very fun movie. Does not slow down. Ryan Reynolds is hilarious and although i'm not the biggest Rock fan, he did well. Its just a good popcorn Movie. Good job Netflix.

title: It was just okay...
text: I expected more but it served its purpose. Three of the biggest Hollywood stars of today in a movie with a great story but it was poorly executed. There were really no WOW moments. Plenty of action, though. Aside from some foul language I would have called this an average family movie in the lane of Jumangi but not nearly as good.

title: It's a 5.7 Action movie light.
text: This film isn't terrible, it's.more.of an action film to watch with your 10- 11year olds. Light hearted and really meant for "me, the wife and kids". So as long as your not expecting James bond type detail and cohesion it's an ok film for a Friday night with some popcorn.

title: Bits of this, bits of that
text: OK - so I read the negative reviews - but - so what? Wanted to watch a "buddy" action movie - and that's what i got. But is today's audience so ignorant that they will accept that a 1931 car (a Mercedes - no less) has to be hand cranked to start? Suspension of belief only goes so far.

title: I really enjoyed this one.
text: Perfect mix of Comedy, suspense and intrigue. Ryan Reynolds as funny as ever, Gil Gadot is beautiful as ever and the Rock plays a really good part that doesn't rely on him being a big muscular man. I really enjoyed this movie a great deal. A lot of action, lot of witty snips by Ryan Reynolds and a good yet fun story line / plot.

title: Perfectly watchable and fun
text: With Netflix claiming that this is their most watched film ever, pulling some remarkable stats out of nowhere, I had no choice but to give it a go, and it was absolutely fine.Dwayne Johnson and Ryan Reynolds are always watchable. The two had good chemistry and had decent enough characters to have fun with. The wisecracks came thick and fast, a little too thick and fast for my liking but they were pretty funny at times.Gal Gadot I just can't get on board with. She's a perfectly fine actress but I feel like better casting could have elevated her role.The plot is decent enough. There's a macguffin, a prison escape, several heists, parkour foot chases, car chases, punch ups, shoot outs. Its as if they got the action movie playbook and just ran through every element. Some were better executed than others but nothing was bad. Equally nothing was particularly amazing.A perfectly fine film. One that you can just switch your brain off and relax as you get swept along in this globe trotting adventure.File this one under forgettable but fun.

title: Big names, big budget, big bore
text: On paper this has everything going for it, it just is souless by the numbers mediocracy.I don't know if it's the script, the timing or what but it just doesn't add up, the stupid story doesn't help.Almost 40 minutes in I gave up it wasn't improving, in fact just getting worse and more stupid.The dialogue is meant to be funny but even Ryan Reynolds struggles to keep it going.Some may like it and forgive the stupid story but the lack of chemistry, lack of intrigue, and the I just didn't give an F. So was a big no for me. All glitter but no show.

title: Didnt expect much
text: After seeing the bad reviews I wasn't expecting much. But the movie was really good. Guessing all the sub 6 scores are fakes trying to dump on Netflix.

title: Step above
text: Step above Austin powers. Not a fan of the rock or whatever he goes by now. Typical politically correct he gets beat up by a woman. The bad guy looks like a "in shape" Polly shore. I washed it just because of Ryan Reynolds. CGI is terrible. Prove me wrong.

title: This hurt my eyeballs
text: Before I begin, let me inform you that this film is Netflix's most expensive film to date. Netflix chose this film, of all films to invest in hundreds of thousands of dollars, only for it to be one of the worst movies of the year.Ryan Reynolds needs to take a hiatus in acting and think long and hard about his career. His character was not only painful to watch, but I felt like his jokes were geared towards 5 year olds. I almost laughed by accident bc it was that bad.Everything else from the gaps in the plot, and 98% of the story which didn't add up was a train wreck. A continuous showing of this movie would be a useful torture method for POW.

title: Easy watch
text: Old fashioned heist movie, not the most memorable movie of recent memory however, this film provides a few good laughs, simple plot line and an all around easy watch.If you wanting to switch off and enjoy your evening would recommend.

title: Disappointing.
text: This movie had great potential, which is why I was disappointed to find it was more of a disposable time spender than a thought-out piece with structure and meaning.Some of the plot twists of the movie were unexpected. Yet still, it lacked depth both in story and character-wise. This doesn't mean that the movie is inherently bad. As a family movie for kids and adults alike, I'd recommend it, but it could have been so much more. The characters felt plastic and unrelatable, the unexpected twists themselves lacked substance, and the movie felt incredibly fabricated, which is bad for an "Indiana Jones" style film, potentially trying to develop into a franchise.Overall, this is a good movie if you have two hours to lose. And seeing as not one, but two sequels are in the making, I hope that more work is done on the story and character development. Otherwise - they might as well change the names of the characters to the Rock, Gal Gadot, and Ryan Reynolds.

title: Entertaining!!
text: Action packed movie with a huge star cast and entertainment written all over it. Josh Reynolds was funny and Gal Gadot was just excellent as the Bishop. Dwayne was just his usual entertaining self.

title: Good entertainer
text: A typical Hollywood heist movie . A perfect entertainer for the weekend . Action , Comedy and thrill were perfectly balanced . Story was usual heist story and bit predictable one . They done good in screenplay . Asusual entertainer movies has some flaws and plot holes , if you never mind it you really enjoy this movie . I really liked camera work in action sequence , especially in chasing scenes . There is nothing big to tell about this movie , but overall a good entertainer to watch , don't expect more .

title: Really enjoyed it
text:
I found it really funny! For its genre, very entertaining 🙌
Great chemistry between Johnson and Reynolds, that was a revelation, they make a very good screen duo.

title: Wasn't bad
text: It was pretty predictable.... I only watched it given Ryan Reynolds was in this movie...Overall, not a bad movie if you like criminals and thief's like stories.

title: A Mindless action movie to watch while you do other stuff
text: The movie is just there. Good action. Tries to be funny but all jokes are like internet comments some you chuckle on. Things just happen coz it happens. Worth a watch if you have nothing else to watch or you are busy doing stuff while it runs in background.

title: Perfect blend of action and humour
text: My wife and I went to see this on a date movie and were entertained from start to finish. It is not a movie that takes itself too seriously, so we could happily ignore some of the implausibilities in the action sequences, which were superbly done. The repartee between Dwayne Johnson and Ryan Reynolds' characters was laugh out loud funny at times. Watch for the bullfighting scene - it was hilarious.Recommended for a fun night out - or in. Being a Netflix flick, we will have that option.Parental guide - a handful of swear words and some sexual innuendo, but fine for over 13's.

title: A decent movie
text: This is a decent Friday night movie. I loved all the plot twists and Ryan Reynolds was on par with his usual witty sarcasm. I hope there'll be a sequel.

title: Boring couldn't Finish the movie
text: Boring couldn't Finish the movie, they are giving this lady a role bigger than her and her acting look ridiculously fake. The rock is my favourite actor but i didn't like his role on this move, felt like the gave him a role that he deserve more than.

title: 39 From MTC? Totally Get it...
text: Red Notice gets a red rating, sounds like a match. Well, I can't say MTC got this rating out of nowhere. After all, this film shows no innovation and nothing even slightest sincerity. Humming the score of Indiana Jones while heading downstairs a bunker seems like quite a mock for that Netflix themselves do realize they have copied so many previous films without adding anything their own.However, this is a fun film to watch. As a matter of a fact, I did not dive into this film with high hopes. I was kind of worried that this film would abandon its entertaining core and struggle to be deep and sophisticated, yet the outcome did not let me down. They are very clear about their goal, the TRINITY. Anything beside theses three superstars is irrelevant. Gal Gadot has her sexy charm, Dwayne Johnson has showed his ridiculous muscle chunk( Although he was incredibly weak in this film), and Ryan Reynolds presented his Deadpool-ish joking ability to us(Again).So, if you love anyone of these three stars or better yet, all of them, this film would be a great and pleasant journey for you. One More Sincere Advice For You While You Watch This Film--Never Think Of the Story Twice, do keep that in mind.

title: Predictable movie with Ok comedy
text: The movie was a cliche with lot of predictable lines, exactly what you would expect of a Netflix movie. Laughable comedy here and there, all in all it's an average Sunday night family movie just to kill some time.

title: Super fun
text: It's a lot of fun to watch, although really predictable. So predictable in fact that I think the target audience is children, really, how stupid do they think people are?

title: Not complicated (think Indiana Jonesish) and light hearted fun
text:
This is the first movie I've watched produced by Netflix which I have traditionally avoided altogether not regarding them as real films. I was drawn in by the lead actors which I think of as fun. It's is not an award winning film, the critics didn't like it but the users (on IMDb) did. What the hell, I gave it a try but wouldn't watch it again.The introductory camera shot zooming down from the sky and into a car chase was a really cool start. We soon find out Reynolds is a bad guy, which is new. Lots of stunts in the beginning scene during which you would have to be completely blind to miss the Porsche Taycan (and later Mercedes) advertising. As things progress, Johnson seems to become a bad guy too, which is also new. We like these bad guys cuz they're only stealing fancy eggs from true villains (one of which is really short), they have good banter and they look good in tuxedos. Something I didn't know is Reynolds is tall...not too far off from Johnson who is really tall.There is a fair amount of action with helicopters, cars and a fake bull. When I say fake, a lot of the movie is just special effects where the people employed in these departments outnumbered the stuntmen 3 to 1. Make no mistake, however, this is a big budget film with total crew exceeding 1,500 persons; Netflix has money.A couple of quotes in the movie from Ryan Reynolds were rather cute:
"They're always watching, always listening.....Kinda like Alexa but with guns."
"Doesn't matter what you do, only matters what they think you've done."In the end the double crossers get double crossed....it's that kind of caper.

title: Exactly what it's meant to be and more!
text: Very enjoyable with lots of action and comedic twists especially from hilarious Mr Reynolds. If you are trying to find the truth in it, don't bather please. It's a grown-up's fairytale - pure entertainment. Johnson, Gadot and Reynolds are perfect on what they do.

title: Gal Gadont
text: Ryan Reynolds carried this extremely predictable cliche movie. Rock and Ryan were great till gal gadot came in and god she sucks at acting. She got nothing going and is one of the if not the worst actress in Hollywood. Exteremly overrated and brings the entire movie and production down. Go look at ww2 as example.

title: Not Really Interesting Commercial Grade Movie
text: Action packed commercial movie.Used famous actors/actresses/special guest artists to increase the fame and popularity.No Solid Storyline and Some scenes and sequences are not realistic at all. They haven't made an effort to make adventurous scenes more realistic as well. Might be due to budget but seems like they spent more to attract famous actors and actresses etc. So I guess budget was spent on matters with less priority.

title: Utter nonsense
text: But thoroughly enjoyable. Good plot twists, corny jokes and not-to-be-believed action. Good entertainment, any plagiarism is celebrated, not hidden. A film you don't have to think about too much.

title: Through advertising, expectations are otherwise too high for a good movie, but it works!
text: The premise was that this was advertised as "the first scene is unseen before"Just yeah, that shouldn't be to blame for the film, but unfortunately it created a strong starting point for the film and showed great disappointment, which of course affects the stars.The actor of the guard himself belongs, would I say the biggest names in Hollywood at the moment, which also contributed to the interest.The end result is just nothing too special.An entertaining brain cloakroom action adventure.

title: Not funny bad. Just bad.
text: Small funny man and big strong man and also pretty woman in an all too predictable Indiana Jones meets the odd-couple style adventure movie. Also infested by a load of all crappy CGI.

title: Meh, maybe great, maybe okay, or maybe C) All Thee Above
text:
So, is it a big budget action/adventure/comedy starring top billing names in a would-be summer blockbuster with an overly formulaic script & near century old plot devices driving a film that has been rehashed a hundred times, in hundreds of different films, but still kinda a summer blockbuster if films being released in theaters in the summer were still a thing?Well, I'm glad you asked!Because, maybe!"Straight to streaming" isn't like how "straight to DVD (VHS for the older crowd)" stars once went to their respective fame graves.Once upon a time, famous actors & actresses would have a their time in the limelight & then, for whatever reason be resolved to contractually agree to be in films that never made it to the big silver screen.Alas, 2020 & the Corona Virus decimated more than just the human population...it also decimated cinema.RIP.All across the world, in just over a year, most everyone everywhere became movie critics.Everything streaming everywhere meant anyone anywhere could watch & critique any film at their leisure.Enter Red Notice.It's got the star power!It's got the witty banter!It's even got the famous McGuffin!It kinda has everything that once would have made a fun summer blockbuster, but it's not quite that, is it?It has the feel of the first Brendan Fraser "Mummy."
It overtly references Indiana Jones.It even throws back to Hitchcock & films like The Thomas Crown Affair, The Italian Job, & all of the "Oceans" films.It suspends our disbelief while keeping our interest as a nod to the Nic Cage blockbuster action/adventure "National Treasure" which did that exact same thing.All really great references. All pretty great, or at least entertaining, movies.Most of which were blockbusters in their respective times, right?!They spawned sequels, prequels, spin-offs, & a bunch of other profitable ip (intellectual properties).So, does this answer the question you first asked at the start of this review?In case you forgot:
So, is it a big budget action/adventure/comedy starring top billing names in a would-be summer blockbuster with an overly formulaic script & near century old plot devices driving a film that has been rehashed a hundred times, in hundreds of different films, but still kinda a summer blockbuster if films being released in theaters in the summer were still a thing?Well, I'm glad you asked!Because, maybe!HashtagMcGuffin.

title: Easily forgettable
text: You know what I really don't get about movies like that? In one scene - the character can fight 30+ prison guards by himself and in the next scene he can't fight to save his life. He can only fight when it's convenient for the plot. Hey writers - you gonna have to decide - can he fight or not??I mean... dumb movie. But entertaining. Just don't take it seriously.

title: Another Indy
text: Red Notice is a Netflix flick with A list stars Gal Gadot, Ryan Reynolds and Dwayne Johnson. The three work together to find the three the most coveted treasures lost for a millennia. They betray each other, lie and steal with plenty of plot twists. The storyline reminds me of Indiana Jones with a mix of Jackie Chan type of movie. It was a great high action cat and mouse chase. Love the chemistry between Ryan and Dwayne, they are great together and Ryan is hilarious. Great fun story, beautiful sceneries and great actors definitely one to watch. This was Netflix's most expensive movie ever created.

title: A fun action-heist flick
text: Certainly too much CGI background but I rather loved the standard Reynolds smartass with The Rock's straight man bit. I dunno if the plot really work but it's enjoyable.

title: Haven't reviewed in a while...
text: ...THIS MOVIE IS ACTUAL DOG CRAP.The camera work will make you throw up, the CGI is absolutely atrocious and my god how the hell was this movie EVER greenlit?

title: What a thoroughly enjoyable film!
text: Just watched on Netflix and can't wait: a) for the sequel (hint hint) and b) to purchase my own blu ray (hint hint).In these stressful times this movie is the best. It is funny, heart warming, tantalizing and filled with likeable characters. There is mild suspense and a cohesive storyline. And, what the heck, a boy gets a girl. What more do you want? Oh yeah, a few robberies, chase scenes, dramatic escapes and gunfights. Lots of fun.

title: IT felt super-generic despite it's big budget
text: I was dissapointed, and it even drove me to actually write a review to express this dissapointment.I was kind of "anticipating" this movie ever since they began teasing it in early 2021. My thoughts were so naive.... hoping NETFLIX could actually make something worthwhile with these 3 actors.Boy was this generic and sometimes confusing. All three actors brought to the table the exact same style of acting as they have in their previous roles.Ryan the wise-crack nonstop babble-mouth, dwayne the tough-as-nail law enforcement figure who is funny between serious and gadot the eye-candy smart-cheeky femme fatale.Sometimes, I thought I was watching national treasure when suddenly a scene from jumanji took over with a dab of jungle cruise and deadpool.Heck, even the unbelievably long car chase ala FastnFurious6 Runway scene was thrown in for good measure. I was thinking "why would you dig a big tunnel with ample lighting to go all that way and end up at a waterfall?"My intellect-meter just snapped right then and there and the rest of the movie was just a bunch of noise leading to rolling credits. During that time I was busy reading reviews on imdb and comparing notes to others feeling the same vibes.I told my friend that IF this movie just ends up in the "dissapointment bin" like army of the dead, the harder they fall and other big budget big stars hollywood output by netflix, then I would give up on continuing any hopes for this company.NETFLIX may have the big budget and access to A-list actors, but they certainly don't put a lot of effort into getting some skilled writers with original ideas in their heads.IF you find the need to MUST SEE THIS BLOCKBUSTER MOVIE BY NETFLIX, please make sure beside you and the tv, there is absolutely nothing else in the room that might distract you from the screen.DESPITE IT'S GLOSSY PRODUCTION VALUES, the movie was never engaging to begin with.Trust me, you will feel it within the first 30 minutes. You can easily turn it off and continue some other day without the slightest of anxiety to finish it.

title: That Fake fight with the women
