text: That fake fight with the women is what let the ratings down I mean lol too much of a showing off these days , thats freakest fakest fight ever lol apart from that this movie freaking awesome.

title: JACKIE CHAN MEETS BURN NOTICE
text: I kept seeing Jackie Chan stunts and Burn Notice plots. A few one liners were funny. I was disappointed. It seemed edited like a TV series. It would have worked better as 2 or 3 one hour broadcasts.

title: my opinion
text: A very interesting movie that is suitable for family viewing and becomes an evening evening.. I enjoyed the performance of the actors and I did not feel any bored moment.

title: Another Dwayne and Ryan Flick
text: Red Notice doesn't reinvent the genre but it does make for a worthy addition to the many films that came before. With a good script that did have a few overly convenient plot points it still kept me watching. Great action scenes and editing there were still a few things that fell short. The CGI wasn't bad however it felt more like a really good video games graphics. With many classic Ryan Reynolds jokes it did make for a fun watch with my family. The final act was my favourite and tied everything up, not the cleanest way to end but still had all my questions answered. Overall it was a fun movie with great action and good writing, however all in all it is a Ryan Reynolds and Dwayne Johnson flick and if you enjoy them you will 100% enjoy this movie.Kyle Kinghorn.

title: The Most Generic Movie
text: This movie is infuriating in it's mediocrity. It's like the script was written by AI designed to make action movies but not advanced enough yet to make something good. It never didn't feel like a waste of time. I turned it off when it was nearly done because I simply didn't care how it ended.

title: Great fun
text: The movie is good fun with fantastic actors. Camerawork and special effects are great... The fake gunfire is a bit to visible... Only thing that ruins this movie is cars with 75 year old petrol in the system starting up without any problems. Petrol is out of date even before a year has past. Still this is good entertainment.. There a no bloopers in the end of the movie :/

title: Big Stars but lack of the story.
text: Well if you had 3 big stars then you won't worry about the storyline. But now the world's look in a different way because storyline is important too. And this movie doesn't have any type of story that could engage the audience. But what I quite like about this movie is their characters. Specially Ryan's character is the main hero in this movie who will keep you entertained. Rock is good but not in his attire form and Gal is pretty but not engaging.Action sequences are good and fun to watch specially the conversation between Rock & Ryan are too good. Except that movie falls flat and nothing new you could find. One time watch I will say about this and yeah you'll get entertained but don't keep too much expectations....

title: Uninspiring.
text: Movie stars, comedy, and shallowness.This movie is pure fast food. If you're in for it, then it's great background noise.This movie is trying to be only fun and slapstick. Which..... Doesn't work.It's sad. I love comedies but we are turning comedies into THE joke. Not the source of it.

title: Maybe 6.5?
text: Trying to be fair here but just not my cup of tea....too loose and fluffy for me but I can see some fun in it. Not a serious heist or chase movie and the plot twists at the end were rushed and stereotypical. Light no thinking allowed entertainment...might fill a void for you.

title: Silly but enjoyable.
text: Best described as a movie cocktail of the Ocean films, Bond and Indiana Jones, there is not a shred of originality to be seen, but the three lead actors all work incredibly well together and make it a fun movie. I for one am hoping for another movie. Incidentally, whilst Ryan Reynolds had all the best lines, I thought the Bride seeing Ed Sheeran was the funniest scene.

title: A rehash of other Rock movie.
text: The usual rip off of other comedies with Dwayne Johnson in them. Ryan and Gal bring some new bits, but you've probably already seen this movie...with a different title.

title: Amazing actors and lots of surprising twists!
text: With some of the best actors out there, this movie keeps you on your toes the whole time. Just when you think you've got an idea of what's going to happen they go another direction. So much fun and quite hilarious! Love it.

title: Good For What It Is
text: Overall the movie delivers more than what I'd hoped, which sure wasn't much before starting. Yes it's silly , the plot is sort of a dollar store Indiana Jones , but overall it provided decent light entertainment. Personally I'm not usually a huge fan of the Rock or Ryan Reynolds acting and find them to be some of the most unidimensional actors out there. The Rock can usually only play the Rock or some FBI type cop and Ryan Reynolds is the exact same character in seemingly every role, essentially Ryan Reynolds himself. Still, I oddly found the combination of the two here worked quite well.Reynolds and the Rock have better chemistry in delivering the cheesy one liners than other combinations I've seen. And yes, the script is totally reliant on these one liners. Normally I find movies that are so reliant on the one liner deliveries to be tacky and annoying , but they make it work here.Overall the big twist at the end is decent although probably predictable for some. In terms of a mindless, low taxing I would say it achieves what it sets out to. It doesn't feel like it wants to drag on or overextend its welcome.I' ll definitely give the second one a watch when it's out.

title: Plagiarism. The only thing they stole was 2hrs of my life.
text: I thought it was going ok for the 1st 40mins even if you accept it's written for 10 year olds. You know, the kind of movie where you don't have to think a lot. Well I found that I stopped thinking altogether. Absolute drivel. Cobbled together from numerous other heist movies and just annoyingly smug but with absolutely no justification to be so. Save yourself some time before you watch it by spending 10mins remembering the plot from those old frothy 60's heist movies. Job done. Then go out and enjoy yourselves.

title: SUPER FUN.
text: It's Indiana Jones for dummies. Just turn off your brain and enjoy it. The shining star of the movie are the jokes, but they fall rather flat at times. An afternoon cliché movie to watch with my family to laugh a little, but nothing unexpected or original.

title: So Genreric
text: Its twists are so predictable and story is so generic, feels like a movie that has been seen multiple times already. Can be avoided or can be just played in the back ground.

title: A homage to action movies.
text: This is a movie where Jackie Chan quality stunts meets with 007 adventure, with Indiana Jones kinds of humor and predicaments and a pirates of the Caribbean kind of pace. It adds nothing new, but wraps it all together in a very enjoyable story that tucks and amazing amount of action in without sacrificing plot. At times it gets a little too cliche, and over the top.The plot is simple. Cleopatra was supposed to have had 3 golden eggs. An Egyptian billionaire wants to given them to his daughter as a wedding present. So he put a massive reward on the eggs. Top thieves then vie for the eggs to collect the reward. Some of the scenes are indeed memorable. Some just poorly done. Lots of laughs, great stunts. The plot is pretty weak, but that's not why you watch a movie like this. It's a great way to burn a couple hours and be entertained. The humor spans the gamut from slapstick to sarcasm to subtle running jokes. I suspect it was written with Johnny Depp playing. Nolan Booth. It is definitely a role Depp would have carried off without effort.

title: Nothing new here but okay
text: You've seen this movie before. It borrows from so many other heist movies, Ryan Reynolds even whistles the theme for Raiders of the Lost Ark.Gal Gadot in barefeet with broken glass all around manages to avoid any injury.A car that starts after 70 years (gas goes bad and it evaporates).A chase scene reminiscent of Temple of Doom and Crystal Skull at the same time.Ryan Reynolds gets a not so subtle product placement for his vodka brand.A joke about how the eggs are a maguffin.

title: Enjoyable to watch, but really lacks some basic common sense
text: It was fun to watch this movie; but when people submerge in the water without getting wet, when they fall off a plane into the water in the middle of nowhere and their location is still being shared on their phone, it's really hard to give it a good rating.

title: Good
text: I saw Red Notice and it was really good.I enjoyed the film because it had Ryan Reynolds and Gal Gadot in it as they were both my favourite in the film.Dwayne's character was okay but I loved Ryan's character the most because he is so funny and he is funnier than Dwayne.I loved Gal Gadot because her character was beautiful and sexy and she was perfect and so was Ryan Reynolds.Both Ryan and Gal did a great job in this film. I loved their characters. They were both funny.What I liked about this movie was Ryan and Gal's chemistry. They were both enjoyable to watch in the film.If you wanted to watch a film like Red Notice watch it because of Ryan Reynolds and Gal Gadot. They are both great actors who have great chemistry between each other.

title: It goes all the way, and beyond!
text: This little action comedy gem has enough going for it: cast chemistry, a laughable premise and outrageous action. By all means it's should be just a by-the-numbers heist flick with light twists, enough to keep you entertained.And entertaining it is, as long as you can suspend your disbelief just the right amount.Driven largely by the chemistry between Reynolds (who seems to play Deadpool everywhere) and Dwayne Johnson (a natural comedy genius) with Gal Gadot an unlikely by charming addition, this movie is just enough of light saturday night entertainment to help recharge your batteries.But there's another side of the movie: it never takes itself seriously and at the same time it subverts your own need to suspend your disbelief. As the movie nears its conclusion, do take the time to revisit in the back of your mind all those moments that seemed too outrageous (and the script does take the time to address them either during its runtime or at the end when it goes back to "explain" some things). Yes, the movie mocks you for suspending too much of your disbelief and not going with the simplest explanations.This tiny bit of detail helps this movie out of the hole of generic action flicks, perhaps just enough to warrant a second watch.

title: Eggs
text:
Red Notice is a 2021 American action comedy film written and directed by Rawson Marshall Thurber 🥚It's very good! 😀
I'd recommend it 👍🏼PRO AND CONS.

title: Absolute Entertainer!!
text: I am unable to understand how this movie is even getting bad reviews.Loved every part of the film!!The Comedy, Action, Drama, Chemistry, Thrill and of course Gal Gadot!!

title: Ocean's Eleven and National Treasure Meet at the Temple of Doom!
text: If Danny Ocean, Indiana Jones, and Ben Gates all walked into an establishment, this movie would be the plan written on their bar napkin. Unsurprisingly, you see Gal Gadot's WW assertiveness, The Rock muscling his way around, and Ryan Reynolds doing his signature Deadpool comedic lines during this entire movie.There is no shortage of plot twists so be prepared to become lost on why some things happen the way they do. One issue I have is Interpol being so naive and borderline bumbling that it's hard to take them seriously in their apprehension efforts. Also to be honest, the originality of this film involves subtle references and mimicking of several existing franchises (ahem, like the ones mentioned up top). The plot structure is linear and predictable in terms of which way to go next and it feels like hiring three A-list actors to sell this movie is what makes up for said linear plot structure.However, this movie is watchable with gorgeous international scenery, fast-paced action, and lots of humor. The interesting part is that I did not see one person die, nor did any character shoot a henchman or security guard with a firearm which leads me to believe this is a family-friendly film. Don't bother with reason, just watch it and enjoy!

title: Corny entertainment
text: Typical "The Rock" type movie. Stuff all the typical epic action explosions, plot twists, corny lines and scenes into a movie and this is what you get. Mostly funny to me where they might not have been trying to be funny.

title: Very passable
text: I feel like you can enjoy the movie if you put aside all of its flaws and cheap-looking production, especially when considering the chemistry between the three actors.. but its a lose.

title: They play their characters
text: It is 2 hours of Ryan, Rock & Gal playing their public characters. Wit, Brawn, Sexy with some action and a bit of story thrown in. You love those three and their typecast characterizations - you'll love Red Notice.

title: Better then expected.
text: I was very sceptical before watching this movie.I like Dwayne Johnson, but most of the movies he plays in turn out to be disappointing for me.It's an ok story with a good plot and has tons of comedy scenes.

title: Fun
text: It's what you expect with the story and actors. It's a funny movie with some good action and a good few twists and turns, I really enjoyed it and it's getting negative reviews for a basic story line ? Sometimes you need to go into these movies with just a fun attitude, I recommend.

title: Entertaining but predictable
text: It's a simple movie. Dwayne plays his standard character, and Ryan is is a smartmouth.But Gal was better than I expected!But the "big plotwist" could have been seen from very early on.

title: Silly Movie
text:
It's just boring stupid not entertaining movie
I wanted to end in the first 30 minutes . Nothing special in it may be some of Ryan Reynolds Joke or reaction made me laugh.

title: Loved it Awesome
text: I never miss a Dwayne Johnson Movie. I watched all his movies. He is awesome. This movie is also awesome as all other his previous movies. Gal Gadot is most beautiful actress I have ever seen. This movies is thrilling and action packed. Loved it.A must watch movie. Thank you Netflix.

title: Very funny and enjoyable
text: The movie was very funny and enjoyable it also had very funny jokes in it. Its obviously not a Oscar performance but it certainly is a movie worth watching.

title: Beige Notice
text: This fits right in with the likes of Extraction and The Old Guard and other in a seemingly growing list of Netflix original action flicks that are full of flash but devoid of lasting substance. Red Notice is a fun movie, that's about it. There are moments of straight up laughs and then others of groanworthyness. The acting isn't exactly a spectacle, the effects are REALLY bad at times and the movie suffers from being a little too meta for its own good without properly committing to it, which really undercuts a lot of the plot movements. If this would've gone into full on meta, parodying the ridiculous action movies of the time and being self aware and referential it could've been a really fun romp. Instead it goes into half measures that feel more distracting than anything.Again, it's a fun watch and I don't regret the time spent but it's all fluff from start to ridiculous finish. It does kinda veer into Crystal Skull territory near the end (not aliens so much as just the overall vibe and stylings) which was a problem. Still fun though!

title: Predictably Good...Well, Predictable and Good
text: Star power makes this movie work, even if the plot is a bit predictable. The appeal of Reynolds alone can often make his films draw crowds and provide for fun, witty dialogue...add Dwayne Johnson and Gal Gadot and you have a winner.It's arguable that Reynolds, Johnson, and Gadot kind of play different versions of the same person in all their films, but that's ok....their appeal makes it work. The plot for this action-comedy is pretty good, predictability aside. It's engaging and entertaining without making you think too much about it.I recommend it. If you're looking for a fun flick to watch, add it to your list.

title: Great Fun!
text: Mindless and a whole lot of fun. Great to watch as a family and worth it for Sheeran's cameo alone. So refreshing to see a film with no nudity, sex scenes or graphic violence, things which to often creep into what are supposed to be child friendly movies.

title: Lots of action and cheesy dialogues
text: Ryan Reynolds and Gal are good and the rest are just there..Lots of cheesy dialogues, unnecessary action. A Friday night movies.. Watch and forget..

title: Dream cast in a action packed comedy that is pure entertaining.
text: 5 out of 5 stars.Red Notice is an awesome action comedy that brings the fun talent with Dwayne Johnson, Ryan Reynolds, and Gal Gadot. Taking these characters into an action packed ride with a side of laughs.I actually enjoyed the film more than I thought I would. Lots of action and humor. A story about a FBI profiler John (Dwayne Johnson) joining an Interpol agent Das (Ritu Arya) to help track down one of the highest skilled thief con artist Nolan (Ryan Reynolds). Who is on a track of trying to steal three of Cleopatra's golden eggs. When Nolan is caught and John is set up by another skilled con artist known as the Bishop (Gal Gadot). Nolan and John in a Russian prison. They both try to join forces to escape and chase down the Bishop before she can get her hands on the eggs. And John clearing his name.The film is action packed. And a lot of fun seeing Ryan Reynolds and Dwayne Johnson banter at each other throughout. Johnson being a brute and Reynolds being the wise cracking talker. And Gal being a skilled fighter. The film is fast paced. Lots of fun set pieces. And humor.Director Rawson Marshall Thurber knows how to handle the action sequences. Taking these characters into a fun Indiana Jones mixed with a bit of National Treasure ride. Great cast ensemble. The film does have a twist that is fun and entertaining. Which leaves you wanting more after it ends. I would love to see a sequel.Overall, Red Notice is a lot of fun, fast, action packed with some humor.

title: Red Notice
text: It's hard to review this film as nothing is surprising about this film. The three main characters essentially plays their most comfortable selves around a plot that is simple and done a million times. Just a mundane action flick featuring three mega stars, the money probably would have been better spent elsewhere for Netflix.

title: And enjoyable movie
text: This is a great movie to watch had a lot of plot twists that kept you guessing. And a surprise twist at the end that I didn't see coming and I'm usually pretty good at spotting them before it happens. Also love the cast but I couldn't help feeling that Ryan was acting like Deadpool, Gal was acting like Wonder Woman and The Rock was acting like well the Rock. And what was up with Sotto's voice he sounds like Dumbledore.

title: Boring
text: This movie started of well with nice neat direction but then it just lost the ball. It starts to become boring. The characters aren't even that good. The story is rubbish. And the movie is just quite simply not entertaining. The prison with Ryan Reynolds and the Rock that was quite an interesting dynamic and was that little bit interesting. The other characters are dull. Not an interesting or remotely cool concept in this. It had it's moments but overall not my cup of tea.Overall: 3.7/10.

title: The Fast And Furious Hitman's Bodyguard...
text: If the Fast and the Furious had a baby with the Hitman's Bodyguard had a baby, this comedy-caper would be the result. Ryan Reynolds is the world's most famous art-thief, or at least he was until he was sold out by a competitor in a race to assemble three golden artifacts for a wealthy billionaire. What follows is a bro-oad-trip as Dwayne Johnson and Ryan Reynolds banter their way through a humiliating contest against the alluring Gal Gadot.Where Red Notice shines is not in originality, nor is it in brilliant writing, but in its comical contempt for taking anything seriously. Ryan Reynold's signature wit and comedy riffs break the fourth wall with frequency, including looking for a crate labelled Mcguffin while in an underground Nazi vault. Dwayne Johnson recycles the same character he plays in Jumanji, Jungle Cruise and pretty well every other movie he's been in, while Gal shows a little bit of her creepy side when torturing a prisoner but is never quite convincing in her relationships - one of which feels downright awkward.The production values are a mixed bag with some prominently poor green screen, and the script had the feel of being so painfully written that the actors started to adlib their own lines to improve it. This plays to that strength of goofy comedy that doesn't require much thought while hedging itself in between several sequences of action and pretentious explosions.Altogether, its goofiness will attract some, and deter others. For the family audience, frequent swearing and sexualized language push this up to a teen audience even if the sexual content is limited.

title: Bland
text:
An action movie made with green screen, computers and no stunt men.The rock looks bored he can't act and he's upstaged by Ryan reynolds in every scene
Only reynolds and gal gadot save this from being below average.Can we have some proper action movies made sometime soon please.

title: It had a chance to be better..
text: Edit more than 30 minutes of overkill out, and it's a better movie... Now it has the potential, but drags on it's excitement, draws, successes, action and fun.

title: Great movies!!!
text: I love this movies. It feels like the new generation of Indiana Jones. I hope there will be another sequel. Great acting, good plot, great action. Enjoyable!

title: Would be an 8 Only if
text: Gal Gadot was not in it. She is a terrible actress and I'm amazed she has a career.Ryan Reynolds is funny as usual. He and Dwayne Johnson are a good comedic team. This movie has the typical unrealistically absurd action scenes but this is to be expected nowadays.Worth watching especially on a rainy day.

title: pretty bad
text: Sorry to say this was pretty bad. Generic story, generic action, bad cgi and no chemistry at all between the leads. Which is sad because all of them have shown they can make good movies with plenty of good humor and action.The humor is nothing to write home about and just doesn't work in most cases. It's forced and badly written.Sadly you probably won't be sitting on the edge of your seat either biting your fingernails in anticipation of what's next.Nothing wrong with a turn of your brain blockbuster now and then. This just isn't it.

title: A Fun, Entertaining Break From Our Anxious Times
text: Dwayne Johnson, Ryan Reynolds, and Gal Gadot star in this most recent of comedy action crime thrillers that seems to follow the typical genre of Indiana Jones movies including Raiders of the Lost Ark (1981) with Harrison Ford and Karen Allen or even Romancing the Stone (1984) with Michael Douglas, Kathleen Turn, and Danny DeVito. As for the contemporary update, Gal Gadot has a much more active role in Red Notice. Not a lot of new ground is broken in this movie, but there are more plot twists along with good pacing and comedy with the action. An entertaining movie that fits well for the need for relief with the anxiety times of our time.

title: Enjoyable, but would be better without Gal Gadot
text: Light entertainment, enjoyable movie. Filled with clichés, that made me think I saw the movie before the entire time ( I checked the release date twice). So predictable but that shouldn't stand in the way of enjoying a movie. Ryan Reynolds is being Ryan Reynolds and the Rock is being the Rock... and that's ok. Bad thing is Gal Gadot as the supporting actress. The acting performance of the other two actors seems stellar in comparison. Meanwhile Gadot recites her memorised lines if she was a 12 year old doing a school play.

title: Deadpool without the suit
text: The problem with Ryan Reynolds is that he nailed his role in deadpool so good that every role he plays from that moment on , u expect him to show up in that red suit at some point in the movie.

title: Exactly what you'd expect
text: A film that isn't drastically different from the Netflix formula when it comes to their action palette, but it's certainly a film that entertains and does what it has to do.The chemistry between Dwayne Johnson and Ryan Reynolds does take it time to get going, but they both complement each other's talents and provide a solid outing as the films driving force. Ryan's quick witted humour is very unique and that is used to the films advantage, the writing from a comedic element hits well.There's no doubt the action is central to the film's core and I expected it to be as entertaining as it was. The set pieces were well done and the masquerade scene is a particularly one to look out for.But the film does suffer from consistent cliches that make the narrative predictable and lazy in areas. Besides the comedic aspects, the writing is ordinary and doesn't do much to enhance the narrative.Nothing you haven't seen before from Netflix from a narrative point of view, but it's a good Friday night watch, and for most, that'll do.

title: Easy watching, nothing amazing
text: This film is exactly what I expected, no great storyline just a steady film that you can watch at the end of a hard week.The storyline is just enough for the film to plod along, the giggles are typical Reynolds it's just good, clean fun.The chemistry between the actors is clear and that helps in their delivery. Overall a nice easy watch thats good to have in reserve if there's nothing else on.

title: Expected nothing else from these guys!
text: Honestly this movie played out exactly how i thought it would. The Rock playing the Rock, Ryan Reynolds plying a non superhero Deadpool full of quips and Gal Gadot just being Gisele from F&F in smarter clothes!Most of the time i was smiling from the comic action and then the jokes flying around. Even if there were jokes that didnt land it didnt slow any of story or make an awkward moment. Just watching this made me happy its not a great film but cant help but say give it a watch and enjoy the Netflix cheese!

title: Just complete package
text: This movie contain pretty well balance of comedy, action and suspense.Comic timing is excellent punch lines are great.This is what i am waiting for years.....

title: Memory of Chinese food takeaway lasts longer
text: When you are a big fan of a particular star you watch the movie first and don't care about reviews. Here is such a movie where you love all the 3 stars (BIG ones at that) and lot of brouhaha surrounding it. That's about it, no extra-ordinary moments, other than the big bucks which went into the making of it. You may probably not remember anything after watching the potboiler of a movie. You could probably get more entertainment if you watch the social media stories of the Rock or Ryan Reynolds or Gal Gadot. If you only saw Instagram, you would probably believe that this is biggest hit of the year. Far from it, a PG (13) rated, politically correct Indiana Jones version of a treasure from the World War II-Germans' hidden loot. Also continues with Gal Gadot's movie theme - no one is hurt or killed (like in WW 1984), justifies that family theme. No big cinematic moment or unforgettable lines that go into adventure movies. So many opportunities were created, but the stars got in the way of screen time.

title: I thought I'd give it a try
text: Unfortunately it was boring. To be honest I don't remember any decent film with The Rock lately. Ryan Reynolds is trying to be to funny, Gal Gadot is annoying - being former Miss Israel means nothing if you can't act.

title: Fun, exciting, Entertaining
text: Well this movie from start to finish was simply entertaining. Ryan reynolds bring comedics sequence as always, the rock is well the rock and gal gadot is the feminine heroine in the story. That twist at the end was unexpected though. Loved it.My vote is 8. I have spoken.

title: Dumb and dumber
text: Deadpool meets simple-movies-Dwayne.I actually felt a bit dumber after watching this. More for children then adults. Gal Gadot is nice to watch, but after Wonder Woman 1984 I cannot take her seriously anymore.

title: Goes very well until the climax
text:
It's Funny .. Ryan at it's best ...Gal Gadot looks too cute to be evil . Dwayne ..as usual ..
It's a funny ride which ends nowhere..
Ending should have been better .. otherwise its a 7 Star movie.

title: It was fine
text: Ryan Reynolds must get tired of being the snarky one, Dwayne Johnson with being the muscly straight man, and Gam Gadot with bring a beautiful Amazon warrior in every movie. But they are so good at it.

title: Could have been better, but still entertaining.
text: Considering the A-list cast they really could have done better, especially since all 3 of them have good on-screen chemistry. The writing was a bit disappointing, and so were some of the special effects. It was still quite entertaining even though it's not the really fun action comedy it could have been.

title: enjoyable but a missed oppertunity.
text: First of all.. how often can RR play the same character!!! The guy must have some other mode? Has anyone tried pressing a different button? OK OK I live RR and his one character but surely there is more?Other than that the film is ok. There are a few laugh out loud moments. However, the "twists" are ridiculously obvious and the plot just an endless list of cliches. I swear you could recreate this whole film just be pasting together a few well chosen clips from other films.

title: Weak script
text: Just like most other "content" on Netflix this movie suffers from the same disease. A lot of glamour but no substance. The structure is awful. The dialogue is awful and the acting is mediocre. They say the spent a ton of money but the visual effects looked very cheap.the movie is a knock off of mission impossible and Indiana Jones.

title: Delivers what is promised
text: Honestly, what is with the bad reviews?It is a typical Dwayne Johnson movie. The comedy is on point, and Ryan's comic timing is commendable. Rawson Marshall Thurber evidently draws inspiration from Indiana Jones, and it is hella impressive. On the other hand, the plot is pretty straight forward.An art thied Nolan Booth (Ryan Reynolds) has to collect all three ancient jewelled eggs that once belonged to Cleopatra, but have been in the possession of the Nazis for centuries. Officer John Hartley (Dwayne Johnson), is after Booth, preventing him from stealing these priceless artefacts. The Bishop (Gal Gadot) also is after Booth, competing over the same possession. However, things change course, and various truths are revealed about the identities of the three of them. It is quite interesting, I honestly didn't get bored, and the wit is on point!

title: Predictable Hollywood Film
text: I wouldn't spend my money watching this in theaters, so it's OK on Netflix. I would have like to see someone else in the role of Dwayne Johnson. He seems to be everywhere these days and it's getting tiresome, at least for me. What turned me off was what we found out about him at the end of the film.

title: Boring
text: I thought this would going to be a fun movie. But, unfortunately, it was just really boring. I gave up after about 20-30 minutes. I actually liked Dwayne and Ryan but the other actors, not so much. The initial action sequences almost put my sister and me to sleep.

title: Entertaining silly action comedy
text: Heist action comedy movie starring the Rock, Ryan Reynolds and Gal Gadot.An FBI agent is framed for the theft of a priceless Egyptian egg. He and a professional thief work together to find the treasure and clear the agents name.The plot is entertaining but a little far fetched and silly. Reynolds is very funny and a perfect foil for his straight man, the Rock. Gadot plays it far too smug.Overall, entertaining with a few laughs and some decent action.

title: Decent comedy action adventure film!!
text:
Sanjuzzreviews #RedNoticeNet
Starring Dwayne Johnson, Ryan Reynolds & "the oooh soo sexy" Gal Gadot is a comedy, action, adventure film.This is about a quest by 2 rival art thieves Gadot & Reynolds to find & steal the 3 bejeweled legendary eggs given to Cleopatra by her Roman lover Marc Anthony 2000 years ago. Dwayne Johnson plays an FBI profiler who is unwittingly caught in the midst of the heist, framed for a robbery he didn't commit & desperately wanting to clear his name.Decent one-time watch, great cast, comedy by Ryan Reynolds will keep you in splits. However action scenes are sometimes over the top. Timepass, feel-good, fun watch.

title: Like Deadpool had a threesome with James Bond and Raiders of the Lost Ark
text: I loved Deadpool - Ryan Reynold's brutal, rude one-liners combined with great humour and a script full of love. I feel that the creators of Red Notice tried to recreate this with a couple of big-hitting stars (Johnson and Gadot) but with little finesse or scriptwriting.

title: corny
text: Banal plot but funny jokes. Cast 10/10 great game colorful picture. Overall the film is not that bad for a standard American comedy. Just seems a little dated to me today.

title: A fun action comedy film.
text: Lots of action, comedy plot twists.Great casting and they worked great together. Gal looks great and Dewayne and Ryan had great comedic moments.Lots of nods to other movies. Puts James Bond movie to shame.

title: Easy watching but not spectacular
text: This is pretty much your standard Hollywood easy watching movie. The key actors are big Hollywood names, and they all play their roles well, especially Ryan Reynolds, who spends all the movie being...basically Ryan Reynolds.The story (about thieves who specialise in antiquities) is fun and does have some originality to it, there are plot twists but they are a touch predictable.That being said the film is a lot of fun, the production levels are high, and there are some genuine chuckles along the way.Side note, in one scene I genuinely feel like Spielberg handed over a lot of his props from Raiders of the Lost Ark...which was nice!

title: any similarity to the real world is pure coincidence
text: Things in this movie have nothing to do with the real world. Prisons don´t work as depicted, police forces don´t have the protocols they have in the movie, bullfights aer not like that, and security forces dont act like they do in the movie. Everything looks dumb and forced in order for the plot to take us from A to B.The only thing that worked in the movie were Ryan Reynolds'jokes.

title: Fun, cheeky, glamorous
text: The movie isn't some theatrical marvel and the storyline isn't very riveting but the acting by Dwayne, Ryan and Gal makes the film come alive . The sets are very elaborate and keep you entertained even during the boring parts. Overall a fun watch over the weekend.

title: Exactly what you expect
text: This movie never tries to be something it is not. If you are into funny action movies or more specific Ryan Reynolds or The Rock-movies, you will enjoy this one. If you don't like them, then it's nothing for you. But since I like thos kind of movies I actually really enjoyed it.The plot is mainly carried by the three stars Reynolds, Rock and Gadot, who have a great chemistry. Especially the banter between Reynolds and Rock is quite entertaining. The fact, that their characters are simply written after their basic movie persona, leads to the fact, that you never see anyone else on the screen, besides the actual actor.The action and humor is nothing extraordinary, but entertaining and it definitely has it's moments.Just don't expect too much. It is a generic action movie, that combines the typical thief themes together.Like a sweet cupcake, it tastes good while you eat it, but it doesn't satisfy you in the long run.

title: No. Just no
text: I like The Rock. I like Ryan Reynolds. I like Gal Gadot. On paper this movie should have worked. But it is AWFUL. Honestly it is one of the worst movies I've ever seen. There is zero chemistry between the 3 leads. They seem completely bored by the whole thing. The comedic timing is terrible and falls flat. The ONLY reason I finished the movie is because I was on a long flight with nothing else to do. I would not recommend this to anyone, unless you like terrible movies.

title: Absolutely nothing special
text: I really don't know when Dwayne Johnson is going to have another character besides the only 2 he has in his repertoire. He couldn't act his way out of high school drama class. There's no way I can believe he is in this film the FBI Behavior Analysis Unit. You need to have brains to be in it and Dwayne doesn't have them. I love Ryan Reynolds too but sometimes his routine gets old when he tries to convey even more wit than he already does. With Deadpool it's alright but lately he's been over doing it a little bit. Still love him though. Gal Gadot isn't an Oscar winning actress either lol. She's awful as well but likeable. Still don't understand how she got this far. It's all good though. It's a movie you can watch that everybody will like. There's nothing wrong with a brains off comedy/action film. It doesn't take itself too seriously but at certain times it feels like they do. Not a movie you can get lost in.

title: Lower than expected
text: A down-to-earth movie that can entertain you. It has good action and an interesting story. The positive feature of this movie is the Reynolds and Johnson couple who were able to entertain us. The most negative point of the movie is the catastrophic acting performance of the actors. The director could not play the actors and this made Ryan Reynolds not his best and made his presence in the film ineffective. The film ended with an unexpected event. Johnson's Disappointed me. He betrayed his good characteristic in this movie. With all these problems, the film is visible and can be entertained.

title: No Originality. Great Cast. Lot's of Action.
text: There is nothing original about this one. It's a mixture of Mission Impossible and Indiana Jones. I loved Ryan Reynolds, but again, not original. They tried to make him sound like Deadpool. I love Deadpool, so I didn't mind the jokes. It was the one thing I really liked about the movie. But by doing this it's just reminding me of a character I really like. As always The Rock was okay, if you seen him in one movie, you've seen him in every one of his movies. Gal Gadot was beautiful as always and very capable. She too, plays a role similar to her famous Wonder Woman, but she's a little more sly in this film which was highly entertaining.The balance of cast was perfect. The spy stuff was cool. But it's a mediocre film that takes all the things we love and tries to combine it into Red Notice. It's not a bad, it's just not great.

title: Worth A Watch, Won't Win An Oscar!
text: Red NoticePretty much a crowd pleaser from start to finish, a movie for a winters night stuck indoors on the sofa and far better than the last miserable bond movie.It's a firm 6 outta 10 from me, meaning worth a watch won't win an Oscar.

title: I don't understand why critics say it's so bad
text: It's so well made,has a really good plot and is an all-round excellent film. Ryan Reynolds' acting is just delightful! Gal Gadot and Dwayne Johnson also do not disappoint. Overall, it's a really exciting action-thriller that is really funny.

title: Good humor, not enough everything else
text: The movie combines three good actors, good writing and ok directing. This is a solid 6/10.Reynolds once again plays as himself. He is a sweet heart, his jokes are great. I think having him in cast added a few stars to this movie, in my opinion. However, action scenes with Reynolds had a big number of cuts. I get he is not an action star, but something better could have been done to avoid that. After all, he is not the first comedy actor put in an action movie.Now, the movie itself does not feel completely like heist or action genre because it has neither enough to call it any of that. Heist scenes with stealing and escaping were not that elaborate, they felt simple, "easy-peasy". Action scenes were good but then again, they felt watered down - as always none of numerous faceless antagonist goons died, the heroes did not feel any consequences of any action scenes at all.CGI was... not as bad as it could have been. But it definitely could have been much better. Fire, bull and falling bodies looked like they were taken from a cutscene of a computer game, not a multimillion budget movie.Overall, this is a good action heist flick. It is like Aviator gin and tonic with a twist... of lemon piece (two puns intended) - sure you can go for something more elaborate with more ingredients but it works just fine to cheer you up in the evening.

title: Under par movie !!!
text: There was no chemistry whatsoever between Ryan and Dwayne. Dialogues are extremely drab, making the interactions boring. Heists, heirlooms, counter plots are getting old. Gal Gadot was decent in her role. Dwayne looked disinterested and was just going through the motions. In short there wasn't anything new to remember this movie for.

title: Perfect Movie to Bring Some Laughs This Winter
text: Want something to bring light & laughter to an evening? This is the movie for you! I think with all the tough times people are having right now this is a great movie to watch. Our whole family highly enjoyed this movie! Truly a great cast! I think Ryan makes any movie he is in brilliant & this was no exception, his perfect comedic timing & humor kept the movie alive & fun. The Rock does his typical action stuff but I think him & Ryan were a wonderful combination! Gal Gadot did a fantastic job- she is both skilled, intelligent & stunning in the film- I feel like she shows girls how powerful women can be which is a great thing! Overall I think it is well worth the watch & that if you enjoy it please leave it a 10* not an 8 to combat those leaving poor reviews! I want Netflix to know that many of us do enjoy them coming out with great movies like this with quality actors that are also appropriate for teenagers not just adults!

title: Bad script and too much cgi
text:
Really poor script, two stars like Dwayne Johnson and Ryan Reynolds in a bad heist movie with a really bad cgi.It is boring , generic, and missing a lot of action and thrill.And very expected childish jocks
yeah it is a disappointment.

title: Fun movie
text: Honestly, the action is heavily CG, which can get real boring, but Ryan Reynolds's and the Rock? So much fun.The movie is worth a watch, but it certainly isn't The Godfather.

title: The good old times 🤗
text: This movie took me back to the good old times when movies were fun. Very good acting, great story, excellent filming locations, good visual effects and sound. The only drawback is that the story unfolds too quickly. But all in all, the film is superbly made and fun to watch, a work that is not polluted by the woke trend in the slightest, that is a rarity today, I recommend it.

title: Ryan Reynolds is Deadpool in Red Notice
text: Is he going to play the same character for the rest of his career. Gadot and Johnson are fine in this caper. The film is a good watch but Reynolds is beginning to do my head in, the laughs from his character are getting less and less as each film goes by.

title: Worth A Watch
text: If you like Reynolds, Johnson and Gadot, this is worth a watch with witty humour and fast action and twists and turns. Looking forward to a second one.

title: Predictable but enjoyable
text:
Majority of the movie was predictable, but the ending was kind of fun. I am huge fan of all three actors and I strongly believed they will create real magic on screen but there is just too many clichés for year 2021!It's worth watching just to see three of them together - Ryan with his funny references, Dwayne being himself, but Gal, even though very beautiful and charming, I feel like it was not her best acting...
Overall enjoyable, but it's better not to have high expectations...

title: Yay, another movie of Ryan Reynolds playing Ryan Reynolds
text: Boring drivel. It's like characters from other movies playing Oceans 11 with so many nonsensical twists. Best thing this movie is for is falling asleep, which I did, twice. Don't waste your time.

title: Actually pretty good!
text: Simply put it's just fun. Don't take it too seriously and I'm not just saying that to like the movie more. I thought this was going to end up boring and forgetful like Ryan Reynolds' other movie Free Guy but maybe it's just the love of treasure hunting I have that made me really enjoy this movie. It's funny, has engaging action and just keeps you tuned in. Unpopular opinion; I don't find Gal Gadot attractive but for some reason she's smoking hot in this film. I'm glad they're still making movies like this and it seems like they hinted at a sequel which I definitely look forward to. Appreciate the effort and hard work!

title: Enjoyable enough for the dumb blockbuster fare that it is
text: In action comedy "Red Notice" Ryan Reynolds & Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson are a high-end art thief & the FBI profiler after him - who 'team up' against uber-art-thief Gal Gadot when she frames Johnson & out-thieves Reynolds... as they're all hunted by Interpol's Ritu Arya (out-prettying Gadot - which takes some doing). Rawson Marshall Thurber's silly screenplay is full of holes but has fun lines aplenty (esp for Reynolds) and: his direction is glossy & fast-paced; the likeable A-list cast have fun; and the glitzy locations bounce thru the likes of Bali, Rome, Cairo, Paris, London, and the South American jungle. Enjoyable enough for the dumb blockbuster fare it is.

title: A Dead & Wonderless Turtle Headed Fraud...
text: Pool big red crosses through this poorly forged fakery of counterfeit chaos, contradiction & contrivance that will leave you holding your nose at the eggtraordinarily niffy necrosis emanating from plot, production and especially performances.

title: Cliche But 2 twists
text: Somewhat similar to Carmen Sandiego. Acting, Perfect. Jokes, some are really funny. Plot, good enough. Everything seems good but you can guess what will happen from 30 minutes. Only those 2 twists are what saves this movie for me.

title: Pretty good thief flick
text: All the actors are playing themselves. The jokes miss more than they hit and the visuals don't look great.Yet it was undeniably entertaining. The plot of finding the 3 eggs is simple and engaging. Most of the movie, especially the first chase sequence feels like an uncharted movie, which is pretty fun to see. I had a good time with this one and would recommend if you're looking for a lighthearted blockbuster.

title: Everything's Good... Except the Final Product
text: There's a stellar cast, a traditionally silly, far-fetched plot (a cross between the Pink Panther and Indiana Jones), action, not overmuch violence, exotic locations... What could go wrong?Well something doesn't just quite work. Is it the rather forgettable soundtrack (despite a famous cameo singer)? Is it the writing, the direction, the editing? Is it that the whole thing was put together working within covid restrictions?Well, not surprisingly, I guess it's a little of all these. Though the pace, the one-liners and the sight gags are mostly pretty good.I think the biggest problem is at the core of the plot. It's just a bit too silly, too soon and with a few too many twists.We start with two art thieves - Ryan Reynolds and Gal Gadot - and Dwane Johnson, an "FBI profiler". They're variously after each other and three golden eggs that were gifted to Cleopatra and that are rumoured to be in Egypt, Italy, Germany, Argentina... etc, etc, etc. You get the idea. (I do hope the slightly flat end result is not because we've become just a bit too familiar with these escapist fantasies in general.)Perhaps we really should be identifying with just one lead (Ryan Reynolds?) but the focus is split between three, plus, initially, Ritu Arya as the Interpol agent. We really are missing the strong lead role - the actual Indiana Jones, the Inspector Clouseau or the James Bond.It's an enjoyable caper, though, if you don't go in expecting too much. 6.5/10.

title: Good For Timepass
text:
1. Good For Timepass as I said
2. Story line not so good
3. It could be better
4. Just a commercial movie
5. Not curious for its sequal
6. If you spent money on Netflix I suggest not to watch.

title: Really enjoyed the movie
text: I can't understand the hate. It was a classic Ryan Reynolds movie and it was funny from the beginning till the end. I liked the plot although it becomes more and more complicated. I hope to see them (Ryan, the rock and gal) playing together again. Can't wait for red notice 2!

title: So funny
text: This movie is so funny it doesn't take itself seriously. That's the best thing about it. Very easy going and fun to watch. Ideal for watching with kids and family.

title: Red Notice
text: 5/10 - stunning cinematography and some massive star wattage may be enough for some viewers, but unfortunately there is not too much of interest in this big-budget streaming hit.

title: Good and funny
text: I think that Ryan Reynolds and Dwayne Johnson are a good Duo together, I hope they are going to make more movies together in the future. The movie reminds me a little bit of Indiana Jones which I liked a lot. The humor was also good, I laughed pretty hard a few times :)

title: Terrible and predictable
text: This movie started off well but fell in a heap. I am trying to figure out who was more painful Gal Gadot, Ryan Renolds or Dwayne Johnson. It tried to be funny but was just plain stupid, dumb and unrealistic. I like these actors separately but this movie didn't work. My husband and I were cringing at this movie in most scenes. Give this one a miss.

title: Ryan and Dwayne J typical
text: It's as if they extrapolated. Ryan Reynolds's Deadpool. Character = style. And D Johnson from Central intelligence plugging those characters into this plot of rare art theives. Although some twists and turns still summarized as disposable entertainment. Of course gal Gadot is worthy of the time spent watching this movie .

title: amirhoseinahg
text: Positive points of the film.Rason Marshall Tarbar's Acceptable Direction: Although there are definitely some issues with directing the film, especially in editing the action scene, Rawson Marshall Tarbar is still a trusted couple who knows how to do it. Looking at the director's career, we will see that Red Notice has been his most stylish and cohesive work to date, regardless of his low ambition in action sequences. Terber's decision to shoot most of the action gives the film a surprisingly visual factor by slipping into the scene and showing strange scenes, even in the simple layout of the action sequence of the film, which involves chasing Booth along a scaffolding. He is also very good at bringing out the best comedy of his actors, so he has been a smart choice to lead the project.Ridiculous twists and turns at the end of the film: There is no spoiler here, but while the Red Notice script is largely predictable and simple, there are moments, especially in the third act, that may surprise viewers. . Frankly, the finale of the film takes on a fun color and smell by showing the large number of revelations and text-changing flashbacks thrown at the audience.Speed is one of the film's greatest strengths: Watching an incredibly expensive movie in less than two hours is certainly refreshing, isn't it? Obviously, no good movie is too long and no bad movie is too short, but the red notice stops with a perfectly reasonable run time of 118 minutes, long before it can derail. The film moves so energetically from one comedy-action sequence to another that there is little room for viewers to get bored or start looking at their watch.Negative points of the film.Simple Screenplay: Few expected Red Notice to be anything but a fun spy action comedy, but director Rawson Marshall Terber's screenplay is essentially literally a complete copy of the dozens of adventure action films before him. Indiana Jones, the Pink Panther franchise, and the National Treasure are the most obvious benchmarks for the script to be copied, but even if you take the film as a tribute to it, almost all of the film's major scenes are detached from its iconic sequences. All the action and comedy moments are a reflection of what we have seen in the genre for years, even decades: as if Terber had spent a month watching classic action-adventure movies and then writing his screenplay over the weekend. This is a film that has very few characters and instead deals with the existing successes of this genre.

title: Watch it for the Stars
text: Red notice is pretty much everything you expect it to be it's a straight forward heist movie with some comedy & twists sprinkled in between. Movie's USP is its stars who are doing what they do best.Rock is your stoic tough guy, Ryan is your killer comedian and gal looks hot while beating people. It's nothing you will remember after a few weeks but a good one time watch.

title: Good ol' adventure
text: This is a classic buddy, around the world adventure flick. Treasure, check. Beautiful girl, check. Funny, fun rollercoaster ride that is good for a laugh, check. Don't expect a deep, minder twister here. Reynolds and Johnson do a good job with constant one liners from Ryan and Johnson playing the straight man. Definitely worth a watch.

title: Can you smell what the rock is cooking?
text: You certainly can smell the rock has concocted an elegant mix of humour, drama and action.. ok maybe not so much drama but it's a pretty decent watch. I can see the critics not rating this highly, but for the public watching at home this is a great movie.It had everything you'd expect from a great action movie, the rock doesn't take himself too seriously with Ryan Reynolds providing line after line of pure comedic talent!You might describe this as a marmite film, if you love the actors and actresses then you'll love it.. if you're sick of them being typed casted into the same roles then maybe you won't.I throughly enjoyed it.. looking forward to a sequel!

title: Ryan Reynolds
text: I liked this movie but I would have liked a lot more from it I mean Ryan Reynolds is the man in multiple movies but when you put him alongside the Rock then things are going to get Messi and I mean they did pull this movie off but I mean it could have been a lot better if you put him alongside somebody different. The action sometimes seemed like it would be from a Disney movie with all the music in the background I mean honestly I just think Ryan Reynolds deserves to be in more R-rated films PG-13 movies are kind of looking cheesy these days.

title: Too boring
text: Worst combination of actors in the movie. Famous actors / actress with super hero movie complex but worst actors.Screenplay is another worst part in the heist.

title: Has its flaws but a superb movie!!!
text: If you over analyze it you won't enjoy it. It's a great movie, great cast. Little action than I'd have wanted. The chemistry between Dwayne Johnson & Ryan Reynolds is astonishing. Gal Gadot delivers some intense fight scenes. You can't go wrong with this.

title: Standardized fun
text: Really attractive people doing fun things in exotic settings and locations. And it has a budget. To say it's a bad movie is incorrect. To call it a "film" is, additionally, incorrect. If you're lonely, turn this on. Otherwise, time can be spent better elsewhere. But, it's made by people who clearly love action-adventure movies, and the cast is reliably on point.

title: Same Song and Dance
text: Ryan Reynolds legit only plays Deadpool in every movie now!!!?! Dwayne Johnson gives us the same badass Dwayne we always see of course. Gal Gadot, yup she plays a sexy female badass, damn near Wonder Woman. It's like these people play the same character in every movie. It's repetitive and old now. Decent action movie I suppose but you've seen it....... a thousand times already!

title: One man show
text: The movie is nice, but It felt like a one man show, Ryan Reynolds was the only special thing in it, you only enjoy his sarcastic comments, the rest of the actors were like decorations.

title: Uncharted 4 copycat
text: The movie looks way too similar to uncharted game series especially the 4th entry in the series, there are no doubts that the director took ideas and references from the game.

title: Problems of married life.
text: Red Notice. Problems of married life. Funny and sometimes dynamic typical action movie with the brutal Dwayne Johnson, the film's main comedian Ryan Reynolds and the dangerous Gal Gadot. I didn't get much emotion from watching it, but as a film for one evening, it's not bad.

title: A very good movie for family
text: This movie impressed me because it hasn't violence and just a bit of action. The actors did nailed it. Perfect for watching it in family. It was filmed in Rome, Bali and other familiar places. The actors did played their role very well in this movie.

title: The Safest Bet Netflix Has Made
text: Ryan Reynolds plays a thief competing for a McGuffin against Gal Gadot, who also plays a thief. Dwayne Johnson plays an FBI agent trying to stop them and gets entangled in an adventure with the thieves to find the McGuffin.The acting is non-existent as all leads just play their public personas with different backstories (instead of 'Ryan Reynolds is a rich actor' it's 'Ryan Reynolds is a rich thief') and the rest of the cast keep it generic. This isn't really a criticism as the movie appears to be exactly what it wanted to be: an action/adventure movie that appeals to practically anyone. The action is inoffensive but bland. The effects are serviceable but nothing notable. The costumes look great.The movie doesn't necessarily drag but you definitely won't get invested in the anything that's happening. There is some character building done in the start but it's just verbal exposition dumps, so nothing the audience will feel connected to. No action scene has tension and any twists this moch spy thriller takes are uneventful if not predictable. There are plot contrivances every scene but you shouldn't even try and suspend your disbelief or you'll become delusional.I recommend Red Notice for kids or adults looking for something basic.

title: All over the place
text: The script managed to bring out the worst in all three leads. Action sequences horrible. Too much green screen CG and quick cuts. This movie is all over the place in the worst way possible.

title: Great action movie
text: I thought it was fantastic. Star studded lineup good chemistry. Really liked the action sequences. The popcorn was fresh heated seats. Thought they did a great job liked it better then James Bond.

title: Enjoyable/not special
text: This movie relies heavily on Ryan Renolds comedic prowess, Gal Godot's charm and Dwayn Johnson's stature. The chemistry of these three actors is hit and miss. The story line is inventive, but out of the reach of reality at times. Red Notice is no James Bond or Indiana Jones, but it is a fun distraction if you don't expect too much.

title: Another dud!
text: Why do Netflix keep doing this to us?? Another film with money thrown at it but with no substance.Three big name actors of which only one is any good, as long as he is playing a jokey, ironic character with voice over work. Thankfully I do like his being jokey, ironic and his voice over work, it's the only thing that stops this film getting 1 star.Can we please stop pretending that the Rock and Gal Gadot are actors. They aren't, there really isn't anything that makes them enjoyable to watch other than their obvious physical attributes.This film is just as bland as every other film Gal and the rock has ever made bar Pain and Gain and parts of Wonder Woman, films they were born to be in.I think everyone should watch this pile of c**p just to give it the low score it deserves and beat off the fake high votes it's been getting.Do better with my money Netflix!

title: Nothing special
text: If you are looking for an entertaining, no brainer movie and this is it. It has all the right elements humor, action,double and triple cross and tries to have 'shocking' twists... It meets expectations. Personally I found it very boring, predictable and it was trying hard to be something different than your average art stealing movie plot.

title: Mediocre performance and script
text: Somehow putting together 3 of the most beloved hollywood actors, didn't really pan out the way Netflix has hoped.The performance is pretty meh, not even the funny lines from Ryan Reynolds ( Which are getting boring, after hearing them in the last 20 movies he has been a part off ) lifts the movie to correspond the budget.

title: Do badass stuff and feel like this, yes!
text: So the double-cross who crossed the double-crosser was also a crosser, that's awesome that was the twist of this movie in my opinion so badass that i was impressively with it till the end, WOW they are the perfect team, that moment when you feel you had it all then realized you were wrong from the beginning that concept only is so expensive that keeps you wondering what comes next, these three are the perfect combination worthy of the red notice.

title: A good time pass movie
text: If you have some free Time and want to spend it in a lite way then just go and watch this. However, there is nothing exceptional, but Deserve a respectable rating and review.

title: Excellent and Unexpected
text: I didn't think this movie would be as good as it was. The Rock is pretty much as good as any other movie he's been in (Jumanji, Moana, and Jungle Cruise), while Ryan Reynolds is slightly more serious than many of his other roles, though still fairly silly in this one. The plot is interesting. The cinematography is excellent. The overall production value is very high - with the directing and audio production on point. I also really liked the screen writing in this one.This movie isn't so much about personal growth, or anything deep like that. It's just a casual film about treasure thieves that comes with plenty of funny moments and laughs. Highly recommended.

title: A Good Romp
text: A jolly jape with laughs and action all the way through. But why on earth does the villain have to do a second rate impression of Richard Harris as Dumbledore? Quite off putting and spoils the performance.

title: Not a single new idea
text: ... Reynolds ist annoying AF ... just not worth watching ... huge dissapointment for me.For me, this was a complete waste of time.Movie obviously lives off its cast.

title: Don't think too hard - just enjoy
text: It's fun. Sure, huge bits are unlikely, silly or plain even ridiculous, but hey...it's a movie! Ryan Reynolds is brilliant as always and I'm getting to be a bit of a fan of Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson. Wonder Woman was pretty good too, and this is a far better movie than Wonder Woman 1984. It's a caper movie full of action, endless twists, the violence is pure cartoon make-believe so not ugly or vicious, and at just under two hours, not too long. Like I said, don't think too hard, just enjoy a bit of light entertainment.

title: Director dozed off while the movie was being shot
text: Damn. What a dumb movie.Ryan Reynolds is the same on every movie. Same one liners. Random jokes.I think this could have been a travel movie.Gal gadot. Stereotyping herself with such roles.

title: Harmless fun
text: Before I begin my review I just want to ask the powers that be at IMDb to please Lower their required characters to a more realistic number 600 is really too many 400 would be more acceptable and less stressful trying to think of more to put without adding loads of spoilers . Anyway wasn't sure what to expect given the mix of cast but it worked ok however Ryan Reynolds voice and jokes throughout the film caused me to keep visualising deadpool which seemed odd,don't get me wrong I loved the deadpool films but this was not one! Basic story fun and entertaining not great but not bad so on that basis 6 stars.

title: Good But Not Great
text: This was a good entertaining movie with a great cast but held a few flaws as well. There was some great camera work and action sequences. The acting was decent and there was some good humour. However, a lot of the dialogue seemed to force out jokes and I'm not a huge fan off heavily GCI backgrounds but GCI was pretty well done though.

title: Meh
text: Just a movie made for the sake of making a movie.Things don't make sense. The actors had no chemistry, which is odd, since they all usually work great in everything else with everyone. Maybe it is how the characters are written?And how did they do to make interpol feel like a bunch of bad guys? The real baddies.It just doesn't make sense.All and all it had it's moments, I laughed here and there. I felt joy and I felt cringe.It's not bad and it's not good. It's just meh.

title: 5.5 Ryan and Dwayne can't save it
text: It feels like it should have been better and funnier but it was just a letdown. Ryan just playing his usual character but even more OTT than usual, and Dwayne along for the ride. Wonder woman hardly even mattered.Not at the top off my rewatch list.

title: Does what a movie should do
text: This movie was fun to watch and kept me entertained for the entire movie.It has a good pace, it is funny, and has enough twists to keep it interesting.Will it win awards, no. Does it entertain, yes.

title: Can Ryan Reynolds be too sarcastic?
text: This was a fun movie to watch on Netflix. It met expectations but didn't exceed them. Disappointed that the chemistry between Ryan and Dwayne just wasn't up to par with what I had hoped given their brief encounter in Hobbs and Shaw. In many ways this reminded me The Rundown with many similar plot points. Then there is the whole Indiana Jones knock off the final act. I'm also pretty sure they did a call out to Raiders of the Lost Ark when Dwayne shined his flashlight at one specific box.I'd say my biggest gripe is that Ryan was too sarcastic throughout the movie. I like his schtick but this was excessively written that way. I'm not sure he had one serious line throughout the whole movie.Overall, if this movie had been released in the theatres; it would have bombed commercially but being on Netflix; it was a good time and I look forward to a sequel if Netflix deems that it brought in enough viewership to justify another.

title: Average
text: Nothing new full of plagiarism even had to go with the Indiana Jones Nazi link. The so called twist was so predictable and would have been a real twist if it didn't happen as everybody who watched it should have seen it coming.It is decent fun but any votes over 7 are really at it though some have mentioned the never seen the twists coming hahaha that explain more about the viewer than the movie.

title: The satire runs deep
text: Wonderful movie. The references to other movies was subtle and very well done. It's supposed to be predictable, that's the point. Can't wait for red notice 2!

title: Ignore the critics
text:
This is a fun heist movie, you'll laugh and be well entertained :)
Everyone's gorgeous, the set pieces are excellent, and it's streaming on Netflix.Honestly, what more do you want?Go make some popcorn and enjoy!

title: Only if you brain dead
text: Brainless not funny at all, predictable, even the so called twists. Reynolds talks instead of acting. Rock is the rock instead of acting. Gal is showing that she skipped funny in acting school.

title: What a weirdly uneven movie.
text: So the bad parts are poor cgi, poor green screen and weird canned dialog from gal gadot in a few scenes. Just give her better words and it would've been better. I'm free if you need someone to write something. However that being said I gave it a 7 because of the damn wedding singer at the end. The whole movie is worth watching for that part alone. Overall it's pretty fun but has its flaws so if you're okay with a pretty mindless heist flick then you'll be alright. Just don't go in expecting it to be mind blowing.

title: Average but enjoyable
text: Would have gave it a 5 but since these stars came together to give it to us Netflx subscribers, they deserve the extra star, lol. Script was decent and sometimes predictable. Action was OK and since budget was tight (obviously)...it was below the big-screen style many of us are probably used to. Ryan Reynolds was his usual self which must be what Director's want as whether he's in Deadpool or Bodyguard, his style/acting is consistent.Definitely worth watching and appreciate Netflix for keeping us entertained.

title: Great movie
text: Save yourself the 10 paragraph reviews from wannabe professional movie reviewers. It's funny, it's got action, it works. Nothing mind blowing, but an enjoyable two hours. Ryan Reynolds and The Rock are awesome on screen together.

title: Don't take it seriously and you'll enjoy!
text: I was leaning more towards a rating of 6 but decided to go with seven because it is an entertainer. Don't expect a flawless concept and a factual movie, I don't think this movie falls into that sort of a genre or was trying to. It reminds more of an early 2000's era of making entertaining commercial movies without worrying about the storyline being predictable and cliché. A good one time watch.

title: Self awareness does not equal entertainment
text: A few Wilhelm screams, an homage to all three Indiana Jones films (+the Mummy), and predictable banter between the Rock and Reynolds does not make an interesting product. Adding some "ha ha double crosses" along with "ha ha celebrity triple crosses" isn't entertainment, it's just predictability for anyone with more than twelve brain cells. I have no idea how this cost two hundred million dollars because even the ironically-poor special effects are worse than something from the '50s.Every single aspect of this experience is cliche. Every aspect is predictable. The dialogue has no nuance. The "chemistry" between the leads is manufactured and only plays off our expectations from their past roles. Throwing what I assume is a popular hip hop tune at the end while some CGI sun flares go off behind the Louvre and everyone walks away from the camera with sunglasses on does not blind me to the waste of two hours I just experienced. Nice try, but I know psychology and I know what you're trying to do.If your IQ is above what a shiny stone would measure, there is nothing that will surprise you. There might be a couple jokes that make you go "ha!" halfheartedly, but if you're looking for that sort of thing you don't need to spend two hours fishing, you can just go to Youtube and search for cat videos.

title: Fantastic 3
text: All three of them my favourite 🙌🏽 And they are working together in a single movie 🎥 seems everything is bonus. Background music, dialogues, comic timings, action sequence storyline and suspense. At some point it was predictable too. But I liked because of three. They were amazing.(Thanks to my pal Ras too)

title: A decent, run of the mill action movie.....
text: My rating: 66/100 (6/10)"Red Notice" definitely provides some entertainment value. However, with the likes of Ryan Reynolds and Dwayne Johnson starring in this film you should know to not take it too seriously. Reynolds is up to his usual funny antics, and unless you hate the guy, he's quite enjoyable. I, myself, enjoy Dwayne Johnson in a lot films, however, I found in "Red Notice" his acting was a bit too rigid and his fight scenes just felt complacent. Gal Gadot also fell short of my expectations. She tried to play off this mysterious, sexy thief, and unlike her role in "Date Night", things felt stale coming from here. A couple positives for me were the fight scenes and the unexpected twists. I also found good humour in Reynolds and had some hearty chuckles.Truthfully, nothing in this movie should be taken seriously. It's just one of the action movies that provides decent entertainment value. I would definitely recommend giving this movie a try, especially, if you enjoy any of the three leads, but I wouldn't call it a must watch.

title: With an A list cast, A list cameo's a large budget... how have they made such terribly boring and corny film?
text: It's absolutely baffling how films can be as dull as this.I like Ryan Reynolds, but he's a one trick pony with predictable one-liners playing the usual 'Ryan Reynolds' seen in other films.... this cheap slapstick American 'comedy' soon becomes irritating and it doesn't help improve the film.Dwayne Johnson is a super nice chap, but plays himself in all these films..... and Gal Gadot is the 'pretty girl' in the film - cliche, irksome and much like Ryan & Dwayne has little acting talent.So, why did I keep watching the film after I knew it was going to be this bad? Well it took several days of bearable bite sized viewing chunks... most of which were played in background - other than that I have no idea.Give it a miss. 3 out of 10 is a generous score.

title: Campy heist caper
text: Not a deep or great movie but a fun and campy heist movie. If you like heist movies for entertainment this one isn't bad. Ryan Reynolds has some good one liners and the rock plays the rock.Worth burning a few hours for with some beers.

title: The comdey thou
text: This movie is absolutely comedy. Ryan almost broke the Rock in each single time they're facing each other. Family entertainment movie. Comedies are the main in this movie..

title: A thrilling watch!
text: What do you get when you make a mix from the ever thrilling comedic Ryan Reynolds with the save the day chunk of macho hunk Dwayne Johnson with an additional dash of charming, clever and competent Gal Gadot?A very enjoyable 2 hours ride of witty and quippy dialogues with more than a dash of pleasing action scenes. It delivers a typical plot with plot twists foreseen and unforeseen, but the cast is enough to carry the movie.The 200 million dollars budget also helps deliver a visually stunning movie, as you travel around the world with the characters.

title: Very funny. Good "Buddy" movie.
text: There are a lot of "that can't happen" moments, but the movie is full of action, humor and twists and was a lot of fun to watch. Ryan Reynolds gives off a Harrison Ford vibe from Raiders of the Lost Ark.

title: Pure Adrenaline Rush
text: Red Notice is a movie that starts with a big adrenaline rush and pulls us into its world with it. From the very first moments our eyes get attracted to the main attractions of this film Ryan Reynolds, Gal Gadot and Dwayne Johnson and stay stuck with them. The way the screenplay goes along with the elements makes it stand out not quite smooth but a bumpy journey. Presentation as well as the direction of Rawson Marshall Thurber in this film tries to stick every together like a nice harmony and gets quite victorious from it, not because of having a really good plot but because of the pure adrenaline rush it offers from time to time. Talking about the story, it does make us think about a lot of predecessors that came before this movie and that turns this one quite predictable from time to time. Overall it's a two hour content. You can definitely sit on your couch with popcorn and enjoy watching it for the first time but not sure about watching it for the second time.

title: Over rated!
text: I love this cast of actors! But I didn't love this film.I can watch just about anything but this didn't grip me at all, my attention dropped in and out so much and I ended up turning it off before it finished. I couldn't even really tell you what happened in it.My partner felt the same way.

title: Can't go wrong with Reynolds
text: He has his kind of humor, that we've seen in many of his movies but it works and is fun. Great cast, funny, dynamic, entertaining... Fun movie! Loved it.

title: Netflix Strikes Again
text: Congratulations Netlfix you've done it again! This is an embarrassingly dumb film, complete with a deficiency of chemistry between the A List actors, laughable dialogue, and a convoluted script that lacks any sort of depth. Additionally, the ending seemed like a hollow cash grab to set up future sequels. Reynolds uses his usual schtick, except this time it was less intelligent and more exasperating. Gadot was awkward and miscast, and Johnson, even being the best of the three, seemed to be off his game. Red Notice has virtually no redeeming qualities, is neither funny nor unique, and is an outright bust of a "blockbuster."

title: For a Pastime, This would Suffice.
text: "I Know All Your Browser History"Ryan Reynolds, Dwayne Johnson, Gal Gadot; in terms of sheer likeability and amiable screen presence what more could you possibly ask for?However, I'm afraid any film shouldn't get a complete pass just because of its great casting! To attain tangible success, movies need much more than that! And Red Notice is simply being another testimony to that same fact.From a story perspective, this isn't something we haven't seen before! Neither the film tends to follow any unusual routes nor did it propose anything substantially unique in its course; Truth be told, this whole Fiasco has been heavily reliant upon this core group of Protagonists (or Antagonists, if you may suggest so) and their charismatic abilities to withhold viewers' imperishable interest.Not gonna lie, myself being a staunch admirer of both Ryan Reynolds and Dwyane Johnson, I enjoyed what it had offered. Well, for the most part, I mean! You see, there are indeed some funny banters and lots of meme references to help pass your time. And there's also 'Wonder Woman' in it. What do say about that huh?Speaking of Gal Gadot, she is one of those performers that by definition I may not be a 'Fan' of, but yeah I quite like how she goes with her business and man! I just love her infectious smile, Who wouldn't right?When Netflix first made the announcement of this ambitious 'Crossover' between Black Adams, Deadpool and Wonder Woman (See, what I did there?); Everybody, including me, was super excited, not only because these actors will share the screen for the first time but also for the limitless possibilities they might bring to the table.Unfortunately, the Director as well as the Writers they all failed to capitalise on the prospects of such a rare happening! As a result, we got only a half-decent outcome! Nowhere near what it could have been in a perfect scenario.Don't get me wrong, for the sole objective of entertainment, this might amuse a lot of people by providing them with enough value. But my argument is, the amount of buildup and marketing Netflix had gone with before its release; I'm sure, the majority of us had higher expectations. And as I see it, the film didn't stand up to all our wishes and prayers.

title: Not bad..
text: I didn't expect this movie to be this good. It was super entertaining and you didn't want the movie to end.Ryan as always is hilarious in this movie.
