Gal creates the spark in the movie and Dwayne completes the package.I kept thinking during the movie why Dwayne wasn't showing much emotion like he does in his movies, but then I read that his father passed away beginning of this movie. So now I know.It's not like he shows a lot of emotion in his movies, but at least a little bit. But he was almost completely stone-faced here. As if he was gone, understandably. But that didn't affect the scenes.But there are many hilarious scenes in the movie, you will enjoy it!A very entertaining movie that will take you away for a couple of hours.Gal, Ryan, and Dwayne were a great team for this movie. I read there will be a Red Notice 2 soon, awesome.Totally worth a watch!!!Have your popcorn ready and enjoy!

title: Very funny!
text: Ryan Reynolds is hilarious and Dwayne Johnson is also great at having the mick taken out of him.But the highlight is Ed Sheeran's cameo...proper laugh out load stuff!Really enjoyable.

title: High budget rip off of bollywood masala movie
text: I knew....how the movie is going to be.Still i just watched the movie only bcoz of "Gal Gadot".....i have an immeasurable crush on her....If u want to watch it just for entertainment then go for it..... don't find much of logic or loopholes.

title: Great heist movie
text: I thought Dwyane Johnson and Ryan Reynolds chemistry was amazing. The story was filled with twists and turns at every turn.. Great action and cinematography. I highly recommend this film.

title: Entertaining enough
text: A film starring a trio of Dwayne Johnson, Ryan Reynolds and Gal Gadot would instantly be anticipated and would set high expectations.Red Notice is what one expected. There is solid action sequences, silly light comedic moments and humor, great scenery views and the actors playing well off each other. Nothing too great or classic worthy but enough entertainment to satisfy casual audiences.As others have mentioned, the leads don't exactly bother stepping out of their comfort zones. Dwayne Johnson plays Dwayne Johnson. Ryan Reynolds plays Ryan Reynolds and Gal Gadot plays Gal Gadot.The chemistry and back and forth dialogue between Johnson and Reynolds makes the film worthwhile. Meanwhile Gadot is the eye candy.Overall the film was a Netflix success and apparently a sequel is in the works. There are a few different directions they could go towards. Interested to see how it unfolds.

title: Boring. Not a fan. Same old stuff from Johnson and Reynolds
text: Hard to believe they spent 200 million on this movie. It was legit the most expensive movie Netflix has EVER made. With that said, it sucked. Every single movie Dwayne Johnson and Ryan Reynolds are in is exactly the same. It's getting old same kind of comedy and nothing new to offer. I rated it 2. I was not impressed..

title: Funny, relaxing and Gal Gadot is just...wow
text: I actually wanted a fun, relaxing movie and there it was it. All three main actors bring something to the table: Reynolds with his humor, The Rock has his tough-like attitude (and his own type of humor), while Gal Gadot is absolutely stunning.And the result is pretty good actually.Some expected a master-piece, but why take life so seriously?Just sit back and enjoy the ride. :)

title: It deserves the bad ratings it got well.
text: The overall movie was great. The plot, background stories, music, etc are also good. It never makes you feel bored.But the ending part was not like that as expected. I am greatly disappointed with the injustice they did to the character of Ryan Reynolds, Nolan Booth.Here all the 3 characters have all these 3 traits of Beauty, Brain and Power in common. But from what I have observed from the movie, Ryan was supposed to resemble exclusively brain, The Rock resembles power, and Gadot resembles beauty. And I also liked that distribution. But it would have been great if they have executed that clearly and dynamically in the movie.A great expected ending was destroyed by the large twist where we got The Rock & Gadot as the main hero-heroine, while my most liked character of the movie, that is Ryan with the 2nd highest screen time in the movie was moved just as a gay side comedian, like in an Indian movie.Looking at the ratings, I think this deserves that well, for turning its good story into bad ending. Even an emotional ending would have worked out to save it from getting to be an average heist movie. Despite these, this movie deserves a watch.Let's wait and expect Ryan to take his revenge in the sequel.

title: A crime against humanity
text: Beyond the poor craftsmanship and the utterly mediocre acting, writing, and directing this movie is an ideologically despicable text.Interpol is the world police, sending people seemingly without trial or representation to jails around the world. These are, the movies would like us to believe, the good guys. The world of this movie is inherently fascist which I guess makes the Nazi fetishism make sense.In the final act, stolen Egyptian heirlooms are returned to Egypt. Only for interpol to show up and say: "no no no these were the Nazis possessions and now you can't have them. You're own history is a crime." Yeah that happens, along with a lot more orientalism and dehumanising of the native Egyptians which the movie does so casually I don't think any of the creators bothered thinking about the Egyptian people as actual humans.This is truly awful stuff. Incepting hatred and bigotry into the working classes stupid entertainment. In other words, classic Hollywood. Something that the world desperately needs to leave behind.

title: Is Ryan Reynolds the best comedic actor out there right now ?
text:
I have to think he is... delivering he lines in a sarcastic way and tone that just makes the person who asked the question look stupid... and it makes me laugh. And is the ROCK or is he known as Dwayne Johnson, these days now a better actor then he was a wrestler.... I reckon so ! You want someone to jump onto a helicopter or off a waterfall into the lake beneath then dwaynes ya man...
this is a good netflixs film... there's probably going to be a sequel. Yeah it won't win anyone an oscar.. but its good fun... think Indiana Jones meets Oceans 11.

title: It was almost the perfect movie to just relax to and enjoy for what it tried to be.
text: The story isn't anything new. To be true it's probably one of the most used stories ever. Cop capture uncapturable thief only to just at that moment need his help and so on.The movie is quite good. It's actually almost great at the beginning and get some good parts then and again. Strangely all the good parts are when Gal Gadot isn't on screen.Or no. Ryan is funny as hell, but he's just being his regular self so that's not surprising but also not to special (but he is funny). Dwayne is also playing the same character he usually does. Big, tough, smiley and cute and looking like a nice guy (even when he tries not to). Not much acting really but he charms his way through.When it come to Gal Gadot i loved the first Wonder Woman movie. Maybe more becuase finally a strong female heroine in a good movie and all. She fitted the role I thought, the english pronounces, the stiff persona, it fitted.But... That seem to not have been acting at all, just her reading the lines because damn she's dull. She can't act. Every time she show up on screen here it ruins the moment and the immersion. She's the same as in ever other movie she play in. Nothing change. Not a single emotion she tries to pull of succeeds, ever. Had she not been in this movie I'd happily been seeing it a couple of more times, but now, no. There is sadly no acting talent to be had there and it ruins every movie I've seen her in apart from Wonder Woman (which she was great in as herself, not because she could actually act).

title: Red Notice is Gold
text: Major stars joining up for a great direct to streaming movie for Netflix. Dwayne Johnson, Ryan Reynolds and Gal Godot do a fantastic job entertaining you in this Cops and Robbers movie, the dialog is fast and funny the chemistry is awesome and the ending is outstanding.This is a fast passed Heist movie that I would love to see a sequel to. I do not wish to give anything away, but it has, Shoot-outs, Car chases and Gal Gadot, she may not be Wonder Woman in this movie, but she is a wonder woman! How can you go wrong with Reynolds smart and fast whit and the reactionary comedic talent of The Rock (Dwayne Johnson).The Action and fun will keep you in your seat, so get your popcorn ready before you hit play because you will not want to hit that pause button.

title: Deadpool meets Indiana Jones
text: Red Notice is very much the cliche confidence/heist film. However Ryan Reynold's whit and Dwayne Johnson's charm really make this an enjoyable film. Not to mention Gal Gadot!

title: Enjoyable
text: This movie was pretty good had some twists in it, had pretty good action, acting was pretty good, and fun characters so overall a fun movie too watch.

title: Just terrible...
text: I can't believe this movie costs 200 millions... it's predictable, boring and certainly not funny. Expected some sort of a entertainment but in reality this is the worst movie I've ever watched.

title: Thought it was great
text: The movie was entertaining. It didn't take itself too seriously. Had a solid cast. And it was lots of fun. Had some cheesy and some predictable moments for sure, but overall an above average film. It's worth the watch for sure.

title: Enough of Ryan Reynolds
text: The last movie that Ryan Renolds starred in as this character that was funny was Just Friends. Time for a new shtick bro. The talentless smart a** routine isn't funny anymore for the 700th time. This and Free Guy were both unwatchable due to his performance.

title: Mediocre at best
text: Please replace gal gadot for every movie .. she is just an eye candy .& not an actor .. Dwayne & Ryan do try & save the movie somewhat but .. the overacting is so overpowering from all the characters that it is off putting .. Gal Gadot being the worst of all ..

title: Why comercial movies like this nowadays are so predictable?
text: Like at the ending I kinda knew what will happen and the title didn't make it worth untill the very end, I thought maybe there's red notice for them and they will trying to escape from the cops hiding but at the same time they do their initial mission thing but no that's not happened they got red notice at the end and I think there will be another movie, maybe if this movie done well Netflix make another one, it's like a trend nowadays.

title: Red notice is weak for a better weekend 😔
text:
Red notice- not a suspense thriller ..if u r a fan of Deadpool and wonder woman plz don't watch as it's only a single thread story liner.Still can't believe it had a huge budget among Netflix movies..could have given better
This movie is good to watch in a evening time which itself gives a lot of time to eat snacks rather the screen presence
Story-
It s just a quest for 3 eggs which was earlier with Cleopatra and the capture of these eggs by a thief and story revolves around this .. I'm not saying more about this bcz if I say then then entire red notice will become a short notice..and u won't watch it ..only ull read the review
Happily it doesn't get bored only because of the cameo present..good to c gal Gadot in a movie other a adventure
Screenplay was little dramatic and no thrilled experience..normal fight normal chasing.still I can't understand y the police are as usual late in every con movies even when they get the clue earlier and also they were not able catch them and the chase end in vain
Overall- Red notice- the police con game could have been still better and served more to us .a predicted story line with usual suspects and transparent storyline.

title: Very Enjoyable Flick
text: This is a great film! Pleasantly surprised. Well written with superb acting. Many unexpected twists and turns, with an ending you won't see coming. Also great comedic lines. Ryan and Dwayne are both naturally funny. Worth the watch.

title: Better than Average Netflix Movie
text: I Gave Red Notice a 7/10. Yes, it's a cliche buddy caper film and pretty ridiculous quite often - but it's The Rock, Ryan Reynolds playing Ryan Reynolds and Gal Gadot.. I mean, what else do you want? Was it epic? Nah. Better than the average Netflix movie? Damn straight.

title: Unbelievably bad
text: Quite literally the worst movie that I have ever watched the whole way through.Such a shame. I know all three of these stars can actually act. I can't believe they were able to perform these lines without laughing out loud.The plot is an insult to the genre.They set up for a sequel at the end. Please don't. The world will be so much worse if you do another one.

title: Gal Gadot Shone In This Movie
text: Gal Gadot's previous roles have not given her the opportunity to show off her wittiness and comic timing, but she outdid herself in her role as The Bishop.Ryan Reynolds and Dwayne Johnson were also brilliant in their roles though my realization is that Johnson will always be typecast because of his physical appliance. The storyline and humour is always written around his physical appearances which means he may never be challenged to break the mould. Overall, the chemistry of the actors was brilliant which made the movie enjoyable.

title: Laughable, enjoyable and easy to swallow
text: Trailer gives a lot about what this movie is, brisk dialogs, well exercised action scenes, hardly believable twists.Shortly - this is Indiana Jones with Reynolds and Johnson in main roles. We had quite a few laughs with my daughter, no thinking, just consuming this well done, easy to swallow movie steak, colorful, adventurous and laughable.

title: Another disappointment
text: Yet another disappointed movie from Netflix..What a waste of time. They need to stick to shows and miniseries. Stop making movies. You're embarrassing yourselves..

title: In my head all I can hear is smack my bitsh up
text: Not bad, a little bit too drawn out. It was really great to see Ryan Reynolds punk the rock with his one-liners. And it was a lot of fun to see an actual actor (Ryan Reynolds) carry the show.

title: Uneven but entertaining hybrid of National Treasure, Ocean's Eleven, and maybe Hobbs & Shaw.
text: That headline sounds like faint praise but this may be the first movie by Rawson Marshall Thurber that I actually enjoyed. With some caveats.Red Notice's best feature is that it has three charismatic actors: Dwayne Johnson, Gal Gadot, and Ryan Reynolds. Their characters are pretty much as advertised. The Rock is the cop; Wonder Woman is the thief; and Deadpool is the con artist. And there's much back stabbing and alliances of convenience that play out across three continents. All in pursuit of a lost artifact once treasured by Cleopatra. They play off each other very well. Especially in the movie's slower moments. It's obvious they had a blast working with each other.The pacing is something weird. It clocks at around two hours and doesn't really waste time. But it does feel like a first draft. Revelations and plot turns move a bit too quickly than you'd expect to see in something released in theaters by comparison.The action scenes are plenty and they are pretty fun to watch. Highlights include an escape from a Russian prison on top of a mountain or a high speed chase through abandoned Nazi bunker. It's the kind of pulpy globetrotting goofiness we don't get much of anymore. Also It feels like it would take place in the same universe as The Fast and Furious. Or that other action-adventure movie did called The Rundown;hopefully people remember that movie. It's really good.As far as Netflix movies go that try to ape the style of Hollywood blockbusters, it's not half-bad. Though there are moments where you know it can be better. I would actually not mind a sequel.

title: The last 3rd was clearly phoned in
text: You get exactly what you expect given the movies premise and cast, it delivers really well on this for the first 2 thirds of the movie, then for some reason the director got changed and I assume some producer started taking over and we are left with a strange looking turd.Al in all its still a worthwhile entertaining experience.

title: Marriage of Convenience
text: A Netflix Original fueled by action, star power, and daddy issues! Dwayne Johnson and Ryan Reynolds play off each other wonderfully, but the addition of Gal Gadot seals this as a home run from the casting department! The plot is simple, even with a few twists, but the spy vs. Spy tone allows for plenty of fun hijinks!

title: Ryan Reynolds does it again
text: Ryan Reynolds adds another great movie to his accomplishments. A fun, action packed feel good movie with some of your favourite actors. Then again even with Ryan Reynolds and some unknown actors it would have been as good. Dwayne and Gal adds some extra star power and publicity though which is all good \_^_^_/

title: Fun, likeable, but waaaay to predictable
text: Ok, let's start by saying simply that I like Ryan Reynolds and his cheeky humour, I like Dwayne Johnson and his obvious lack of ego, and what's not to like about Gal Gadot?So it's clear that there's plenty for me to like here, and so I spent an enjoyable hour and a half watching this. It was reasonably well paced and filmed (mostly) with a good eye. It was stylish in parts and inoffensive. But sadly thats where it ends.I found myself fairly early on muttering 'if the twist ending is.... I'm going to be very disappointed.' I was disappointed. I'm not going to give it away, but frankly anyone who doesn't call it within the first act probably hasn't watched a film in the last 40 years. It was so laughably obvious, that the longer they held on to it, the more it overshadowed the rest of the film. I found myself wishing they'd just get it over with so that maybe, just maybe, they'd slip something unexpected in afterwards. Sadly not, just the usual franchise-launching open ending.It's not a bad film, it's just not a great one. Maybe if they can find writer who can come up with something original for any sequel, they might have something worth making.The question below that I have to answer, 'does this review contain spoilers?' No, but the first half of the film has plenty.

title: Terrible Actors = Terrible Movie
text: I went into this movie with an open mind based on the reviews. I typical like or hate a movie meaning I'll watch it more than once if I like it and never again if I don't. The cast was stretching for this type of movie. Gal Gadot, who I had never watched in a movie before, needs to go to acting school (an under statement). It takes more than good looks! Ryan Reynolds I was really hoping he could get out of his Deadpool persona, but nope. Seems he's still the wisecracking stunt double user he's always been. The Rock is still the same guy in a different wrapper in every movie (think Sam Jackson). The movie itself had a decent enough plot it just needed better actors!

title: Well scripted and entertaining
text: Nice original plot with good twists and tight packed actions, as a comedy it has done its job for entertaining purpose that shouldn't be taken too seriously, though the story is kind of improbable. Most of the aspect were generally very well made, this is the kind of movie to sit back and enjoy without thinking too much. Red notice is way better than overrated garbage like shang chi and suicide squad yet received a lower rating by the pretentious phony critics, their reviews are totally ignorable and stupid.

title: Fast moving action!
text: A good movie to enjoy and with the fast changing scenes, you will enjoy every bit of the movie. Those viewers not liking comedy can relax as the film is still acceptable with the quips here and there. It's a lighthearted fast action movie for overall enjoyment. Better then some other recent movies from Dwayne Johnson, but Ryan Reynolds is still a pain in the neck.

title: Avoid.
text: I'm fairly certain not a single person working on this movie has been to bali. The inaccuracies start to stack up and not matter what you try to do you can't pretend you don't know better. If you have more than two brain Cells avoid.

title: A fun adventure movie
text: This film is the slightly backwards love child of an afternoon tryst between Indiana Jones and the Fast and Furious and is a perfectly adequate fun brainless adventure movie.That about covers it.

title: A little forced, misses on dialogue but ends ok
text: The story is solid, it creates the appropriate motives for the main characters and it all feels natural.Where it falls over is the dialogue and the relationships.Both are 'enter obligatory relatable moment here', it's not witty or funny as you would expect, especially for Ryan who is essentially acting as himself which has always worked in the past. Jokes seem forced, relationships flip from sour to solid in one unconvincing dialogue. Comedy is as slapstick as Mr Bean in parts and a lot of scenes are borrowed from other spy movies or even Indiana Jones.The rock is solid.. but he doesn't have a lot to work with.Overall, it's reasonably entertaining if you had no expectations. If the whole movie was as good as the last 20 minutes say, it would have been something completely different. If you wanted something new, refreshing, smart and funny all the way through, or even The Rock or Ryan Reynolds anywhere near what you have come to expect from them, you will feel unsatisfied.

title: Derivative and predictable, but the terrific cast makes it enjoyable
text: You've seen it all before. Loads of special effects sequences. Explosions. Chases. Fights. Double-crosses. Triple-crosses. Wry quips. But somehow it all works much better than expected. The stars deserve the credit. There is such a thing as on-screen chemistry and the three of them definitely have it. Ryan Reynolds' riffing and jokes are especially good - he continues to impress. (I had thought he was just another pretty boy actor when he was just coming into public view, but I changed my mind about him when he was in a great little movie called Adventureland - an underrated film in which he had a supporting role.) Great mindless entertainment.

title: Hilarious
text: Hilarious and action packed. Ryan Reynolds and Dwayne Johnson make an amazing comical team. The way that whenever they are in movies together especially this one they always hate each other in a friendship sort of way.

title: Red Notice Is a Fun Movie to Watch
text: Red Notice is a high budget film that brings you a compelling lead cast. The beautiful Gal Gadot, hilarious Ryan Reynolds, and serious brute Dwayne Johnson lead you into a movie with attention-grabbing car chases, smooth cat and mouse theatrics, and several beautiful locations. This movie has a great pace and never goes stale. If you like fun clean movies with heist elements, I recommend watching this movie.

title: Decent comedy action adventure film!!
text: Sanjuzzreviews #RedNoticeNetflixRed Notice streaming on Netflix starring Dwayne Johnson, Ryan Reynolds & "the oooh soo sexy" Gal Gadot is a comedy, action, adventure film.This is about a quest between 2 rival art thieves Gadot & Reynolds to find & steal the 3 bejeweled legendary eggs given to Cleopatra by her Roman lover Marc Anthony 2000 years ago. Dwayne Johnson plays an FBI profiler who is unwittingly caught in the midst of the heist, framed for a robbery he didn't commit & desperately wanting to clear his name.Decent one-time watch, great cast, comedy by Ryan Reynolds will keep you in splits. However action scenes are sometimes over the top. Timepass, feel-good, fun watch.

title: Central Intelligence was superb, this is not.
text: This is NOT action packed at all! 15-20 minutes of action at best. Central Intelligence was superb, this is not. I think this is weakest duet with anyone and Rock. Like they just do they job nothing more, also Raynolds here exeptional not funny because this script like REALLY bad, and I dont know this is COVID or what, but here you 90% jd time see only Rock and Reynolds who talk about film, but you dont have a film. This is not good move and wasty of your time, tipical straight to the internet release. Don't waste your money and dont believe reviewers with this strange low ratings but not sincere reviews. Want good film with action go to see Hitman's Wife's Bodyguard.

title: Full of adventure and comedy!
text: Great movie with great stars in it, ryan Reynolds nailed the character so charmingly, twists and turns with great comedy, action, adventure in the movie. Loved the movie. MUST watch!!

title: meh
text: Ridiculously stupid plot with some fun action and comedic bits mixed in. "lets go here, oh lets go here now, lets get out of here, lets go there"If you have netflix but have nothing else to watch and dont value your time in the slightest then go for it. Or if you really like the rock and ryan reynolds.They try to make up this historical treasure mystery tied to the story but it just feels tacked on just to excuse this constant traveling all over the map. It doesnt make the movie better or interesting. Just takes room from the only good things in the movie, the action and the comedy. And the comedy isnt the laugh out loud kind it just kinda makes you smile (the usual ryan reynolds jokes).But it most certainly isnt a good movie.

title: They should have known better
text: You have the best paid actors in the world, all the streaming budget you can imagine and this is what they come up with... No originality, cartoonist characters and a script that was done a thousand times. Mediocre even okish on its own (if somehow this is the first heist movie you see) but not even deadpools humor can't save this for me. They just should have done better.

title: Fun, relaxing, crime caper.
text: Funny, especially if you like Ryan Reynolds' humor. No nail-bitting, edge off the seat suspense and a lot of it is just silly. It's a fun movie though and that counts for something too.

title: So Over Ryan Reynolds
text: Its not a bad movie, there's plenty of action that runs along at a fairly brisk pace - its a typical Netflix family(ish) movie. Not great but not too bad, but Ryan Reynolds and his wisecracks are just too annoying, every bloody movie is the same now and its wearing a bit thin.

title: Ed Sheeran stole the movie
text: It was a funny one evening movie until Ed Sheeran completely stole it! Damn he made my day! If he smashed his guitar on the guard's back it would be even more funny) This "I was in Game of Thrones!" was the most hilarious. 7 for the movie, 10 for Ed.

title: Amazing and Pure Entertainment
text:
So this is what Netflix's most expensive film looks like...
The characters themselves were great too, The Rock I feel has been playing himself in a lot of movies lately and although this isn't a major change it is a step out in a new direction. Gal Gadot was stunning as always and she brought a lot of humor and banter which I enjoyed immensely. And now for the one and only Ryan Renolds... he was a godsend in this movie, his timing was perfect. The movie was amazing and pure entertainment. The set design is beautiful, including but not limited to the Russian castle, the cars, the costume design. This film is like a strangely entertaining hybrid of Bond, Indiana Jones and Deadpool (thanks, Ryan). If they ever make a sequel, ill be there to enjoy it!

title: Don't Put All Your Eggs in One Basket
text: Equal parts fluff and Tinseltown action "Red Notice" carries on the heist format in lighthearted and cheesy fashion. Thiefs, cops, exotic locations and a plot as twisted as a highway car crash the film never lets up in its cliched panorama of Hollywood plastic. The all-star cast of Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson, Ryan Reynolds and Gal Gadot bring on their respective charms and the fast-paced action with the fun script keep this going from start to finish. This is pc to its liberal marrow bone so expect your wimpy white male and kicka** women who can do no wrong (and one with the ubiquitous and oh so pronounced British accent) not to mention "The Rock" missing his trademark charisma and looking like he'd rather be somewhere else (I wonder why). Bring out your popcorn and sodas and enjoy this lightweight ride into millennial entertainment where everything is facade and the insides scream to be fed. I look forward to the sequel.

title: Generic...
text: Once again Hollywood makes a movie filled with the tropiest of Tropes! So predictable. Fake physics, Gal Gadot as a super know everything do every.thing thief and the Rock as a Super Dense FBI guy. And as always Ryan Reynolds has to carry the workload. Ok to watch if you have exhausted the Netflix archives!

title: sum
text: Finally something light fresh and creative action movie - it could be better but in this time when no movies like this exist it's top - and I am happy with that 😀

title: What happened to real story telling?
text:
The writing of a real story that keeps you hooked and intrigued seems to be missing like so often nowadays..
Not to bad, but also kinda lame.I mean, again a woman that beats up the guy that basically does nothing else than train his whole life like he is a puppet.. so ridiculous and stupid that it hurts.. I don't know, but who wants to see that..
Everything is kinda ridiculous and you can't take anything half way serious. What happened to a real story? Inexistent.Everything wants to be to cool and then it just isn't.Dull and annoying somewhat and just way to predictable and foreseeable..

title: Another cheap action movie.
text: I newer understand why do they make these movies. Better say, why someone may want to watch it. However I understand that that's something that anyone decides individually.But for me? There is nothing in this movie. No message, no interesting story. Not a fantasy but can't be real at all. No superman but well, some characters do tasks that no one can do in real life. There is only some fake cheap action scenes.With all due respect to people who may like or enjoy it, I consider it as a total waste of time.

title: Didn't see this coming
text: Not a big fan of dwayne, but overall was a great combo with Rayen. Would have gave it a better rating if hadn't for the very bad, awful acting, bad writing, beautiful villain.

title: a farce of a farce
text: Johnson, the rock, is the fbi profiler, who has just proven that the famous cleopatra's egg on display on rome is a fake. Ryan reynolds is booth, notorius, sarcastic, wisecracking thief. Who has just stolen the real egg. Chase scene. Chase scene. But is everyone who they say they are ? And the bishop seems to be running things behind the scenes. It's fun and entertaining, but way over the top, so we kind of go along for the ride. And you have to keep track of where the various eggs are. Written and directed by rawson thurber.

title: Predictable
text: It look like they all signed this movie to have fun only. It's a very predictable movie. Nothing we haven't seen before. It's only one time watch movie. Typical Heist movie. Not up to the expectations.

title: Your average fun action movie
text: Can't be pretentious with these kind of movies, you see the actors and the synopsis and you know what you're getting.Don't get me wrong, they can be very bad, that you want to see a silly action movie doesn't mean that it can be horrible and it's ok, but this isn't bad at all.The Rock and Reynolds do what they always do (maybe Reynolds is starting to over do it, but well...), Gal Gadot looks beautiful and the naughty / badass role suits her greatly, so the trio worked worked well for me.The story is quite bland and seemed quite uninteresting until there's a twist that really picked it up from mediocre for me.Visually, it's well done, the action sequences are fun and there are a few original bits to refresh a saturated market of this genre (which I'm more and more inclined to ignore, lately), these big productions have the advantage of technical possibility but not always deliver creativity, here there are some bits that add up.Of course it's exaggerated and over the top, but it's not meant to be realistic.There are some arguable points in the history, but if you relax knowing this is not meant to be serious and it's an excuse for action and gags, it's ok.I don't know if I would watch more of this, the ending it's pretty open to sequels, but I can say it was entertaining and better than some other of the same style coming lately.

title: Boring and predictable
text: Boring and also too predictable. The actors skill are so bad and jokes aren't funny either. Very disappointed. Other than that, Gal is very pretty, as usual, although the acting skill is boring.

title: Fun film with lots of action
text: Enjoyed from start to finish. Lots of funny lines come along with lots of action. Some reminders of Indiana Jones movies.Some unexpected twists and turns. Perfect casting with Dwayne, Ryan and Gal.

title: Just inane!
text:
What a total waste of time..
Don't bother.One of the worst movies I have ever seen.Nonsensical script.Annoying having to spend 150 characters on this rubbish.

title: Good Fun for a Boring Sunday afternoon
text:
Netflix have for some time now pumped out rushed turd after turd with a sprinkle of gold here and there! And I'm pleased to say this isnt a turd!Firstly we are not talking about and academy award winning film! Just a fun bit of action, some cheeky one liners and a beautiful women who has more charm then a snake handler!RR's usual quick whip, is great blend with The Rock's eyebrow raising one punch action
And Gal Gadot with electric charm blends them together perfectly (Yes I love Gadot) let's not talk about WW84 🤢Plenty of fun action across multiple backdrops, folk law and history and a few unexpected twists and turns your not expecting!All in all entertaining and would watch again!

title: A little far fetched but enjoyable
text: I enjoyed this movie, you need a good imagination to watch it though because it's so over the top in parts. It's a movie I wouldn't watch twice though.

title: Annoying but funny
text:
I love that kind of movie, probably like everybody we watched millions of version it before.. It is funny movie but after a point, jokes made me sick...I really said 'enough'. Also for making us shock and surprise, they changed the direction of movie many times, that made me tired and actually I think it is so predictable..lots of logical errors too
... Anyway It is mix of Indiana Jones, tomb raider, ocean's for me. Don't expect too much, if you have a time, you can watch.

title: That was interesting to say the least
text: I simply decided to watch this movie because of boredom. I also liked Gal Gadot in Wonder woman as the titular character so since it's also an action movie, I thought it would be some what interesting. Well, it's definitely better than the last movie I've watched called "Encanto", but how's it? Let's find out!The main characters are two completely opposite men: Nolan Booth (Ryan Reynolds), who's a thief and John Hartley (Dwayne Johnson) who's an FBI agent. They suddenly teamed up in a russian jail because both were mistaken for stealing one of Cleopatra's eggs (even though it was only Nolan who stole it). Now their goal is to find the lost third golden egg before the bishop (Gal Gadot) comes in.Let's just say that the plot was pretty good and I was invested in it. Especially when Nolan and John tried to go through the security system and the treasure room of a rich man Sotto Voce, and then the Bishop suddenly knows everything about their plan and fights them. I enjoyed the action scenes, like the already mentioned security room fight or the car race scene in the end of the movie. Although the plot was engaging, I can't say the same about the characters. John and Nolan are the typical duo where they are the exact opposite of each other, but for a specific mission, they need to team up, sometimes they argue and sometimes they are friends, but they still reach their goal and become teammates. The Bishop was a pretty interesting antagonist, she's powerful and cunning, she wants to get all 3 treasures no matter what, thus putting the duo in various dangerous situations, like tying them up in the basement and using the electric taser to tease John, or hacking the systems so no one could notice that she was the one who stole and replaced it with a bootleg. There was also another female character whose name I forgot, but she was one of Hartley's allies before discovering that he's working with a criminal.Overall, I would probably recommend the movie to fans of one of these actors or people who enjoy movies like fool's gold. But it's not exactly a must watch, since there are probably better heist/treasure seeking movies out there. I kinda enjoyed and I hope that the actors will get interesting movies in their career like this.

title: Action, laughs and a good twist!
text: Dark November afternoon enjoying an action with Reynolds/Johnson and Galot!Not disappointed a bit. Got all I thought I'd get - funny and action filled.

title: Very nice
text: It turned out exactly how I had expected after having watched the trailer. It's a fun action comedy with a fitting cast. Yes, Ryan Reynolds and Dwayne Johnson are playing their typical roles (Hobbs and Shaw, Deadpool, Welcome to the Jungle, etc.), but guess what? It works. Both actors are well capable of range. But for Red Notice, it wasn't needed.All in all, it's a good movie. Nothing more.I just wish, people on imdb would stop crucifying movies, just because they had a disappointing experience. There are always 1-star reviews. What point are these people trying to make? Are they trying to get the average rating down, so they give it one star?I have seen one star productions. They exist. But not on platforms like Netflix. Not even 6 Underground deserved one star, even though I really disliked that movie.So would you please stop overreacting? Give your bruised artistic ego a couple of days to cool down and then rate the movie for what it really is, instead of what you were feeling right after watching it.The same goes for the 10-star crowd. Red Notice is clearly not deserving of 10 stars. Very few movies actually are.Please remember my plea the next time you are mad at some director for not making the movie of your dreams. Otherwise, yuo can't be taken seriously as a critic. You're just a troll.

title: Average
text: Overall it's a pretty film, there aren't really any surprises so quite predictable throughout the film but it's still a decent film. Would watch it if you want a light comedy with Dwayne Johnson, Ryan Reynolds and Gal Gadot. But again the story is pretty simple with some minor twists but still rather predictable.

title: All that money
text: They must have gotten paid really big money.Why else do this?This thing is a bad copy of the early heist flicks that were actually fun to watch.Even the ones with poor acting.This one puzzles.Why???!

title: Surprisingly Entertaining
text: There are not a lot of desirable movies for us (Senior Citizens) having recently seen and enjoyed Riders of Justice & Black Box recently. Being a very humid day and having been rained out at golf, we trawled through the unpromising list of movies currently showing and decided somewhat reluctantly on Red Notice. Used to like Ryan Reynolds but he has been in a few stinkers (in my view) over recent years. We settled in and it looked like a random action piece for the first 5-10 minutes. It then took off on a wild ride with snappy dialogue and unpredictable twists and turns and did not let up. Much better than I expected and would be willing to see again (which is a real recommendation). All actors play their parts well. Some unexpected appearances and if you wait 10 mins to the end of the credits you get to hear Gal Gadot sign off . The end leaves you hanging: will there be a sequel? Thought the same at the end of The Phantom but sadly it did not eventuate. Left the theatre in a really good mood. Highly recommended.

title: a shallow action movie
text: The ending (relationships between characters) is a bit unexpected, this is a plus. However, overall, this is just a action movie without any depth or laugh points. After watching it, I thought about why did I watch this movie? What did I learn/gain from it? Nothing. This is certainly not my type of movie.

title: Nice and fun movie to watch
text: I thought it was a very good movie, the concept was great and the storyline was a classic heist story. But it did not annoy e because it had great actors.Red Notice is a movie I recommend to watch and I hope this will be the beginning of a sequel. We need ore heist movies like this.

title: Aside from Reynold's usual semi-witty remarks, it's terrible
text: Almost feels like it would save itself if it didn't take itself so seriously. But it does. And it's hard to watch. The only saving grace in this is Ryan Reynolds clever dialogues which he kept all to himself.

title: From Paris to Berlin and every disco I get in...heart pumping action galore!
text:
Red Notice, FBI's most wanted code is the title of this film that brings three megastars together in a caper film reminiscent of the old Hollywood blockbusters.From Italy to Bali, and the story of Anthony's 3 eggs gift to Cleopatra, in-between, starts the story of an FBI profiler chasing a renowned art thief, dobbed in by the mysterious Bishop. The cat becomes the mouse and the story borrows sparingly from many of the references they make on-film!The three must reunite the three golden eggs Anthony gifted Cleopatra for an Egyptian's millionaire's daughter's wedding, ironically named Cleopatra as well. But one egg is lost in myth and mystery!Stuck in Russia now. A black site holding cell for the double crossing agent and an escape artist, the Shawshank Award is begging for a winner, as they smart-talk their way from one fight to the next, trying to get out before the Bishop beats them to it.Meanwhile, The Bishop in London has her own plans as she makes her way to the second egg's location at the wealthy Sotto Voce's palace in Valencia. Jet-setting never looked as fine! An Eyes Wide Shut nod later, and we find out one of three knows where the 3rd egg is...
Indiana Jones meets the Usual Suspects with Ocean's 11 and Inspector Clouseau chasing Pink Panther's Golden Egg. Through twists and turns the comedic gags come as hard as the awesome action pieces to make a film that would have been worthy of a cinematic release.Highly entertaining even though nothing knew!

title: Don't waste your time
text:
I have been looking forward to this movie ever since it was announced.1) Great cast
2) action movie
3) Netflix ProductionIt checked all the boxes for me. The movie started out promising, I like Ryan Reynolds but he is horrible in this movie. He plays the same character over and over, in this movie picture Deadpool meets Indiana Jones. The plot is really dumb and the plot twists are so predictable. Bottom line, big budget and great actors don't equal a good movie.

title: Action packed
text: You will not go to sleep on this one! So many twists and turns that you don't know who's on top or who's in bed with whom! This one is a keeper and I can hardly wait for a sequel and you will be just as eager. Loved it and so will you! My kind'a movie for sure!

title: The definition of derivative
text: Somehow, with the infinite charm and charisma of its leads and $200 million at their disposal, Red Notice looks and feels cheap and artificial, failing to distinguish itself in any way from the hundreds of crime films that inspired it.

title: Entertaining and fun.
text: Can't believe the bad reviews. So what if the plot is predictable? Such a fun movie! Pure entertainment, charismatic characters, great action with silly stunts and goofy, corny jokes!! No better way to spend a dreary, rainy and cold February afternoon.Who says all movies have have deep meanings and complicated plots. Aren't movies made to entertain??? " Red Notice" checks all the boxes for a fun-filled, entertaining cinematic experience. If you're looking for deep meaning and complex themes, this is not for you. But if you want to wash away your stress and are in the mood to laugh at silly jokes and James Bondish stunts, then turn this on and enjoy!!

title: REMINDER: Gal Gadot still cannot act
text: REMINDER: Gal Gadot still cannot act. The film has 6.4/10.0, which is impossible if humans are watching. IMDb, chimpanzees don't qualify to watch films. This film makes no sense. Over forced jokes or lack thereof. Only Ryan Reynolds holds his own but does this film only for the money as the script is deeply insulting and *NOT* funny. And oh, Gal Gadot still CANNOT act!

title: Haters gonna hate and I have no idea why the bad reviews
text:
Haters gonna hate and I have no idea why the bad reviews.This movie is entertaining from beginning to end
All the characters are likable and funny.This is honestly one of the best Netflix movies that have been made.The low ratings are absolutely ridiculous.An enjoyable two hours.

title: The best movie of the month better than shang chi and eternals
text: This movie was really fun to watch I was almost glued to my screen just because of Ryan's humor and gadot's charm. This is a type of movie where you shouldn't care what critics it is a great movie and wouldn't bore even if you are used to watch action espionage thriller like James bond movies etc This movie is really like a parody of other action emotional movie, don't try to find emotions in this joyride, it's a movie to watch love and forget, but really enjoyable better than almost all entries this month 😊

title: Meh
text: Ryan Reynolds charm can only get you so far in a movie. Dwayne "Gary Stu" Johnson in another eye rolling role, with Gal Gadot still being nice to look at, but no acting ability what-so-ever. This movie put me to sleep numerous times. I wouldn't recommend.

title: A good laugh throughout.
text: Actually, I have just upped this to a 9 out of 10. We watched it on Monday night, and it was good easy watchable, funny slapstick humour. I have had all today to think on the movie, and how enjoyable it was to watch on a Monday night after an eventful weekend. Not only is there many laughs, there is the crime "thriller" part, that actually cleverly keeps the viewer guessing as to what will happen next. There are various twists and turns, and some unexpected occurrences. For being a comedy, it has been cleverly written to keep the viewers attention to the storyline. Perhaps there was a few silly things, and the part with the "bull" was pretty poor CGI, however there are more plus notes than negative ones. Sometimes the movie is like Indiana Jones and the last crusade, sometimes a bit Dirty Rotten Scoundrels, sometimes a bit James Bond or Jason Bourne. Enjoy the movie, it gives a lot, and is easy viewing.

title: Makes no sense
text: With the cast led by A lister Ryan Reynolds I had high expectations of a sleek, well polished, well presented storyInstead it's a 'D' rate disaster that frankly makes no senseAbsurdities ruin any story e.g. How Americans arrested in Rome end up incarcerated in Russia (without explanation) was just one of many bizarre examples.Gal Gadot gives an appalling performance and after Wonder Woman 1984 (truly awful) I suspect this marks the end of her career.Huge dissappointment and not worth watching. 3/10.

title: bad writing, good one liners
text: This is a absolute stereotype of an action comedy. Sadly the writing is very poor. The story is a mix between Indiana Jones and Oceans 11 but bad. The side characters aren't developed. Also the story is so unrealistic it's funnier than the jokes. But I have to mention the one liners made me laugh quite a few times even if they shouldn't. This is peak popcorn cinema but at home. All in all Red Notice is a mid movie.

title: Another stupid fun Netflix movie
text: This was everything that I was hoping it would be. It was cool to see a movie that featured Deadpool, Wonder Woman, & The Rock together. Give it a watch, if you love stupid fun movies.

title: Polished turd
text: This film is an interesting case study. It has a 150 million $+ budget, plenty of star power, and still manages to barely even cause a single thrill in its audience.Take any metric by which you would like to rate a film. Dialogue? Makes all the mistakes, from exposition to flat references. Comedy? Somehow manages to make Reynolds unfunny. Suspense? Utterly predictable. Plot? Utterly stupid, complete with faux twists and everyone showing up everywhere at the right time (literally).Every scene left me feeling bored and annoyed. I even felt stupid when the twists were revealed because they were the one thing I didn't see coming, but this was only because they were so asinine they felt slapped on post hoc. Yet even if there had been genuine clues, I would've been far too unengaged to spot them.Why is this film so mediocre? In part, it is because it's designed as a Hollywood 'tick-all-the-boxes' kind of film. No one took any risks, it was meant to attract people with the star power and barely sit through it. I understand that, but that answer has never satisfied me, because with this budget they must've at least had a writing STAFF, i.e., multiple writers, who received at least one million. How, then, is this the result?I rate these films harshly, and I think we all should, because just as it isn't hard to score a C when your parents bribed you into college, it isn't hard to make something mediocre on a blockbuster budget. This film is comprised completely out of spam, filler content. Not a single risk was taken; nonetheless, it was rife with mistakes the industry should have learned by now. Compare this with any thrilling low-budget film, any rough gem, and you'll see it for the polished turd that it is.

title: Movie Premyy's honest review
text: Red Notice is a wonderful heist adventure with an amazing cast. Highlights: fast-paced action, camera work, actors' charm, comic one-liners, and twists and turns. Typical and Predictable story but deserves a watch as it never bores throughout its duration. Highly recommended! ❤

title: Quite bad. Gal Gadot is REALLY bad.
text: Overall quite bad, zero chemistry between actors, mind numbingly unoriginal. But Gal Gadot is worst of it all, she was more than good in the first wonder woman, but she has made a huge quality drop since then. And in this one she is actually as bad as in WW2.

title: Very Fun Movie
text: Ryan Reynolds and The Rock are two of the most charismatic men in Hollywood and neither of them lose a step working together. Gal Gadot proves, once again, that she is good looking.The story is that Ryan Reynolds is the world's best (?) art thief, looking to steal Cleopatra's eggs (which I refuse to google whether or not exist). The Rock is an FBI profiler out to catch him, and Gal Gadot is a better (?) art thief who's also in the mix.This movie was a ton of fun. I honestly had a smile on my face throughout the majority of it. The jokes (mostly from Ryan Reynolds) all landed.Sure, it's formulaic and not particularly realistic, but it was never supposed to be. This movie harkens back to the great fun action comedies of the 80's and 90's. Big summer blockbuster vibes, just happened to be a November Netflix release.In my opinion, one of Netflix's best original movies. Not Oscar great, but fun great.

title: Woulda coulda shoulda
text:
This was a missed opportunity to make a classic heist movie.Instead producers and director opted otherwise and so here we have 2h of one liners that everyone has heard in every movie and reduces this project to boring cinematic cliche.None of the characters are believable ( must be because of the 1 liners)
So the whole thing is reminiscent of a SNL skit ....... a very very bland and long One.Probably that's why the characters come out as caricatures, poor script and too much reminiscent of comedy sketch shows
Unless a comedy sketch show was the idea all along .... :)

title: Its a Perfect Match!!
text: An Awesome Mix of National Treasure/Indiana Jones/Mission Impossible and Deadpool!!! It was Awesome! Can't wait for another one! Great Match of all 3 Characters! Love Ryan and The Rock together! Looking forward to another one soon. Great Movie!

title: If you have anything else to do... Just do it
text: It is a cliche. Plot is predictable, jokes are from Deadpool or any other Ryan Reynolds movie... the Rock is the rock and Gal Gadot, well she have to build a monument of her agent. She is a very poor actress but she always get the job...As I said in the beginning, if dishes has to be washed, just wash the da*n dishes don't lose time with this movie.

title: Worth watching
text: This movie is lit.... Absolutely fantabulous..... Action pack with comedy.... It gives you thriller experience.... Watch it with your friends and family.

title: Excellent but cheesy
text: Plot humour and action. Received poorer ratings than deserved because some of the visual was the usual Netflix cinematic cheap version. Nevermind you cannot please everyone. I've scored this so well because the work ethic and dedication the two leads show is absolutely fantastic. The rock once again stands out but Ryan delivers. A fun thrill ride of twists and details well done.

title: The definition of "content"
text: If you would like to see a movie lead by three incredibly average actors who get overpaid to phone in performances in a mediocre and forgettable caper movie.. then this is the movie for you.

title: [7.9] Escapism!
text: A very fun movie to watch and enjoy. Super well-paced, very interesting, light-hearted and no dragging at all.The flow is just superbly good, full of cheesiness, comic moments, a little tense acting from DJ and I agree, RR saves the movie on more than one occasion. It's simple cheesy entertainment without thinking at all.P. S. The eggs were yummy and superbly done. Pure gold!

title: Another one of those young-adults comedy trash
text: If you are up for corky lines, puny jokes, stunts, and The Rock, this is for you. Not for me, though.In Brazil, we have had movie session in a famous television broadcast channel called Afternoon Session, which became a joke, because movies there were usually corky comedies for children. Red Notice is an Afternoon Session.I admit I'm biased when watching these movies. I usually don't like comedies targeted towards all ages. I guess I don't like comedies in general; I laugh very sporadically on those. But Red Notice has that distinct The Rock vibe. Everything feels forced and "cool-wannabe."The Rock plays himself. After he became the most paid actor in Hollywood, he just plays himself in all movies. Ryan plays Deadpool-like dude that thinks he is in his 20's.Truth be told, my wife and I could not make it past the first half of the movie.

title: A Lovely Romp
text: It's not perfect, but it's loads of fun! The cast looks as if they're having fun, and I know I did! Reynolds's typical sarcasm is a perfect foil for Johnston's earnestness, and Gadot ties it all together!

title: Pretty terrible
text: Just not much good to say unfortunately.The characters and writing did not make much sense at all and most of the jokes fell flat.More annoying than entertaining.

title: Good film, very good actors
text: This is a funny and action movie. The final is not expected. The story will keep you focused to the end of movie.I really love these three actors.A good movie to watch in a relaxed Sunday.

title: Stupid
text: A little Indiana Jones, a bit of The Italian Job and a bit of Deadpool mixed with loads of plot twists. It adds up to a really unlogical plot with a few funny moments. If this is the best Netflix can produce on a record budget I would really urge them to stop their efforts and lower my subscription fee. This is a waste of resources.

title: Forget The Plot And The Story, And Just Enjoy The Action & Adventure !!!
text: Red Notice is the third collaboration between writer-director Rawson Marshall Thurber and Dwayne Johnson after Central Intelligence and Skyscraper. Toplining a blockbuster cast, with Gal Gadot and Ryan Reynolds joining Johnson in this action comedy, the Netflix release gets its title from the Interpol term referring to locating and arresting wanted persons.Red Notice isn't a serious heist film. The plot is feeble, but the A-list star power and humour are loaded enough to make the madness enjoyable.FBI profiler John Hartley (Johnson), on a tip-off from The Bishop (Gal Gadot), is in Rome, trying to foil the theft of an Egyptian egg, one of three priceless spherical jewels dating back to and belonging to Cleopatra. John is close on the trail of art thief Nolan Booth (Reynolds), second in skill and reputation to the sharp and swift The Bishop, but always first with the glib one-liners.Both are competing to be first to find the elusive third egg and complete the trio, which would make it a prize sale in the jewel thief market.The race for the treasure takes them from Italy to Bali to Russia. When Hartley and Booth team up, the wisecracks fly fast and furious. Will they outwit The Bishop or will Interpol inspector Das (Ritu Arya) catch them before they get their hands on all three eggs? That's the bare bones of the story. There's a big twist towards the end, leaving the floor wide open for a sequel.The backstory gives a fedora-shaped hat-tip to the Indiana Jones movies, with some very obvious tributes such as the treasure hunt, Nolan's costume, and Nolan's whistling of the Raiders of the Lost Ark theme tune.There is something for the fanbase of each of the leads. The Deadpool devotee can expect trademark Reynolds humour, Wonder Woman fans can bank on Gadot glamorously delivering the goods. Johnson's followers can be sure of self-deprecating jibes as well as chunks of action. The Johnson-Reynolds combine is a quintessential buddy comedy tie-up.That the cast is having a good time is evident. And so they should, as this is the film's greatest - and maybe only - appeal. As mindless entertainment built on silly jokes, a thin plot, visual effects and window dressing, Red Notice is a 117-minute distraction, easily forgotten in half that time.

title: Worst, disappoiting, crap
text: Terrible movie. I could not watch until the end. The script is a complete garbage. We can't laugh, we can't pay attention. Baywatch is way better than this.

title: "No it's Pulp fictions watch" that line is great!
text: Crazy how this is one of Netflix's highest budgeted films even more than the Irishman which had expensive makeup/cgi Red Notice makes more sense budget wise with the various loot and high octane action scenes. I meant to watch sooner and finally felt like it today so worth it for the entertainment value and goofy banter; spectacular fun! Rawson Marshal Thurber usually has great movies like Dodgeball and We're the Millers are the best.

title: Please stop making garbage like this!
text: This movie was terrible. I don't understand the good reviews. The bad reviews are justified and probably a little too forgiving. In that spirit, I will be try to be negative less: Witless, talentless, artless, directionless, lifeless, mindless, soulless, shameless, hopeless, useless, chestless, cloutless, pointless, thoughtless, listless, and finally, lessless.

title: Enjoyable fare from start to finish.
text: The movie was quite enjoyable. Many twists and turns and good witty dialogues. I really enjoyed it. These kind of movies are not to be twken seriously but needs to be enjoyed on a lazy subday and you will not be disappointed.

title: What a dissapointment...
text: It is "far from perfect" child of indiana jones jumanji and puss in the boots.... so shallow classical dissapointment....Waste of time and full of bad acting...

title: Funny entertaining action comedy
text: Great acting and comedy from Ryan Reynolds.Interesting history inserts and story line.DJ is a great actor as always and so is gal.If you're looking for something easy to watch, this is your movie.

title: CHEAP
text: The action scenes were on-point and carefully executed, but Ryan Reynold's "funny" antics and Dwayne Johnson's performance just wasn't working for me.

title: Great robbery action
text: It didn't let me down. Brilliant story with twists and turns and face paced action. Loved the humour and interplay between the main characters and interpol. Well worth watching.

title: No reason whatsoever
text: We watch different movie for different reasons. There is really no reason whatsoever to watch this one. Banter without humor, caper without thrills, leading cast without chemistry, every zillion times seen cliche used without an ounce of shame. Even a commercial piece of fluff has to bring something to the party. This one doesn't. It comes to the party empty-handed and then stills the cutlery.

title: Very funny
text: A very funny action movie. Great actors, great camera, great special effects and some cool ideas. I cannot understand the low ratings of this movie. It was what I excepted: very entertaining, not more, not less.

title: I finished the film so it earned something...
text:
Netflix.... Netflix.... Netflix....
Another Netflix film entertaining and sucking me in for 45 minutes and then slowly jumping the Shark from funny / action/ somewhat routine but fun story...to overfamiliar poorly laid out good old triple cross with ZERO shock or surprise.This pattern because I'm figuring 60-75 million just for the salaries of Gal Gadot, The Rock (I will not call him Dwayne Johnson his overly exceptional Dwarfing of Hulkamania went beyond saving wrestling) and Ryan Reynolds who is practically a partner at this point is irritating me.Don't misunderstand it's our society and that's what Box Office names get. However combined with production costs I rather pay Five dollars less a month than be bombarded by costly productions that get a lot of viewing hours are logged.Another ridiculous metric...the metric is "Did making this film with hours lead to a matching increase in membership at least for that month.I guess this is more about Netflix that had it stuck to its original plan to replace stone and brick video stores. And with advances continued with that concept modifying to by today a huge video store for a flat 40...Then there would be no 500 streaming services.I have a globalized entertainment company with mediocre content, rarely a new theatrical release unless it was a bomb or overly successful. I rather have access to everything remastered bt FULL HD From 1927-Today for a flat rate. The % of actually good entertainment in shows and films produced by Netflix compared to how many they make is low....
This business plan post COVID this movie in theaters would bomb. I doubt there'd be a studio willing to make this film for theatrical release. It's the type of movie that opens #1 and by week 2 it's not in the top 5 the following week.I don't think this plan is worth 25 a month.

title: A fun movie
text: A very silly, cheesy, and predictable movie... especially for anyone that was watched spy/thief movies that aren't contemporary.... It's definitely not a new story line. That being said, it's an enjoyable movie, it's funny and entertaining. My honest and only complaint is the subpar cgi and body double switch outs. Other than that, it's fun.

title: Red Notice a Fun Ride
text: I found this movie funny,cool,loved that they were in so many locations around the Globe reminded me of the uncharted games ( i bet this movie is better then the actual uncharted movie that is coming out ) it was a fun ride till the end, and after this im excited for Red Notice 2.

title: Another EXTREMELY mediocre Netflix film.
text: They can manage to get quite a few decent actors, but why are Netflix Original filmmakers so very consistently bad? You'd think there was at least an off chance of them striking gold with a production, but everything they do is just hardcore Hollywood throwback fromage. This is yet another Netflix Original along with 6 Underground and Spenser Confidential that features either copy/paste action sequences or cliche hooks and twists. They get decent actors like Mark Wahlberg and Ryan Reynolds and make utterly forgettable films one after the other. Another poorly directed, poorly acted, poorly written, soulless film. Gal Gadot is already overrated as an actual actress, and, as much as I'd love to lie on top of her, was an utterly piss poor choice for this kind of role. She has the looks, the elegance and the body, but she is hardly the sly vixen type that the role clearly calls for, just being realistic here. Great Wonder Woman though, and never unpleasant to watch. Netflix Original films are just SOOO BAAAD, WHYYYYYYY?!?!?!?!

title: Very cool to see
text: If you are waiting for a amazing movie of action you are just dumb.This movie delievers everything that promises.Really hope a sequels is in the making.

title: This script was clearly written by a 16 year old
text: Without prior knowledge of screenwriting.It's full of plotholes and every story arc is only ever driven by stupid decisions and coincidences, so it can drive the story forward without actual consequences.Who actually greenlit this piece of something?

title: JUST INCREDIBLY FUN!
text: The comedic timing in this film is perfect from every single actor, along with the moments of necessary drama. The story is fun, and actually quite believable, along with an fantastic fight/flight scenes. Great costumes and set designs, along with exotic locations with constant twists & turns. Ignore the negative reviews and just have fun, it's not meant to be James Bond! I am really, REALLY hoping there will be a sequel!

title: Mediocre and boring, watch in the background if not atall...
text: Dwayne Johnson and Ryan Reynolds are both good actors who have been recently hit with the curse of becoming "overused actors". Both have hit high notes in numerous films, and both have hit low notes in what appear to be quickly put together, run of the mill films. Avoided this film for about a year or so, expecting it to be watchable but not something I was dieing to watch. This evening I gave it a go but actually turned it off with half an hour to go after failing to pay attention any longer. All the will in the world to be a great action flick, yet it has a boring story, boring action scenes and unfortunately for the both of them.. very boring lead actors. Personaly, give this movie a miss and without FOMO.

title: A "dumb" heist movie well worth watching
text: There are heist movies that are all about a great plan being prepped and then executed, and then there are heist movies that go for the quick flashy unspoken plan guarantee and glue you to the screen more with hijinks and fights and fanservice.This is the second kind of movie.With fights that make you wonder if this whole thing was made by people nostalgic for Jackie Chan movies, Evil (Actually Just Doing Their Jobs) Russians thrown in seemingly just for padding, ridiculously diverse locales and three leads that are very easy on the eyes, all on top of more references, subtle and not, to great films of yore, than you can shake a stick at, this movie simultaneously delivers both the tired-and-true Summer Blockbuster feeling, vying for the way the late eighties action flicks felt, and the "actually, what you thought was a plot hole is a plot POINT" of the Netflix era.And you know what? In no way is this a bsd thing.

title: Brilliant
text: Funny and thrilling. Every time you think you've got it figured out, it makes a predictable yet surprising twist. If you want an engaging stress buster, this is it.

title: Disgraceful
text: This movie is soo bad that I couldn't finish watching this carbage! Really don't know how this got even a cinema release and who would pay to watch this crap!

title: Silly Fun!
text: Don't take it too seriously and you might love it. This definitely had me laughing, and I thought the action sequences were great. I appreciated that it wasn't full of bloody, gory action violence, though at a point it did feel a little unrealistic that every single bullet misses every single person (LOL), which has the effect of making the stakes feel lower in terms of peril. However, that's not really the point of this movie. It's an action-comedy (emphasis on the comedy) and it made me laugh. Super fun overall with cool locations. Loved the Russian prison in the snow and the party sequence with Gal Gadot's gorgeous red dress.

title: Pointless unrealistic action flick
text: The plot, which revolves around a stolen Egyptian tomb artifact, is implausible from the get-go and doesn't get any better. There are plenty of acrobatic stunts, car chases, gun fights, helicopters under rocket attack, and even a car going over a waterfall, but it just comes across as action for action's sake. During all of this none of the actors or extras suffer so much as a scratch, no doubt to maintain its PG-13 rating! Dwayne Johnson simply is not credible as an FBI profiler. Ryan Reynolds is not bad as a professional thief. Gal Gadot plays the perfunctory sexy babe. Some may find the manufactured humor amusing, but I did not. I found myself checking how much time remained so I could go to sleep. If you watch this movie, watch it with your kids - they will love it.

title: the long-awaited film
text: Awesome and the most expensive novelty from Netflix, which everyone should definitely watch. The trio in the faces of Dwayne Johnson, Ryan Reynolds and Gal Gadot turned out to be just perfect. I'm thrilled! The film met all my expectations. To begin with, I will tell you for those who do not know what a "red notice" is and continue my opinion. Interpol uses the phrase red notice as an international request for the arrest of particularly dangerous criminals. As soon as I found out the cast, I immediately decided that I would definitely watch the film itself, and when I came across footage from the filming of a new action movie, the desire to watch it only grew. The novelty turned out to be exciting, dynamic: fights, chases - something is constantly happening, I didn't want to be interrupted, distracted for a second .... Funny jokes, unpredictable denouement, delightfully chic shooting. The film held my interest from the beginning to the very end. He seemed to absorb into himself, into his atmosphere, into his incredible dynamics and mood. I look forward to the continuation and really hope that it will not be worse. Enjoy watching!

title: Silly but Entertaining
text: Unless you live in a world where people entertain themselves with witty banter while pulling off impossible feats of daring you aren't going to be impressed by the storyline. However implausible the plot it does manage to entertain you, and in these dreary times it's a welcome bit of escapism.

title: It was okay dokey
text: I somehow had higher expectations for this movie because of it's casts. But story is simple and easy guessable. What can casts do about its plain story? They did an amazing work, specially Ryan comedy kept me watching this movie. Otherwise, I would have dropped it in the mid way.

title: Light hearted caper(no pun intended)
text: Just put brain in neutral and enjoy the ride.i found it to be a guilty pleasure with likeable leads a thin story line.reminiscent of the film rough cut with Burt Reynolds,David Niven and Leslie Ann down.

title: Only one time watch
text: Overall movie was timepass for me , I was more expected from those 3 superstars 😐 even I got bored during watch this movie but still i gave 5 stars to this. No suspense, No action look like a low budget movie , funny thing is that trailer is much better than fully Movie. I heard about.

title: How could you not like this movie?
text: This movie made me completely forget my problems for 2 hours. It is simply action packed! And Dwayne Johnson is superb! He's a natural. From start to finish, I couldn't take my mind off it.

title: Algorithmic comedy
text: It feels generic from start to finish, but it's just good enough not to be bad. It feels artificial because it does exactly what you expect from these kind of movies and it does it decent enough, but it tremendously lacks character in every aspect: sets, dialogues, story.In comparison with Knight and day, a similar contender from 2010 it falls short on originality and fails to bring anything really new after 11 years. The issue is, after all these years the sub-genre is so saturated that the only good thing about this one is novelty.

title: Knock off movie
text: A literally waste of time this movie is knock off the girl is so annoying and over face expressions which is very cringe . I really don't recommend you to watch it . It's just so obvious that they are trying.

title: Cleopatras third egg
text: This is such fun, These two main actors Dwayne Johnson and Ryan Reynolds are so comedic as the reluctant partners. Well Dwayne is the reluctant on. Dwayne is the cop and Ryan is the robber but as the story proceeds. The plot gets all twisted up. Especially when the two females come into the mix. Nice couple of hours of mayhem ensues. Loved it. I will watch it again.

title: A truly awful must see movie
text: A truly awful must see movie!! I was searching through Netflix everything is so serious and so long. This movie has three great actors in the worst movies of their careers. That alone is worth the price of admission! It's so bad it's good! Just pretend you're 12 years old and you don't know any better and you'll love it!👍

title: Oh Dear
text: Was expecting a heist/cat and mouse chase with a bit of humour. Got a poor man's imitation of Raiders of the Lost Ark without any of the charm, jokes that fall flat, predictable action sequences, and sets that were so unrealistic it was like being on the soundstage with them.

title: Loved it.
text: I found this movie great. It was a heist movie that didn't take itself to serious. I loved that. It was very comical.The 3 lead cast members played well together and I would love to see the 3 of them on another movie together soon.Hopefully they make a sequel to this. 😀I loved the National Treasure/Tomb Raider feel towards the end in finding the third egg. All of the visuals were lovely and some great cinematography being done.All in all, I enjoyed this movie and will watch it again. 🙂

title: Disjointed fun
text: This movie really had me going. Promising cast, very cool cinematography and beautiful scenery. The setup is clichéd to death by this point, good guy chases bad guy and it turns out they have a lot in common.Plot seems very disjointed though. The movie is edited in a way where the protagonists magically appear in the next stage as if they were characters in a video game. No sense of passing time (other than letters on the screen telling you where you are and how long it's been), and most importantly, no apparent struggle of getting into very well guarded places.In terms of cast, Gadot is mediocre at best, (we get that she's pretty, you don't need to rub it in every movie she's in), the Rock seems old & a little bored, but luckily this movie has Ryan Reynolds' energy and delivery to weirdly make up for all its shortcomings.It's a fun action flick but it seems you need to switch your brain off to enjoy it.

title: Loved it
text: Ryan Reynolds stole the show. I laughed all the way through. Light, good. Lots of homage to James Bond, Raiders of the Lost Ark, Lord of the Rings and even The Great British Baking Show. Recommended.

title: This is actually a very good highly entertaining movie.
text: I clicked play with a low expectations... but this is actually a very good highly entertaining movie.The Rock & Ryan Reynolds... chemistry magic... love Ryan improv and jokes he made in the expense of The Rock and some of the jokes are very meta to The Rock actual life.Very good, entertaining, funny and great actions set.Highly recommended 7.5/10... I like how The Rock in this movie is not somekind of superhero like most of his film... he's kinda vulnerable and got his ass kicked and the twist also kinda unexpected.

title: Pathetic tripe
text: Smug, typical elitest attempt at being cool but another example of Hollywood self centered ego. Over acted but phony with more arrogant unfunny dialogue.

title: Love it! Best Comedy I've Seen In Years!
text: I'm not typically one who loves comedies, but this movie is hilarious! It's packed full of slapstick humor and wise cracks, and I was giggling from beginning to end. It's also a nonstop adventure ride, and I was practically on the edge of my seat all through the film.Dwayne Johnson, Ryan Reynolds, and Gal Gabot were outstanding, as usual. Great acting, great directing, and a great story that I look forward to watching again!

title: Major plot holes and obvious storyline
text: If you can get past the major plot holes and gaps in the story, the obvious and predictable story line, the highly choreographed stunts and average CGI then you've got a typical Ryan Reynolds sarcastic vs Dwayne Johnson's action movie.It's ok to watch if you've got nothing better to do.

title: Red Notice is a short but sweet journey back to the golden age of Hollywood.
text: What is different about movies today than the way movies were? Yes, movies needed to change. But they didn't have to be the same cynical clones of each other. Now, there's a sub genre of "old" movies, but why do we keep revisiting them? Simple. They don't make them like they used to.Ryan Reynolds plays the worlds greatest art thief, and Gal Gadot is the world's second greatest art thief. Pursuing them both is Dwayne Johnson, who belongs to the FBI. However, Dwayne Johnson gets framed and put into prison along with Ryan Reynolds, and they agree to team up to get out of there. They succeed, and pursue a priceless treasure in a race to beat Gal Gadot. Ryan Reynolds wants the treasure for himself, but Dwayne Johnson just wants to prove his innocence. They crisscross the globe with numerous hilarious encounters.The directing is top-notch. A movie doesn't have to be a serious drama to be artistically beautiful, and Ryan Marshall Thurber demonstrates that amazingly while having a good time. The cinamtograohy, adds to the excitement, with an (in my opinion) Oscar deserving score. Not too serious, but it fits the movie perfectly and beyond. The acting isn't anything new, but the actors do an amazing job of almost playing themselves and their stereotypes, which, lets be honest, is what we really want to see in a movie like this.A harsh critic might not enjoy this film. There's no question there are a lot of happy "coincidences" that occur that are not realistically plausible. But this is a crime that Indiana Jones and Star Wars are frequently guilty of anyway. Some movies you just can't over analyze, and that's ok. A movie can't be silly, but it can be fun. I've seen a lot of terrible movies that in their attempt to be fun they just end up being silly. A joke of a movie. But Red Notice is not only good, but it's fun too. And that's why it's my favorite action/comedy movie ever.

title: Made an IMDB account to say how bad this is
text: This movie was horrible. I almost turned it off like 4 times. I just kept hoping it would get better but it never did. I usually really like Dwayne Johnson movies but just fell so flat. Advertising made it look a lot cooler than it actually was.

title: Forgettable action comedy
