text: If you can't decide with your partner what movie to watch and it's getting late in the evening, then go ahead and put on Red Notice, it will provide you with mild background entertainment and might give you a chuckle or two. No need to pause the movie when you go to the toilet or get something to drink.I do like the opening scene that is all one take (no doubt with the help CGI, but still).

title: Would have been great in theater
text: I'm glad it was on Netflix but I really liked this movie... Ryan reynolds and the rock really pair great together. It was nice to look at gal Godot and she was good too.

title: Puhleaseee...not even worth the hype
text: It started out well, promising even. But 10 minutes into the movie, I am beginning to tune out everything that is happening. Same old, same old.One, Gal Gadot is hot but that's all there is to it. She can't carry the character with her basic acting. And don't even get me started with Dwayne Johnson. Please stop, just stop taking acting gig that requires you to be cheeky, funny and cunning because you are none of the above. It's like watching a brick (or a rock in this case) kissing another brick. Unlike Brendan Fraser in The Mummy, Dwayne is not even close to being charming. Cringey is more like it. Looking at you too Jungle Cruise.Second, let's talk about the plot twist. It's like halfway through the movie, the writers decided to take a shortcut and threw in the most boring and laziest twist ever. Because, hey the viewers are stupid and they won't see this coming. *rolls eyes*Trust me, this is like all the other Ryan Reynolds' movies. Snarky, smart ass comment. Weird jokes. Movie references yada yada. Nothing new there but still, not as bad as Gal Gadot's and Dwayne Johnson's on screen chemistry. The dance floor scene? Ughhh don't remind me.

title: Not as funny as I expected
text: Well...it's what we should expect? Yes, but...I admit that I was expecting to laugh a bit more and to see some crazier scenes.The Rock is the Rock. Always the same role, but always a cool guy, enjoyable. Ryan Reynolds is starting to get seriously annoying. I think that's the reason why I didn't appreciate Free Guy and here I also rolled my eyes several times with all those constant (failed) jokes. Gal Gadot surprisingly is not that bad. Not something special either, but cool and with a lot of charm.Most of the film is predictable and most of the jokes didn't work for me. I also don't understand how you spend all this money in a film and you can't even present a bull looking like a bull. The CGI on that scene is bad, bad, bad.Either way, some good action pieces, some funny references and good (at least entertaining) 20 final minutes saved this from the total disaster. I hope that the sequel - that will definitely happen - can be a slightly better popcorn fun.

title: Brilliant
text: Just enjoyed it all throughout. Great heist plot and good ensemble cast. The three main lead characters Gal Gadot, Dwayne Johnson , Ryan Reynolds were wonderful. Excellent! Hence my high rating. Even better can watch it on Netflix not in a cinema with covid around.

title: .... and it's a meh. My grandma thumbs are more entertaining to watch
text: It's just ... meh, there is not much to it. All the actors play themselves - confused meatball, a wooden stick and an average Reynolds (seriously his Instagram stories with gin commercials are funnier that this).

title: Loved it!
text: I was reluctant to watch this movie and only did so on the recommendation of a friend. The night before I had watched No Time to Die. Not being much of a Bond fan, I can tell you that I enjoyed this movie much more. It was non stop action but very humorous at the same time. Ryan Reynolds timing was brilliant. Will be watching again. Do yourself a favour and have some laughs.

title: Khan Review
text: What was this hype all about? I found the movie below average boring. It did not hold my attention even for few minutes, I watched it just because I had downloaded and dod not wanted it to go wasted. Neither it's an action nor a comedy, surprised how it got good reviews.

title: High octane world travelling movie
text:
A very interesting movie, which has more twists than a plot, which isn't a bad thing as no movie is perfect..It's a like watching scenes from James Bond movies
where globe hopping actually has meaning!

title: Forgettable movie after 1st watch
text: It is some story which just starts because there is a movie is happening. Every one explain everything about what they are going to do or how they are going to do.Everything is on your face. This movie can't make it's own mind what the movie is all about. Is it a buddy cop or action or adventure.I don't understand Dwayne Johnson. Why he is making such numb next to stupidity stories. Yes I have seen his previous movies but this one was produced by him. Why he selected this story. Ryan Reynolds was as usual goofing around making jokes. Why Gal Gadot signed this movie. Why she is there. Any one could have done that character.

title: Will this be the start of a new Buddy Movie Series?
text: It's a heist movie. It's an action flick.And it is a Buddy Film.I was hesitant to mention with my initial write-up but of all the comparisons out there for this movie the one that hit me the most, and perhaps because of my age, was a comparison to The Road to....... movies with Bob Hope, Bing Crosby and Dorothy LaMour. It's all there the buddy film, the double-crosses, the romance aspect, and of course the comedy. Homage can be found to many films here but you can't neglect the Road Series.The Chemistry is there between The Rock and Reynolds. Their interactions and timing are there. And they were just plain fun to watch together. I can see them teamed up this way again.The writing was good. Filming, editing and effects were good.And no, I did not forget Gal Gadot, she's always a joy to watch and played off Rock and Reynolds well.This film is easy to enjoy.

title: The definition of consumable media
text: Nobody is really acting in this film. Each actor plays as themselves-the suave jokester, the femme fatale, and the funny buff guy. You might enjoy it enough to forget how many potato chips you've eaten so far, but afterwards it's completely forgettable. It's what you get if you mixed every comedy action movie in a blender.

title: Finally !
text: Great movie ! Pure fun, not too much to figure out in the plot, just straight and thrilling action. Charismathic actors, superb locations worldwide, crazy pace. What else should an escapist flick have ? Go for it. Finally a real Netflix hit.

title: Same old same old!
text: Stop with the quit wit, it isn't funny any more. Ryan Reynold's movies are starting to get tiresome. It's not all about him. What about developing the other characters a bit more and giving them some humour to act out. I so nearly switched off half way through because his smart alec approach was becoming very annoying, but I stuck with it and I am more the fool for doing so.I like Ryan Reynolds but he seems to be hell bent on having all of his characters become these fast talking making up on the spot non funny lines, where he should become more focused on developing his character, cutting out the quantity of jokes and going for the quality.I look forward to seeing this happen in his future movies. Come on Ryan, you can do it. 😁👍

title: Fun action film
text: I just enjoyed watching this movie. I hadn't seen Ryan Reynolds acting before and wow he plays a role like this very very well. Good comedy/action/treasure hunt movie!

title: Really tried ...
text: ... but after 48 min and having started 3 times, it just was pathetic ... the script is sooo bad, that even a good cast can't make me continue forever.

title: Concept copy of bollywood film RACE..
text: Concept is inspired from bollywood film franchise Race ..just story and actors is different..its very unexpected for me..nothing new for Indians..we already saw this type of content..

title: What the hell is wrong with you people!
text: Are we talking about the same movie here. A lot of comedy, a lot of action, thrills and adventure packed together into this movie. Top performance by all main players in the movie.I am definitely looking forward to the sequel.

title: A bargain-bin Indiana Jones
text: Dwayne Johnson plays Dwayne Johnson: a man that looks lost in a film he's starring, with only his enormous, threatening size being only thing on offer. Hulk mad!Gal Gadot plays Gal Gadot: incredibly beautiful yet dull actor who didn't get a role in Bond or Mission: Impossible movie and thus, has to act in whatever she gets.Ryan Reynolds plays Ryan Reynolds: An adult human male version of Bugs Bunny. A really, really annoying Bugs Bunny.How is he still getting those roles, I'm not sure. Why is he still accepting those roles, I'm even less sure. This character served him well in Two Guys and a Girl, and fit Deadpool, but it really feels old now. What's up, doc?Together, they endlessly chase each other to obtain three artifacts, ride weird CGI roller coasters, and mix and mash bits of every other, better heist/adventure movie they could come up with. Problem is, it feels very cheap and childish, with zero tension. Actors seem to be trying hard, even The Rock, but there's just nowhere to go with this weird soup of a script.Grand adventure movies like this are rare nowadays, but Red Notice doesn't seem to reinvigorate the genre, even despite star power and insane budget. The final taste ends up being bitter, and you're not quite sure if you watched a heist movie, a parody of one, or an episode of Looney Tunes.

title: Absolutely disappointing
text: Do not waste your time, storyline is terribly weak, trying to be funny but it is not, was not able to even smile once. Very overrated. Netflix you totally wasted the money, it is not even entertaining.

title: Watch till the end
text: It's a fun watch.The comedy is there but I think it's a bit too much and present in almost every scene.The writing appears as childish at first because of so many things that don't make much sense. But...The best part of the movie is the later reveal that feels up all the holes.It put a lot of smile in my face and I'm glad I watched this.I love the big trio.

title: An Average Entertaining Film
text:
Over the years Netflix has been getting bigger and bigger and Red Notice is the biggest film project that they have ever done and I have now watched it and here is my review for it. The premise of the film sees a police profiler have to work with a thief to clear his name.Main Character
Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson plays the lead character and he is exactly what you would expect. He is charming and cracking one liners left right and centre as you would expect by Johnson as he is a pro at doing just this. But I just feel like this is expected by now and the actual character here is really dull, I know this isn't a film to be taken too seriously but I just need some more character depth or else this is just another Dwayne Johnson action film with no substance.Supporting Characters
Ryan Reynolds plays the thief in the film and I kind of feel similar with is performance. He is entertaining as he pretty much is in everything with one liners a plenty and the two of them have some decent chemistry. His character is handled better but it still leaves quite a bit to be desired and the humour was the thing that was chosen instead. Gal Gadot plays the antagonist and she seems like she is having a lot of fun. It did feel like something different for her as an actress and it made her performance stand out more to me then the other two more prominent characters in the film. Ritu Arya from The Umbrella Academy plays an interpol agent and she is functional but I guess I wanted to see more of her and what really motivated her to the plot of the film.Story
The story of the film has some fun and exciting set pieces with decent chemistry between Johnson, Reynolds and Gadot with the situations that they are placed in. But the film is so generic that it makes the whole thing worse. If you have watched some films you have seen plenty of story elements from this film and then they throw in a twist that makes little sense just to try and spice up the story a bit more.Script
The script has some funny lines and interactions in it, which considering this is a film that sees Dwayne Johnson and Ryan Reynolds share the screen you would expect that. But the film is pretty illogical and the drama falls really flat that by the end I kind of wondered what was the entire point of it overall.Style
The film does have some good action scenes, they are fun and have lots of great stunt work and action co-ordination in tact. But there is just something a bit off, the pacing is okay though I think even the style is quite generic and it hurts the overall feel of the film.Overall
Overall, Red Notice is an average film. Despite the A List cast and heavy financial backing it falls short and needed better writing and creative decisions being made.Rating - 5/10.

title: BEST ENTERTAINMENT
text: Best movie to watch, Totally entertaining and really nice work by all the leads. The movie starts with a Bang and ends with one. Nothing lesser than a james bond movie.

title: Crappy caper
text: Yet another American heist movie where they spend so much on the leading cast they have to end up with some terrible British supporting actors to cover the cost (sorry but true)Ryan Reynolds does what he always does, the tongue in cheek, talks too fast, always has an answer for everything schtick which is starting to become 0 dimensional, while the Rock plays the usual FBI guy who dresses far too well and lives this amazing lifestyle on basic wages.Gal Gadot couldn't keep a straight face throughout she must've know how awful this all was and she's made some horrendous films so that saying something.Rant aside is it enjoyable? In a word: no.

title: The Popcorn Entertainer!
text: The trio is legendary. The plot was predictibly decent and the cat and mouse thing between those three were fun to watch, each and every bit of the story is predictable still the comedic touch of ryan and rock being rock just like any other movie with the gal being entertaining. Overall the movie felt like i watched almost 100 times but the trio makes it dencently fun movie!

title: Achtung
text: Feels like a cheap flick in more than one way. Gal Gadot isn't selling it at all and neither does Dwayne Johnson really excel here to be fair.A weak story, below average visuals and a witty Ryan Reynolds isn't cutting it.Do better than an impressive cast Netflix.

title: Just a fun movie
text: So many bad reviews?...why? The point is just to enjoy a movie. Twists and turns, I liked it. Why be so critical? It's a fun time movie with enjoyable characters. I'm glad I didn't read these miserable reviews before watching. Obviously, some viewers can't just enjoy a movie without being nasty. It may not be realistic, but it gives viewers a little while just to leave reality and have fun watching. We all have opinions and the right to express them. I just want to say, I hope you watch and get a little joy and laughter in your life. It doesn't have to be real or true to life, just fun. Escape.

title: Its a light action adventure comedy.
text: I watch movies to be entertained & as an escape from reality. Theres no major sex or violence in this movie or serious criminal intent. It should appeal to a broader audience. It does have a bit of an Indiana Jones feeling to it or as someone else has mentioned like "True Lies" with Arnold Schwarzenager.I Iaughed alot at the banter between the characters. I would not be embarrassed to watch in the company of all ages.I bought "Central Intelligence" on dvd & was disappointed, even offended. I wish I had this movie instead.

title: I love it
text: Why? Well, it's funny, it's highly paced, it is well acted, it has a nice story with a funny twist. Is has the most enjoyable easter egg since months or even years, and finally: no stupid characters, no annoying children, no pc or inclusion crap... JUST FUN!It is, was Indiana Jones and James Bond once was. Stir it all together, put in a grain of heist and pink panther and voila!I am really surprised, something like thisnis still possible these days, and I'm glad it is so.

title: It passed the time, but not the smell test
text: This is a fairly slick production from the Hollywood machine. However, the writing and directing are abysmal. Seems like a movie I would have enjoyed when I was 13 or 14. It passed the time ok, and wasn't bad enough to turn off, but not very memorable and very predictable. Tons of campy dialogue that just wasn't pulled off very well, considering this cast is usually pretty good at that sort of thing. Stream it if it's free and you want something light for background. Don't pay to rent it though!

title: Fun Adventurous Movie
text: Good fun action movie, thoroughly enjoyed it start to finish. Great little plot twists, cameos and product placements. Look forward to the next one if they make another one.

title: Fun and perfect balance
text: The movie is absolutely awesome. They managed to get the balance between action, comedy and character development just right and the movie was engaging till the end. The current rating of below a 7 is utter horse shht.. This movie deserves a lot better.Absolutely loved it and can't wait for the sequel!

title: What could have been but never was!!
text: This was a movie that lost a great opportunity to have made use of a stellar cast for an excellent action flick with robust plot and story line. Instead we are fed mediocre fare, with the actors the only redeeming feature.The story is a big disappointment, especially in how predictable it is, and the blase manner of the plot lines. The action sequences were good, but that is not the point of a movie is it? It is like putting on some icing to cover a badly baked cake!Five stars just for the actors - I mean they do a very good job with a below-par script. Such a shame, could have been much better!

title: Disregard the Metascore
text: This movie is pure fun and worth watching for Gal Gadot alone. The banter between the Rock and Ryan Reynolds is a joy able and the action scenes are pretty decent. It's not a movie that will get Oscar noms, but it's highly entertaining. Joe Bob sez, "Check it out!"

title: Utter Bollywoodization of Hollywood
text: I'd rather watch Indian actors catching bullet coz it makes more sense than this crap... Netflix's machine learning products are destroying cimema as we know it...

title: Action. Comedy. Thrill
text: .. Hell yeah!If you're like action with comedy, and some great thrill then this is a perfect choice. The trio(Ryan Reynolds, Gal Gadot and Dwayne Johnson) is amazing and really compliment one and other in this flick. The comedy/humour is of good taste and really funny.In short, you won't be bored. ☺

title: Nothing exciting about this one
text: This movie is more like a compilation of every other dwayne movies with not that tasty tadka of ryan raynold. In toto it is a bland movie which has nothing exciting except the cinematography and effects. An easy pass on this one, better watch 'welcome to the jungle'

title: Good movie
text: Good movie with a lot of action. Ryan Reynolds has a weird voice which was a dumb choice for the character role. But in spite of that the movie has a lot going for it. Lots of adventures and good costumes, sets, etc....That's all I want to write. I don't know why imbd believes that long reviews are desirable. I wish they would reduce the minimum to 15 characters. That's enough. There are no Spoilees in this review. At this point I have to type an additional 138 characters. Ridiculous! Imbd what were you thinking when you came up with this reidiculously large minimum for required characters???

title: So weak!
text: Great cast thanks to Netflix budget but they've managed to churn out a boring BS 'action thriller' that offers nobody anything new. I'd like to shoot myself in the face now please! 😩

title: Typical heist movie
text: Nothing new. A typical heist, action, comedy movie, but if you enjoy Ryan Reynolds' brand of humor you'll probably enjoy it. The rock and gal gadot are also decent - a performance you'd expect from them. The action is average, the unnecessary cgi is kinda bad. title: Again, Gal Gadot is the worst actress of our time
text: Gal Gadot should NEVER be cast. I thought her performance in WW184 was beyond horrible but she nearly outdid herself in the "ZERO acting skills" department in this failure. Combined with the acting-challenged Rock, this movie never had a chance.Hollywood is in serious need of talent.

title: Awesome action movie
text: There was so many twists and turns... fun movie... we all loved it.The story take several twists so fun and unexpected.Xoxoxoxoxoxoxoxoxoxoxoxoxoxoxoxoxoxoxo.

title: Not Again
text: Ohhh not again.. what happened to Gal from WW- II. Not at all good performance from her.Story has no base or does not carry to the audience. Some scenes does not make any sense with story line.Both Dwayne and Ryan did their best but Gal is total flop.

title: Perfect Action Comedy
text: Red Notice is fun, action backed and humorous. It gives nods to classics like Raiders of the Lost Arc. Don't go into this film expecting it to be an Oscar contender, that's not the genre or the goal. It's perfect to watch with the family. Its lucky that Netflix purchased it and it was direct released on their platform versus having it go first to theaters.

title: Great...if you are a 12 year old
text: Otherwise it's a super cheesy, amateur writing, borefest. I challenge you to watch past the 25 minutes mark and not yawn at all. Really don't know how movies like this get green lighted. Doesn't anyone read the scripts?Spend your precious time somewhere else.

title: Pretty Funny Movie
text: Hadn't heard of the movie before. But with the Rock and Ryan Reynolds I said what the hey. The movie was funny, fun, and I really enjoyed it. The chemistry between Ryan and the Rock was awesome. I didn't see the twist at the end. Hope they make a 2nd movie.

title: Loved it
text: Love Ryan Reynolds & The Rock, but the Ed Sheeran bit got me. 😂 loves his cameos so much he even referenced his GoT one. Quality.Defos a recommended watch if you have any sort or sence of humor.

title: It Cost How Much?
text: Poor CGI, bad acting (hello Gal Gadot, Sotto Voce and cop lady) and Dwayne Johnson phoning a performance in. Even Ryan Reynolds got tiring. More twists than a Chubby Checker concert which only goes to prove it was a poor story. But I watched it on Netflix, so at least I didn't pay any more than my subscription to endure it.

title: Worth a watch
text: Decent non-buddy, buddy action/caper movie.Some of the plot points are a bit trite and hackneyed, but it still works. And it's kind of standard Reynolds as the smart-alec while Johnson plays the straight man. But again, it still works. Worth a watch.

title: RED NOTICE-AVOID!
text: I like both Dwayne and Ryan. All i did not like is this movie. It is not funny,it is not smart,and it has no sense whatsoever. Please,please don't make any more movies like this. NEVER!.It was painful.

title: Just Fun
text: A typical fun movie when. Ryan Reynolds is in the lead.Crisp dialogues and fast moving action.Dont expect anything more.Good for one time watch if you have nothing else to see !!

title: Completely predictable and bad post-production
text: No surprises in script. Everything is predictable and unreal. The post production and also stand-ins are terrible. The way Reynolds comes of the boat and then is replaced by someone else you see from the back, followed by close-ups shot in a studio are terrible. The green screens are so bad. The cheep backgrounds and matte paintings are pathetic!A complete waste of time.

title: It's real fun
text: For what it is meant to be, It is really good.I don't get the bad reviews nor the neutral. Either you hate one or all the main actors or you don't like commedies or it is guaranteed you will have a shure thing good fun time with this movie.

title: No interesting storyline
text: I watched this movie with great expectation. Buy it severely lacks the element of trust between the trio. It was expected atleast at climax. Gal's character is always killing the fun. Story could have been much better if they made it like these three are doing the crimes as a team and revealing this secret at the end.

title: good movie
text: I really liked it. Yeah, it was very similar to other Rock and Ryan movies, but it was really good. Thanks to netflix for bringing huge budget movies to our screens. Plot twist didn't surprised me tho, i kinda suspected that something might happen.. Go watch it.

title: Comedy is Dead and We Killed It
text: Don't go in there expecting a "comedy and to laugh, it's just Rock and Ryan doing their Rock and Ryan thing.I think the last decent (new release)comedy movie I saw was back in 2018 with the movie Game Night, which this movie's plot is surprisingly veeeeery similar to that one's.The last good comedy movies where they had balls to do whatever they want were Jump Street duology, and that's it. I haven't seen any new comedy movie even close to what Jump Street and The Hangover were. It's suffice to say that comedy is dead and now we have high budget action "comedy" movies with A-list actors, because that's the only way people are gonna watch your movie, put Ryan Reynolds or Dwayne Johnson, or in this case both of them, in your movie and you'll be rolling in dough.And I know it's a cliché thing to say - and so are their roles - and many people have already said it before, but are we not tired of seeing Ryan and Dwayne in the same exact role for the millionth time? Are studios so afraid to make something different and stop writing the same characters for these two?And can someone please tell me where the "comedy" was? The only time I chuckled in this movie was with the Putin pictures scene and that was a low hanging fruit. You shouldn't expect to just put Ryan Reynold in your movie and give him some dumb lines to say and call it a "comedy". Seriously, wtf were those dialogues? Who wrote the things Ryan had to say? You're not writing Deadpool, even though you are trying to copy it, but you're really bad at making decent funny dialogue, it's so forced and weird and unfunny.This movie also tries to be a smartass and self-aware, while being a parody of itself, it's copying every movie imaginable and there are twists after twists after twists that you're expecting 99% of it and it gets really boring. And by 99% percent, I mean that surprisingly I didn't see the last one coming, which I should have, but you throw all these twists from the beginning that your major twist don't really have an impact.What worked in Game Night with it twists, was that they were few, but smart and unexpected and they knew not to go overboard with it.Also lo and behold, the pinnacle of characterization: Daddy issues.All in all, the movies is predictable, full of cliché, full of self-indulgent twists, bad dialogue, lack of realism and weak plot.But you may ask why did I only rate it 4 and not lower. Well, as I much as I wanted to not like this movie, I realized at the end that it surprisingly didn't bother me that much and I kinda liked the ending twist, even though the movie way overstayed its welcome. But the movie wasn't that kind of movie that goes on my nerve and make me hate every minute I wasted on it (I'm looking at you Life 2017 starring Ryan Reynolds!), so I go kinda soft on it.But for the love of god, next time you're making an action movie with these two in it, please please don't call it a comedy.

title: Highly entertaining
text: Of course you'll find the usual low star reviews here criticizing the story, acting, consistency, storyline, camera angles, lighting, prop management, transitions or whatever they think they're an expert on. I'm always assuming these reviewers had a bad day, didn't get their quota of chocolate, are 13 year old wannabe critical reviewers or have lost their sense of fun. And I'm 99% sure they've never shot one minute of movie.But let's get to a happy place...this movie!If you like action movies, tongue in cheek comedy, Ryan Reynolds (c'mon guys who doesn't? :-), Dwayne Johnson, Gal Gadot and popcorn, you'll have a great 2 hours.

title: Dwayne Johnson, Ryan Reynolds, and Gal Gadot make for one entertaining film,
text: Interpol agent John Hartley(Dwayne Johnson) is tracking a clever art thief(Ryan Reynolds) who is good at staying one step ahead of everybody, but for once catches him, before he gets away, but Hartley is framed by The Bishop(Gal Gadot), and is sent to the same prison has the thief, and realizes he must team up with the thief in hopes to escape and stop The Bishop.This movie has it shares of surprises that you just won't see coming. A pretty good action caper. Dwayne Johnson and Ryan Reynolds make a pretty team, they just have a good love hate thing going each other. Gal Gadot is really rocking here, besides from playing Wonder Woman, but shows in this she'd be an awesome James Bond girl also. A fun film to enjoy on Netflix.

title: This was surprisingly bad
text: I was ready for 90 minutes of fun.The jokes did not land. The cast did not have chemistry. The action was not fun. There was cliche after cliche and the I found the twist out, 15 minutes into the movie.

title: Comedy One liners
text: I really enjoyed this movie. It was nice to relax on Date Night and laugh. Ryan Reynolds one liners were delivered at the perfect time. I like some comedies but this movie I will watch again.

title: Red Mess
text: This movie was not worth the 2 hours spent watching it or the 200 million spent making it. The plot is predictable and the acting is abysmal. The Rock replays his "hero" role. A few of the comedic moments were funny and classic Reynolds, but the storyline overall was anti-climactic. The bad accents for specific characters suggests that Hollywood/Netflix prefers paying a white American to play someone from a different culture instead of casting an authentic person from that culture.

title: Its just a great movie!
text: Explosions, gunfire, chases, and LOTS of laughs! What's not to like??? Ryan Renolds is a laugh a minute, and Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson is his usual funny self. Don't miss it! It's well worth the watch!

title: Hmmm...yawn
text: Although I like all three main characters...this movie just doesn't come together. While it is a fun little romp...it is too implausible to be believed. There's just too much "made up stuff" in here to take it seriously. It should have had a more James Bond or Thomas Crown vibe...but it just couldn't get to that level. It's more like a video game trailer than a movie. It's cute and a bit funny but you can only enjoy it if you don't take it seriously.

title: yes, there is a twist. No, it doesn't make it better.
text: Gal Gadot speaks. Well. But that's what she does. She may have amazing acting skills, but no chance in this movie.Both guys - they are quintessentially same as in any and every other movie of theirs.There is *NO* way you can tell the difference if scenes from this movie were to be copy pasted in their any past movies or vice versa.They need to do different movies now. Badly.

title: All seen before
text:
While it's a disappointing movie, where the plot is nothing new and it drags on and on with scenes of explosions and gunfights, the important thing is this:
1. The Rock has the same expression the whole movie. Actually in every movie.2. Very important: Gal Gadot CAN'T ACT! She's basically not an actress. It was fine when she had roles where she would just stand there and look pretty, but now she has lead roles in blockbuster movies which is ridiculous.3. The only good thing about the entire movie is Ryan Raynolds.

title: The whole movie is very funny comedy
text: Ryan Reynolds acting made the movie really funny. It is full of great jokes that makes the movie enjoyable.The movie is very interesting and fun to watch.

title: Looks and feels cheap and amateurish
text: Despite the charm and charisma of its actors and a budget of US$200 million, Netflix's most expensive film, Rawson Marshall Thurber's 'Red Notice,' looks and feels cheap and amateurish. It fails miserably to stand out from the hundreds of other crime films that influenced it in any way. Dwayne Johnson is overshadowed by Ryan Reynolds, who is a better performer on this. It's like they put two stars in the movie and it just didn't work very well.

title: Light hearted yet high valued
text: Enriched with excellent visuals and scenery this adventurous drama is a balanced mix of fun and action. It's outstanding how the story has it's own value despite having a great cast.

title: Doesn't hold water!
text: Johnson, Reynolds, and Gadod all seem pretty out of shape and unprepared for this rather cheap popcorn film. Funny how some of Netflix's shows, f.i. Narcos, make some of those tired Hollywood stars look dated.

title: Very entertaining
text: If you liked the Mummy movies then you will dig this adventure/action film. Not sure why others have rated this movie so low, my family really enjoyed it!

title: Not the best
text:
Dear directors,Please stop having a character jump from a moving car to another one. Especially jumping forward from a speeding car. Do you understand basic physics.Thank you,
Movie watcher.

title: Brilliant
text:
Typical of The Rock this is another great fun action family film. Reynolds' one liners perfectly complimenting this and with Gadot looking as stunning as ever.There's also a wicked twist which for me wasn't expected....although the clues are there if you look for them
Brilliant to watch.

title: Nothing Special
text: Even though the movie has a huge star cast still it is very blend. Same old actions & story. Gal Gadot is soooo overrated. Her acting is same in every movie.

title: RED NOTICE / My P.O.V.
text: What can I say? Such a great trio leading. I think that it is not their everlasting wish to possess the third egg that gave them wings through the story. They differ so much from each other, and that's what makes them unique as a group.The story itself shows an incredible and adventurous mind of Rawson Marshall, the screenwriter and his ability to bring it up to the screen in such a powerful way. But it couldn't be possible without Ryan, Dwayne and Gal. They rocked and brought their characters to life the best.And just like as Ryan (Nolan Booth) struggles with the word "teamwork", that's exactly what they are. A TEAM.One huge congrats :)Greetings from Serbia :)

title: Design by Committee garbage
text: No vision, no character development. It feels like some AI writing program watched a bunch of action films then spit out this script. There's no chemistry in the film and it's awful in every way. No doubt there will be sequels too. Ugh.

title: Red notice rocks
text:
An amazing film with 2 male characters but far beyond Gal Gadot was something more than amazing. She was charming. Can't wait those guys snows up in a second ren notice
.

title: Maybe more stars, but...
text: ...despite the nice idea and production, Ryan Reynolds ruins the entire picture with his obnoxious personality and unnerving playacting. This guy is the new Owen Wilson. A bottle of ketchup poured into a gin-tonic.

title: I really liked it!
text: It's a fun movie with some twists you actually do not see coming. I'm looking forward to the sequel. Though not Emmy worthy, it's far better than some of the other offerings this year and the past. I've found the more the professional critiques do what they do-criticize-the more I like the movie they are panning. If you are looking for some escapism, some giggles and laughs, this is a good choice. Never would have thought Reynolds and the Rock would make a good pairing, but they work. A welcome break from weather balloons, WEF, political antics and mislaid computers. For that, I am truly grateful.

title: Fortunately its not too long
text: Predictable plot, action and ending. I watched it for free so it only cost me a little time. Couldn't wait for it to end, had to start fast forwarding.

title: Literally SO funny!!!
text: I couldn't get enough of this movie! I was laughing so hard the entire time!! It's like another Get Smart with The Rock again! It's absolutely amazing, I don't know how it didn't get a higher score! Highly recommend setting this!

title: Even Ryan Reynolds can't save this bomb
text: If there was an edited version that only contained Ryan Reynolds lines, then it would be reasonable. The rest of the movie was a big stinking bomb. CGI effects are terrible.

title: Couldn't stop watching it which is quite unusual
text: Hi read the critics's critics. One goes as far as writing "can't argue with the bonafide value of watching 3 A-listers in a sleek fast paced action thriller". And that, for him/her/them its a 60.For me, that's a 9/10. But maybe that's just me being dumb as I usually am.Think Mission Impossible or James Bond with Ryan Reynolds's sense of humor. Yeah, it's the same jokes always, he can only do Deadpool - don't you just live him for that? And The Rock can only play himself and so can Gal Gadot.Or maybe they found out that people really like to see RR, TR and GG over and over again.I know I do.If you do, too, and MI, why haven't you seen this?Do it. Now. ;)

title: Watchable but cookie cut.
text: Slick Hollywood comedy dialogue is overdone, thus has become mediocre. The film is highly predictable and formulaic. It gets points for the film craft, but the ultra-commercial script is trying too hard to be fresh when it's not.There a were two good chuckles - when the big guy falls through a tarp and when the elbow hits the un-breaking glass - hehe. However not much else original to speak of.

title: Great fun film
text: Fun film, these two together are always great.What do you want from an action comedy film?Action and Comedy!Just enjoy!Had to write at least 150 characters to be allowed to post this review so I will just repeat!Fun film, these two together are always great.What do you want from an action comedy film?Action and Comedy!Just enjoy!Fun film, these two together are always great.What do you want from an action comedy film?Action and Comedy!Just enjoy!

title: Convoluted Miss
text: By now Reynolds's schtick is wearing a bit thin. We've seen a lot of this before. There's the obligatory witticisms, the convoluted scheming, and the frenetic action scenes, but they're rarely interesting in this rehashing. I wanted to like it. I didn't.

title: Solid film.
text: I really enjoyed this film. The plot was fun, the characters were interesting and there was constant action. An Indiana Jones inspired film, and that's a thumbs up for me.Looking forward to the next film.

title: Only thing funny about this was Ryan Reynolds one liners movie was horrible
text: I'm a fan of both of these gentlemen but this movie was horrible from the narrative to the ending, wait so you automatically think we one a second one, movie seemed more like a chick action film, from the cop that some how works for Argentina but seem to arrest them in other states, that's impossible and only idiots believed that, movie was as generic as it comes two thumbs down.

title: The plot, locations, and characters were all well thought out, so it's hard not to be amazed.
text: There was almost no chance that a movie with such excellent and entertaining leading roles would be bad. I laughed and had a lot of fun throughout the movie, especially the Ryan and Dwayne dialogues were really good. The plot, locations, and characters were all well thought out, so it's hard not to be amazed. I'm looking forward to the next movies.

title: $200 million dollars. Two. Hundred. MILLION. Dollars.
text: And what does it buy you?Three very personable leads. You know what they're good at, they know what they're good at, and that's exactly what they deliver.But, oh dear, everything else.A supporting cast of nobodies who have richly earned that status. An absolutely basic script that seems like it was written by a robot that just blended together previous mismatched-buddy and heist movies randomly without understanding them. Dialogue that is almost entirely exposition. A clumsy score that oversells what's on screen.And where did the rest of the budget go? Locations, it seems, but not on wirework, CGI or cinematography. There are far too many quick jump cuts and tight shots, and no sense of scale.It's also half an hour too long for its meagre material, and drags badly in the middle. A cheap quota quickie that's neither quick, nor cheap - although it looks it.Netflix are becoming masters at wasting talent, and having entire productions simply phone it in. They need to be a lot more ruthless at leaving footage, movies and careers lying on the cutting room floor.

title: Loved it
text: Ryan Reynolds funny af :) Entertaining and definitely worth seeing. Do not understand why there are so many negative comments about Ryan Reynolds, if you do not like him, maybe you should not see the movie? It's an action comedy and it delivers.

title: Gal Gadot is truly an awful actress
text: Sure, this movie is predictable with bad cgi and stupid dialogue but I could still enjoy the fun action scenes and The Rock and Ryan Reynold's banter. But oh my god is Gal Gadot awful - she doesn't have enough charisma to pull off a badass criminal mastermind. She's is painfully unfunny, especially when on screen with such big characters, and it's just extremely annoying. Hollywood - stop casting her in roles she clearly cannot pull off....

title: Bloody brilliant
text: This film honestly has me in stitches. First there is Dwayne the Rock Johnson who doesn't love him, then there is Ryan Reynolds and these two have a chemistry onscreen that's unmatched (Hobbs and shaw) they just bounce off one another. Plus who doesn't love Ryan Reynolds - then they go and throw Gal Gadot in there Wonder Woman she is!! Honestly the twists and turns of this film make me smile scream and laugh. I am actually happy with the ending which is unusual but I do require a 2nd please would be brilliant. Plus it has a cameo with Ed Sheeran who is awesome. But most of all seriously the way the Rock and Ryan just literally say to one another ok I don't like you ok maybe you love me really. It's just brilliant. Plus I got to love me some action and some bromance/romance. Definitely worth a watch.

title: Could be great!
text: Wasted potential.. Gal Gadot is very pretty but she is horrible actress. This moovie could be great with actualy talanted actress in the lead role. Ryan and Dwayne are pretty solid as usual, and there is a bit of twist, but everything is ruined by the terriblee acting of Gadot. The moovie is a decent one time watch but nothing more than this.

title: Look at the Cast!
text: So this is what Netflix's most expensive film looks like.Don't listen to what the critics are saying!!!!!This is a damn entertaining film that really delivers on what it promises and this is definitely one of the better Netflix films to be released this year in my opinion.It's actually a lot better than what I was expecting to be honest!

title: A 10 year old could have written the plot
text: 5 stars for Gal Gadot. Everything else is a waste of time. The director picked every single tired scene used and abused in every B action movie and created a script. Cheap and silly.

title: Excellent heist film
text: Absolutely loved this film. Action, adventure , Ryan Reynolds wisecracking , Dwayne Johnson being Dwayne Johnson with one heck of a neck and glamarous Gal Gadot. Yes it does take elements of other action films and it knows it. Don't overthink it and just enjoy the ride. The actors seemed to be having fun and so did I . I hope they make a sequel 😀

title: Waste of time, all done before
text: What do you get if you put Indiana, National treasure and a splash of True Lies in a blender and leave it on for 24hrs and then throw it on a green screen? Red Notice... the extreme lack of originality and the main characters «character» is the same character they play in all other films they make... I don't get it, how can you fund something like this?

title: Cool action comedy - with a nice Egyptian touch to it :)
text: This is a cool action comedy - indicating that it takes all kinds of folks to make the world go round - and that with great team work we can do lots of cool stuff together - such as getting hold of Cleopatra's third egg :) Now here is a 'Red Notice' from my side: As an expert in Egyptian history, mythology and mysticism, I can confirm that Cleopatra's third egg really does exist - not on a material level - but in a spiritual, mystic sense. A bit like the third eye (also called the mind's eye or inner eye) - but Cleopatra's third egg goes even deeper - helping us to manifest joy, love and harmony in our lives.So this is a pretty cool chaotic colossal comedy - which also promotes peace and reconciliation in the US, I think - namely that both Democrats and Republicans can live in peace and harmony in America :)

title: Other movies do it better...
text: If you're looking for dumb, mindless fun, there are still other movies that do it way better. Gal Gadot was a bit annoying in this role, kind of like Carmen San Diego. The script sucked. At one point I felt like I could almost see Ryan Reynolds annoyed with doing a movie that was so sub-par. The action scenes were meh. This is definitely the kind of movie that's so forgettable that a year from now I won't be able to remember the plot. Honestly, John Carter was waaaay better. Or any of the Rush Hour movies. Even Jungle Cruise was more fun. This felt forced.

title: Obvious studio forced and gun point movie
text: This is one of those studio contract movies where the actors have no choice but to do this movie. Story is awful, all the location sets are green screen. The story is and dialogue is just plain awful. Don't worry I forgive you, thankfully the movie was free on Netflix.

text:
Loved the combo..ryan has a way to make me laugh..paired with a seriously hard
rock and oh lala wonderwoman..enjoyed watching every minute..i love flashbacks so you would understand why it happened and how did it come to this..well you better watch it for yourself.

title: Entertaining...
text: "Red Notice" is an Action - Comedy movie in which we watch an Interpol agent trying to track down the most notorious thief. Everything falls apart due to the occurrence of some unexpected events and something has to be done to change it.I enjoyed this movie because it had an interesting plot, filled with plenty of action scenes and much of suspense. The combination of comedy with action was very good and created a nice atmosphere in the movie. The interpretations of Ryan Reynolds' who played as Nolan Booth, Gal Gadot's who played as The Bishop and Dwayne Johnson's who played as John Hartley were very good. The direction which was made by Rawson Marshall Thurber was equally good with the interpretations of the cast, and he presented very well both the plot and his main characters. Finally, I have to say that "Red Notice" is a nice, entertaining movie and I recommend you to watch it because you will laugh and you will have a great time.

title: Good movie but gal gadot not really thing that is suitable for this kinda movies

title: Better Heist: IN Movie or THE Movie?
text:
TLDR: It pains me to write this because I really like everyone in this cast, a lot! ... I just don't like anything _other than_ the cast. Only recommended as background noise.-----
Maybe my excitement and expectations were too high. I realized halfway through that I was less into the story than I was seeing what the much-adored cast were going to do next. A few more mins went by and it was clear that I was only watching it for the cast and, if they were replaced with lesser-known actors, I would have turned it off in the first half hour. Obvious product placement from stars' dueling alcohol brands aside, Red Notice just didn't bring anything new to the table. Gadot played a character marginally different from what she's done in the past, but Reynolds and Johnson just played Reynolds and Johnson. The script was full of clichés. Very clever lines and scenarios may have been funny the first 50 times I've heard them, but they just didn't work for me this time. Finally, the action was marred by poor editing (obvious green screen, too many cuts, shaky cam).Even now, as I look at the score I gave it, I think it might be way too generous, once again taking advantage of my affinity for the cast. I mean, if you like these actors, even with a low score, you still kinda have to see this movie, don't you? That's fine. Pop some popcorn and try to enjoy yourself. Just keep in mind it's probably better suited for background noise than a watch party.4/10 ... +1 pt each for Gadot, Johnson, and Reynolds. Only 1 pt total for everything else.

title: Production look bad
text: The movie is good and funny, but the story was blend. Too much CGI use on the background when this movie budget was over 200 millions. But I was hoping to have a sequel from this movie as well. Perhaps shall do better next time without using much green screen.

title: Oops! (We) did it again...
text: Yup, that's right, yet another pile of steaming Netflix poop!Generally find Ryan Reynolds, and even The Rock, palatable, in a mindless sort of way. Despite heroic efforts from both, they understandably fail to muster much enthusiasm from a limp, wilted lettuce leaf of a script, with a flavour of direction which is still more incompetent than the writing.If the producers had piled up 200 million dollars in 100 dollar bills, doused the whole thing in gasoline and set it on fire, the whole event would be infinitely more entertaining than Red Notice.

title: Best movie of 2021
text: Watch it without any doubt. It has a lot of twist and turns & also very funny and you will not be bored even for one second. Guys just watch it without any thought.

title: Hollywood is definitely dead
text: I was intrigued by the cast, I love Gal and I don't dislike Ryan, but this movie is objectively unwatchable. Maybe some not demanding very young teenagers could find it enjoyable, but in my opinion if you are are older than 15 years old you have no other chance to switch off your television and asking yourself how 220 millions dollars have been spent for this shallow and nonsense film. The standard of Netflix productions are generally very low and poor, we know that and everytime something new comes out we have e further proof of that, but at least most of the times they don't spend an embarassing amount of money as in this case to produce its garbage. Avoid it at all costs.

title: GREAT FILM!
text: Great film! Really loved it. Never thought Dwayne Johnson and Ryan Reynolds tandem would work in a film plus stanning Gal Gadot. Would love to get a part 2 for this!

title: I just loved "Jumanji-Fast and Furious" Johnson
text: I just loved "Jumanji-Fast and Furious" style Johnson pairing with "Deadpool-Free Guy" Reynolds for such a crazy funny Dynamic Duo (battling against a Wonder Gadot) in this "Arsène Lupin/Indiana Jones/National Treasure" cinematographic treasure...

title: As aspected..
text: Not really a fan of blockbusters. Overly priced actors, expensive locations and expensive fights don't really make a good movie.I rather have Netflix to spend their(my)money more wisely.

title: I LOVED IT !! ACTION & COMEDY
text: I really dont get the hate towards this movie. I enjoyed it from the get go. It was really funny , laughed so hard and also there are some action scenes . But i found it to be more comedic than action . Hope next time there will be more fighting scenes .

title: No Juice Box For You
text: Red Notice is a campy, fun movie. With lots of pretty locations. The sound track and pacing remind me of the original Mission Impossible television series.

title: Silly, silly fun
text: Don't take the movie too seriously. It's purely popcorn action fun without any graphic violence. All of the action if fun and even a bit cartoonish at times but still a fun spectacle to watch. Funny dialogue and a few good story twists.

title: What a pice of garbage...
text: Having seen this piece of "entertainment" yesterday evening, I want my two hours of time back. There is absolutely nothing memorable or impressive about this movie that sparks any kind of positive emotion for me. Instead, we have three stars whose performance screams "fast paycheck". There is a constant CGI-massacre during the entire film (for frakks's sake, if the film is set in a jungle, you drive to the frakking jungle to film there) which, to top it off, is on a TV-movie quality level (especially the scene in the arena). The editing is of the quick cut style and the music is just background noise.All in all a forgettable film which leaves behind the question on what the 200 million dollar budget was spent on...

title: The film depicts the world of thieves well, in which no one can be trusted.
text: The story of the film is one of those criminal comedy stories that naturally does not have a certain depth and is more for entertainment, and like most theft stories based on stealing antiquities, it has a high appeal. The film is full of action and thrilling scenes that are balanced with a good and funny comedy and with its attractive and lovable actors, it creates fun and happy moments for the viewer.

title: Light action comedy in the style of "Indiana Jones
text: Hello dear readers!Well, how could one not be interested in the film "Red Notice" when there are so many reviews about it, and the reviews are rather contradictory? Of course, I added it to my "Wishlist" and finally found time yesterday to watch it.In one of the main roles, handsome Ryan Reynolds starred, he plays one of the most elusive thieves in the world - Nolan Booth. He is not only charming and charismatic, he is well educated, smart, he is dexterous and quirky. Having committed many "high-profile" crimes, this time he laid eyes on one of the three golden eggs of Cleopatra, which is stored in the museum of Rome (look at the sights and rejoice, you were there)FBI agent John Hartley is trying to stop Nolan - everyone probably knows the actor "The Rock" - Dwayne Johnson (wow ... he's really huge! He's also 196 cm tall!)Well, how without seductive, fatal women? Of course not! Gal Gadot, whom I personally met recently when I watched the movie "Justice League Zack Snyder"The film itself for me is a hybrid of "Agent 007" and "Indiana Jones". The same rapidly developing events, fights (cultural), chases, struggle for possession of the rarest value. There is not a single moment of "sagging" in Red Notice, there is always something going on here. But you know, I watched 1.5 hours in one breath, and then I realized that somehow it was already enough ... tired ... tired, so the next 30 minutes already looked a little harder. Although I think if I had watched it in the cinema, the whole film would have flown by like one minute.Funny and relevant to what is happening jokes perfectly decorated this film. In general, the film is very dynamic and atmospheric, it looks easy, but somehow does not leave any special emotions after itself. I watched it, enjoyed the action, well, I forgot after a couple of days (which, probably, sounds insulting to the creators and Netflix, because the budget of the film is not a joke)

title: Loved it
text: My wife and I loved this movie and are already hoping for a second. It's a bit predictable but it is meant to be comedy, not a crime-solving thriller.

title: Comedy
text: This is best movie of gal gadot. I like it very much in the way of comedy with action and thriller. What a combination. I am waiting for 2nd part of red notice.

title: Attention to detail not the greatest
text: Starts at "the castle sant'Angelo" but the museum they are in is decidedly not the rooms are far too big and there have never been that many people at that museum even peak tourist season.

title: Predictable film with a stable cast and boring story
text: It seems the film's main budget went to paying 3 popular but stale actors.The story was very predictable and not written well in the slightest. Very few creative parts but mainly a bland story with no real effort in the writingThe cast were also very stale. Ryan Reynolds played himself, Dwayne Johnson just did his usual low-tier acting but Gal Gadot was terrible. Surprised she can't even pull a simple Netflix film role off.If you're expecting cinema-quality stuff, don't bother with this film.

title: Like
text: In this case, "Red Notice" is an action comedy about swindlers, filled with comedic situations and funny dialogues.The complete absence of cruelty, violence, blood, murders and humor below the belt in the frame. The last remark greatly raises the bar for the film compared to the obscene "The Bodyguard of the Killer's Wife" with R. Reynolds ... Probably, D. Johnson was able to influence the script for the better, since he is more removed in "family" films. Or R. Reynolds took up his mind after the success of the family "Protagonist" and decided to no longer go too far with toilet humor ...In fact, a GOOD FILM filled with chases, gunfights, scuffles, special effects and other bells and whistles typical of an expensive action comedy...

title: There was no need to be this bad 😱
text: Three great stars. One big budget. One powerful outlet. But all we got was another Netflix copy and paste high def glossy action cliche. A story so predictable and dull you could have asked a child to write it. So lazy was the story that it felt a little insulting.Gal Gadot is always amazing on film. Fact. Ryan always funny. And The Rock so 'insert same character' here. But all three great stars just took a pay cheque and sleep walked through one cliche after another. It was painful to watch. It looked great. But the story was so weak and the convenient plot twist so damn lazy.It tries to cover for the lazy story with humour. Trying to be 'self aware', but this dint hide the money grabbing intent of such poor writing.Yes you will be entertained. Good actors. Special effects. Action. Fights. Adventure. All the boxes ticked. But this is nothing more than a quickly made cheap cop out created to optimise profits. Nothing more, nothing less.Recommended, but with your brain in neutral.

title: Fun and funny, what's more to ask?
text: Wanted to have some mindless fun after a week's worth of work, and this is exactly what I got. Phenomenal production values and a great action/comedy/adventure combination. As many locales as a James Bond movie, and awesome A-listers in the cast. Don't expect it to be the next Inception and you'll have a lot of fun.

title: A real waste of time
text: Perhaps if Hollywood spent less time on their woke agenda they would produce movies that are worth watching, this is very boring and moronic.when I compare this trash to what was made before- it comes up really short. Compare this to some of the classics from the 1940s and this is awful.

title: Cool twists and great tandem of actors
text: I've missed such films - intriguing, with a good and dynamic development of events, with good jokes. Perfect for a relaxing evening) it's like Lara Croft and James Bond in one but in the modern shape. I personally liked the film and definitely, I will watch it again. 10/10. I do not see anything for which points could be removed. Super emotions after watching, actors done their job perfectly.Especially I liked the funny scene with Ed Sheeran. Many parents need to take note after it.

title: No reason to get attached
text: The film had a basic start, they re-imagined the Stallone/Schneider dynamic from Judge Dredd (1995), which was a weird choice, but it was ok.Ryan Reynolds played himself, the Rock projected his reluctance to get involved in this production. Gal Gadot was also there, and even after all these years, she still cannot act.It felt like a generic adventure film for quite some time, until they gave up at the end and just started throwing stuff at you.When the twist bombardment began I was just laughing cause I gave up trying to understand why anything in this film had to happen at all. I wasn't into the 'big stakes' from the beginning, and there wasn't anything mysterious about this, but in the end, everything was just rendered pointless.There were two funny jokes, one good action shot at the beginning, everything else was supposed to work, but was indeed either CGI or green screen. So all the Indiana Jones-sy stuff (besides the crate reference) didn't feel at all, because it wasn't real-life.They set up the sequel and the film will probably sell, but even as these mindless adventures go, in the end, this was a waste of time.Mildly entertaining/no characters/no story/no attachment out of 10.

title: Shallow in every sense
text:
The only clear positive of Red Notice is its cast. Johnson, Reynolds, and Gadot are interesting draws, which only highlights how disappointing the rest of the movie is. A production that snagged three A-listers would hopefully possess more substance. Red Notice isn't necessarily bad but it definitely isn't good. It simultaneously looks like an expensive blockbuster and a cheap knockoff. The decent CGI is grossly overused, smothering every action scene in inauthenticity. This artificiality extends to the production design as well. Red Notice tries to be global and elaborate, but is failed by limited sets that shrink the world it attempts to construct.Meanwhile, although the cast is famous, their acting is underwhelming. Gadot is wooden and Reynolds' constant quips are downright annoying. Johnson plays his usual role, which isn't much but is fine. Perhaps this is because the material is largely uninspiring. There is a twist that keeps the script from being completely unoriginal, but that only helps so much. In the end, this all adds up to a film that is shallow in every sense. Red Notice may be easy to advertise but is totally void of craft.Writing: 4/10
Direction: 4/10
Cinematography: 6/10
Acting: 5/10
Editing: 5/10
Sound: 6/10
Score/Soundtrack: 5/10
Production Design: 4/10
Casting: 8/10
Effects: 5/10Overall Score: 5.2/10.

He and the rock are excellent together.The movie ended with a pretty good set up for a sequel and I really REALLY hope that they make a sequel and they make it soon.Go see this movie. title: Based off of Indiana Jones.
text: Rawson Marshall Thurber's "Red Notice" should work on paper. It's got a charismatic cast sent globe-hopping to beautiful places on a treasure hunt straight out of an "Indiana Jones" movie. How could it go wrong? Well, for starters, Thurber and everyone involved forgot a little thing called personality. Rarely have I seen a movie that feels more processed by a machine, a product for a content algorithm instead of anything approaching artistic intent or even an honest desire to entertain. When the poster for "Red Notice" was released, most people lamented its Photoshopped, bland nature. They didn't realize how honestly it captured the movie. The film opens with an awkwardly inserted info dump about three coveted eggs that were once the property of Cleopatra. Only two have been discovered, making the missing golden egg into a Holy Grail for treasure hunters, including one of the world's most notorious criminals Nolan Booth (Ryan Reynolds). In the film's relatively effective opening sequence, Hartley catches Booth trying to steal one of the eggs, inadvertently tying the two for the rest of the film into a classic buddy comedy dynamic-the muscle guy and the fast talker. They battle the authorities, a few bad guys, and another criminal mastermind nicknamed The Bishop (Gal Gadot) as they bounce around the world, trying to obtain all three eggs and sell them to the highest bidder. Films like "Raiders of the Lost Ark" and "National Treasure" were clear inspirations on "Red Notice" but to say this movies lacks the identity of great action/adventure movies would be an understatement. "Red Notice." Made for $200 million, none of that fortune was spent on anything that retains a human touch-it's the iPhone app of action movies. So much money, so much charm, so much movie, and yet it adds up to so very little. "Red Notice" is as disposable a movie as you'll see this year, something that most Netflix subscribers will have trouble remembering exists weeks later. In theaters tonight, November 4th. On Netflix on November 12th.

title: Red Notice: A Surprising Action-Adventure Film Packed with Thrills and Humor
text: Red Notice is an action-packed adventure film that left me pleasantly surprised and entertained throughout its runtime. I genuinely don't understand why it received such a low rating, but I'm glad I decided to give it a chance because I thoroughly enjoyed it. The movie reminded me of the Indiana Jones series with its quest for a vanished treasure, clever puzzles, humor, unexpected twists, and non-stop action. The film's plot is full of thrilling moments, and the treasure hunt aspect kept me on the edge of my seat. The mix of action sequences, witty banter, and unexpected plot developments created a perfect balance, making it an enjoyable and engaging watch.In conclusion, I highly recommend giving Red Notice a chance, despite the initial low ratings. It's a fun-filled and exhilarating movie that will appeal to anyone who enjoys action-adventure films with a touch of mystery and humor. I, for one, would eagerly anticipate any future installments.

title: Fun Action Comedy
text: Red Notice stars The Rock, Ryan Reynolds and Gal Gadot. I was interested to read that this was the most expensive Netflix film at 200 million dollars to make, and was intrigued to see what this would be like. After watching Red Notice i can liken it to films like Indiana Jones, Lost City and Romancing the Stone. In other words a fun Sunday afternoon adventure type film. The plot has lots of twists and turns and although it is nearly 2 hours long the film zips along at a good pace never being dull. All three leads have good chemistry, The Rock being..well the Rock, and Gal Gadot putting in a fun performance. Reynolds is good but his performance does border into annoyance at times with the comedic elements. Action scenes are good, although as is the way these days there is too much CGI which can be a bit off putting. All in all though i really enjoyed Red Notice, it is a film i would revisit again and a film i certainly enjoyed watching. Everything is set up for a sequel and i hope they make one.

It goes without saying that the story is terrible but if you are watching this and expecting that then you are watching the wrong movies. The ending was pretty funny though I will not lie.

title: Why do reviewers care about production cost?
text: Reading the other reviews here that cry about how much this cost to make is laughable. Maybe they're all netflix shareholders.Red Notice is an Indiana Jones type treasure hunter movie with well made set pieces and some big stars. The plot is thin in parts but this applies to almost all 20s era movies. We've seen the overpowered Interpol agent in a load of movies in the past few years although the celeb guest appearance was pretty annoying.It's a fun family action movie with humour and interesting locations aplenty, no more no less. Ryan Reynolds is funny and irritating at the same time, the Rock is always fun to watch and Gal plays her part well enough.It's better on a second watch and I'm personally looking forward to the two rumoured sequels. Hope you enjoyed it too :)

title: Action Heist
text: Anwar Says : Like Bollywood, OTT also releases new Hindi Web Series/ Movies on Friday only and I have to settle for Netflix new releases and this release is where the action really lies. Three eggs of Cleopatra and the best of the art stealers of the World are behind them - Dwayne Johnson, Ryan Reynolds and Gal Gadot .Action stretches from corner to corner with funny remarks from Ryan takes me to memoirs of 007 series with Sean Connery and Eva Jones . The movie drags in between but the sharp changing of location would keep you hooked. Some scenes look illogical but you have to give liberty to the director when you are enjoying Action- Heist.Probably our Bollywood should take lessons as to how a normal plot can be made an engrossing one . If free from your WFH some evening, go for it, you won't be disappointed. Delivers what it promises. Have a action packed movie with some excellent casting . Watch with open mind and you would enjoy .#netflix #anwarsays #dwyanejohnson #RyanReynolds #actionthriller #netflixoriginal #cleopatra #cleopatraeggs #whatactionisallabout.

title: Entertaining dialogue, slightly crude but captivating story, rewarding conclusion.
text: This isn't a masterpiece of a movie, but I rate movies within their genre, and (family friendly) action comedies will never be masterpieces by default. For what it is, it does its job perfectly.And not to jump the bandwagon too long, but compared to many modern scripts that try to sell basic stories with basic writing, this definitely stands out for the effort behind it. It's not unique by a long shot, but that would be impossible in its genre, and it still manages to feel fresh. It also smoothly manages to perform subtle sarcastic nods at genre tropes without becoming a cheap parody.

title: Awful

title: Boring and without any substance!
text: Dwayne Johnsen plays Dwayne Johnsen from every other movie, and of course he ends up in the jungle (who had guessed that?)Gal Gadot plays Gal Gadot playing WonderwomanRyan Reynolds plays the same god damn bigmouth like in 99% of the other movies he's in.Why? Because not one of them seems to be capable of anything more than that. Maybe they are? But there's no experiments in Hollywood about that. What sells has to be milked as long as possible until people get tired of this. <-- BTW, when will this happen?Fighting scenes are cut so badly, you barely can follow what's happening on screen!And because at least half of the money has alread spend into actors and directors, everything has to be filmed in front of greenscreen, and spiced a bit with CGI which a sixth-grader could have done better.What you get for your money is boring actors, horrible CGI and bad cutting packed in a mediocre heist plot! Isn't that what we all want, when we go to the theaters to have a good time?

title: My Favorite Comedy-Crime Movie Ever
text: Despite being Netflix's number 1 most viewed movie and having 311 thousand IMDB ratings, Red Notice's 6.3/10 is CRIMINAL. A movie starring Dwayne Johnson and co-starring Ryan Reynolds with Gal Gadot as a likeable antagonist HAS to be rated higher. From an exquisite gallery in Rome to a lavish home in Bali to a Russian prison to a bull fighting ring to an Argentinian jungle, Red Notice is all over the place and it is beautiful. It's Ocean's 3 but comedy gold from start to finish with a twist ending I did not see coming at all. It's truly a shame Red Notice didn't hit theaters and I'm DYING waiting for Red Notice 2.

title: Enjoyable...
text: But could've been so much better - a kind of Indiana Jones meets modern heist caper - generic script and not much of a plot, the whole thing really relies on the charisma of the main stars to pull it through - which they just about do. But surely with just a bit more pizazz and thought this could've been a whole lot more....

title: A fantastic movie
text: In the list of my all time favourite movies....... Hope to see the sequel soon..... love all the cast...a very fine delighted comedy movie.... hope to see the rock ,gal gadot ,Ryan again....just eagerly waiting for the return of the cast again....once again the best movie ever...

title: YAWN
text: Utterly predictable. Indiana Jones vs National Treasure Walt Disney family entertainment at most. Ryan Reynolds' humor was about the most entertaining part. Good cinematography at times. But that is as good as it gets.
