title: Preschool level plot
text: This movie is not even close to being similar to Indiana Jones franchise, as some suggests, but rather a plot concocted by a preschooler Tintin fan. It's somewhat saved by Ryan Reynolds comedic talent, though whose dueting with Dwayne Johnson falls rather flat. Gal Gadot is pretty and all, but her constant turning up out of nowhere, finding the two without any effort what so ever, is an annoyance. That is, up until the big "reveal" by the end. A pretty lame reveal, that is. It must have been a rather costly production, wich makes Red Notice a watchable movie. At the most. A scary thought I got, was not me fantasizing about them in a 3some, but the notion that there seem to be an underlying promise to a sequal. Brrrr, save me!

title: Fun thrill ride!
text: This movie is great entertainment. The three main actors are top notch actors and have great chemistry together. You can tell the three main actors are having fun in the roles they portray with great back and forth banter between them. The writing is witty and contains great twists and turns. It has good action scenes, but it also brings you a nice adventure story with some Indian Jones go find the hidden artifact feel to it. I don't understand all the negative reviews especially from the people that say they've seen this type of movie before. Those negative reviews come from people that need to seriously lighten up and think his/her own poop is somehow gourmet. I've got news for those people as if you've seen one James Bond movie, you've seen them all. If you've seen one Marvel movie, you've seen them all. I'm not trying to knock Marvel or James Bond, but simple to point out that certain criticism doesn't make sense. This movie is kind off a parody of many action/adventure theft movies and they execute it perfectly. Many action and/or theft movies can be so incredibly stuffy and boring, but this movie has a great vibe to it and doesn't take itself too seriously. This movie leaves you on a high note for another theft to take place with an Interpol inspector doing all she can to close in on them. I look forward to the Red Notice sequels.

title: Why
text: I really don't get how this is rated as high as it is, but movie was a total flop. The humor was awful, unless you like over-used d**k jokes and laughing everytime one of them says "oh s*** ". I think that's the only dialogue (or lack of) I heard throughout the movie. There were no likable characters, nobody to relate to, no character growth and all of the protagonists were flat out annoying. Like, yeah sure they added a plot twist near the end, and Ed Sheeran was a nice touch, but frankly, that was the only interesting part of the movie. And then it became the movie that just won't end. The plot was predictable most of the time and many scenes are so overdone. I'm out.

title: Easy watching.
text: If you like Ryan Reynolds and Dwayne Johnson then you'll love this film. A relatively simple script and plot, this film is an easy one to watch and an enjoyable one too. Reynolds and Johnson keep the film funny and Gal Gadot is very good in her role too.

title: That was nice and also good actors were there.
text: That is the appetizer for your free times.. That's nice and also good actors're there. Especcially Rayn Raynold's attracting the viewers besides Dwayne "the Boulder" Johnson and Gal Gadot forsure IMO.

title: Another Johnson and Reynolds movie
text: I am surprises that the most highly paid actors in Hollywood just survive by playing the same characters over and over again. Reynold used to less successful but a much versatile actor. Now it seems like he is just playing dead pool in pretty much every film. Johnson on the other hand has always been playing the alpha male "I am the calvary" roles. It's a cliched boring flick with seen before action sequences with pretty much no story and just a weak plot. I'd rather watch Inception again. Watch only if you are extremely bored and have nothing more important to do.

title: Funny, stylish, and hits big!
text: It's hard to say much without giving anything away, but the way it poses as a solid action-adventure-comedy just helps it hide the intrigue until the right time. A solid 7.5 until the last 30min, and then so much more.

title: So fun
text: Lots of laughs, great one liners and fun ending. I'm a Rock and Ryan Reynolds fan so this worked well for me. Gal Gadot was better in this than as Wonder Woman. Go into it for fun and you won't be disappointed. It's not Oscar worthy and isn't trying to be.

title: I'm sorry.
text: I am saddened and must share my pain with you. I'm sorry. I deeply apologize to all of you. I wasted two hours watching the most mundane and predictable movie of my entire life. What can I say in my defense? There were three of my favorite actors. I'm guilty.

title: Deadpool does Indiana Jones
text: Very enjoyable film which like my title suggests is Deadpool featuring in an Indiana Jones film. Well cast and good story make for real enjoyment. It's not the best film in the world, but thoroughly entertaining.

title: Is it JUST me?!
text: Why does Dwayne Johnson always have to play a MACHO character?! He may be strong in real life but is there any chance he could play a normal character- then there is Ryan Reynolds playing a goofy character.#dreamteamIs it just me is Ed Sheeran made me laugh with his cameo?! Ed Sheeran if you read this, carry on making CAMEOS.

title: THE Average Action Comedy
text: There's a couple pretty stupid plot points, but nothing offensively bad.At the same time, there's a few good scenes as well, but nothing that really shines.This movie is truly the epitomy of the average action comedy. You've seen it all before if you're familiar with the genre; there's nothing new, nor anything remarkable.But sometines that's okay; this is a perfectly average way to spend an evening.I'd say this is best enjoyed with company, so you can riff on the stupid stuff.

title: Stylish and action packed
text: I really enjoyed the ride this film took me on. I thought it was well acted and reminded me of a cross between a good Bond film with Indiana Jones type antics. Bravo Netflix.

title: It's a movie. That's the best I can say.
text: Typical premise and execution. The camera work on some scenes is really good but overall the movie feels hollow and boring. It tries to be funny but the humor is really shallow and dry.

title: FUN!!
text: The movie was perfect for me until the twist, i was wondering how the movie is going to end until the twist, at the end twist makes sense and ended up the movie with some good and satisfying ending, the trio did a great job, the movie is full of fun and action packed, i would recommend it if you want some entertainment for 2hrs.

title: Dont waste your time
text: What happens when you take high profile actors and put them in movie with weak storyline and terrible dialogue? You get Red Notice. It was painful to watch.

title: I liked it
text: An easy-to-watch movie. Great action without a single death. Has something childish in it, but some heavy bad words at the same time. To me it was like a Disney movie made for adults between 30 and 40 years old. I felt the same about Cruella, so if you liked one, you'll probably like the other.

title: Mediocre
text: I only made it a quarter of the way through before I shut it off. What little I saw made me think of Oceans Eleven if it had twice the action and triple the sarcasm. Think Van Wilder meets Heat without the same level of quality. Besides the Irishman, I've come to regret almost every Netflix film I've seen.

title: High profilic characters but low budget movie
text: Producer most probably paid all the money to the three centre characters that he didn't had enough left to use it in the movie! It is a entertaining movie but not a near- 'wow' type of movie. Rock has disappointed me in his last two movies.

title: Loved it!
text: Really shocks me this movie is getting bad reviews. I loved it. Ryan Reynolds is hilarious. The action and story is great. The CGI isn't the best but for a Netflix movie I didn't expect it to be. I'll for sure watch it again and I hope they make a sequel.

title: Gal gadot is the worst comedian & action actress in the history
text: Gal gadot is the worst comedian & action actress in the history , the chemistry between the three wasn't the best the same ryan ryonalds the usual Dawayne johnson nothing new and very boring movie not what i expected.

title: Oh so good!
text: Very cleverly written and wonderfully cast. The movie capitalised on both Johnson's and Reynolds' talents for both action and comedy. This is not to be missed by those who enjoy a joyride of twists, turns, and excitement.

title: I'll give it 5 for Ryan Reynolds
text: This was a fairly average heist plot with an interesting twist. Unfortunately the actual execution wasn't amazing. The first half hour is plagued by "that's not how that works" about every 30 seconds. Every once in a while is excusable, but when major setpieces are bathed in it, even the most capable disbelief suspender would be challenged.It does eventually pick up a tad, though leaves plenty of wide gaping holes in logic for the sake of convenience, and even ties up a couple of early bits that felt jaw droppingly convenient, but ultimately even Ryan Reynolds couldn't bring this beyond average at best.I'd say it's a decent popcorn flick, and has some good points. Just don't go into it expecting anything revolutionary.

title: Reynolds again
text: I have to say that I don't usually watch films with Dwayne 'the rock' Johnson in. Always seen him as overrated. The ONLY I decided to give this a go was because Ryan Reynolds was in it. Usually funny, so I thought why not?To be honest I thoroughly enjoyed it, and have to say that the interaction with Johnson was good. Seems he too, had some comedic timing. I gave this an eight, above the average. I would, and probably will, watch this again as no doubt I missed some of the more subtle comedy. I even enjoyed the cameo, always easy on the eye as she is, all told of you've not seen it, give it a go.

title: Hudson Hawk meets Tango and Cash, covered in The Fast and the Furious sauce!
text:
It's every action and action comedy romp thrown into one half aware, and half unaware romp. I think... it's bad, but I watched it and it was kinda fun. Like aquaman
..

title: Really good comedy action
text: Really entertaining with a few plot twists. All three leads are strong and the setting trying to film matches the strong lead performances. Really enjoyed this!

title: Really horrible script and editing.
text: Honestly after 40 minutes, I couldn't bare to finish it and it's been a long while since I've had to do that.I love Ryan and Dwayne, but they deserved much better than this.

title: A great watch
text: What a pleasure to watch a film that just has a good story line and doesn't have endless gore and boring fight sequences.This was really enjoyable - well written, funny and a real surprise.

title: Meh
text: You don't watch this movie unless you are forced to. Poor performance, fool of cliches, no logic whatsoever. Dwayn Johnson plays his usual character, RR same. Corny jokes from both characters which is really annoying. The plot is very predictable and no characters development. Total waste of your time, very average.Meh.

title: 10/10. Super fun movie!
text: I've read the bad reviews here and some I can even agree with; however, those are irrelevant. This is just a fun movie. Ryan Reynolds delivered his lines perfectly and had me laughing out loud throughout the entire movie. His chemistry with Dwayne was hilarious. Just watch the movie and stop looking for perfection. It's just a fun ride!

title: Corny con caper caper
text: If you like Ryan Reynolds, the movie is passable. One thing that becomes obvious from the outset is that Dwayne Johnson, aka The Rock, isn't an actor.. Ryan Reynolds plays a quick-witted, happy hour lucky, ace art thief whose exploits put him on the most wanted list 18 countries..The Rock tries to play an FBI profiler on an international hunt to track down and apprehend Ryan's character. To our surprise, circumstances compel the two to work together as partners. Not necessarily a new idea, but one that seems to work well on occasion. This doesn't qualify as one of those occasions. There was no chemistry between the two, largely due to the lackluster performance of Dwayne Johnson's character.Dwayne Johnson is a monotonous albeit articulate script reader, and his total lack of dynamic range is painfully palpable. The Rock's aspiration to branch out as an actor is analogous to an aspiring singer with a vocal range of one note (which is slightly out of tune). If anything, I kind ofI felt bad for Dwayne, as he really seemed confident in his abilities. My misplaced pity quickly evaporated as I realized he was likely paid more to make this film than most who would watch the film make in a year.The story consists of the same sequence of events repeated over and over again, albeit in different locations. The action scenes, like the other scenes in the movie, were quite tame and often made little sense. Who cares? It's Ryan Reynolds and the Rock! (kinda' sounds like a song title... like "Benny and the Jets). Like the movie does so often, I digress.All in all, there wasn't much creative effort put into this film. The producers banked on the draw power of Ryan Reynolds and Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson.starring together in an action/buddy flick, and I doubt they were wrong to do so..There isn't much in the way of violence or other issues to warrant a PG-13 rating, and as such, it's a fairly family friendly movie.Would I watch it again?. There are too many great buddy/action movies worth a second watch. This isn't one of them. Do as you will...Five stars is a stretch, but Ryan Reynolds hasn't yet worn out his unique acting schtick. I would like to see Reynolds take on a more serious role, if only to see his potential range., but that's neither here nor there (especially not here).Have fun, kids!

title: Don't listen to the haters
text: This is a great movie for what it is. Stop watching these fun, relaxing movies expecting Shakespeare. It's a great movie to just watch and escape from the real world for a couple of hours. Don't overthink it and you will enjoy it.

title: Wasted potential
text: Great cast, top locations, expensive CGI and a bad, really bad script.I'm astounded to see Netflix getting their priorities backwards again. I hope next try, they will start with a story with telling and then figuring out the numbers.

title: Keep your tongue firmly in your cheek!
text: It's the closest there is to a deadpool 3! Lots of lines that sound like they came from the great man himself! The story line is silly, the Ryan Reynolds one liners are great.

title: Sleep 1 sleep 2 sleep 3 and about to sleep 4
text: *) K Reviews *) ( ( Most of the people including me must be thinking that they duped most of the movie budget in casting 3 people which made the movie "abysmal" as Joey would say. The ending did some justice to the movie, but all the mistakes which can easily be caught up by any movie lover are way more to ignore, hope that the second installment is better than this.

title: Good
text: This is partly a robbery movie, partly a buddy comedy about a lawyer and a criminal, bound figuratively, and sometimes literally with handcuffs (Gadot's personal fans should take into account that she is generally in the background here). But mostly it is a collection of adventurous movie stamps and glossy pictures from all over the world: Egyptian pyramids, jungles, bullfighting, costume ball, Nazis - whatever your heart desires. A separate gift to the Russians is a large fragment in a Russian prison. The prison is something like Wolfenstein Castle on top of a snow-covered cliff. I remember the guard who likes photos of a half-naked Putin on Instagram during working hours. The actors quickly, but with invariably sour faces, move from one shooting pavilion to another. Johnson looks especially confused, who, according to the author's plan, needs to portray two or three conflicting emotions, and this is one or two more than he is used to. But Reynolds, who in contrast with him should bubble like champagne, pulls at best on yesterday's duchess. Their implied bromance causes only excruciating awkwardness, and nothing changes from the visits of Wonder Woman: it seems that these three were simply created not to be together.

title: Mediocre run-of-the-mill fare
text: Good actors with a heist plotline should make this a winner. In practice though it is hackneyed, stale and derivative as well as being a little ridiculous. OK it is billed as a comedy so unrealistic is allowed to a degree, but it fails to be funny aside from a few isolated gags and lines. Not worth the time spent watching it.

title: Cool?
text: To be honest, after the trailer, I myself was in anticipation of something banal and clumsy one-time, and what was my surprise when I saw a quite high-quality product, the most expensive, by the way, for Netflix! A project where the Rock is not clichéd, but on the contrary is completely different - pretty aged and shabby, with bristles, with a different dubbing, in a brown leather coat that is uncharacteristic for him, a white shirt, here he is constantly tormented by everyone to anyone, and at the same time in Russian prison clothes he carries stones and washes dishes! (The question is, where are you such a world-wide creation of a multimillionaire and the most expensive actor of our time!) This is a project in which the beauty Gal Gadot at the peak of her form has never been extremely sexy in the cinema, as she is now, and where she even fully manifests - sexier, than anyone else on planet Earth!This is a project that constantly surprises with a change in the dispositions of forces, a change in the results of the winners, a change in the main characters. A project where a major from 'Silicon Valley' is pleasantly charismatic, where a bust of a law enforcement officer from Interpol sparkles. Where many worldwide locations. But this is all lyrics and a small wish!In general, in my opinion, the FILM MORE THAN SUCCESSFUL! Here 3 main characters are very cool modern superstars! Here is an interesting picture. Adventures. Nice number. One impulse. Single style. No sagging. Watching is interesting, tasty, easy, captures and falls in love, even if there are practically no chases and shootings! So watch the movie for sure and don't hesitate! To be honest, I still don't remember that from the last single copy there was something more suitable than this tape!

title: Fun, mindless pap, but leaves a foul taste in the mouth.
text: Ryan Reynolds barely saves this turkey from complete failure. Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson is loads of fun as the long-suffering straight man to Ryan's constant and quite hilarious jokes, but the rest of the picture is a C average at best.The script is silly and way too complicated for this kind of caper/buddy film. Gadot couldn't act her way out of a paper bag, and without the whole Wonder Woman schtick she's just a bore. The CGI is cheap video-game fare. By the time the big 'reveal' happens, it's far too late for us to give a darn.The cartoon violence destroys any sense of realism forever, and the Interpol agent with the giant boobs demeans the cause of women everywhere.Fun, mindless pap, but leaves a foul taste in the mouth.D+

title: Movie Stars Being Movie Stars
text: This is why Gadot, Reynolds and Johnson are Movie Stars. They hit their mark, deliver their line, wink and nod at the 4th wall, with the I know you love it and will be back for more confident performance of professional entertainers. There is less plot and character development than CGi budget. Don't care. Good fun.

title: Ah well ...
text: It was entertaining in the end. A nice Indy meets James Bond mashup sort of movie with good looking actors that play the same role as they always do.So it was fun. But a movie that I will very soon forget.

title: Fab trio great movie
text: Love this combination.Hilarious bouncing off each other and a comedic plot.Worth a watch, I will be rewatching it no doubt and any movie worth a rewatch is worth a high score.

title: Attempts to be funny
text: Well, its Ryan Reynolds being literally the same character he is in every other movie, and the Rock being the same character he is in every other movie. I had 2 glasses of vodka and still couldn't get into it. This movie wants to be a fun adventure movie with interesting action sequences and quirky humor, but what it it really is is Netflix's latest waste of money. I'm writing extra just to fill the word count for this review, which is the same approach I believe the script writers took towards this movie. Three famous actors who apparently are desperate enough for cash to agree to this film. There's a lot of boring movies, and this is one of the boringest.

title: Fun time
text: Definitely has that 90s action vibe. If you love treasure hunting this is the movie for you. It definitely has Indiana Jones vibe. The chemistry between The Rock and Ryan is what makes this movie fun to watch.

title: Pink Panther meets Raiders of the Lost Arc
text: Nothing original. Lots of stunts, chasing, fighting - you name it. A serial action movie that we've seen countless times already.We watched it because of the featured stars.

title: The worse film I've seen the rock star in
text: Incredibly dull story line . Just a really awful film . My husband said the exact same thing . We were looking forward to it as the casting is amazing , so we were very shocked at how bad this movie is.

title: Not a classic... but Cheesy and good fun nonetheless!...
text: As the title says, don't expect a complicated plot or reasonable explanations for how they appear in various locations suddenly, but it's good enough for a Sunday afternoon film with a 9 & 12 year and a break from the rubbish on YouTube! LOL...

title: Three Is A Crowd, Less Gal Gadot Please
text: Dwayne Johnson does what he normally does. Ryan Reynolds does his best Ryan Reynolds. Gal Gadot does a great wonder woman impression. Very formulaic movie which takes a dose of Dirty Rotten Scoundrels, some Indiana Jones & more world travelling than a James Bond movie and comes up short. Most expensive Netflix movie? They should be able to get a decent CGI bull, alas.

title: It's a goof, just Enjoy it.
text: Don't judge the movie, don't get serious about the plot. Acting is obviously great and Ryan and his humor was just awesome. I laughed at every part of it. Overall a great movie, doesn't deserve the hate.

title: Incoherent
text: The whole movie is incoherent. Good cast but that's it. The movie becomes boring because of the clichés and the non sense twists. Netflix's productions are becoming repetitive and boring. Lately (6 months or so), I haven't been able of finishing most of the series and movies.

title: Must see Acton flick
text: Expectations were very big for Red Notice. Reynolds(hilarious), Johnson(Brilliant) and Gadot(dynamite) smashed it, very funny and entertaining, was a bit cheesy at times but still fully happy with outcome. Great from start to finish and looking forward to the next one.

title: Waste of time
text: Yes, it could be worse. But Ryan, Green Lantern wasn't your worse movie any more. As for other two, who cares. Johnson isn't actor anyway, and this is right up Gadot's level of acting. It is more entertaining to watch Seinfeld for 7th time, then this.

title: Fun, Funny Film starring 3 Super Star Actors/Actress
text: This movie is not for everyone as it has it's slapstick moments & outlandish acts, but that is exactly what I like. The movie is silly, crazy & funny with lots of twists & turns including 3 Hall of Fame Actors/Actress. It's probably the best movie I've seen in 2021.

title: Utter disaster and an absolute waste of freakin' time !!
text: Really bad direction, story, screenplay. Such a drag with cringeworthy moments. Please don't just release movies for the sake of it! The best example for proving that a star cast does not make up for lack of quality story direction!

title: Fun Fun Fun
text: A good family flick with popcorn and pretzels. Just enough action to maintain everyone's attention. You must just sit back and enjoy, don't think. The story was enough for a 7 grader.

title: I love that you don't have to watch ads on Netflix.
text: PLOT: In Red Notice, the Rock pours a COKE over an egg while Ryan Reynolds escapes in PORSCHE before they both drink a couple of NAME BRAND alcohols and talk about ETSY and watch THE GREAT BRITISH BAKE OFF on a SONY TV (which is available on NETFLIX in the US).Anyway, that was the first 15 minutes and at that point I fell asleep and when I woke, I didn't feel the need to go back. I was only going to forget the movie in a few weeks anyway, so I saved myself the trouble.It's a great strategy to make such forgettable movies. Now NETFLIX viewers can endlessly scroll and choose the same movie they've already watched but forgotten because it was so generic and vacuous.By all means watch it. But when you're on your deathbed, don't bemoan the fact you could have done more with your life. I'm just glad to not be watching adverts anymore.

title: Enjoyable twaddle
text: Very enjoyable silliness, following a well worn but successful Indiana Jones-style formula. Add The Rock, the most beautiful woman in the universe and Netflix's love child Ryan Reynolds, and you've got a licence to print money. Loved it 8/10.

title: Great Movie
text: Dont let the negative reviews deter you, it is a must watch fun movie. It is most definetely not a masterpiece or some mind twisting narrative. Just keep your expectations grounded.

title: What in the Indian Jones!
text: I LOVED THE BEGINNING, the movie started off so well, but nothing after that compared. Red Notice was full of cliché's and actors playing their most popular characters, there's nothing new here. Ryan Reynolds is Deadpool without his suit, Dwayne Johnson is a version of Luke Hobbs and Gal Gadot is Wonder Woman without her powers. Though Gal Gadot (The Bishop) didn't have the passion of a villain, nor expressions, she seemed like great eye candy. Ryan (Nolan Booth) and Dwayne (John Hartley) had such good chemistry, I'd love to see that in more movies. Nonetheless, Red Notice is entertaining and fun. It's shot well, the visuals draw you in, and it's perfectly paced.The action scenes and stunts don't disappoint. The heist is barely technical so extremely easy to follow. The twists are fun, neither surprising nor shocking. Avoid logic though, it will fail you at numerous spots.Overall, it was nice, it was fun and it was entertaining.

title: Fun but it's missing something
text: I found that this film was fun to watch but I feel like it's always the same type of characters for Dwayne Johnson and Ryan Reynolds, the stoic character meets the funny one and that's it (I haven't seen much of Gal Gadot's works but she is lovely to watch!). Anyway, I found the characters a bit boring and some things were to be expected in a film like this (I won't say because of spoilers) but you know what's going to come.But, I did find the story quite fun to watch and the action scenes were pretty good, the dialouge could be a bit weird at times and I missed a few bits (mainly from just not understanding something).

title: Great comedy
text: One of the funniest movies I have ever seen. Even though it is not super complex movie yet it is funny and nice comedy to watch during bored evenings.

title: CHEER! - (8 stars out of 10)
text: The stage curtains open ..."Red Notice" starring Dwayne Johnson, Ryan Reynolds, and Gal Gadot was everything it was billed to be ... and more. It is the perfect blend of comedy and action with plenty of twists and turns, adventure in exotic locations, and a worthy premise to match. I've read some pretty lowly reviews for this film and I honestly don't know what else they could've been looking for. This movie has it all.We are introduced to the story by way of a quick history lesson on Cleopatra and the three priceless, bejeweled eggs that Mark Antony gave to her, that have been scattered over time. Two of the eggs's locations are known, whereas the third is lost to the winds. Enter our characters who have more than just a curious interest in the eggs. We have our FBI Profiler, John Hartley, and two art thieves, Nolan Booth and his competition (as it were), Sarah Black who is also known as the Bishop. The race is on to find the last egg, each one trying to get to it first and chaos ensues.I know that the story is a bit weak and some of the double crosses going on doesn't compute, but what a fun ride this movie was! The cinematography was awesome with some excellent special effects. Ryan Reynolds was at his comedic best, and you could tell everyone was having a lot of fun with this film. It had your cat burglar appeal with some good "heist caper" moments, and a healthy dose of Indiana Jones thrown in.Movies are escapism - they are made to entertain us, make us smile, laugh, and excite us to elaborate stories and adenalin raising action scenes. On this note, "Red Notice" delivers all the goods. I had a lot of fun watching it, and am looking forward to seeing it again sometime down the road. And if all the indications at the end come true, then hopefully we'll be getting a sequel as well. 8 strong stars out of 10 and a high recommend.

title: Red Notice is a mediocre movie
text: Red Notice is a mediocre movie. In addition to the cast, the film does not stand out, and only Ryan Reynolds stands out from the actors. Typical scenario, typical location. The whole film is just a set of scenes that the viewer has seen more than once in dozens of films. Red Notice is a movie trailer, everything interesting from the film has already been shown in the trailer on Netflix or Youtube. I can not advise anyone such a film.

title: Meh!!!
text: Convenient, contrived and insipid.Don't take me wrong, it is extremely fast paced, jumping from France to Russia to Spain to Argentina from one set piece to another and with "witty" one liners and predictable character banter but nothing inspiring happens. We have seen Ryan Reynolds doing this character million time and so did The Rock and Gal Gadot has never played anything complex and layered. So we get a beautiful looking serving of same old same old.It's vanilla ice creams decorated with snowflakes.

title: Fun, fun, fun ..
text: It's comedy and fast paced. Witty full of action. Too much guns and the car chase was pointless but the twists and plot was really good. They even whistled Raiders of the Lost Ark. Always impressed with Dwayne and Ryan is Ryan.I think this makes my top 100 just for giggles.Sadly there will be a sequel and it won't be done as well.

title: True lies but worse
text: Same formula...the rock or arnold...same character...same story...gal Godot is pretty but that's where it ends. Every ridiculous moment she happens to show up and be right there with them...stupid, predictable and played. Oh and they found a car that was stored for 80 years that happened to start right up. Can we make a movie with an original idea for ince?

title: Enjoyed it
text: Good movie for a friends/family night. I enjoyed watching it and I recommend watching it. And don't care about its rating.I hope to see part II soon.

title: Predictable and no brain required to watch
text:
Predictable heist movie...
Ryan Reynolds is the only redeeming feature...he's his usual comedic self (nothing new but gives an otherwise bore fest, some humour).The Rock is....the Rock, he plays himself very well but don't expect anything that you haven't already seen in his other movies.Gal Gadot has a good part but just doesn't come across as a serious thief...more a spoof version of a thief.Overall it passed a couple hours but it was boring in my opinion and only watched to the end as family were watching also and I was hoping it'd get better.....it didn't.Very forgettable and a one time watch, for me.

title: As cliche as it gets
text: Not to spoil the movie, but if you can't pick the plot twists before they happen in this one, you better still hold an adults hand whilst crossing the street.

title: Really Enjoyable Action Comedy, But.....
text: In my humble opinion it lacked killings. The certificate should of been bumped up to the next level and not be on a "safe for kids to watch",one. It reminded me of the A-Team TV series back in the day, where hundreds of bullets are flying everywhere yet no one gets killed. Still, the movie itself I found to be entertaining and as per, Ryan Reynolds is on top form.

title: Really disappointing !!
text: Big disappointment. Besides a few funny lines from Reynolds there is nothing else to be excited about. For such a big starcast it looks like a very half hearted attempt to make a movie. Predictable plot, mediocre acting, bad CGI. Characters trying to explain twists and turns like they are addressing a child. I do not care about the illogical plots of interpol, russian prison in middle of nowhere, same cop turning up in different part of the world and what not. I enjoy escapism but this is just plain boring and banal. If you have difficulty sleeping put this on in the background, will definitely help.

title: Loved it
text: This movie is like Dead Pool meets Indiana Jones Has a stellar cast, and everyones character jives. Well written, great script,.. sooo funny... Sarcastic dead pool funny. And action packed the whole way.

title: Easy to follow
text: If you want to chill out and half watch an action movie then this one is for you. They explain everything to you every few minutes. Ryan Reynolds is funny. The rock is big and strong and Gal Gadot is pretty. They steal stuff. OK.

title: Super movie
text:
--->expected more comedy
--->expected more action sceans
--->by the way super movie.--->good story
--->good twist
--->Ryan performance excellent
--->Ryan comedy excellent
--->and that's a joke🤣🤣
--->I think someone is angry on me
--->good.

title: A Disappointing and Generic Action-Comedy
text: Red Notice is a movie that wastes the potential of its star-studded cast and its globe-trotting premise. The plot is simple: an FBI agent named John Hartley (Dwayne Johnson) teams up with a notorious art thief named Nolan Booth (Ryan Reynolds) to catch another art thief known as the Bishop (Gal Gadot), who is after three priceless eggs.The movie has some moments of action and humor, but they are few and far between. The chemistry between Johnson, Reynolds and Gadot is not enough to save the movie from its bland and predictable script, which relies on clichés, stereotypes and lazy jokes. The action scenes are uninspired and over-the-top, with no sense of danger or excitement. The plot twists are obvious and contrived, with no logic or coherence.The movie also suffers from a lack of originality and identity, as it tries to emulate other successful action-comedies, such as the Ocean's series, the Fast & Furious franchise, and the Mission: Impossible movies, but fails to capture their charm or style. The movie feels like a generic and forgettable Netflix product, with no memorable scenes or characters.Overall, Red Notice is a disappointing and generic movie that does not live up to the expectations of its cast and genre. It has some moments of fun and entertainment, but they are overshadowed by its flaws and shortcomings. It's not a terrible movie, but it's not a good one either.

title: Enjoyable ride
text: Thoroughly enjoyable movie with likeable characters. Contains Much tongue in cheek humour and obvious Improv, alongside action sequences paying homage to Indie and more. Definitely worth a watch.

title: Generic AF
text: Im usually pretty chilled with that kind of movies, not expecting too much. This one however shall not pass. Too generic, not much funny, acting is just servicable. Verdict : waste of time.

title: VERY ENTERTAINING AND GREAT ENDING...
text: Three great actors in this action/comedy movie! If you like movies with suspense, mystery with humor, it's worth watching for sure... NOT SURE HOW ANYONE GAVE IT A BAD SCORE? Worst score I would ever give it would be a 7...

title: Instantly forgettable
text: You can forget the movie while watching, it's that forgettable. Ryan Reynolds carries like normal, Dwayne and Gal are weak like normal.Hard to see why this had to cost 200 million.

title: Very good action
text:
I don't understand why so much negative ratings. It wasn't Oscar candiate, but it was great pleasure to watch.It had pretty decent twisty story and great action. Cheap 3D effects bit ruin the party, but otherwise OK. Nothing that original though, but if you are fan of treasure hunts, this is for you.Can't be bad movie when Dwayne Johnston is in it! Good acting by everybody else too.It's not good as 10 points, but 7-8 for sure!I'm really looking forward for a sequel.Bottom line...

title: Entertainable
text: Seems like Ryan Reynolds is stuck in Deadpool's character. Hoping to seee him do something new. Ryan's and Rock's chemistry is good in the movie though the story is predictable.

title: Fun and Engaging
text: This movie is pretty much a mix of Indiana Jones, National Treasure, and The Hustle. It was very fun and engaging. Loved the ending. There weren't any parts that moved too slow, and it wasn't completely filled to the rim with action, which I really enjoyed.

title: Pretty bad even with very low expectations .
text: Sometimes u have to put your brain on hold to enjoy a movie somewhat , but Red Notice requires u to be able to do so on a very high level .This movie has so many unconvincing characters and unlikely moments , in a story that is basically nonsense , there is not much to be positive about.It felt i had do some effort to finish the movie , was kinda glad when overFeels like the movie took some inspiration from James Bond , Indiana Jones , 48 hours , Oceans 11 and surely some others , but then in a bad way that doesnt work , and surely cant be saved by any plottwist .Rock is the most convincing of the 3 main players . But not much effort was needed for this achievement .I wonder if he will ever somehow land in a good movie , he is kind of a big name by now , but this is just another bad movie on his list .

title: Loved it
text: Great team up of actors that gave me comedy, thriller, twist and turns. Art robbers, agents from around the world hunting down the number one or two art thieves, well bath or one, two and three. I found it as a great movie to watch while laying in bed before going to sleep. Everyone has to give it a chance. Well worth the time.

title: Something to watch...
text: ...yet completely forgettable. I really look forward to never thinking about this movie again, as harmless as it may be. This last sentence solely exists to meet the minimum character requirement. Nope, still not enough characters. This should do it. Seriously? This is starting to look like a gimmick. Refrigerator...................................... Oh come on! This is ridiculous. Umm, ihfrcnmiommgfcjyfbjiojnnnhgbnkkmmkl. I give up. I once saw a Capybara in the wild when I was in Brazil. I was like "what the heck was that??" They're bigger than you think. It was like some weird, giant guinea pig.There we go. Byyyeee.

title: Pretty nice
text: Pretty nice movie with a nice plot even if too unnecessarily complicated without the slightest sense, it has too many small twists that carry on the plot with extreme effort. But the film is still very enjoyable and entertaining.

title: Move on, nothing to see here.
text: Imagine someone wins a truly obscene amount on the lottery (in this case, a reported $160m), spends the next few months throwing it absolutely everywhere and then ends up crying in the newspapers having wasted all of it ... well, apart from crying part, this is how I feel about Netflix's 'Red Notice'. Currently, it has an IMDB rating of 6.6 and I'd like to question those who decided that this film warranted such a generous score.This offering reminds me of a kid on a bike pulling wheelies, showing off, shouting to their friends "look what I can do!" without having any real skill at all. 'Red Notice' is a pretty boring and unbelievable pseudo-comic romp through the world of Interpol and organised crime. Ritu Arya plays an Interpol inspector who, at one point in this awful creation, is seen brandishing an enormous hand gun whilst she herself is dressed in a skimpy evening gown - just where on earth was she concealing it until now?Chris Diamantopoulos plays, well I'm not really sure who, but he's a bad man with an equally awful English accent with forced pronunciation. The dubbing on his character has been polished to the point where it's as plain as as the nose on my face that no on-set microphone (hidden or otherwise) could possibly reproduce every last detail of inflection quite so clearly as we have in the finished product.Dwayne Johnson and Ryan Reynolds are just themselves - as you would expect in a buddy movie. Nothing special, true to form and exactly as described on the outside of the package. The film stumbles over its own untied shoelaces for the best part of 2 hours, with nothing to show for itself apart from the money thrown in every direction and the weak and feeble storyline (if you could call it that). Netflix must be questioning their investment as nothing says "Houston, we have a dud" like wall-to-wall promotion.

title: Where Nobody Noticed.
text: This movie is basically about how Ryan works as a thief trying to steal some gold eggs,but he who himself gets kidnapped by another thief known as Bishop and about a group of cops that tries to catch the person.There are basically 4 main characters here, one is the main thief that is ryan and the other is the ultimate thief who keeps on kidnapping the other thief and making ways to make him work for her. There is a main cop and the special agent that was hired by the cops or not, we dont know.It is an amazing movie becasue as mysterious as it gets , the more funny it was getting and over all the actors did such a gopd job that I watched 2 hour of the film and I couldn't guess the polt twist it had that made the movie that it is!As mentioned above about the plot twist, I loved the last scene in particular because that is when the whole movie tuerned out to be, because of the amazing turn it had.The lesson I have learned is that never judge a book by it's cover.It can be watched by everyone, from age i guess 13 to any all the age groups elder then this because i am pretty sure everybody will like it and that is why i give it a A star rating.

title: A Worthwhile Watch!
text: If you like nonstop crash, bang, wallop, action, then this movie's well-written story and script is for you.With Ryan Reynolds and Dwayne Johnson leading the solid cast, the script keeps the viewer glued to the screen until the end - which I won't spoil for you.Thoroughly recommended - A1+.

title: Watched it twice, mehhhh
text: I gave Red Notice a second shot, and well, it left me with a resounding "meh."On the positive side, the comedic moments, largely fueled by the charismatic performances of Gal Gadot and Ryan Reynolds, bring some life to the movie.The plot fails to break free from predictability, leaving little room for genuine excitement. The storyline lacks the twists that could have elevated it beyond the ordinary. It all feels a bit too formulaic, making the overall experience less thrilling than expected.I watched it with friends the second time, and all of them were bored...there are better options...

title: A High-Octane Adventure with Star Power and Thrills
text: "Red Notice" is an electrifying action-comedy that delivers a thrilling and entertaining cinematic experience. This star-studded film, featuring Dwayne Johnson, Ryan Reynolds, and Gal Gadot, combines explosive action sequences, witty banter, and globe-trotting escapades to create a captivating ride that keeps viewers on the edge of their seats.The movie follows an Interpol agent, a skilled con artist, and a renowned art thief as they team up to track down a notorious criminal mastermind. The plot twists and turns, taking audiences on a wild journey filled with unexpected surprises and exhilarating set pieces. The chemistry between the lead actors is palpable, and their charisma shines through, elevating the film to another level."Red Notice" excels in its ability to balance thrilling action with comedic moments. The film seamlessly blends intense fight scenes, breathtaking chases, and clever one-liners, creating a perfect blend of adrenaline-pumping sequences and laugh-out-loud humor. The well-crafted script and sharp dialogue add depth and entertainment value to the overall experience.Visually, "Red Notice" is a feast for the eyes. The stunning locations, impressive production design, and sleek cinematography contribute to the film's high production value. The action sequences are expertly choreographed, bringing a sense of excitement and spectacle to the screen.Beyond the action and humor, "Red Notice" also explores themes of trust, betrayal, and the pursuit of justice. The characters navigate treacherous waters, testing their alliances and challenging their own moral compasses. These deeper layers add complexity and depth to the narrative, making the film more than just a thrilling ride.In conclusion, "Red Notice" is a high-octane adventure that delivers on its promise of entertainment. With its star power, thrilling action, and comedic charm, this film is a must-watch for fans of the genre. So buckle up, prepare for a wild ride, and immerse yourself in the excitement and intrigue of "Red Notice."

title: Reynolds is the same in every movie
text: Except this time it's worse. The 'plot' was disconnected and difficult to navigate and the entire movie was cliche and quite boring.At least it was Dolby.

title: People are spoiled brats. Big time.
text: I didn't even know about the movie, saw it on Netflix and watched it casually. 11/10 I laughed soo hard.People are so spoiled rating this lower than 8. I actually think they are hating on purpose. Or just cant relate to the jokes and coolness kd actors, because they are dorks themselves and hate on the actors.

title: How could they spend 250 Millon on that
text: It is truly astounding what a waste of money and talent this movie is. The writing is so bad that it doesn't let the actors really do their trick of making the conversations feel normal and organic. Then there are the special effects where you just want to stop watching. The green screen in combination with the lighting makes it so obvious they are in a studio that it completely ruins any pressure from the situations. The plot itself is nothing to special pretty straight forward, the twist is unexpected and honestly the best part about this movie.

title: decent heist movie
text: The film did feel a bit like an A-lister Hollywood cash grab with Gal Gadot playing an out of character role and the Rock and Reynolds playing as the only types of characters they ever do. But as a whole the movie itself was not terrible and worth watching.

title: Well worth watching when norhing else is on
text: It started promesing, but into 15 minutes its gets boring. The chemestry is not existing and some of the scenes are just dumb.Plus the story with the golden eggs, is just an insult to history.

title: Finally some fun!
text: This is why we go to the movies! The quick banter, the adventure, the action, the amazing backdrops and sexy stars with charisma. I hope Hollywood keeps making movies like this. As a huge fan of the "Uncharted" game series I saw the Uncharted movie I wanted to see in this film! Tons of similarities in style and I'm 100 percent ok with that! Now fingers crossed the ACTUAL Uncharted film is at least this good.I haven't written many reviews on here but as a film buff I had to write a review for this one. Especially after all the terrible films Netflix has gotten us hyped up for and let us down with time and time again. I hope critics take note that the general public wants more films like this that don't take themselves so seriously all the time!What a great escape this was. More more more!

title: Generic...
text: ...turd of mediocrity. Ryan Reynolds plays the character of Ryan Reynolds, as always. The Rock is The Rock. Gal Gadot is hot but flat. The acting is tepid, the plot generic, blah, blah, blah.

title: Super love it.
text: The entertainment I was looking for. Action plus comedy in one. The characters play their roles well. This movies has the identity of great action/adventure movies. There's a lot of running and a lot of banter, which makes it so entertaining and fun. I don't really care much of all other movie aspects as long as its entertaining and the characters are adorable. I love this film.

title: I stop watching after 15 minutes
text: Ryan Reynolds is on my black list for a longer period with a reason. His acting is perhaps funny for 7-10 years old kid.But I tried to watch a movie anyway, but action movie with stupid jokes just don't go together.

This cast is just too good to not watch this movie. As I was very excited thanks to the cast, I had high expectations. And I am not disappointed. At all. Ryan Reynolds is just amazing with his jokes, which fit perfectly. The storyline is full of nice twists that don't get boring throughout. The only thing I would pick out - CGI is not the best for the budget this movie had. Some shots were a bit painful for my eyes.. Overall 8/10, would recommend for sure.

title: An insufferable watch- to say the least
text: Exotic locations; hackneyed plot(see Jackie Chan Chinese Zodiac replacing the eggs with the 12 zodiac sculptures and Karate with guns), average acting for two big stars, and Ryan Reynolds, good grief...his cheesy, hard-to-crack-a-smile. Wanting gay lines had me longing for the movie to end...It was an insufferable watch.

title: Surprisingly Good!
text: When I saw the trailer for Red Notice I immediately knew I wasn't going to watch it. But the reviews on IMDb were good so I gave it shot and this film didn't disappoint! If you're tired of seeing Ryan Reynolds' smart-ass comments and just seeing The Rock again in another movie, this might not be for you. Otherwise enjoy the show!

title: Generic comedy, but nothing too special
text: Expected more from a Ryan Reynolds movieGot a chuckle out of it but it fell flat in some scenes, and the interaction between Ryan and the Rock felt off and forced throughout the movie.

title: Action packed movie
text: One of the best movies I have seen in 2021. Amazing actors and surprise ending. The movie kept me at the edge of my seat. It was even better than I thought. I would highly recommend this movie.

title: How?
text: How did they mange to make a film with Ryan Renolds, Gal Gadot and Dwayne Johnson it so bad? Wooden acting, weak script and just bland.Looked like they were all their doing their best Bruce "im only acting for the paycheck these days" Willis impression. Looked like they were obliged to do it.Resorted to checking my phone at points during watching it to entertain myself instead....

title: Nothing about this movie is unique or anything but obvious.
text: Just by looking at the cast you really can get away with not watching this movie. Everyone does what every character in any similar movie does. Dumb men and invincible women like so many other movies of this type. Watch 15 minutes and you basically understand and get the entire movie. title: meh
text: It was just ok. I love dwayne johnson and Ryan Reynolds I was excited to see them in a film together but for me it didn't click. I found myself flicking through my phone at some points. Alot of it looked very faked and the jokes felt forced.
