text: I expected good action, story and visuals. Well cinematography was good, overall visual sense was upto mark but the story was not anything near to making sense (Just cliched plot i mean).Acting from main cast was really good in their roles but some roles looked so forced.Overall i expected more from this piece in terms of substance or even entertainment.

title: Not great, easy to forget
text: I must say i was looking for this - fan of Dwayne and Ryan, used to be fan of Gal but I'm getting tired of her "acting". The movies is... Well not great, lots of plot holes, teleportation, everyone's super smart but always got tricked. Why even got for third if you should first steal 2 from gal. Following someone. This is more like movie for kids. Just don't think about it and let it on, browse on your phone. I hoped Dwayne will go berserk and break some necks but no. I also start to think that writers really believe that kick 120kg muscle guy is like blowing candle.

title: Bland
text: Ryan Reynolds plays a smarter Van Wilder but yet again he plays van Wilder in every movie. Found myself scrolling through my phone more often than not.

title: More money doesn't mean more quality
text: Action Adventure heist movie where Netflix hires the highest paid stars in Hollywood to carry a poor script. Whenever a scene is too big or expensive it becomes cgi and the crowds become 3D assets. Plenty of scenes are ripped from other movies, sure you can call them parody, but this movie doesn't go far enough to make it. If you can't live with Ryan Reynolds jokes don't watch it, most of the movie is his jokes. Low quality all around.

title: Had potential to be great...
text: I suppose it is pretty brave to put a comedic spin to a movie about art-theft and arm-dealers, and this movie proves why. The light-hearted and superficial script cannot possibly in any version of reality carry a plot like this. The cast consists of all great actors and I am sure they were able to do perfectly if only the writers and producer had let them. But for some reason we are left with this forgettable garbage-fire of a cashgrab to which there will surely be a sequel. I know that there is people in Hollywood who can truly make good movies, but I do not think they showed up for work when Red Notice was made and that is a waste.

title: Even The Rock couldn't save this one.
text: Cliche after cliche after cliche. Predictable and even the twists and turns are boring and unbelievable. I am not sure how these three first tier stars were talked into making this. I presume the director was a friend or there was a huge payday involved.Don't waste your time watching it.

title: Badly written
text: This is a film that looks like it has been written by a mediocre film student. It's boring! What a pity....with such good cast. Shame on the producers and the director....and writers. No depths, no story at all. Very bad....don't waste your time because life is short!!!!

title: Missed Chances
text: It's star-studded but this doesn't guarantee a quality film. The actors, charismatic in their own right, seem too wooden, caricature-like in the way they approach their respective roles. They lack intensity in this film. Come to think of it, acting is not the problem but the lackluster, lackadaisical script is the culprit. It doesn't provide the excitement that the actors can deliver if given a good script to work on. Even supposed funny lines sound trite or cliched.It's a waste of acting talent, and it's disappointing for the fans of these popular, respected actors.

title: Classic raynolds charm
text: First off all, I love how ryan raynolds is at his prime in this. He and the rock are doing their best to keep the movie entertaining. They have a great chemistry. But unfortunately poor acting of supporting characters like gal gadot makes it a mediocre movie. Her acting is mostly off and exaggerated caricaturebeIf they had a good actress for the role, this could be the movie of the year.

title: How difficult can it be
text: Again and again we are tricked by flashy promotion, great stars that aren't actually bad but are working with awful and cringe material that just have no bigger point.It's one of those movies that you wanna watch and not being pressured to follow it all because it isn't that smart or good. You could also start watching it from 30min in and still have same conclusion and feeling, or you could stop watching it at halftime being satisfied with what you saw and forgetting it after 2 hours.Chemistry behind Ryan, Dwayne and Gal is at moments great, at moments stretched but always on point and keeping you watching. However story is dull as it can be, it's overblown, trying to be smart but being dumb, forcing itself and failing to actually be innovative. It tries to sell you movie because of people that are starring in in instead of actually being good and because of that wanting you to see it.It will get you laughing couple times, and having a cringe face more often but when it comes to challenges it has non, and surprises are non existent because you probably aren't paying much attention to story as just letting movie play out.

title: A kind of silly Indiana Jones
text: I feel generous and i say that this film It's for Indiana Jones what Austin Powers is for James Bond.Except the fact that It's not a parody with intention, but an easy, silly and sometimes funny movie.It's watchable and this is the best thing i can say about it.

title: Way over the top
text: It's an okay movie at best. But the plot is too convoluted, the action is just chaotic and overall there's much better films to watch if your looking for a caper flick.

title: Assumes you're a complete imbecile
text: This movie is unwatchable if you're not retarded or a child. There are so many cliches and plotholes it's unbearable.The *only* thing that's sometimes slightly entertaining is Reynold's signature commentary.

title: A Will Ferrell like comedy movie
text: Oceans 11 combined with Will Ferell humor. It's ok to watch not too bad, but nothing very amusing as well. The so great plot twist at the end is not so great.

title: Indiana Jones meets AliExpress
text: That's it. That's the movie.It's a Indiana Jones movie, from AliExpress.Would not recommend it. You should watch Indiana Jones instead.Ps. Loved Chris Diamantopoulos performance.

title: Muppets
text: Easy going film slow and steady easy to watch and forget film reynolds and Johnson playing their usual roles with gal gadot as the cherry on the top sadly predictable but set in nice location's ,Muppets most wanted was a better heist film and it has catchy songs.

title: How did this cost $200m?
text: You have to wonder where the $200m went for this film, I assume $190m of that was on salaries of the people involved and the rest was on horrendous CGI.I'm not even exaggerating in saying 90% of the movie is green screen, almost George Lucas Star Wars prequels bad CGI. They go to multiple locations and it looks like a Syfy channel movie at times. I get covid would have restricted the travel but they could have shot these on a studio lot.You look at Terminator 2 which is godlike and had a similar budget and was released 30 years ago and it looks 100 times better than this.As for the movie it has the usual Ryan Reynolds and Dwayne Johnson humour with Gal Gadot popping up every time something good happens to ruin it for everyone.If you have Netflix then watch it to pass 2 hours otherwise you aren't missing anything.

title: Not worth to watch
text: Classic Ryan Reynolds movie, but worse. Maybe it's because Rock is in the movie. It's not a good scenario i hate it. The movie is full of cliches. Some reviews like this "it's a action comedy movie what did you expect" we want to watch good movie .u moron.

title: Indiana jones parody?
text: And that's all..sorry..jokes are not funny, the plot is not working. For me. Not sure where's the "aw" moment..and it's too long, better play candycrush at the end.

title: Harmless Adventure Film that is completely mediocre in every way.
text: Gal Gadot is stunningly gorgeous. Ryan Reynolds is a cute nice guy. The Rock is a cute Wrestler turned actor. Put them all together and let them do their schtick. Make it a globe-trotting CGI laden action film and as it keeps jumping from place to place, the audience is rewarded with ridiculous plot contrivances, corny humor, unrealistic action scenes and a cheap thrill ride of a movie.If you want a dumb pop-corn movie I guess this it. There is nothing serious about this movie from the get go. From the McGuffin they are all chasing, to the ridiculous gangster and his special room that they must breach, to the finale in a treasure room, the writers went back to Mission Impossible and James Bond and about a zillion other past stories and hobbled together this thing that is based upon the charm of the three leads to overcome how everything is preposterous.Throw Gadot into hot red ballroom gown and a bathing suit, and I'm pretty happy. If you find the oh so overdone smarmy syrupy humor that is now become Reynold's trademark acceptable, then you'll be happy. The Rock plays it fairly straight and goes along for the ride. Technically it might have worked better with someone who is not a roided out giant in the role, but for the most part he is fine as a mostly straight-man to Reynold's tiresome jokester. So his fans will be happy.Bored is not really the right word for this movie, the leads are all so polished and the action keeps it moving. But this is definitely a sugary dumbed-down version of appealing.It's a time killer, not a must see.

title: it is an ok effort
text: 3 big names... must be good, right? Turns out to be quite average. All three play their typical characters, nothing new. Storyline is formulaic but decent enough. It is somewhat entertaining, definitely could have been better. It felt like they couldn't agree on the direction and then compromised, and settled on the safest route.

title: Cheesy and boring
text: This is what cinema and tv have come to, put in some handsome and beautiful actors, throw around some cgi, make terrible jokes, put in a twist that has been done a million times befortheythe film is Cheesy, terrible script, terrible acting, terrible jokes, terrible cgi, terrible twist. People will watch it and like it just because Ryan Reynolds, Gal Gadot and The Rock are here, and they did not put in the slightest effort at all. The plot is very mediocre, the wrtiting is terribly boring. I fell asleep at least 4 times. Physics don't apply at all. The twist tries to be clever but fails at every level.

title: What's going on Netflix?
text: So Netflix pretty much gave a hack writer and a hack director to write and direct this non sense? This guy can't direct and he surely can't write. He gathers all the cliches and writes terrible lines and you have Alist actors to read those lines. I'm sure everyone got paid except viewers who had to suffer this nonsense.

title: A useless movie
text: I confess I expected much more. In the end, what I saw was Ryan Reynolds playing another version of Deadpool (he keeps playing the same part after that), Dwayne Johnson playing himself, again, and a sure downgrade for Gal Gadot, a wonder woman not so wonder. The same jokes over and over, the same Indiana Jones wannabe and in the end the impression of watching a sucession of dejá-vu clips. An absolute spam.

title: Can Ryan Reynolds play ANY other character?
text: It's as if Reynolds is incapable of breaking free from his Van Wilder persona. His witty, smart-ass, comedic jive was funny in Van Wilder. It was hilarious in Dead Pool. But after four more movies of the same shtick it's just tired now. And Gal Gadot as a villain is like putting a spiked collar on a Golden Retriever. You just can't take it seriously. The Rock does his same boring act. Red Notice is just another cookie cutter action movie with some big names hoping you will overlook the fact that this was a mediocre film.

title: Awful
text: Typical heist movie with no clear plot or storylines, the writing completely relies on using the shock factor with no proper characters building, and what made the experience even worse was the poor acting, every Gal Gadot scene made me feel second-hand embarrassment, Dwayne Johnson was plain and sloppy, Ryan Reynolds did his best job playing himself.In conclusion: please Don't Watch this film it is a major waste of time.

title: Boring
text: I didn't enjoy this at all. It was a bland obvious storyline and very average acting. There's so many similar films out there that are a lot better.Don't waste your time this one.

title: 3 is more than enough
text:
It was so dull, so lame, so boring
Not a new idea!! We've seen this type of movies before so why are they giving us the same exact ideas?!To be fair it was kinda funny and that's it.

title: A comedy in every sense
text: Basically just 3 big name actors, all of which are one dimensional in their acting to begin with.Reynolds was funny in bits, that's about the only good thing about the movie.The plot is predictable. Most of the stunts and sequences are not realistic at all.The twist you could see a mile away.The script was boring. No substance or depth whatsoever.Very cheesy and left a really crappy feeling in my mind along the lines of (I just wasted 2 hours of my life).If you like garbage like this kudos, otherwise give it a pass.

title: terrible story, bad acting, nothing realist. a spoof of other movies
text: Bad movie, with no original plot.Its Gal Gadot act like a school girl and foil Ryan Reynolds and the rock, over and over.Nothing original, another movie that bases the back story on the nazis & ww2 and does it badly.

title: Predictable
text: ******Spoiler******The gal-rock romance was simultaneously blindsiding and obvious, purely because of how little sense the relationship makes, and also how obvious as a choice it was.

title: Stop thinking and still you would get a lot of turf off scenes
text:
Movie's start is quite promising which turn in a bunch of non-connected events.The story is just steal and shoo off cops and repeat.Few good dialogues and star cast,
Disappointing with this big cast and almost all over the world scenes.That's it. No one is thinking about "HOW".Overall alright time pass if have nothing to do.There is a hint of sequel, I hope that will come with a different story and not showing just anything. (Please)

title: Mix 3 and get a 2
text: I watched it with my 21 year old son. We thought it was ok. But you didn't care about the characters and the story was mundane! A very shallow film filled with sequences and gag lines we'd seen many times before. It was repetitively dull and uninvolved! The actors seemed to read their lines off a teleprompter! No chemistry between the leads and it was like we had seen all of this many times before!!

title: Hard to make a film this bad
text: Think the director of Austin Powers Goldmember meets the writer of Jonny English 3. The talent is all there but it's all a bit late to the show.Really looks great, glides along with a knowing wink, some genuinely funny jokes but OMG.This film is charmless fluff. I can take movies like this but they have to have it, soul, love, passion.A by the numbers film, shame as could easily have been very good.

title: Bad Movie Good Laughs
text: This move works only because of the cast. Its bad. You know action movies will have crazy unrealistic scenes but the ones in this movie are just like non exciting nonsense. Loved the cast and u know you will love RRs humor for sure makes it worth watching. DJ is awesome as usual. Different cast and I would have turned it off after 10 min. Just not good. Enjoy it if theres nothing else to do or are in the mood for some laughs from Ryans witty humor but if you dont watch it you wont miss much else.

title: Good actors awful movie
text:
Script has a lot of holes
Phrases and dialogue is awful and cheesy
Remarks, connection between actors/characters, it's all bad
It's like it's been written by teenagers or something
And the connection between Gal Gadot and Dwayne!? What connection?You'll watch it anyways, cause of the actors, even though you'll want to stop at some points (it's that bad, cheap and cheesy) but most likely won't want to see it again .I didn't think such a bad movie can be made with such good cast.Go with low expectations and maybe you'll find it funny.

title: Egg Hunt
text: Red Notice is like Indiana Jones for dummies. That's not to say it's bad, its just bland. The talent here is great, and the production value is good, the only problem is that it's wasted on such a predictable and sleep-inducing script. When it comes to the humor, I only had one chuckle. I was hoping for something akin to 2015's 'Spy' in terms of smart, funny writing. In the end I got a turn-off-your-brain movie filled with both leads' alcoholic drinks as in-your-face product placement.

title: Too much hype
text: A movie with all top stars but a very silly plot.Mindless with no logic.Waste of time.Several glaring loopholes and more like a filmy masala that is so often seen in Indian cinema.

title: Another terrible movie from the Rock
text:
Just another Movie from the Rock who markets it as
the most ground breaking never been done before 20hour shoots relentless epic movie.... And all you ever get from him is another B movie!Don't waste your time watching this!

title: Really?
text: I sure hope that any of the main characters aren't as annoying in real life as they are in these roles. It's like a series of bad slapstick jokes surrounded by millions of dollars of wasted sets props and CGI. To be fair maybe the movie improved but after the first 20 minutes I decided I did not want to waste another hour of my life in pursuit of trying to prove it was worth watching. Way too much amazing content to waste your time on this.

title: Misses
text: This is very campy with lots of Indiana Jones, Lara Croft, and James Bond rip offs and a few from other movies like Sahara. Lots of chasing, lots of scenery, and lots of double crosses. Really too many double crosses. The movie is far too long. Chemistry between the three was almost there. I judge by would I watch it again someday. This I would not.

title: Seen it all before.
text: Ryan played himself (always enjoyable), Dwayne was able to play off that and have some fun, Gal didn't get much screen time to try and build any chemistry or do much more than flash her legs/be glamorous. Overall the movie was just relying on star power, special effects and beautiful locations which it did well but overall had nothing noteworthy about it to make it stand out.

title: Great plot, but bad execution.
text: The plot is really good - in fact, way better than I thought it was going to be, but the execution was poor. The comedic aspect is completely over-exposed which ultimately ruins the movie. The cast is great and all, but not the right fit in this case. This movie deserves to be 1000% better than it actually is, and an amazing story-line was wasted in the process. But points for trying, Netflix.

title: I seen this before
text: All these actors played these same characters in different movie. Ryan just needed his suite, Gal just needed her sword and bracelets and well the Rock he is the same in every show. Don't waste your time watching this move.

title: Boooooring Netflix production no. 2349829347
text: Netflix movies are really unwatchable. Same boring and wooden story that only follows what people like watching on social media, big name actors that are acting horrible in a horribly written movie. Not even Ryan Reynolds humour can save anything. CGI backgrounds that are worse than unreal. I'm really never gonna watch a Netflix movie ever again. They are all the same, have no heart or soul or creativity, the only thing they are are money creating machines.

title: Come on! Really?!!!!
text: I love the main actors, specially Ryan Reynolds and I watched this movie because of them. Now I feel cheated. The plot was so bad I couldn't even pretend for the sake of actors. There was some usual jokes of Ryan but even that was not good enough. Gal played poorly, and DJ...I thought the time he played in bad movies was behind him. It's very disappointing to see such actors play in such a terrible movie. Good actors playing in a movie is like a signature. With playing in a movie, they say it has a minimum of quality. Playing in this movie was a poor choice and it makes me second guess all of their future movies.

title: Lacking chemistry and too long
text: I think this movie could've been better if there was a different cast. I love these guys, separately, but I found no believably chemist between Reynolds and Johnson, the chemist between Kevin Hart and The Rock is amazing.. and I think it's because Hart is so chaotic and over the top that Johnsons dryness balances him out. Whereas in this movie Reynolds is his usual overtly sarcastic self, and Johnson was his usual dry humor, together they're dry on dry.Gal Gadot was the polar opposite to Wonder Woman with a cheeky demeanour which I sadly didn't buy either. So all 3 together sound GREAT on paper, but I felt no believably friendship or romance chemistry. So even if this was a stellar script (it's not), it runs for too long, and you feel every minute of it not being lost in a great story.. what a shame.

title: What a mess, a mass of plot holes
text: There seems to have been quite a few films like this recently, take a great cast, then give them a terrible script and a tenuous (I'm being kind here) plot and then burn through a load of money to make something that they shouldn't have bothered with.In a scene early in the film, an item is destroyed by pouring coke on it, sorry, what?! So many plot holes it is unreal.Ryan Reynolds grates against everyone else playing it inexplicably straight. There are some cringingly bad lines and for some reason various characters keep appearing miraculously in locked rooms without having made a sound.Presumably there is a whole group of people somewhere who put this together and thought it was good, but they were wrong.

title: Don't waste your time.
text: Giving this film a star each for The Rock, Ryan Reynolds and Ed Sheeran respectively. Otherwise don't bother with this film. Mind-numbingly boring with a few odd jokes tossed in here and there to keep your attention. Go rewatch Shrek or something instead.

title: Don't bother
text: Billed as comedy caper. But no laughs and baring nice twist at end not much fresh hear, became a pastiche of Raider of the Lost Ark about half way through. No chemistry between characters. All going through motions. Pity.

title: Good and bad. Mostly stupid.
text: With that lineup you know what to expect. You got Ryan Reynolds for the laughs, the Rock for the action and Gal Gadot for some sexiness. And that's what you get, not a bit more.The story is a bland heist plot weakly copied from several classics. Everything is so on the nose and predictable, it would be laughable if it wasn't for the entertainment routine Reynolds and Johnson bring to the table. Gal Gadot seems to just have fun, as her character isn't even written convincingly. That said nothing is there to convince you this is anything but a stupid, short-lived action flick.What's really bad is that for the money spend the movie looks amazingly amateurish at times. There are some really awkwardly cheap blue-screen shots aswell as bad CG-effects and the set design drops occasionally to a highschool stageplay level. For the budget spent, this is rather embarrassing.Furthermore the movie steals far too bluntly from James Bond and Indiana Jones movies. So much so, Reynolds obviously had the urge to comment this in his typical snarky way surprisingly often throughout the movie.The only reason to watch is the fun the two main actors have on the screen. Reynolds manages to pull any aweful screenplay around and here he saves this from being another horrible Netflix star hodgepodge.

title: What did we all expect, I mean really.
text: It's National Treasure, no wait it's James Bond, no wait it's Indiana Jones. I think they did it on purpose, since at one point Ryan Reynolds character literally whistles the Indiana theme.The movie was kinda funny but a lot of tropes. Everything just works out some how. Since The Rock was one of the stars I figured it would be very so so.

title: Sort of Fun, With One Major Flaw
text: This has all the ingredients of a fun caper/Indian Jones style adventure. The problem is, one or two twists too many. I won't spoil it, but you're left with no reason to root for anyone.Not something you're likely to rewatch. At least, this reviewer feels that way.A real shame, too. It could have been above average.

title: Over-under acting
text: A combination of ever Indiana Jones and ever hunting treasure movie we ever seen nothing new and not very good. Please for the love of God someone get Ryan Reynolds to shut up!

title: Same old, same old, characters, plot..
text: Ryan reynolds playing the same role as ever.. fun but no range, tiresome, the lady detective gets no credit not even her name mentioned enough for you to remember and as any other American movie, make european police seemed incompetent and if they need to go teach them how to do their work.

title: Bland.
text: Predictable, underwhelming Netflix junk.No charisma between anyone, basic acting (why does Dwayne Johnson keep getting so many parts...) and in the end you don't care about any of these characters. I LOVE Ryan Reynolds, but this makes me think his acting career is wearing thin. He's always the same guy in every movie.The 3rd act is just ridiculous, but by then you just want it to be over with. And yet they let you know real hard they're trying to create a franchise here...wow. Not going to happen, not even a sequel.Just a big waste of time.

title: A Hybrid of Boredom
text: Feels like Oceans Eleven, 007, & Mission Impossible merged with some comedy but falls flat, cliché, and we've seen this movie many times before just done better.Not worth the time.

title: On VHS and a small screen it would have been OK...
text: The title of my review also speaks about the overall quality, not just about the lousy CGI-s. Seriously, you would even laugh hard if you would have seen some of the CGI made for this movie in the '90s in a cinema.About the story: it is like an average treasure-hunt and master-thief movie from the '80s - 90's, with lots of holes on the script.About the characters: I like Deadpool, but having almost the same character from Ryan Reynolds (whom I also like) in a different set up, seems just a clumsy recycling.

title: You can't invest $ 200 million much worse.
text:
The story is a typical heist comedy, nothing new really
The acting performance is not particularly good for this well-known cast. It feels like Dwayne Johnson plays the same character every film and Ryan Reynold again in his typical Deadpool role, the acting generally uninspired.Camera work etc. Super good, one can expect. CGI hit and miss again, there is a scene in an arena where the CGI looks just ridicolus, for example.The film music is also annoying and cannot support the film.The film always has its good moments, for example the big twist at the end. Some jokes are funny too, although there are a lot of jokes that don't work.All in all, it can be said that as a viewer you can and should expect more for a $ 200 million film.

title: To predictable
text: From the unrealistic plot and action scenes to being completely predictable.The cast is a good ensemble, but that's where the pros stop.Leave your brain at the door and you might just enjoy this movie.

title: Junk
text: By real film standards, a boring movie. All the whiners are welcome to thumbs down this review. If the euphemistic imdb don't bin it first. It's sad that this kind of movies are still being made. Partial cliche partial propaganda. In this day of age who is going to believe that the FBI are the heroes? Yea i said it. Besides this, the humor is not really funny too. And oh the "jackie chan imitation" action scene at the scaffolding is a poor attempt.

title: A Really Subpar Homage to Indiana Jones
text: I went into this film knowing it was going to be filled with cliches and coincidental plot-points, but there was something else about this that just made this film so stupid.When I go into these kinds of films, I know I'm going to at least enjoy myself. However, I didn't quite get that experience from this movie. I expected that this film would do something different, and would expand past the other cliched films of the same genre, because that's what makes these kinds of films fun. And it didn't really do that until the end, which didn't really change much for me.The ending was mediocre and just convenient for the sake of it being convenient, and many of the jokes didn't really land. Ryan Reynolds plays Ryan Reynolds, and Dwayne Johnson plays Dwayne Johnson.Don't get me wrong, I love watching both actors on the big screen, I absolutely love Free Guy, Deadpool, and the Jumanji series. No complaints there. But when their performances can't carry the film, it really just doesn't need to exist.Only reasons this is getting 4:1. Loved the Indiana Jones references, the music, the action, and the concept all kind of reminds me of that impeccable franchise2. The jokes that did land were witty and fun3. It was kind of entertaining, but not something I could rewatch.So yeah.

title: Stylistically bland CGI action/treasure heist
text: Stylistically bland CGI action/treasure heist with few jokes as a backdrop for looking at pretty people. At least The Rock's acting was good. The most of the delivery of the script and jokes was pretty awful.

title: I watched it last week and I have already forgotten most of the blah blah blah jive talkin'
text: I hope Ryan Reynolds stops being stereotyped as the comical half witted con man because I am getting more than a little tired of him playing the same type of role trying to talk ... talk ... talk ... and still talk some more his way out dangerous situations that always rely on a chase scene riddled with bullets and broads. In this case the love interest action lady is Gail Gadot whose easy on the eyes but not sufficient enough to make this film pass the smell test even with Dwayne Johnson who is usually a money maker guarantee.Mrs. Shullivan and I watched it last week ... and this week we had already forgotten the films title. I give it a so-so 5 out of 10 IMDb rating.

title: Written to a formula
text: This is one of the worst films to come out this year. It has a woeful story, horrendously cliched, with very little to any thought going into the story.It's a movie that is clearly designed to make money by getting big name actors, namely a buff action guy, some comic relief, and a pretty leading lady, then throw them into a sub-par story, with no depth. Add in some actions scenes and the occasional catchy one liner to use in the trailers, and you'll get plenty of people coming through the door, or internet browser in this case.Furthermore, the film uses CGI so extensively that I genuinely wonder if they ever even needed to the studio to film this movie.Everything about this film just feels cheap, lazy, and designed by using a formula, rather than any kind of creative writing and production. This is the movie equivalent of those mobile games that take a catchy idea, promote it through a bunch of ads, but then put very little money and no effort into the design and production, and rake in the profits by getting people to pay to remove ads before they realise the game is rubbish a day or two later. This movie does the same thing, make it look appealing, spend very little time or money on it, and turn a profit before people actually realise they've been duped into watching a piece of garbage.

title: Not sure what they saw in Gal... very bad actor
text: The movie could have been much better without Gal. Not sure what they saw in her as she acts the act! She is bad but i guess money talk.......... she needs a lot of work to improve.

title: too many plotholes
text: I love ryan reynolds and dwayne jhonson is awesome but this movie was too silly. I can't begin to dive into everything that's wrong with this film so i suggest you watch pitch meeting with ryan george because he will present it in a much more nuanced and fun way than i ever could.

title: Just because you throw money.....
text: Just because you throw money at something does not make it great. This was a subpar movie. Yes action was good/ok and some twist but my god the rest seemed to drag. The cgi at points was very bad. Many scenes could have been cut out. This movie could have lost about 30 minutes of run time and still finish the same way with no story lost, may have made it better honestly. Not great wont watch again and will forget it existed if a second part comes out in 2-3 years.

title: Mostly Predictable, Overly Long and Very Forgettable.
text: If not for Ryan Reynolds being Ryan Reynolds, this movie would have been a total bust. He carries the film, brings the charm, and delivers his signature witty, matter-of-fact, sarcastic humor. The Rock has all the personality of a rock and has no chemistry with Reynolds. While Gal Gadot is strong, stunning and likeable, I think she's miscast as a femme fatale. She's seems too sweet. I do appreciate that her character did not emasculate the men in the movie. The lead Interpol agent was annoying. She showed up just in time to ruin the fun or momentum in scenes. As for the plot, you can see everything coming, even twists, before they come.

title: Quite disappointed
text: Love Reynolds and Johnson but the mix just wasn't there. Oddly. I didn't quite feel part of the story and felt a little bit bored in some parts. Reynolds is awesome and so funny and Johnson is usually much better. Love him with Hart. This just didn't do it for me though unfortunately. Not the worst film, just not great.

title: New Title of a Mediocre Film
text: The film should be re-titled "Raiders of the Lost Egg." That really doesn't give anything away, but by the time you watch the entire movie, you will know what I mean, that is, if you have the time to waste.I watched the film only because I like the individual lead actors. They were OK, but the script is so formulaic and the lines were just so cheesy, it was painful to watch. There is lots of banter with zero emotional connection between any two characters in the entire movie. Zero chemistry.Ryan Reynolds lines were the cheesiest and could not possibly have been delivered for real laughs by even the best of actors, which he is. OK, I laughed a couple of times. But the action was so "canned Hollywood" in its nature, it was boring. If you want to turn off your brain for two hours, watch the movie...Note: A rating of 5 means "Barely Watchable." Despite warning you, only one out of five people thought my review was helpful. These actors have all been in better films, and you should watch them again IMO as opposed to watching this one! I wonder whether the down ratings come from people who are connected with the film? Just wondering...

title: 25 years too late
text: The age of the badly done buddy-cop movie is thankfully long deceased. But there will be throwbacks like this. The dialogue writing is horrendous and truly ruins the movie even more than "the risk, no surprise, no caring"-plot that this movie already suffers under.The normally witty and talented ryan reynolds.is reduced to delivering excruciating and cringe-y, provocative lines to attempt to amuse in between the fighting that dwayne johnson is allowed to do.Basic dialogue, basic plot, basic fights with kicks to the groin for fun. What a waste of talent in this pile of carp.So bad it made me write a review.

title: Alright... If you lower your expectations
text: To be honest, I really just watched this movie because Ryan Reynolds was in it. He's always been a solid actor that provides a good laugh... and he did it once again in this movie. However, he was probably the best thing about it. There were some good moments, and a good twist, but they left it way too close to the end to reveal that twist. There were some good stunts, but they were largely overshadowed by the lack of character arc in the Rock's character. But it did entertain for a few hours, and that's what a movie should do. It was a fun concept, and if you lower your expectations, you might just enjoy it.

title: Check your brain at the door
text: There is a lot of eye candy on the screen and something for everyone. Hunks, beautiful women, lots of action, and a lot of jokes. Overall it is a lot of fun. It is silly, full of plot holes, and just plain goofy.Red Notice is well done, the money is on the screen to the point that it is over produced by what you see on the screen instead of making the script better. So much of if you watch and just as "Why?" or "How?"Fun to watch, and a second viewing would likely reveal more jokes and patter, but you have to as "Would it be worth it?" Maybe if you had a couple hours to kill.

title: Gal and Ryan are pathetic
text: Let's start with Gal the way she fails acting as she's just there to wear fancy dresses. Her so-called acting is all about symbolism as you may find in low budget soap opera from the 90's. She just can't endorse a character, can't produce the right voice tone, she is so fake in acting, God it hurts so much watching her pretending to be an actress, not even close. Working in a fashion shop should do it for her, just leave the industry. Now Ryan, it is a shame that this actor play the same role again and again. Nothing changes, same all attitude, mimics, jokes... no really it's a shame, it's like Bateman. They both can't act someone else but themselves. I never imagined saying that the rock was good, he really is in such movie. And the plot... don't let me start you've had enough so far I guess ;)

title: Such lovely actors but....
text: I love all three actors but the story and the writing was so bad that you couldn't wait for it to end. Awful direction and very unoriginal sets copied straight from Indiana Jones, but done badly.A great waste of such a good cast! Shame.

title: Unrealistic and boring
text: I only give the movie 3 stars because it was at least a good quality movie. But I was bored from the beginning to the end mainly because it was factually unrealistic the majority of the time. Greenscreens have gotten better but not good enough not to notice it constantly. Gal is obviously beautiful, again, Dwayne is obviously bulky, again and Ryan is sarcastically funny, again like in every other movie. It gets old and predictable. I understand all the positive ratings and reviews but mine is from an honest fed up point of view.

title: Unexpectedly bad
text: I was kinda looking forward to this, as it seemed as a good idea for a Friday evening. We watched it together with my husband who is usually a bit less critical and also likes soulless comedies but... He was suspiciously quiet through the whole movie and at the end he said: "That was SO BAD." It wasn't exactly boring, no. But the CGI usage looked horrible, like someone tried to save money on it, Gal's character was supposed to be sexy and seductive but instead, she seemed lame and not too smart (and don't take me wrong, I absolutely LOVE Gal Gadot and I love to watch her in almost anything. Almost anything, just not this.) The only thing that kinda made us watch the whole disaster until the very end were Reynolds' obligatory comments throughout the whole thing (for some, this might seem like a paradox). So one star for him being himself and one for Gal's presence.

title: Embarrassing...
text: Ridiculous story, ridiculous acting, ridiculous directing... how can anyone do such an embarrassing film???At least we saw it in Netflix... no money charged!

title: Worst movie of 2021
text: Whole movie is just a setup for a sequel. You feel cheated in the end.Bad acting, bad jokes and bad premise.At the end you really stop caring about all the actors. They tried to do a Rush hour, but there is no chemistry between characters.

title: Take notice and do something else
text: All those who believe the Rock can't act will have their expectations met. Ditto for all those who think Gal Gadot would look great in a slinky red dress with a giant slit up the leg. As for those who believe Ryan Reynolds can act, you can only be left bewildered as to why he's in this movie (gee, maybe it's the money).The best part of this movie was the closing credits. The worst part was the ending, which seemed like nothing more than a teaser for a sequel. God help us!

title: Typical NETFLIX Original
text: Typical NETFLIX production. Every aspect of the film is way below average. Makes me wonder why on earth Ryan Reynolds and Wayne Johnson agreed to play in it. And of course, since it is a NETFLIX Original, both protagonists have "daddy issues".

title: Expected more
text: Actors are great, shot nicely but the story, sets are just not working.It just felt too unrealistic even for a movie.Nicolas Cage already set a very high bar for movies based on finding historic treasure, and Rock also set the bar high with Journey to the center of the world.This is not it man!!

title: Really bad movie
text: The dialoges could've been written by a 13 year old. That is how people talk in this "movie". There are some things basic research could've prevented like Interpol operating secret prisons in russia or Interpol agents beeing able to arrest someone. If you have an IQ below 80 this movie is for you but otherwise stay away and don't give your money to this soulless bs.

title: U cannot be serious !!!
text: 160M$ budget movie ??? Tell me is a April Fool, anyway Ryan save the little u can call it a movie. Ritu Arya is worth to watch with Mister Reynolds, love her since Umbrella Academy.

title: Errrrrr
text: Ryan Reynolds is great, Gal Gadot is great, Dwayne Johnson honestly sucks at acting, it depressing watching him try and act, and he thinks that if he can flex some muscles he will always stay relevant, but he won't.

title: Silly fun. Oceans minus 11
text: Don't expect Oceans 11 or the Italian Job just some silly fun. Some good Reynolds humor and one liners and Johnson plays off of him well. Gadot is good in her roll. Watch for fun with some snacks and just enjoy.

title: Worst Rock/Reynolds Movie yet
text: The acting is way over done and there is way too much double crossing. I don't know who wrote this movie, but I don't think they knew how to make up there mind. They wanted so many endings and possibilities it ruined the whole production. Time to go back to the film room for the Rock. This was not a hit for him.

title: Cookie-cutter template action movie that wants to be a heist, a buddy and an indiana jones flick
text:
I was thinking Red Notice looked like a fun romp from the trailers but I gotta say its mostly firing on all the default cylinders - but if you just want more of the same, it's probably going to get ok.The movie tries unsuccessfully to mix a elements of heist movie, buddy flick and even throw in some Indiana Jones elements to mix it all up. But the story line is paper thin and takes you video game style (scenic opening shot + name of what city/locale you are looking at) from location to location without much transition.On the main actors - this is more cookie cutter,
The Rock plays The Rock as he has done in so many movies. Ryan Reynolds defaults to wisecracking Deadpool style. Gal Gadot shows some sparks as potential diabolical villain (she should really explore that) but it is all very very bland.To keep things moving, there is added an Interpol.agent thrown into this who chase Johnson and Reynolds around - with the little factual mistake of American writers having once again gotten the idea that they are an international FBI.I would have to say this is utterly forgettable and could easily have been made much, much better - certainly very easy money for the 3 leads.

title: Same trash in an expensive looking trashcan.
text: We have trashcans in our houses, yeah? And you know how we visit people that have fancy trashcans with all kinds of fancy sensors and technology? That's what this movie, apparently Netflix's most expensive, was. Same old trash, but in very fancy packaging.Ryan Reynolds - SAME character that he plays in every movie. In this one, he started off funny but got to a point where it made me go "Okay, dude! STOP talking so much!" Dwayne Johnson - SAME character he plays in every movie minus the lame comedy. Gal Gadot - The SAME character she played in FnF, but she was one of the main characters in this one for a change.Having a beef with Vin Diesel and wanting to do your own thing, I get. But someone needs to tell The Rock that because Vin makes expensive trash, it doesn't mean he's gotta make trash as well.That said, Rock + Ryan > Rock + Kevin Hart.Watch if you have nothing else to do.

title: Over acting
text: Over the top over-acting. Childish. Wanted to give a film with Dwayne Johnson another shot, but just not my cup of tea. Unbievable thuis is nummer 1 in Netflix in Holland.

title: Fun, cliche Netflix movie
text: Red Notice is Dwayne Johnson's first Netflix movie and its somehow the most expensive so far. COVID was one reason since the film was shut down. I was excited for Red Notice despite the early reviews. Red Notice was okay as expected, its a cliche action comedy.The acting is good, Ryan Reynolds gives the best performance. Johnson and Reynolds have good chemistry like with Hobbs & Shaw in fact I think their banter inspired Red Notice, Universal was the original studio. Gal Gadot is good but her role is small or you could say its average.The plot is formulaic, it could of been worse. You know what's going to happen from beginning to end. There are a few twists but they don't work in fact the final twist is forced. Red Notice is exposition heavy so you must pay some attention.The action is crazy but serviceable which may sound weird. No, its not really crazy like the Fast & Furious series. Nobody dies so there's no tension or grit I suppose.Overall, Red Notice was okay. Its a goofy Netflix movie which plays it safe. If you like the leads, give it a shot. If Red Notice spawns a sequel, hopefully its better.

title: Abysmal
text: Firstly, genuinely impressed that a pairing of Dwayne and Ryan could actually be so poor! Cringe worthy obvious one liners, slow, boring and very difficult to like characters played by genuinely loveable actors!I'm used to far fetched nonsense and suspending all disbelief, but a tiny woman flooring the Rock by one hand hitting his arm ... wtf? How much does he weigh exactly? Not even sure wonder woman has that level of power. Potentially the most boring film I have watched in a decade.

title: Netflix is dying
text: You pay a lot for Netflix these days and they shove some ads in 4k down your throat in cheesy cheap shallow american garbage.Netflix is getting more and more full of fast food like movies and series.

title: Bed Notice
text: What a cast, Gal Gadot excepted as she is totally over hyped, what an opportunity, what a fail.It's all stuff done before just done poorly, nothing original and really not much in the way of entertaining. I really enjoy The Rock and Ryan Reynolds, but the script and substance behind this is woeful.

title: Stop taking every job you're offered.
text: For s**ts and giggles, I usually love films with Dwayne Johnson in. For the same reason, films with Ryan Reynolds. But my god, this film had me wishing I was watching The Proposal or San Andreas instead. Not good.

title: Really?
text: If you're going to rip off Lucas - do it well - and make me care. Just filling up my 150 word review minimum as I can't post this without doing 150 words. Can barely bother writing any more. Sunk coat fallacy.

title: Cleopatra is Egyptian
text: Cleopatra is Egyptian, What are they really trying to prove in this disgusting movie? And Gal can't act she just doesn't know how to act. Unfortunately, this movie is not worth watching and it is not worth the $200 million.

title: Cliché
text: Repeated rolls for Dwayne Johnson and Ryan Reynolds, the same old clichés the same old jokes nothing new. Bad performance and bad acting from Gal Gadot. The only good thing in the movie is the locations and the beauty of the cities.

title: Makes 6 Underground look good. That's not a compliment.
text: You can almost hear the actors counting their money as they vomit their lines. Gadot is a bright spot that helps the slog som ewhat. Predictable plot lines and tired jokes from Reynolds and Johnson pretty much seal the deal.

title: Sheer Ineptitude!!
text: The creative team - esp the screenplay and director - should stay out of the movie business permanently!Have not seen anything this amateurish in ages!!

title: Cookie cutter
text: For the past decade, the Hollywood trend of visually appealing, A-list casting, over-budget films with subpar story telling seemingly trots onward. Red Notice stands above the rest in one category: mediocrity.It's an interesting attempt at an action comedy with the only downside being the action and the comedy. I will not elaborate.Unless you are looking for something to pass the time, do not bother.

title: Netflix unoriginal, again.

Actually Chris Diamantopoulos did a better job than the lead cast. His short cameo was more engaging than the lead cast. Overall a very awful experience and a pathetic waste of 2 hours.

title: "Best movie of the year!" "Wow a masterpiece!" Yawn
text: This is not the best movie of the year. It is not a masterpiece. It's also not entertaining, it's cringe and it's soulless.Ryan Reynolds is his usual cringe self which is why I usually don't like movies he stars in. The Rock I find is mostly comical and easy to watch but this role just sucks for him. The humour is dull, jokes are predictable and cringe, action is too CGI as are the locations. It's just flat. There's no body, it's all just boring and forgetful. I'd say forget it unless you want to watch it as background noise while you scroll more interesting content on your newsfeed.

title: So Disappointing
text: This movie seemed to promise a lot of fun without having to think too hard, but instead I found myself thinking way too hard about how much I wasn't enjoying myself. The jokes fell flat at best and made absolutely no sense at worst. There was very little chemistry between any of the characters, though the script was trying very heavy-handedly to make it happen. The various twists in this movie also seemed pretty contrived, and I found that I couldn't care less each time one happened. Perhaps someone with the right sense of humour could find some silly fun to be had here, but I'm not one of them.

title: Bad production and lack of geography research
text: The producers do not even know where Argentina is, they confuse the countries, I think they would locate Washington in Canada if they put a map on them, the plot is the same, the characters only acted the same from their previous films and they put it here, as if to encourage getting people to see the movie, but they only dug up the ending to give it some originality, but the rock couldn't act well which made it lose credibility to the character.

title: Red Notice
text: The best part of going to watch this movie is to not have high expectations. If you leave them aside you can actually enjoy the few good parts it has. It's not a good movie, by far, it doesn't have a good script, just 3 big stars randomly acting together and honestly I was entertained. The kind of entertainment you want on a sunday afternoon with your family. So not so bad after all. Of all 3 I enjoyed more Reynolds effort and jokes. Seeing the success it has on netflix maybe we can expect a 2nd installment?

title: Meh. All the HYPE but didn't even half deliver.
text: Predictable and quite a basic storyline. Considering all the big names involved this was disappointing.The Rock's acting never changed. No depth and no impact with his comedic or witty one liner. I am writing this review because the Rock was so disappointing I hope this bad reviews triggers him to work on his skills. For the millions he is getting he is so one dimensional. 😅Ryan Reynolds seems to thrive with this kind of acting. Repetitive but he is effective.Gal Gadot is very beautiful she's alright. Haha Nothing good but not bad.Again, I only was compelled to write a review due to Rock's bad acting. Lol.
