title: Please, tell gal gadot to stop acting....
text: Is there anyone who work in Hollywood can tell gal gadot she a terrible actress. It's Okey when it's doesn't work it's doesn't work. Just quite and go back with modeling.I believe Miley Cyrus could act better than her.

title: Clearly this was comedy
text: It's a shame that these guys are incapable of doing serious movies anymore. I get it that they want to reach a wider audience but man, it's such a shame. This could have become a serious action movie, think of James Bond type movie but I don't understand why they would do this to Gal and The Rock. The storyline was subpar, the fight scenes was funny at best, the dialogue wasn't that funny, but Ryan tried his best but we are so used to his type of humor that it's so predictable now. So much talent gone to waste and for what? 3 useless eggs.

title: Uninspired acting and directing
text: I. Dwayne Johnson. He seemed bored throughout the movie. I never sensed he was having much fun here.Ii. Gal Gadot. Yes, she looks good in clingy dresses, but her acting is passable at best. She didn't project 'criminal mastermind' at all. There is zilch chemistry between her and Johnson.Iii. Ryan Reynolds. He trots out his usual Deadpool-schtick... AGAIN!. He's been doing this self-aware smirking sarcastic bit since the days of Blade III. He has become a one-man cliche.Iv. The terrible CGI! This is supposed to be a globe-trotting adventure with exotic locations, but it's very clear that the actors are mostly standing in front of soft focus CGI backgrounds. The studio lighting which never matches the background is a the biggest giveaway. And that scene with the bull? Just awful.V. The action scenes are journeyman. Like a fast food meal, they will feed you, but you'll forget them almost as fast as they are happening.

title: 3rd Draft
text: When the director is the writer, they see their 3rd draft as gold. Someone needed to pull this away from him and tell him it's not funny or exciting. Humor is difficult. I watched 35 minutes and had to stop. I'm sure these actors cringed watching the final cut. Does Ryan Reynolds just play the same mile wide and inch deep character in every movie? And Gal Gadot is simply here for eye candy. And that gets old. At least, Dwayne comes off as a decent actor. This is such an incredible waste of time.

title: Just awful
text: Very juvenile. They should all be ashamed. The plot was transparent and the acting mailed in. Ryan Reynolds character was over acted. Gal Godot was horrific and she can't sing. The Rock played the Rock. Nuff said. Glad we didn't pay extra for this mess.

title: Everything that's wrong with blockbuster cinema
text: Movies like Red Notice are frustrating to watch. Especially The Rock shouldn't brag about this being the most expensive movie Netflix ever made, when he took a big chunk of that budget and it looks a notch above dogsh**, pardon the expression.Why do an adventure movie in the first place? If you don't show exotic places and real stunts, but instead a green screen with poorly integrated actors. Honestly, the post-production on Netflix movies (and even Marvel movies) are reaching below mediocrity. Not only are the performers terribly integrated visually, but the actors don't even make an effort of bringing the scene to 'life' with their performance. The worst example being the bull/Arena sequence. The bull looks and moves like a cartoon, the characters behave like they aren't in danger, but nothing is funny or exaggerated. So what are audiences supposed to feel watching this? It's almost like the studio is unable to grasp the concept of a movie.The Rock stars in his 50th movie with a milquetoast script where he has to partner with a comedic sidekick. As executive producer he makes sure to look cool and probably directed the movie himself.Ryan Reynolds is chewing the scenery with his schtick that was already grating on the first Deadpool. Gal Gadot, says lines... They cast these three actors to play themselves and I guess that probably alone cost half the budget. I hope it was worth it for some Netflix executives who paid the bills.For everyone else (aka the audience) this is a complete waste of attention.Avoid it.2 out of 10.

title: An entertaining yet ultimately generic, forgettable Netflix blockbuster
text: It seems the Mecca of dumb quippy action movies has arrived. RED NOTICE, a recent arrival on Netflix, is an expensive and overblown spy thriller starring Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson, Ryan Reynolds and Gal Gadot. Supposedly it boasts the largest budget of any Netflix movie thus far. This is impressive, but it appears that much of the money went into collecting the A-list stars and planting them in elaborate sets with CGI backgrounds. The plot almost never makes sense for more than a couple minutes, and almost every scene is over-the-top to the point of absolute absurdity. And yet, because of Reynolds and Johnsons' charisma, the movie is constantly entertaining and engaging. RED NOTICE knows what it wants to be and never aspires to be too much more, which seems to call back to old Sylvester Stallone and Arnold Schwarzenegger movies. Does this make the movie good? Not really -- but I can see RED NOTICE , and many of Johnson's other movies, seen in the same light as Stallone and Schwarzenegger films in the near future.The plot of RED NOTICE isn't anything new or exciting -- it comes across as a typical globe-trotting spy thriller at best. Ryan Reynolds plays Nolan Booth, an art thief who self-identifies as the best in the world at his craft. However, FBI Special Agent John Hartley, played by Dwayne Johnson, is hot on his tail and knows where Booth is headed next. Both are on the hunt for three expensive and beautiful eggs that were supposedly a token of appreciation gifted from Marc Antony to Cleopatra back in Ancient Egypt. The variable that thwarts them both throughout their pursuit is The Bishop (Gal Gadot), a mysterious kingpin who manipulates the world of art theft to her own benefit. In order to outplay The Bishop, they must team up to find the three eggs before she does while trying to chase their own ulterior motives.One trait that a spy movie needs to have in order to succeed is the smarts to outwit its own audience. If any movie has characters that constantly double-cross each other, then the movie needs to trick the viewers into believing these same tricks. Unfortunately, RED NOTICE director/writer Rawson Marshall Thurber seems to think his script is far smarter than it actually is, making the twists and turns of this movie feel laughable instead of shocking. On a dramatic level it doesn't quite land either, because although the two main male characters are given some solid backstories, the constant twists render these stories pointless because certain motivations are tweaked as the movie progresses.So if RED NOTICE doesn't quite work as an espionage thriller and a dramatic character piece, then how exactly does it work? Well, it's a ridiculously overblown action movie with Ryan Reynolds and Dwayne Johnson in which they banter and throw insults at each other for damn near the entire runtime. I'd argue that the movie doesn't need to be much more than that. Reynolds is his typical scene-stealing, hilariously entertaining self, and the movie would be a complete failure if it weren't for his presence here. While Dwayne Johnson gives a fun performance as well, Reynolds elevates the quality of each passing scene just by making stupid comments, and this alone, along with the fantastic chemistry between the two actors, is reason to check this movie out on Netflix.The rest of this film is generic and forgettable fluff, and despite the two charismatic lead actors, I cannot see myself looking back fondly on RED NOTICE in the future. Every other character besides the main couple ultimately falls flat, which includes Gal Gadot as The Bishop. This character seems like it was designed to give Gadot a chance to become a prolific deliverer of killer one-liners, yet she never steps up to the task, delivering another mediocre performance that makes me wonder why Gadot keeps landing such coveted roles. The CGI is also astonishingly inept given the enormous budget of this production -- roughly 200 million dollars that must have been spent to pay the A-lister stars on the poster. The film is jam-packed with big-budget action sequences, all of which look as if they were filmed in a green-screen studio in Los Angeles rather than an actual location. To me, this shows the amount of effort that was injected into this film: enough to let the major stars shine but not enough to make a quality movie worth remembering.Many critics are treating RED NOTICE as if it is an existential crisis for the state of filmmaking, and that the quality of movies will forever deteriorate because of this formulaic Netflix hit. I think they're overselling the issue, because RED NOTICE to me seems like a harmless and reasonably entertaining action thriller that knows its audience won't be looking for The Godfather: Part IV. Sure, it's a formulaic and conceptually average film that never delivers anything that isn't just a carbon copy of one of the four Indiana Jones movies. This, to me, is not a complete condemnation, although it does stop the movie from being one I would ever pay money for (some movies deserve to be on Netflix). Ryan Reynolds and The Rock fans will rejoice regardless of the quality, and I must admit that on that level, RED NOTICE is a success more than it is a failure.C.

title: Not even close
text:
I love hardcore cheesy movies. They are the bread & butter to my ability to completely tune out all of the daily stress. The problem with a good cheesy movie, is that it walks a fine line of awful and clean fun.I watched this today hoping that this would be a fun cheesy movie. Afterall, what else is Ryan Reynolds good for anymore? Sadly, this was a big ole fail.It tried way too hard to be the sort of irreverent spy movie that Reynolds is constantly doing. What put it solidly in the fail column were the tasteless product placements (Aviator Gin, constant reference to cell phones & plans etc). Do all of his businesses really need this much help? Does he (Reynolds) need to fire his accountant for giving such bad advice?Sadly, this is also a big spotlight on how bad an actor Dwayne Johnson is. It also didn't do any favors for Gal Gadot but we all knew she wouldn't win any Oscars. Mr. Johnson seemed to just be going thru the motions in this movie. There was none of his usual energy, heck, he didn't even pretend to show his 'charm'
So, to sum up. A big ole waste of Hollywood money in making this movie.

title: Not a single original idea in it
text: Some lame jokes or quips aren't half bad.But for the most part it's just short of two hours of my life I will never get back.Honestly I don't think there isn't a single scene in those two hours that we haven't already seen in some other b rated movie.

title: Bland.
text: This is an unfortunate example of a Hollywood blockbuster that fails to deliver on its promises. Despite boasting an impressive cast consisting of Dwayne Johnson, Gal Gadot, and Ryan Reynolds, the film falls flat in almost every aspect. The storyline is a convoluted mess, attempting to blend action, comedy, and heist elements but ultimately resulting in a chaotic and disjointed narrative. The plot lacks originality, relying heavily on tired tropes and predictable twists that do little to engage the audience.The film's main downfall lies in its poor character development. Johnson, known for his charismatic performances, is reduced to a one-dimensional action hero devoid of any depth or emotional range. Gadot's character feels woefully underutilized, serving more as a token love interest rather than a meaningful contributor to the plot. Reynolds, often a reliable source of humor, is given a script filled with forced one-liners that fall flat, failing to elicit genuine laughs.Furthermore, the action sequences, touted as the film's main selling point, are underwhelming and lack creativity. The choreography feels uninspired, and the use of CGI is often glaringly obvious, detracting from any sense of realism. Even the supposed "twists" and "reveals" in the story are telegraphed well in advance, leaving little room for genuine surprise or suspense.The overall tone of the movie also feels confused, unsure whether it wants to be a high-stakes thriller or a lighthearted comedy. As a result, the film never manages to establish a consistent mood, leaving the audience disconnected and disinterested.In addition to its narrative and character flaws, it suffers from pacing issues. The film drags on for an excessive two-hour runtime, filled with unnecessary filler scenes that add little to the story or character development. This results in a movie that feels bloated and self-indulgent, struggling to maintain the audience's attention throughout.In conclusion, Red Notice is a disappointment on multiple fronts. Its lackluster storyline, poor character development, uninspired action sequences, and confused tone all contribute to its status as a bad movie. Despite the star power behind it, the film fails to deliver an engaging and enjoyable experience, ultimately leaving audiences with a forgettable and regrettable cinematic experience.

title: No charisma
text: The dialogues are awkward and poorly written.The movie wants to create an indiana jones atmosphere but it fails miserably.No character has charisma and Ryan Reynolds tries his best to be funny, but he rarely succeeds.The story isn't bad either, and with the constant action on the screen, the film still doesn't manage to be unique.

title: Just cliche and bad
text: Unoriginal plot, prolonged action scenes littered w technical errors, Ryan Reynolds schtick humor wears thin. Bad acting from the Rock as usual. Gal Gadot may save it from some Razzies.

title: Could've chosen someone other than Gal Gadot...
text: Not happy with the casting. Gal Gadot's character is pretty much the same in all her movies. Same accent same everything. Could've been a better movie with a different actress..

title: National Treasure (2021)
text: The film was fun for a while then tapered off. Nothing exciting I found in this feature as it was national Treasure all over again with a different twist. And funny, I figured out the last seen right before it ended. Not something I'll see again. No wonder why it lost millions......

title: Some funny jokes, and nothing else.
text: As much chemistry as there is between The Rock and Kevin Hart, there is none of such between The Rock and Ryan Reynolds. The occasional funny but predictable jokes, can't compensate the fact that Gal Gadot is as boring as she is beautiful, just as this movie.

title: A Notice Should be Given to This Movie
text: The amateur hour just never stops with the script. Beyond the A List actors (minus Gadot), this movie is not only underwhelming, disjointed, undermines the intellect of the actors, but also sickening when you hear about the nauseating amount of $$200M that Netflix wasted on making this nonsense. This goes out to this movie's director and all other bored directors out there that are planning to make a heist movie, stop with all of the fancy nonsense and place some emphasis on an intelligent script. All of us are tired of seeing the same old heists and when we see twists and turns, we know that you the director and actors know that the script is weak. Extremely weak in this case. And, if you want higher ratings, for the sake of God, somebody get Gadot some acting lessons or stop casting her in major releases. Her acting is lacking in depth and her timing is way off. Not many times do I look forward to watching a movie and less than halfway through it, check my watch a couple of dozen times for it to be over. In my opinion, watch this movie, if you must, in double or triple speed to get through it as fast as possible, as it's a total waste of time.

title: There are brainless comedies...and then there is this!
text: I had so much to say about this movie but I guess it could all be summed up in one single sentence : " I had Never thought that a gorgous and brilliant actor like Gal Gadot would seem so useless,forced and thirwheel in a movie." She literally pops up anywhere and everywhere out of nowhere!! Why did they do this to her 😑😑

title: About as dumb as it gets
text: Honest don't know how to even review this movie. The plot makes no sense, characters make no sense. Apart from a few decent zingers by Ryan, there is absolutely nothing else this movie offers.

title: Ryan's jokes are getting boring...
text: This is another movie with Dwayne Johnson running, fighting and jumping onto helicopters. Ryan Reynolds keep delivering pizzaguy jokes and bad written one-liners...just wow.

title: Total waste of time
text: I felt I was falling asleep half way through the film and I did not try to stay awake. This was incredibly boring! Reynolds and the Rock are good but I really hated Godot' s character and her acting in this film was absolutely dreadful. We have seen all this before, in all the films the two male characters were in. Can writers/producers/directors think or produce something new?

title: Lame
text: Overpaid actors making garbage for lots of money. Not once did I laugh. Filler movies. The Rock hasn't made a good movie since The Rundown. And Ryan has Deadpool. Its not even funny.

title: There is no movie here
text: Very poorly written with no concept, no story, no sense. Very boring, money and time wasted. Do not make more movies like this please. This is not a Netflix standard it is way below average.

title: Fast & Furious X Deadpool
text: When another Deadpool movie cannot be seen in the horizon yet and the Rock still has beef w Vin what do you do?You make a movie that has Deadpool w Colossus feels w Gisele as one of the main charactersCars and Bullets flying all overDeadpool tryin to Deadpool and you have a movie that's well, still good for entertainment value.

title: Don't think
text: I started to like it once I decided to pretend I was dumb. Nothing really feels thought out. It seems like a lot of the things that happen are just excuses to get to the next action set piece. Also the editing is bad and the dialogue just predictable. Actually the whole thing is predictable. But besides that it can be pretty entertaining at moments and who doesn't love the Rock and Ryan Reynolds?

title: I hate the GREEN SCREEN
text: The whole movie is made on GREEN SCREEN. It is so terrible.Hollywood, please, stop making "big budget" movies, and use green screen. Leave it for TV series, but not blockbuster movies!It is not watchable. Same like first Justice League. Horrible.

title: Shocking
text: Pg-13 Reynolds, a typical performance from the rock and a repetitive laborious plot. Found myself waiting for it to end. There's little to no comedy in the entire film and they've left it open for a sequel god help us.

title: I had to stop after 30 mins.
text: I'm not a huge the Rock fan and I've never been able to watch entirely any Ryan Raynolds' movie, if they can called movies anyway.Total waste of time, poor characters, usual cheap and forced story.

title: Should have spent some of that budget on writers
text: I never expect Ryan Reynolds, Dwayne Johnson or Gal Gadot, to impress with their acting skills, and they didn't, so no disappointment there. But if Netflix spent $200 million for this thing, they really should have spent more of that on writers. Terrible dialog and so many inconsistencies, plot holes and sheer silliness, that it made Red Notice laughably bad. Too bad, because I was hoping to like it. Maybe the sequel will be better, but I don't plan to spend two hours of my life to find out.

title: I couldn't even finish the movie
text: It was pretty bad. I love all the stars in it but boy it was bad. Turned it off with 25 minutes left when everyone shows up in the middle of the forest of Argentina lol.

title: HOW ON EARTH WAS THIS $200M?!?
text: Terrible script, terrible direction, terrible CGI, terrible art and costume design, and Gal Godot is... I'm sorry to say this... terrible.Netflix, please don't make this mistake again. You can do much better than overpaid name actors in a late- nineties-wanna-be-blockbuster.

title: Tired
text: The biggest double cross is that Rock and Van Wilder took Netflix for a pretty penny in this very unoriginal movie. I can't rate the acting because there wasn't any in it, at all. Rock played his Rock character and Van played his Van character. So stale and old. Interpol needs to put these guys away.

title: Product placement
text: Just an opportunity for these two to plug their spirit brands within the first 20mins. Waste of time, just advertising to swell their already filled cups.

title: Can't believe how bad this is.
text: Wow. No plot or story line whatsoever. Ryan R is truly awful. Almost unwatchable. Super basic with so much cheese you won't believe your ears. Every single attempt at humor falls flat. How did this get made?

title: Worst movie of 2021
text: Please stop making these movies, 4 year old kids writing scripts. Don't the actors have minimum self awareness to understand what kind of scripts they are choosing, this is bad even from Hollywood standards.

title: This Movie Sucked
text: The way this movie was directed reminds me of Ghostbusters 2016. I love Ryan Reynolds, but he's just spiting out lines without any real motivation. The Rock plays the Rock as usual, and he looks really old in a few shots. Generic music, terrible fight choreography, and nothing you haven't already seen. It was really hard to finish this movie.

title: It's ok
text: Fun movie but too predictable for the most part. No logic in the capers and no reel twists you can't already see. Acting was forced comedy most of the time. Good if you are out of options for viewing, but a waste of good actors on a worn out plot. For the money spent to make this something else could have been a real success.

title: Nothing original
text: As others have mentioned, there is nothing original here. Considering they probably spent 30-50 million just on the cast alone you'd think they would have spent more on the script. It's tired and uninspired. Perhaps if you're twelve and you haven't seen this formula a 100 times before it might entertain you, but if not, then you'll see the dialog is flat, the story is completely implausible and unfortunately it just isn't interesting enough to let you overlook those issues. Even R Reynold's trade mark quips through out seem to drop like lead balloon as the directing and editing don't have the comedic timing to get laughs. D Johnson plays the strait man, but he is just too strait and serious and it has you doubting if he is in the same movie as the others. It's hard making a good and entertaining movie and this is exhibit A. But films like this really make you appreciate when you do see a film that really works. So, I guess it is good for something.

title: Boring
text: It looked good on paper but it was a big disappointment. Extremely contrived and predictable. Weak script. No wonder it didn't make the big screen. Netflix produces too many of these subpar movies.

title: Nope
text: Please guys do not see this movie. Ryan Reynolds is the same character in every movie no development as an actor. In fact the "action" scenes seemed to me to be slow motion from Tom Cruise and a bit of James Bond. Sucks.

title: Childish garbage made for 12 year olds
text: This movie is a total joke. Completely idiotic directing and story. It is an utter joke of a movie. You watch the first 10 minutes and you quickly see this is ideal for a 10-12 year old. Anyone with an iota of intelligence will turn it off!

title: Utter waste of time
text: Nothing to see here.. keep scrolling to find another..not even worth to kill time.RR is set in his same old tune, if you have seen any of his stuff post Deadpool - you have seen this. The Rock is as emotionless actor as a rock. And GG was never one for acting.Suspense factor of movie, any good binger will see from miles ahead.Just another multi-big-budget-actor stuff from Netflix too sell airtime - don't give into it.Utter nonsense.

title: Netflix Junk
text:
As some said before, it's very generic, the cgi is below average, the plot is predictable. I normally like Ryan Reynolds, but his jokes (starting in just about the first three minutes) were cliché and unfunny, unfortunately. As for the other actors, yes, probably laughing all the way to the bank. Taking everything they can get I guess. I'm seriously considering canceling my Netflix subscription.Normally I'd give at, meh, three tops, but it gets only one to cancel out the good reviews. We should not have to settle for this, some people do still
make good movies.

title: Simply Awful
text: First off Gal Gadot just cannot act, not under any circumstances, her presence is purely down to her Israeli advocacy and Hollywood lickspittle executives.Reynolds and Johnson are not much better but do manage to create some on screen chemistry and their familiar tropes work well enough.The real problem is the plot; two world renowned art thieves who seem to rely on coincidence and the incompetence of the authorities, a totally unbelievable FBI agent, a series of heists and prison escapes that are completely unbelievable and a central thread which is riddled with holes.The action scenes are by the numbers CGI yawn fests and consist largely of Indiana Jones rip offs. No one can shoot straight, there are some oddly placed torture scenes, and casual violence that is gratutitous and wildly out of place.Everyone concerned with this should be embarrassed but of course they won't be because they walked away with wads of cash while the audience is stuck with another lemon to suck on.Don't bother.

title: the rock was weak
text: He couldnt stand up to the pc crowd just because he wants to make a buck with these lame cgi movies. Plus he uses steroids and makes fun of chinese people. He is no roll model.

title: One step above Ishtar
text: If Ishtar didn't exist this would be the worst movie ever. What a waste of time. I never knew I could despise three lead actors. They all contributed to this garbage movie.

title: Made by kids, for kids
text: There is nothing remarkable, memorable, interesting, exciting, ground-breaking nor clever about this film. As my title suggests, this was made by kids for kids - terrible green-screen use, poor direction, red-faced embarrassing dialogue, actors who were paid $20m each and just dialed-in their performance. My main criticism is at the writer/director who got given a truckload of cash by Netflix to cast some high-profile names into his badly conceived and unoriginal screenplay.If you enjoyed this movie, then you must be about 9 years old and never heard of Indiana Jones, James Bond, Jason Bourne or Marvel/DC.And this film is further proof that Gal Gadot might be good to look at, but good god she simply cannot act. Embarrassing.

title: Too impossible, waste of time.
text: Shallow and imossible. I am okay that an action movie is a bit over exaggerated here and there, but this is a new level. All the steps in this movie are done without any thought. Everything too impossible and improbable. Try to give a 007 feeling but without any depth. Waste of time....

title: Your average blockbuster
text: So shallow. So predictable. So stereotypical. So forgettable.Some stylish scenes from attractive locations around the world. Some charming moments. One interesting chase & fight (at the very beginning).But, above all, the most beautiful Gal Gadot!

title: Not worth anyone's time
text: This movie has nothing going for it except big name actors. Heist movies can only be reinvented so many times, but the plot offers nothing new. You'll see the same tired act we've seen from Ryan Reynolds since Blade Trinity and Dwayne Johnsom fails to deliver any depth to an already poorly written character. For the record, I'm not a snob who only appreciates smart films. I realize it's meant to be mindlessly entertaining, but it's an insult to B movies. Unless you have an IQ below 60 I suggest you spend your time on something else.

title: It's Netflix quality.
text: It's Netflix so don't expect big cinema quality. It's more like straight to video quality. It's being carried because of big names and not because it's a great movie. The writing and storyline is paper thin and full of plot holes. The CGI is subpar and the quality of the stage of the waterfall scene is just laughable. The acting is okay but it's all not too believable. The only time I laughed was during the Ed Sheeran scene. The whole movie is too rushed.But....it's still an enjoyable movie for a Sunday afternoon or something just don't expect too much of it because then you'll be disappointed.

title: Yawn
text: Ryan Reynolds is as obnoxious as usual. Dwayne Johnson needs better writers to make him interesting. Gal Gadot is a beautiful girl but this movie doesn't show it. Do we care about any of these characters. Absolutely not. A pile of crap and even though this comes free with a membership to Netflix it needs to be better.

title: Nothing new and Nothing exciting
text: Stars making quick buck from same conventional flick. Very very disappointing to consider them a better actors with a small money minded brain. Don't have much stuff to give 150 words.

title: Pure Fun
text: I had a great time watching it as it is exactly what i expected - entertaining, fun & fast paced with three very likable cast in the lead. Just don't think too much & go for the fun ride!

title: Simply the worst major title of 2021
text: It seems neither of the main actors of this flick bother to play an actual character, but just phone it in, which isn't even the worst part. Suspension of disbelief isn't enough to allow for a terrible plot that's been done before and definitely better. Probably an easy payday, but an unwatchable mess without any real stakes or likable characters.

title: Terrible
text: Terrible script. Raynolds is playing himself/deadpool as always but is ok to watch. Gal Gadot's performance however is totally obnoxious, prancing around everywhere with supernatural powers and bland acting. Super predictable so don't even know why they make movies like that. Just couldn't finish this garbage as it was an irritating waste of time. Therefore can't give it more than 1 star.

title: Nothing special.
text: Just a run of the mill heist movie, nothing original or special about it, The one liners and puns get's really old really fast. It's a forgettable drop in the ocean among theif/heist/set-up movies.

title: What were they thinking ?
text: How to waste 3x A-list stars, Hundreds of millions?Story line doesn't exist just like the chemistry between the rock - ryan - gal. It's odd and better for ryan to get our of the wade winston wilson soon.The unimaginable stealing or fakish looking CGI of London, Argentina or. Bali doesn't bring much to the fun. Action sequences - Yeah, TIL that opening a door, creating a passage is the best way to avoid a projectile hit. I hope, to see such a clever scene in F&F10.Finally, this will add another ~2 hour waste of your time. Just avoid.

title: Everything is over the top, even the acting.
text: I was expecting for hoping for a decent movie. I like all the three main actors in this movie. I was thoroughly disappointed. There is nothing good about this movie... well maybe except for Ryan. He's always funny.If the actors read this script, how can they go along with it. So bad. The whole storyline and how people showed up out of nothing was crazy. How after walking for three days in the jungle everyone was perfectly clean. How they were shooting at each other for no reason. You don't arrest someone be just opening up on them with a weapon. Of course, no protagonist was hurt. All without a scratch.I literally hate this movie, it is so bad.

title: Entertaining, trite, predictable
text: The set pieces are predictable, the chases obvious, the characters cartoonish, the banter too obvious. Good for an afternoon matinee when it's raining.

title: Worst Movie that I was waiting for !!
text:
The movie was a disappointment ..
The comedy was alright but the story was disappointed.And don't let me start with Gal Gadot acting in this film it was so bad.

title: Not very good movie
text: A poor version of indiana jones series. I was awaiting to see this movie on Netflix for one month, but such a waste of time.It's bwttwr to wait for the next indiana jones serie.

title: Shallow and bland
text: Really not one single interesting thought or idea pops up 🆙 n this film. Even the storyline about a genius art thieve and a dedicated agent has been done over and over again.Also very unrealistic without intent, and therefore rather irritating then entertaining.Don't waist your time in it.

title: Ughhhh
text: I really hate to be doing this but this movie was boring as hell. Expected a lot from Ryan Reynolds, I feel he's doing way too much and churning out movies way too quickly of late. He needs to be a lil more picky in his roles.

title: Both, "Ocean's Eleven" and "Mission: Impossible" are ashamed and embarrassed.
text: Cash grab inspired by pure plagiarism, full of clichés, and covered by product placement.Well, first of all I could not imagine that it is possible to add that amount of advertising and product placement (Porsche, Alitalia, Christian Louboutin, Microsoft, etc. In first 30-35 minutes). Secondly, on top of such fat marketing layer, that cake has tremendous amount of different type of clichés (USA=FBI, Italy = Interpol, Russia = Prison, etc.). Finally, cast of the movie seems fine till you realize that they are playing their typical characters; "Deadpool", "Mr. Luke Hobbs", and "Wonder Women".P. S: Of course movie should make money and cover all expenses, but that movie unite almost all negative and disturbing things that kind of making unpleasant experience. C'mon guys, you really consider viewers so stupid and want waste their time for such a empty copy of the well-known movies!?

title: Bad movie
text: So much potential. So much wasted. Maybe next time invest in a better story instead of blowing all the budget on expensive actors. Didn't like it at all. Yes it's meant to be a light and enjoyable movie, but that doesn't mean the story has to have so much holes and unlogical things.

title: Moderately entertaining but ultimately a poorly executed mess.
text: Predictable twists.Dwayne Johnson plays himself.... Again.Gal Gadot, as usual, relies on her looks to get her through her scenes due a severe lack of acting ability.Ryan Reynolds plays Family- Friendly Deadpool... again.The Spanish/British villain decided to deliver his lines as Albous Dumbledoor.It's a hot mess of a film. Barely watchable. Ok if you have absolutely nothing better to do.

title: Poor attempt at an action movie with poor direction
text:
First off the bar let's get this aired, Rita Arya couldn't act her way out of a paper bag. This completely ruins the films aesthetic as her presence in her scenes is one dimensional at best. The movie is a mashup of other movies that makes it obvious and predictable.Ryan Reynolds is entertaining as usual and Dwayne Johnson is as always doing an impression of himself.The action is over the top in the Fast and Furious era. Put it all together and you have a confused blur many action scenes that attempt to carry the movie through
the poor acting of both Rita Arya and Gil Gadot.

title: A list cast but average storyline
text: Like 70% of all DJ's movies it turned out average. Always a 5 or 6/10 for me. The story lines are so predictable and boring. Just because it had the biggest opening Netflix has ever seen and probably grossed a silly amount of money.......don't be fooled. These are not metrics in which to measure yourself on. Your the people's champ so listen to them.....

title: Dwayne Johnson is a train wreck
text: Well, nothing new. When putting Dwayne Johnson in a comedy you can expect nothing less than a train wreck. Other than that, movie is okay for a binge watching, but not worthy for a friday night.

title: A thoroughly MEH experience.
text: Red Notice (2021) is the latest outing from Netflix and is a comedy, action, heist, adventure blend which is about an FBI agent trying to bring down the world's greatest thief with the help of the second greatest after things go screwy apprehending the latter. Starring Ryan Reynolds, Dwayne Johnson and Gal Gadot, I got excited and gave it a watch. Sadly, it turned out to be a very middling experience.One would expect that there would be a great deal of charisma, enthusiasm and quality back-and-forth banter with the Actors (particularly the male duo) the movie has at its disposal but one would be wrong. It's not that there isn't any but what you get for the most part and for a lack of a better word, is pure MEH. It's not terrible, you can stomach it but there is nothing special here. Ryan Reynolds felt like he was doing most of the heavy work by being his usual self with some of the Deadpool persona bleeding in improvising in a not-so-good script still being my favourite part of the movie, whereas the Rock was oddly enough living up to his name, by being a rock, and for whatever reason, he or the director decided this would be the movie for it, against Deadpool... It's good to live up to your name but you still gotta choose an appropriate time and this was not it. Gal Gadot, while being gorgeous and someone who looked like she was having fun, also came with a heft dose of cringe in some of her scenes.Couple that with the goofy nature of the movie which, in a better-written film with interesting comradery between the characters could have been highly entertaining, with a plot that is easily forgettable with the propensity for "twists" without the wit to carry whatever level of self-awareness that movies try to present leaves you with a mishmash of elements taken from much better films where neither the sum of its parts nor the whole is as entertaining as it should have been. Again, it's MEH.Also, with a reported $200 Million budget, it has some pretty shoddy visuals at times while having some cool shots and sets otherwise. This is a repeated trend I've seen in big-budget movies lately where they'll have massive budgets but you don't see that reflected in the visuals/production properly. And if DUNE can look wonderful with a relatively lower budget, these other movies have no excuse with the level of CGI they end up using.Anyway, I was hoping for a lot more fun than I ended up experiencing. You get a massive sequel bait at the end and there are two more entries greenlit by Netflix, so we'll get more of this Trio. Not excited but who knows, they might end up being better. This is an average experience at best which I can't really recommend unless you have nothing else to watch and just want something to pass the time. And if I were to rate it, I'd give it a 5/10.

title: A salad of gimmicks and pretentiousness
text: Plot, action, photography, effects... All stand behind one element, three in this case: the gimmick of the characters.In this movie the characterization of personalities of the characters fit so perfectly Reynolds, Johnson and Gadot, that the two become one. It's them playing themselves. Poorly written.It looks like a 2h Jimmy Fallon's sketch with more action and special effects.

title: Is Ryan Reynolds's an actor? Because Gal Gadot definitely isn't.
text: Does Ryan Reynolds's act? I can't tell because he seems to be the same character in every movie slightly enjoyable and annoying. Gal is boring and offers the same amount of enjoyment to a movie as a warm glass of water does to a meal. Also, if you're undercover speaking to each other via an earpiece maybe try not to touch your ear every three seconds!!! If I was 8 I would enjoy this movie.

title: Cheap
text: Movies are being made a lot cheaper now. The effects are B movie rated and the story had potential but was just ruined completely by lack of effortput into this production. Not enjoyable.

title: Abandon All Critical Faculties, Ye who Enter Here
text: Conjuring the likely pitch meeting for this mess of a buddy movie is easier than suspending disbelief where the flick is concerned: "Yeah, we'll pair Deadpool with The Rock, throw Wonder Woman in as a evil love interest and then have Lila Pitts play the cop that wants to ruin all the fun. We'll make billions at the box office, I'll tell ya! Wait, what, it will be released on Netflix? Oh well, we can always juke those stats...."Indeed, with all star power, including an incongruous cameo by Ed Sheeran (uh, who?), juked stats are a given, which likely explain the 6-star rating this meandering mess has "earned." But hey, that's what you expect when a movie tries to capture some semblance of Hope/Crosby buddy film charm, yet when choosing between a coherent plot and being cute chooses cute. Every. Single. Saccharine. Time.

title: Spent all their money on cast
text: This is bad. I couldn't tell if they were trying to be serious or funny, but they accomplished neither. Clearly they spent all their budget on the cast for a poorly written script and video game-looking fake visuals.Not sure how or why I made it to the very end.The worst part is that they set it up for a sequel, but I'm not sure why. I've seen enough here.

title: Super bored
text: What a waste of time.... Stupid, just stupid without any value or meaning ...I don't understand the high rates to be honest - this is a pure Hollywood trash.

title: Garbage
text: Stinky piece of contemptuous garbage. I will never get this time back. If these actors keep this up you are literally watching them jump the shark.I couldn't even follow the plot it was so simple. Reynolds plays Reynolds, Rock plays Rock and BANG! What should be "paper scissors rock to Gadot" just shows her to be a terrible terible limited actress.As long as overpaid actors like these continue to make this sort of copy and paste film-making we are our own worst enemy for encouraging them.My 13 year old daughter seemed to like it - but even she said the jungle scenes looked like they were filmed in someone's back yard.Avoid.

title: Dont look for any logic
text: This movie is definitely entertaining if you put your brain aside. Do not look for logic at all. This movie is good to bring your childhood memories back when you were entertained by nonsense.I wish they hadnt dragged the end. It just ruins everything.Ps: I think Gal Gadot is overrated.

title: Globetrot my...
text: Interpol arrests someone in Italy and they send them in Russian prison?? For stealing art?? Come on people writing scripts!!And if I can tell that what I see is a studio and not real jungle, lake, etc then even the rest of the magic is gone.Netflix if you pay 3 stars for a movie, pay some Hollywood guys to turn a heartless movie to a blockbuster.

title: Meh
text: Boring and dumb humor. Ryan is not even funny in this. Terrible script. Corny acting. Bored actors trying to make a buck in a mediocre film where no one tries hard to act well.

title: Sunday afternoon flick
text: Cheesy plot, light acting, dumb dialogs filled with clichés, it's...an easy movie. Easy to forget, easy to enjoy, easy to hate.I stand more in the hate part because I really feel if you're over 12 the sheer lack of depth hurts your intelligence, even uf you're just watching it for the jokes and passing time. Quite median, but has rge quality of a big budget so it doesn't insult you further.

title: Not as funny or good as it thinks it is.
text: It should be funny - and it is in places, just not enough places. There is a weak link, and that is Ryan Reynolds. He's just not funny, or likeable. He tries too hard.The script needed rewriting, it isn't slick enough. The direction is clunky at times. There is too much swearing (this is a 12 these days?).Ms Gadot & Mr Johnson are fine, but the material isn't. Pity.It could have been so much better.

title: Boring copy and paste movie
text: We can only take so much of these type of movies.The movie itself is not horrible, but we have seen it soooo many times, it is no longer entertaining.Ryan and Dwayne play the same character in every movie.Most ppl won't waste their time with these movies anymore, there is too much quality out there now , and all we have to do is press a few buttons on the remote to get there.

title: Dead pool commentary was kind of fun
text: The story is horrible, Gal character and performance are terrible, The rock was mediocre. The only thing to really enjoy in this "movie" is Ryan Reynolds Deadpool style jokes. I suggest you do not waste your time and watch the whole movie and just watch the funny bits on YouTube.

title: Oh god
text: Everyone in this movie was terrible at acting except for Ryan Reynolds. I would have rated it less but I think Ryan deserves at least 4 stars. The plot could have had potential but I don't know. I don't understand how it was fumbled this bad. It was a decent cast, substantial let down. Truly can't bring myself to change it to a 5 star review I'm so sorry.

title: No longer smell what the rock is coking
text: Ryan Reynolds carried the movie. The whole time all I could think is... BOY I can not smell what the rock is cooking!!! I kept falling asleep to the darn movie.

title: Seriously, what were you thinking, Netflix?
text: Don't get me wrong. I'm a fan of Ryan Reynolds and his typical brand of humour. And i thought with The Rock on his side, the action will be even better than the Deadpool.Even Netflix must have thought the same. But what was great on paper was surprisingly very very boring and mundane affair after execution.The dialogues were okay (ish), i had high expectations after the awesome writing of Deadpool but this movie is a disaster from the word go.The ending twist is also pretty mediocre and though this leaves the space for sequel, I'm damn sure it won't ever happen!

title: On what was the money spent?
text: Pretty poor efford of a movie, especially when you know how much money it costs. It makes one wonder on what it was spent, but it was definetely not on a script. If you don't like thinking or well written scripts, maybe this is the movie for you.

title: Mediocre at best.
text: Poorly produced, poorly directed, poor editing, action sequences are well below par, CGI is abysmal, poor plot, no depth or substance. It attempts to be exciting, suspenseful, have plot twists, and they do not deliver to any degree. All of the hallmarks of poorly executed film riding on the profile of its cast. The only saving graces are Ryan Reynolds and Gal Gadot. You can tell it's a 7 Bucks Production.

title: No more Gal Gadot please
text: I would give more stars because the guys are good as always, story is typical but its okay.But Gal Gadot is such a bad bad bad actor, everytime she was on screen talking I was about to turn off the movie. HOW ON EARTH anyone can hire her? Because she is pretty? Thats all the quality she has. I don't think I will ever watch a movie again that involves her.

title: Is this meant as a parody?
text: Nuff said.but I have to use up 150 characters so I'll add that a great cast is wasted in this obviously expensive but childish movie. What were they trying for ? I can image the pitch ; it's Raiders of the Lost Ark meets James Bond.in a heist caper movie. Sounds dreadful and it is .

title: Great cast, but still fell a bit flat!
text: My boyfriend liked it more than me, and I really cannot describe why I did not completely connect with it because it has an amazing cast! I love Ryan Reynolds, I love The Rock, and I love Gal Gadot, so not sure. I did get some good laughs out of it though, but besides one moment close to the end, it was pretty predictable.

title: suit for non-cinema movie
text: Its just decent. Just a good action movie with over the top cliché. If you've watched a lot of American action comedy movie with The Rock in it. You pretty much can guess everything about it. It's fun, you can just enjoy it. But it is too cliché and have nothing new to offer, at all.

title: kinda meh
text: You can watch it if you dont have anything to do for 2 hours but nothing new here... and gal gadot is just weird idk why's her acting so bad... and she got arms thinner than starving kids in Africa you expect me to believe she beats up a guy 10 times her body size.

title: Everyone should be ashamed of themselves
text: The writers, directors, actors, Netflix, IMDb, but most of all anyone giving this tripe a good review, you should hang your heads in shame. Absolutely awful.

title: Guiltily Entertaining
text: Turn your brain off and enjoy it. The stars give likeable performances and the storyline delivers attractive locations and a few twists.None of it counts for much, of course. Key to enjoying it is not expecting too much. Nor wondering afterwards whether it was good use of a couple of hours of your life!

title: Not good
text: Bad script writing, not an impressive film. I dont know why any of the actors would even do this movie. I usually think Ryan Reynolds is funny, or at least interesting to watch / has done some very good films but this was just embarrassing. Granted I only made it about 20 minutes in but I can't imagine it was going to get any better. Don't waste your time.

title: predictable but not bad
text: Watched with my 17 year old daughter, the twists were telegraphed , the rock was fine playing the rock, he has zero range, he is a charismatic guy but is the same guy in every movie, Reynold is meh, Gadot can rock red lipstick like no one since Jennifer Connolly in the Rocketeer, but is not much more than eye candy.Its an ok movie and has some laughs, no preaching so a tepid thumbs up.

title: This story is a tale told by an idiot, full of sound and fury,
text: Well....i'm a huge fan of Gale, Ryan and of course The Dwayne...so it should have been a glorious moment to see those 3 in the same movie with an enormous budget....aaaaand well money can be important to shot a movie but as we can see here, it's not the " main ingredient" to make a movie actually enjoyable ( as proven by Edgar Wright ). It's difficult to explain why because, everything looks great on paper, it's another " Netflix" movie with a lot of cash, high speed storytelling ( slow down the coke, writers, you're probably no more than 5 years old....), LSD induced jumpcut editing, glamorising any little fart from the actors ( especially Gale who almost looks/acts like Angelina Jolie...shame on you Netflix ).. it almost makes "6 underground" look like a peaceful, a bit boring, David Attenborough documentary. Well it's very simple, it's like an overdone, overly complicated wedding cake with no actual taste, it's not a movie, it's a videoclip, it's not a story, it's a necklace of clichés that suffocates the actors...it's beautiful but useless and i will take a ham sandwich anytime instead of this stodgy cake.

title: Nothing new.
text: Ryan Reynolds won't bore you but the story is just predictable. Nothing new in this movie except the metaphor around which the storyline is revolving.

title: I wasn't. Expecting much...
text: And... I got just that, Sad really . Just vanilla dressed Up like chocolate I am thinking Ryan may have a "use by" date....2121...................................

title: Obsolete and cartoonish with an abysmal film score
text: Look, I get that this is just a "fun" action comedy but where does one draw the line though? This movie just feels fake and outdated all around. From the try-hard Jackie Chan like exhibition fight scenes to the absolutely horrendous over the top movie soundtrack, the kind that you hear in family adventure films from like 20 years ago constantly assaulting your ears.Boy did they go above and beyond to make this a light-hearted-action-comedy to be this cartoonish. Probably a movie made for the smooth brains and 10 year old's to be honest. Anyways, I couldn't make it though the part where two adult males, one is literally The Rock big and each getting their asses kicked by a 100 lbs chick. Wow so fun and light hearted!

title: Background Noise
text: It's one of those things you watch on Netflix because it's there. It's not something you go to the theater for or pay to rent. I left it on in the background after the 3rd dated pop culture reference. Tony Stark wouldn't even bother to tell Ryan Reynolds to stop. He'd just walk away and forget he ever met him in Red Notice.

title: Lightweight slapstick
text: Big named movie but a bit too predictable.Watched for 30 minutes , got bored. No suspense , poor script, No menace. Seen it all before.It's one saving grace was no woke , no PC rubbish , for that it deserves 4 out of 10.

title: Meh With A Capital M
text: Expectations met and nothing more.I was a little concerned when pairing the Rock with Reynolds that it would be a quip fest and not much else. Thankfully whilst full of smart ar*e comments you don't drown in them.The movie offers nothing beyond a paint by numbers experience, so this one will easily slip away from the memories of cinema goers.The awful. Gadot. In this movie (and perhaps her others) she offers nothing more than expensive eye candy. Its an uninspiring performance that could have been matched by a cardboard cutout.Unless a fan of the three stars, I can't imagine that you would watch this twice :)

title: Gal Gadot saves it
text:
Should you watch it for the plot? Absolutely not.There are plot twists? Yes, many, but they were all easy to find out
Should you watch it just to see Gal in those stunning outfits?? OF COURSE, that's the whole reason to watch itIt also makes you laugh a bit but just some stupid jokes nothing more.

title: Terrible movie
text: Horrible movie, just Reynolds' usual funny ad libs give a few funny - or less lame - moments. Otherwise, the rock is a joke, really bad actor, literally says nothing more than a few sloppy catchphrases, couldn't keep up with Reynolds at all, he got zero chemistry with him or gadot in the movie. Man 200 mill for this trash, getting lower and lower quality in movies.

title: Stupid and boring
text: Someone have paid a lot for fake reviews. This movie suck. Amazing actors are wasting their talent on a stupid script. Interpol will not send prisoners to Russia, the relation to Russia is not very good. If the only escape from the prison is the attack helicopter then they should probably guard with more than one person who watch Instagram. When you open a 50 year old metallic hatch it will probably be some rust and resistant. You do not arrest an FBI agent after only one phone call where someone you never have spoken with before claim that the agent is fake.Ok this is a fun heist movie, or doesn't have to be realistic in every detail. But this movie is just stupid stupid stupid.

title: Predictable
text: Annoyingly predictable and lack of storytelling. It starts off off the rails and just continues from there and I hate how Hollywood made interpol some powerful agency when in reality they cant do anything it's so annoying.

title: Wrote by a 4 year old ?
text: Truly unbelievable , ridiculous situations I know it's perhaps to be light hearted non serious entertainment but it's truly almost like a boring cartoon.

title: Any reviews over 4 are a lie.
text: Netflix must have payed these actors a fortune just to act in this really badly made nonsense. It's a high budget wast of 1 hour and 49 minutes of my life I will never get back.

title: Just plain terrible
text: A star studded cast and beautiful locations could not save this movie from its horrible script. The plot twist did not save the movie and none of my family members enjoyed this movie, although my sister did enjoy Ed Sheeran's cameo.

title: Riding on the hype
text: When I saw the trailer I had some expectations but after watching the movie I must say it doesn't live upto the standards and this movie is just another example of how good the Netflix marketing is. So the movie is about Cleopatra eggs and their heist. It takes place all over the world from Italy to Bali. Now I'm not gonna give any spoilers but the plot is nothing special, kind of predictable there few good jokes here and there. The actors have done a decent job in terms of acting tbh the rolls which they have played are not challenging from any kind. If you want to spend two hours then definitely watch this one but don't expect anything special. This is pure Netflix marketing nothing else.

title: Rock, Heightism is worse than racism
text: So I was watching the new red notice movie with Gal Gadot, the Rock and Ryan Gosling-all who are tall.There's a part in the movie where Gal is dancing with the Rock and this man, Sotte Voche cuts in their dance and asks to dance with Gal. So as the Rock backs off and is walking away; Ryan asks him how he knew he would cut in and the Rock says something like "he's a 5'5 man with Napoleon complex that needs to assert his dominance" something like that.Then later, he calls Sotte Voche a "muscular toddler" and tells him it wouldn't have worked out with Gal (when Sotte calls her his)because she's a hard 10 and "..the height difference, it just wouldn't have worked out" I found it so odd.What's even weirder is the actor is 5'9(average height) and Sotte's height wasn't even something I even really noticed tbh.It blows my mind how normalized heightism is towards short men, even at it's most casual effect.

title: Same old style
text: Nothing's new here to watch or to even expect. Three stars should have been used properly but some very cliche plot, no twist, anyone watched a good heist movie would know what will happen next. Lost 2hrs net. :(

title: A proper terrible movie
text: The acting was subpar, and definitely not funny. The suspense was just a little to zealous and action was just OK. Gal Gadot is just an OK actress and nothing more. Rock can act but here he chooses not to. Ryan was fine though with his trademark comedy moves and lines.Does not have much to say. Almost bored.

title: Waste of time
text: It is not even funny. The plot does not make sense. It's a covid time production. The actor were over whelming the movie with extravaganzas moves. We got three friends recommendation but disappointed at the final results. Too much hollywood!

title: Utter Garbage
text: Full of Cliches and Tropes. Below average acting. And same old Unfunny Ryan Reynolds humour. The suspension of dissbeleive just doesnt cover this mediocre flick.

title: True waste of time
text: Ryan Reynolds has good comedic timing, and that save a lot of his scenes.The Rock, well, the Rock is a wrestler turned actor.Gal Gadot has no such excuse. A cardboard cutout would have fared better.I sense a continuing agenda here, which began with her debut in Batman Vs Superman.Thing is, as time progresses, it is becoming self-defeating. Certain power players will stop pushing it eventually.

title: More High Budget Netflix Garbage!
text: "Let's get three of the hottest names in Hollywood, do a bump of Coke and come up with some random scenes to a thinly veiled plot!"This movie literally tries to do WAY too much.Is it a action movie? Is it a prison escape movie? A historical movie? And buddy cop movie? A Sleuth film? The answer is... none of these. It tries incredibly hard to be something but the random scenes and stories have little to no plot.Fun twist tho which is why it's not a 3Netflix... Do Better.

title: Weak
text: Started out well and became boring halfway. The plot is weak and twists are uninteresting. Disappointing. At some points it was even boring enough to switch attention to my phone.

title: Could have been great, but foul language makes it silly
text: This movie could have been really good and the whole family could enjoy it. However the desperate need to use foul language ruins everything for a family that wants to watch this. So the movie is absolutely not recommended for any family with kids. I'm not sure how Netflix cannot find other smarter sarcastic words as an alternative? Does it not have educated or intelligent people working for the company?

title: Terrible
text: Another project brought down by the rocks terrible acting. It's amazing how insane the world is today when everything terrible gets praised and rewarded. Rock is clearly the weakest link in this bland story done 100 times in the past, but done better. Weak writing and predictable plot make this a must pass.. Stay away from this at all costs...watching paint dry is much more entertaining.

title: Kids adventure movie.
text: It's basically an adventure movie for youngsters. Lots of action and shooting, but no one gets severely hurt (in camera) and the guns are pretty useless except when they act as ''remote control'' to flip distant ''switches''. This screams game adaptation.Overall probably good fun for the right audience, me.. i'm way too old with 40 to enjoy such a silly suspense-of-belief fest !

title: Trash
text:
This is the worst movie i have ever seen, the writing is 0/10, the plot is 0/10, the acting is 1/10
And gal gadot must be the worst actress on the planet.

title: Major disappointment
text: Had high hopes when I watched this.... but was mega disappointed. Who wrote this thing? A 14 year old? It came off as a mish-mash of Indiana Jones meets Mission Impossible..... so many cliche lines that felt forced.... Ryan Reynolds comes across as his typical smart-ass persona... which I'm thinking is how he is in real life...... Duane Johnson ("the Rock") does not come across as an FBI psych profiler... whoever thought he could pull that off is way off their rocker.Skip this debacle....... it's not worth your time....

title: Lo que esperaba
text: Una película de acción irreal, humor simple y sin ningún tipo de originalidad. Ryan Reynolds con su papel de siempre, lo mismo con La Roca Johnson. Gal Gadot continúa desperdiciando su talento y va camino a construir una mediocre carrera repleta de roles poco interesantes. En fin, la película es entretenida y nada más...

title: Who writes this trash...
text: Everything happens for a reason to happen or the story wouldn't work... it's so unbelievable, like none of it would make any sense but only makes sense because something else happens that leads to what happens next. Could have been great, the characters are good, the writing was ok but there's alot of poor cgi, over the top nonsense, but great looking scenes and costumes. The whole story itself was trash like it was written by diffrent people that came up with what happens next. P.s is it me or does hollywood hate fathers lately.

title: Been a long time since I turned a film off..
text: But I just can't handle the blatant product placement. Look at the zoom in on the Porcshe badges,.and even worse, the bottle of Gin whose company happens to be owned by Mr Ryan Reynolds, which manages to magically switch position so the label is always facing camera.

title: Poor, very poor film
text: This could've been a fantastic film with a great cast. Paragraph however the writing is very sloppy, the Bromance is very poor and Gal is just wasted sadly.

title: Corny and Predictable
text: Pretty faces are about all this movie has to offer. Honestly one of the worst I've ever seen. It's about as empty and disposable as a McDonald's happy meal.

title: Sooooo bad.
text: Netflix trying too hard. Its not funny, its not serious, its trying to be too clever with camera action stuff, just doesnt do anything good.....after 5 minutes you could tell what you getting.

title: Moments of not being horrible
text: Three actors who have all played the exact same characters in every movie they've ever been in, a very mediocre, lazy script, and no attempt to make it the slightest bit different than what you'd expect. Pretty nearly unwatchable. I gave it an extra star for not being completely unwatchable.

title: Stupid
text: It could be a funny movie to watch with no expectation. Weak story, screenplay, actors and thats ok. But put a RAIN FOREST AT ARGENTINA is the most stupid thing i have ever seen.

title: HUGE waste of time !
text: It's like watching a very bad movie but with famous actors.I think all actors now days play anything to get payed no matter what.Now I'm going to watch Snakes on a Plane to recover from this Fiasco !

title: Meh 😒
text: Mediocre story and some very stupid action. Overall waste on time. If you've seen any heist movie, and I mean any; then this won'tadd anything to that experience.

title: Generic Predicable Unrealistic Gal Gadot
text: The plot was generic and very predictable, lacking originality. The characters were underdeveloped and lacked depth, despite the strong performance of Reyolds. Dwayne was just being Dwayne in all of his movies, nothing new there, but Gal Gadot was terrible like in all of her movies. I'm not sure why there is so much hype around her but she is absolutele garbage.The heavy use of CGI detracts from the realism of the action scenes. Additionally, some find the action sequences to be particularly unrealistic and difficult to believe. The movie's pacing is uneven, with long stretches of exposition and slow-moving scenes that fail to build tension or advance the plot.

title: Watch ANY other Ryan Reynolds movie, and you'll have a better time
text: Red Notice's only redeeming quality is Ryan Reynolds. He seems to have written his own lines, while every other character's seem as if they were written by an AI. The Rock's character is rock-like, Gal Gadot seemed to be trying as hard as she could, but ultimately brought nothing to the table.Then there's Chris Diamantopoulos. He must have read the script, thought "Well this is the worst attempt at an action movie I've seen in a while", and decided that no matter what he did in his role, it couldn't possibly make the movie worse. The result is an accent that I can only describe as an attempt to copy Eddie Redmayne's accent in Jupiter Ascending, which itself was one of the most cringe-worthy parts of an overwhelmingly embarrassing movie. I don't want to see Eddie Redmayne in another movie until he's seen on video giving his Oscar back for that travesty.The CGI, and it happens a lot, is unfinished at best. There are movies that came out now 20 years ago that have better CGI. Textures are too smooth, people fall faster than physics should allow, people bounce off of bulls with no injuries, and at no point is it convincing.The plot was on par with Godzilla vs. Kong's cinematic interpretation of a four year-old smashing his toys together and calling it "plot", only this movie was clearly done by an older child. Maybe aged six. It constantly bounces back and forth between "THIS character is actually with THIS character...and they're betraying THIS character" with such regularity that plot beats became predictable down to the five second window in which the next rotation of betrayal would happen. The most surprising thing that happens in the entire movie is that Chris Diamantopoulos's character doesn't show up one last time after he may or may not have been killed by a hatch.This is just another garbage movie that Netflix has tried to release, continuing their trend of making passable shows and resoundingly mediocre movies. I don't know why I try anymore, because they ALWAYS result in disappointment.

title: 200 Million for what?!
text: Actually, from the story, it's a fun movie, but that is torpedoed superbly by Dwayne Johnson and Ryan Renolds.Dwayne is playing Dwayne and seemingly trying to get people to stop watching him at some point. "Jungle Cruise" was very enjoyable again, though. In this film, the role was simply miscast with him.Ryan once again plays a variation of Deadpool and he has already achieved what Dwayne seems to want to achieve - you don't feel like it anymore, you already know what's coming.Gal Gadot - that was the real surprise after the dry "Wonderwoman 1984" - she was sympathetic, believable and you really hated her in places. Very good!Now the real criticism - if I see again such an overpriced disaster that I have to pay implicitly AND there were 70 product placements, spread over 30 minutes, especially liquor products of Dwayne and Ryan prominently placed ... then it's enough.A salary of 20 million $ for each main actor was not enough. I don't want to sound like a socialist, but to have bad performance paid royally and personally profit additionally - that's going too far.

title: Pure FROMMAGE!
text: Translation: typical cheesy Rock film - fast & furious meets jumanji meets scorpion king meets get smart meets welll you get the point I could go on for hours much like this movie.

title: So Disappointing
text: Maybe my expectations of this movie we're too high. The stars of this film are awesome. Only one of those stars that shined was Ryan Reynolds. The rest totally disappointed. A user here said that Ryan Reynolds carried the film. That is 100% true. I was really excited for this film to come out and was really disappointed. Ryan Reynolds did carry the film but he carried it with his knowledge of One Hundred Years of cinematography and Deadpool joke. The movie definitely could have been better especially with the cast that they had. My daughter asked if I would recommend this movie and I told her to do what several other films before watching this one.

title: Terrible, run of the mill toilet visit.
text: Seriously, it's less embarrassing to watch a soap opera. All that money and not one original line.This film is so derivative it's offensive, even down to the "smouldering tango" at the "eyes wide shut" party. Think more pillage than homage.The script is clichéd, the CGI poor, and the set pieces are bland and uninspiring.I'm getting pretty tired of Reynolds' comedic comebacks now. In Blade 3 it was refreshing, Deadpool made it work with that 4th wall thing but now it's just getting weak.All in all, yet another entirely forgettable mega-million dollar release. Imagine how many homeless shelters they could have built instead of making this.

title: This movie's identity crisis ruins what could have been good...
text: The big problem with Red Notice isn't the cast or the budget or the sets; it's that it has trouble deciding what it wants to be. And because of that it is a lot worse than it should have been. At the start you might think that you're in for a Bond movie tribute but unless you're a fan of Roger Moore's silliest outings as 007 you're gonna be disappointed. It's not a buddy movie because the chemistry between the two male leads is lacking. It isn't a comedy either. Bad jokes, worse puns and poorly executed slapstick at random moments drain every drop of fun from the movie. As a heist movie it doesn't work either. And as a hommage to Indiana Jones it fails horribly and it comes across as a cheap disrespectful parody instead. No amount of self-awareness (whistling the Indiana Jones theme tune: seriously?!) will overcome that. I was somewhat entertained but I will never watch this again. A pity because with this cast and budget this could have been great!

title: 200 million dollars in trash.
text:
Incredibly stupid and ridiculous movie. The plot is full of stamps, holes and boring dialogue. Johnson plays Johnson if his bulging eyes and raised eyebrow can be called a game at all. Reynolds looks like a bad parody of Deadpool, and Gadot just crooks and overplays terribly. The Russian prison is straight from cheap action of the 80s. Disgusting graphics quality. 200 million budget? That's how much Avatar cost. And it clearly shows what the money was spent on. The Red Notice shows nothing that can cost such money. Obviously, half of the budget was spent on the fees of leading actors..
The movie is pacifier, you don't have to watch it.

title: Nothing Special
text: Even when he's playing a different kind of character, The Rock can only play one character... the good cop with bad jokes. He is the same person in every single movie.Ryan Reynolds was the only reason this didn't get a 1 from me, and I don't typically even like him.

title: A Mr & Ms Smith without charisma
text: Unfortunately I wasn't born yesterday!So I had the chance to watch, Mr & Ms Smith, Indiana Jones, Juwel of the Nile and some other. It's the been there, done that kind of thing.And all the other ones have done it better! Way better! Why? Because all the other movies had charisma in spades! And it comes from acting. Go figure!Wooden acting and no bond between the 3 stars has totally ruined this movie. Dwayne was an elefant in the glass shop. Crushing everything with his physique. Gal Gadot managed not to be sexy at all. And you need an atomic bomb to light a fire between the two. Ryan was somewhat better. Not great. Just passable.The script is generic and not important. Just random exotic places brought to you via green screen. This didn't even bother me. Just imagine Gal passionately kissing Dwayne. You can't? Yeah! So it makes no difference what's in the background.Did you just hatch in this world? Then this movie is for you. A 10/10 recommendation. And when you grow older, go check the other ones!

title: So predictable you will cringe
text: There are predictable movies out there. But some will have good actors. Others might have funny lines. Or maybe just a nice soundtrack.Unfortunately, there is nothing to save "Red Notice". The plot is horribly predictable, and the multiple "twist endings" just keeping dragging on and on. But worst of all are the jokes. The attempt at humour by these so-called writers is the kind of humour one would've maybe appreciated at age 10.Ryan Reynolds' character is insufferable - not in a annoying but loveable way - but career-endinglu "cringe." Gal Gadot plays yet another one-dimensional character who contributes nothing but red lipstick and half-baked jokes.The only mild saving grace is Dwayne Johnson. Although why he has chosen to star in this movie is a true mystery.If you want to waste 1-2hrs cringing and feeling overall ill, this is the movie for you.

title: O well netflix
text: Its a avarage action movie nothing special. Ryan its like watching deadpool with no mask. Dwayne is ok like the tequila. GG a wonderfully woman and beautiful. The Wonderwoman. Hope they dont make any other parts of the movie one is good. Well if the movie was a stock i would be broke today thats how good this movie is.

title: Fun in a nonsensical way
text: I give three stars for this - one for each of the principal actors. The camera works are bad with jump cuts every half a second during fight scenes. The script looked like it was written by a five-year-old. The only saving grace is the chemistry among the actors, well, most of the time.

title: basically its Johnny English & copying Jackie Chan comical fight scenes
text: Basically its Johnny English & copying Jackie Chan comical fight scenes.The Deadpool guy sadly always plays the same character literally.The Rock's acting is always bad and overrated but in a way laughable too.The movie is very predictable and dialogue is predictable.There are many slow dead spots in the movie kinda flat spots too slow... but overall it's worth watching but not gonna watch twice. Once is enough. Ever.. but better than nothing to watch... TBH The best bit waa the Ancient Alien narrator's voice in the beginning ,that was a nice touch.The CGI is mediocre.

title: It doesn't get much worse than this...
text: Look. I get that these type of movies are meant to be a bit of fun... and in that it utterly fails. If maybe Ryan Reynolds new how to do anything else, or if this movie wasn't EXACTLY like 99% of everything he's ever done- then Maybe this would be average... but it's not so that's why I give it a terrible rating. Also I can't stand how Reynolds glorifies crime especially murder (less so in this movie which copies 80% from the similarly awful Bodyguard movies ) as something funny or interesting. It's not. Reynolds is a (sad) joke. Please never do another movie again. Sincerely.

title: Better than other Netflix movies, but there is still a way to go
text: This is a good fun movie that worth watching with the kids. Ryan Reynolds holds up the movie with his Deadpool like performance and jokes, while The Rock and Gal Gadot are not in their best days.If you recommend this movie to an adult, be prepared to be embarassed in certain exaggerated fight scenes and dialogs, mainly when Gadot is on screen.Anyways, way better than efforts like "I care a lot", but there is much to improve. These writers may learn with Tom Cruise's writers in Mission Impossible or Edge of Tomorrow.

title: Nope.
text: Dwayne Johnson stop doing action flicks. Too old too chunky, and too damn slow. I wanted to like the movie. I sort of like the casting. Chunky old Johnson should be the guy in the chair, directing ops. Not a front line guy anymore. Boring.

title: Disappointing is the best review this movie can get
text: Netflix yet fails again. A-list actors with F-list creative. I'm officially adding Rawson Marshall Thurber (director/writer) to my "DO NOT WATCH EVER LIST".No character building, chemistry between actors are almost there but lost by horrible plots, overly long pointless scenes. Action, thrills, comedy is unfortunately lost.

title: How can you make something this bad for that amount of money?
text: I really don't know what to say about this movie. There is no funny plot, no catching story, no excitement, no stunning action and also no chemistry between the actors. It says "BOOM" now and then and they fight. A lot. They say words, good for them. It has been made by professionals, so it did cost a lot of money. It shows, but that's all. So happy my dogs started to play while watching this movie, so actually I had good time, while streaming it from Netflix. Otherwise it would have been a waste of time. Really. I don't anything else to say.

text:
Ryan Reynolds , the rock & gal gadot in a heist movie. I was expecting more seeing these three in the same movie. Ed sheeran s cameo was good too probably my fav scene from the movie.Final verdict- decent movie & one time watchable but you should rather watch something good on Netflix if you are paying for their subscription.Anyways i don t have something else to say and imbd won't let me post this review bcs it says it doesn't have 600 characters so I'm gonna put some of my fav movies & shows on NetflixDeparted

title: Mediocre and generic to the bone
text: I wasn't expecting anything groundbreaking after seeing the trailer, but this movie is so generic it actually hurts my intellgence. Can't we get a fun, light and upbeat action comedy that's at least a bit original?What we have here... Generic escape scene, generic fight scene, snarky remarks, generic prison fight scene, generic escape scene, generic "funny" dialogue, generic conversation about feelings that's supposed to reveal some "depth" to main characters. I mean, even opening a very huge and expensive vault is so stupid. How is it possible to have an open usb port on the lock to an expensive vault door?! How?!Dialogues feel forced. Characters are shallow and predictable. I believe actors were sleepwalking through this boring script. Don't get me wrong I like some lighthearted fun and popcorn flicks. Not everything has to always make sense in a movie for me to enjoy it, but this one was a chore to go through. By the time you see the "big" plot twist you'll be half asleep or you won't care at all.Dwayne Johnson plays the same character in every movie.
