Instead of a suit put a khaki shorts and a tshirt on him and you'll have jungle-something-whatever instead of so called fbi profiler in Red Notice.Ryan's comedic style is amazing, but feels forced in this move. Jokes don't exactly land where they're supposed to. There's no chemistry between main characters. Gal Gadot is stunning as always, but I'm afraid her role is reduced to eye candy in most movies. I belive she could do so much more with a better script.All in all it's a 4 from me. Colorful, sparkly, shiny and utterly shallow, generic and mediocre.

title: The cliche of all cliches
text: I mean you can tell by the first scene that you know everyhing that will happen in this movie. Boring af, cheesy dialogs, poorly executed and a waste of big talents. Its a Netflix movie so i didnt expect much anyway.

title: Sadly misses the mark
text: It's clear that someone was attempting to start a series to join the Mission Impossible, Ocean's Eleven cannon, but it's just too predictable and more importantly it's awkward and clumsy. I absolutely love all of the key actors, but sadly it just kinda falls flat. Needed much better writers and director to compete with the best in this genre/cannon.

title: Acting talent
text: I wish gal could just be a model or something other than an actress she just uses her body her beauty in a vulgur way....she got zero acting talent and no sense of humour at all.

title: Could've been better
text: I think this movie could've been much better with better casting. I think The Rock was poorly cast. Ryan Reynolds out acted him in practically every scene. The movie could have managed quite well with just Ryan Reynolds and Gal Gadot - they were the standouts. It was a bit of fun, I got a laugh here and there, but the Rock was just too flat. I really expected more from Ryan Reynolds, this seems like a knock off of so many of The Rock's other shows...... Ryan Reynolds and Gal Gadot are way better than this. I wrote this review before the movie ended - towards the end it lost all credibility...... my score has gone down from my original post!!

title: Childish, and boring
text: What a snooze fest. Really young and predictable. Ryan Reynolds and Dwayne Johnson are not funny together. The idea of the movie was really bad. Enough already with this type of movie idea. It's like watching Gru and his minions but less funny.

title: As Processed As Fast Food
text: The trailers give you the impression it will have intriguing elements of an adventure, international flavor ala Indians Jones, a weather-worn hat and possibly a whip, danger and fun. Alas! None of these.Red Notice is as bland as sipping water and pretending it's martini with an olive. The film is also as processed as fast food but without the salt and sugar but that's what followers of the three primary cast actors blindly sought after. At least fast food is enjoyable although it may not be good for your health.Frankly, by now, you'd have got tired of Reynold's Deadpool-esque bland humor. How about Gadot? She's just strolled in and out supposedly with intelligence and grace but she just have to be reminded that she is not wearing the Amazonian super power swimsuit here. (No thanks to the script writer and director.)And as for Dwayne Johnson, why bother going for any movie he is in? There's nothing credible about the roles he took on these days nor his performances, if you can call it that at all. They are all not believable and as forgettable as Steven Segal's movies.If you want to waste your time, money and life, and go with numerous ho-hums (read: yawns) with all the mindlessly conceived on screen antics that passed off as creative talent, please go ahead and watch Red Notice.

title: A predictable heist film that boasts of a pricey cast..
text: At $200 million, Red Notice is the most expensive Netflix movie till date. With a cast that has a huge fan following: Dwayne Johnson, Gal Gadot & Ryan Reynolds; this film disappoints big time.FBI agent, John Hartley teams up with a cheeky art thief, Nolan Booth to stop the suave Bishop from stealing Cleopatra's three bejeweled eggs. This puts the trio on a globe trotting adventure with either party trying to best the other.Despite having a cast that boasts of some of the most popular actors of our time, Red Notice is a massive disappointment. Ryan Reynolds needs to do something about his characters. They are all basically the same person; they all have a cheeky nature; cracking similar jokes. He is as good as Varun Sharma or Aparshakti Khurana. Dwayne The Rock Johnson stars in what is one of his weakest films yet. Gal Gadot has the charm to pull of this role and she does. Her presence is the only saving grace.The plot is basically a medley of scenes from different countries across the globe. Most of it I guess was shot on set (except the scenes in Rome). The essence of a global film is lost when it doesn't truly capture the location in all its glory. The visual effects are pathetic for a movie that boasts of a 200$ million price tag. The heist theme has been tried & tested and there is nothing more to innovate here. Even the twists don't come as a surprise: very predictable.Red Notice is mildly entertaining solely because of Gal Gadot. Ryan Reynolds is repetitive and Dwayne Johnson seems lost when he isn't the centre of attention. You are not missing out on anything by skipping this.

title: Fake details
text: The acting and the cast are prefect, however the misleading details about Egypt, and the Egyptian artefacts are bull.First, not in a million years will Egypt let someone has a wedding at the pyramids.Even if they did, the three eggs are originally Egyptian property, so there's no way in hell Egypt's government will let the interpol arrest an Egyptian man and take the artefacts.Writers really need to study every aspect of the story to make it believable for the viewers, and understands that they have Egyptian viewers as well.Really disappointed.

title: Sloppy, choppy, and predictable
text: Not the worst movie, and some entertainment value for movie novices.I feel like some producer's held a meeting to establish they wanted to make a movie for Netflix that is Hollywood caliber. So, they picked a crew for the score. After hiring the actors, they found a writer to write something that wouldn't fail based on the actors level of fame and status within current cinema brands. It was written in a day. Then they found a director to figure out how to make it all work. He shot it all in a day, and phoned a friend to help edit; finished before the end of the third day. It's a movie that will never leave you guessing because of the juvenile and recycled concepts. The only surprise was how the movie showcased the weaknesses of all the actors. However, I did love the performance by Professor Dumbledore. Yes! Dumbledore! Listen, and you'll hear it. It took a couple of days, but I was able to finish the entire movie; regrettably. Sadly, it was so successful that I think the sequel has already been written, cast, filmed, and edited; pending a release date.Prediction: It's probably going to be the same movie with a mystical religious theme.

title: When a 10yo is selected to right a script...
text: Would not recommend if your iq is above 50. This movie is all over the place, but totally makes no sense at all. It's basically a bad crossover between indiana jones and oceans 11. At one point our protagonists are arrested in Rome and then instantly shipped to a prison in Russia. Gl trying to extradite an American to Russia😀😀😀. Anyway the movie is full of this kind of nonsense.

title: Even The Rock and Ryan Reynolds can't charm their way out of this terrible plot
text: The writing in this movie is terrible. Essentially The Rock and Ryan Reynolds are charismatic enough to give a little umph to nearly any plot but they cannot salvage this sloppily written mess. None of the characters motivations make genuine sense. The action sequences are phoned in and the cgi bull is absolutely terrible. I get that it's an action comedy and thus isn't necessarily going to have an air tight plot but this is just lazy from top to bottom.

title: It was awesome
text: Started writing my essay while watching. Never ever finished my essay that fast! Great :)ah and by the way nice greenscreen used with very realistic CGI.

title: Lame
text: I can only assume it is teenagers giving this lame movie such high scores.I like a good fun action movie, but this film fails on so many levels that it is an insult to anyone with half a brain.The script writer seems to have thought that stealing little bits from numerous different movies and then throwing them together with a few big names would be a sure fire hit...wrong.Ryan Reynolds doing his Deadpool/Hitman's Bodyguard insults/humour is starting to wear thin. But I don't blame the actors, they will take the money, What really annoys me with this movie is that people at Netflix obviously thought this film looked good on paper. And perhaps with the lack of intelligence shown by the younger audiences today, they were right. I despair at the number of movies and shows churned out like this today.

title: Single redeeming value
text: A series of clichés strung together by a third-rate predictable script with a single redeeming value....how cute Ryan Reynolds continues to be. Unfortunately, even his jokes are lame.

title: Usually, I rate Pass/Fail 10 or 0, but I'm giving this a 5.
text: All I see and hear from Ryan Reynolds's is Deadpool. He's been like that in other movies as well, so he wasn't even acting in Deadpool, it was just Reynolds going along with the script. It was cute as Deadpool, but tiresome in other movies. It's like Vince Vaughn, he's never acted a day in his life - he's VINCE VAUGHN in Mr. & Mrs. Smith, Wedding Crashers, Jurassic Park 2 and any number of other movies. Same for Reynolds: Life, Free Guy, 6 Underground RIPD...Dwayne Johnson is more rounded out, but he in a place of power & authority is wearing thin.Gal Gaddot continues to be awesome and would have shined with top (gasp) billing or at least second. Women regulated to last place and less pay when among men. Got it. Hmmm, don't both of those men have daughters?Lastly, is this, by chance, another $200,000,000? Are we sure that it's was we (still) need in our lives? About to enter World War III, millions are being hammered by global-warming effect while claiming it's "natural, not man-made" and leaving planet Earth to misery and a quick death. I challenge you to make a great, original movie under $1,000,000. Are there no more high and mighty Hollywood types out there that can do this? Yawn. Didn't think so.

title: Giant "Meh!" fest
text:
The movie is about the second best thief in the world (Ryan Reynolds) trying to outsmart the first best thief in the world (Gal Gadot) and vice versa. And there is an FBI agent (Dwayne Johnson) chasing both of them. That's pretty much what can be said about it without giving out spoilers.Positives:
It's pretty. The cast is a bunch of beautiful people and it's visual spectacle. And that's pretty much all the positives.Negatives:
Everything else. Acting and writing were the worst of them.Let's begin with acting, it was just bad. But since I adore all the three of them, and their previous works, Im going to go out on a limb here and say that they weren't given much to work with, that is with their characters and the script.Which brings me to the biggest issue of the movie - it's writing and screenplay. It was extremely lazy and underwhelming and frankly insulting to us - the audience. Example: Why is Ryan Reynolds a thief? Because daddy issues. What about Dwayne Johnson? Why is he FBI? Because daddy issues. Want to explain why the rich villain guy is the way he is? Sure, daddy issues! What about Gal Gadots character? Why is she a thief? Yes. You guessed it - because daddy issues.The whole movie is just as lazy as this.Here's another example where they are stuck in an underground bunker and need to run from someone who is chasing them through the main entrance - behold! There is an old car in the bunker (been sitting there for half a century, but apparently fully fueled), but how do u drive the car out of there? Oh wait! There was an old road from the underground bunker to the outside that just conveniently appeared.So yeah! It solely runs on star power and is cashing in on their fame. Nothing entertaining, or memorable. Just Meh!3 stars for the 3 stars in the movie - Gal Godot, Ryan Reynolds & Dwayne Johnson. Coz there is nothing else to see here.

title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME WATCHING THIS MOVIE.
text: This is the worst and the most amateur heist movie ever. Just like ever other Dwayne Johnson movie this is over hyped and extremely flawed action heist movie. It's like watching fast and furious 9. Do not waste your time on this.

title: Poor beyond reason
text: This excuse for a film is simply dreadful, derivative rubbish. Not an original idea in sight, a shoddy script full of holes and some appalling 'acting'. Reynolds is funny when he has a witty, sharp script but here he is laborious both in his acting and his joking. £200 million wasted which could have been spent on half a dozen better independent films. It's no surprise that Thurber's directing high points are Dodgeball and Skyscraper.

title: Annoying rubbish!
text: Just because the actors are enjoying themselves doesn't mean the movie will be good. It's not good. Unbelievable characters, over the top fight scenes of superhuman strength. Yes, the usual rubbish.

title: Ehh
text: I was recommended this by a friend, and Honestly I wasn't a big fan of it. Acting was meh, I feel like Reynolds did the best. Storyline was very campy and poorly written, And it was hard to figure out. Storyline seemed stolen by a semi talented 5 year old, and the effects are pretty basic. The story seemed too stretched out, I feel like this could have been concluded in 94 minutes and not 2 hours. Overall a 2/10. I wish this was better, and I'm hoping the sequels will be better than this wasteland of a film.What are you doing down here?We're not strangers to loveYou know the rules and so do IA full commitments what I'm thinking ofYou wouldn't get this from any other guyI just wanna tell you how I'm feelingGotta make you understandNever gonna give you upNever gonna let you downNever gonna run around and dessert youNever gonna make you cryNever gonna say goodbyeNever gonna tell a lieAnd hurt youGet rickrolledThanks for scrolling.

title: Trailer way better than the movie
text: I was really in the mood for an action-comedy flick. Unfortunately, Red Notice was a let down. The Rock, Reynolds, and Gadot were not the best cast in my opinion and it seems they were only selected thanks to Hollywood recognizability. Anyone remember similar action flick duos like Jackie Chan and Chris Tucker in Rush Hour? Now that was a good pairing.The humor often fell flat in Red Notice and overall got the impression that the 3 main actors were simply trying too hard. Simply not enough entertaining and 20 minutes too long.

title: Only if you like Dwayne Johnson...
text: Obviously, big budget movie ... however storyline is good at the beginning but then become boring and predictable.However if you are a Johnson fan , then you will enjoy.

title: Can I have my Netflix subscription back
text: So this is basically product placement for Aviation Gin and Terramana Tequila with some action scenes thrown in?Terrible script if you can indeed call it a script, this film is cheesy with full on Gouda.

title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME
text: THIS CINEMATIC CRUCIFIXION SHOULD NOT HAVE BEEN MADE. IT FELT LIKE A PUNISHMENT TO SIT THROUGH IT. I THOUGHT THAT I WAS WATCHING A READ THROUGH.I AM GLAD THAT I DIDN'T GO TO A THEATER TO WATCH THIS.

title: Awful
text: Total bunkum which i don't normally mind to much but this is awful. The makers are more concerned with multiple product placement scenes than making any kind of coherent film.

title: It's not as bad as people are saying
text: The low reviews aren't accurate it's just disappointed people over dramatising how bad it is, it's not a horrible movie, it's a watch once and never again, there's nothing memorable or special it's below average but it's not unwatchable like some are portraying.The jokes are obvious, set up's predictable, endless foreshadowing and twists that were just designed for a sequel that probably has zero hype, the quality of the actors and cost compared to what they achieved is hugely disappointing as is the fact no one calls out glaring issues in the script to be corrected.The rock is fine, usual self, gadot was the best she's ever been, after the charismaless Wonder Woman performances it was nice to see her have some fun, Reynolds was just woefully the wrong actor for what they needed, it'd have probably even worked better switching him and the rock.His jokes fell flat, he seemed bored, his wit felt forced and pointless and unfunny. He doesn't work as a villain by just being a more deadpan deadpool.The plot was poor but after seeing Spencer the movie I'll not knock the story as any film is better than a KFC ending.

title: Copy-paste cliche after cliche after...
text: Not even writers enjoy writing scripts like this. Typical copy-paste boredom u have seen million times and just watching the same for millionth and one is waste of everyones time. Turned off after one of the main characters as usually explains what shes doing right now because obviously if I'm watching this i must be quite stupid. Thank u Hollywood for making movies that reminds me every five minutes that i must be a real moron if im watching this and need constant follows up on what is happening on the screen.

title: If it's on Netflix it's garbage
text: If someone is trying to push Ryan Reynolds in your face as a tough guy and a world wide international spy, you must respond with violence!!! It's like Tom Cruise playing a legendary NBA character but much, much worse.

title: Wasn't expecting to hate it but...
text: I had a good feeling about this movie. But after the prison escape scene, the whole thing started going downhill and it hit rock bottom and it hit it FAST. This is the most useless and pathetic action movie I've seven for over months. I was expecting a fun but not meaningful movie with suspence but instead, I got this. Hours wasted. Not worth it.

title: Great cast, terrible writing (contains minor spoilers)
text: Note to whoever wrote this mess; plot twists need to make sense. To be more accurate, I guess the plot twist made sense, but everything that preceded it didn't. Almost as if they came up with the idea for the twist first, and then tried to build a story around it. Why did Hartley (the Rock) casually let the valuable egg out of his sight, in an unlocked car, immediately after going to so much trouble retrieving it? Why was Hartley so willing to turn to crime and help Booth (Ryan Reynolds) steal the eggs? Why didn't he turn Booth in and clear his name when confronted by the interpol agent? Why didn't the Bishop shoot them both when they were tied up under the coliseum? So many moments that didn't make sense until the plot twist explained it all.There were other moments where characters actions seemed strange/illogical, seemingly just for simplicity of writing. Such as Sotto Voce taking the 2nd egg with him when he went to torture Hartley and Booth, thus allowing the Bishop to easily take it. Or the interpol agent always showing up two minutes later...shouldn't professional art thieves be slightly better at covering their tracks?And the cast, while promising, was very miscast. Ryan Reynolds and the Rock are both too likeable to be "bad guys". I use quote marks, because we're obviously still supposed to be rooting for them, despite them being thieves. The problem is, we have no reason to. Usually, similar characters in other films have some sort of character development, moral ambiguity, or redemption arc. Not here. The film ends with them double crossing each other, and then planning their next heist together out of necessity. I guess we're supposed to like them just because they are charismatic and attractive.All in all, just a very lazily written, cliched, predictable plot. I wouldn't recommend, for decent heist films try out of sight, or one of the ocean's films. Or if you just want Ryan Reynolds brand of humour and some action, re-watch Deadpool. I know you've all seen it already, but even on the fifth viewing, it's still better than this.

title: A dumb commercial
text: A dumb, pointless, bland, insipid, derivative, blatant, needlessly flashy, uninspired, commercial. Why those reviews have to contain at least 150 characters I have no idea. How and why films like this get made - I have no idea either.

title: Was the camera man on drugs?
text:
Could have been a ok movie I think
But this was lame
that camera work
My god is this our future ?!??So jumpy and strange corners
Was he on drugs or do he need his eyes checked
Strange cuts alsoVery bad camera anglesI expected more
Our 3 stars act like they do
They perform and do their thingBut you can't get into the ride off a movie
If you can't see the story.To bad.

title: Boring
text: I enjoy Dwayne Johnson, can't stand Ryan Reynolds. Reynolds tries hard to be funny and he's just...not. I managed to sit through the first thirty minutes but gave up. I give it a 2 star rating because Johnson is in it and the production is pretty.This movie is trying to be Red with Bruce Willis. Failing. If you want to see t his type of film done right, go watch RED and RED 2.

title: Average at best.
text: Mediocre acting and the story is like the same we have seen for almost all the movies of this genre. I am thankful I watched it on Netflix and did not have to pay a ticket! I love all actors of this movie but NOT on this movie!!!

title: I can't wait to turn it off
text: I'm stuck watching this with my husband who won't turn it off despite my numerous pleas to do so. Ridiculously boring plot in a film relying entirely on the lead actors to be interesting (which it still isn't). The mildly funny jokes from Ryan Reynolds are just getting old, and I'm not even sure I haven't seen this part before - weren't they just running and jumping? Gal Gator doesn't pull off mean very well. I think she might just be genuinely too nice? It can't end soon enough. Maybe our baby will wake up screamingly shortly and afford me the pleasure of listening to his screeching rather than watch the end of this film.

title: Oh good grief!
text: I can understand that someone want this to be good having RR and the Rock in it, but seriously people? It is so weak and not even remotely entertaining. The people giving it a high score must not get out much.

title: klishe movie
text:
The movie is look good but in behind it its just a klishe movie and at the end evry think will chang
acctors working not really good but its appreciatable.

title: Surprisingly awful
text: Most surprisingly, the three lead actors are awfuy at their roles - trying to be funny or serious or a sophisticated international spy villain, which seems well within the acting range but somehow falls very short and looks very cardboardish. Less surprisingly, the plot and the situations are very cliched and uninventive, like the Russian prison where nobody speaks clear Russian. Oh well, looked promising...

title: Formulaic nonsense
text: Incredibles meets Indiana Jones - just nowhere near as good. Both leads are always watchable but this is a giant raspberry to the audience.Laughably bad!

title: Forced plots
text: I was ignoring all the illogical things like how easy it was for the cons to get away, different continuity issues and not getting shot in the face by the bullets but the last 5 minutes where we find out who is who is so cringy that I just took 3 full stars out of it. It appeared such a cheap and low level writing that in the name of twisting the plot you can write whatever you want. Pathetically Lazy writing. I guess producers believe people only come to watch stars and leave their thinking hat at home. Only two people did acting in this movie - Ryan Reynolds and that inspector girl. Dwyane had 1 expression throughout this movie and Gal got half. She is very flexible though unlike Rock's brain and body. Only Ryan knows how to deliver his lines. It is not worth to mention how junior school level was the CGI, production design and background score. Watch it to laugh mindlessly on Ryan's punches and some good action sequences.

title: Could be much better
text: The action is a slick disorder, where logic and laws of nature usually lose out to cool pictures. But even with that big pile of money it never really gets uplifting or compelling. The story is quite well known and comes across as rushed.

title: All the chemistry of a wet dishrag
text: Now look, I love cheesy action flicks as much as the next girl, so I was okay with the ludicrous plot line, the pretty people, and the jetsetting across the world. What I'm not okay with is the complete lack of chemistry between Dwayne Johnson and Ryan Reynolds and Dwayne Johnson and Gal Gadot. Even Ryan Reynolds who is a perennial favorite of mine could charm enough to pull this film up beyond a mediocre level.I finished the film but sadly I won't remember it past tonight.

title: Cartoonish and generic with some fun moments
text: It was like Ocean's Eleven from Aliexpress. Every action/adventure movie cliche was there. It was not exciting in any way, but I was not bored either, so very mediocre I would say.I like Ryan Reynolds and Dwayne Johnson, but they both play the same role over and over, it's kinda enough for me.There were some fun moments and some good jokes though.

title: "RED NOTICE" review
text: The plot is great and the cast is even better, but it was a failure. Almost no jokes hit well, most of the time it was cringe all over the movie. The directer was familiar with working with Dw. Johnson, I think that that's definitely his worst with the actor. "Central Intelligence" was a great comedy, at least I see it this way and "Skyscraper" wasn't the best movie ever made, but was still likeable. Ryan Reynolds and Dwayne Johnson did great acting, mostly because this is their usual role, I almost thought I was watching a Deadpool sequel. Gal Gadot on the other hand didn't gave the best performance in her life, it felt forced! Overall 5/10🍿🔴

title: Not bad at best
text: I always knew Gal Gadot cannot act, so at least this was expected. But I thought at least Ryan will come up with something new, but he didn't. He is still funny though.The movie is not that boring, but I was using my phone when watching. If you are out of good movies, you can watch this one, otherwise invest your time is something better.

title: Could have been so much better
text: If you're after a derivative action movie to watch on Friday night after a tough week at work then Red Notice is for you. It's a fairly entertaining couple of hours but I can't help feel it could have been so much better with the 3 great leads they had. Who all do what they do best really. But it's let down by a bog standard heist story and some poor visual effects which look very fake at times with obvious use of green screen. If this is Netflix's idea of a blockbuster movie then they're going to have to do better.

title: Not bad just nothing new
text: This is an ok movie.It made me chuckle a few times but it was very predictable because it was the same story we have seen many times before.Worth looking at once but nothing more.

title: same old same old
text: Nothing new from reynolds or johnson. Juvenile banter posing as dialogue. Gadot is the gal, as always delightful. Has the makings of a good movie but lazy script leaves it a b- movie at best.

title: And they really want to do a sequel
text: I did watch it all the way through. But it was so bad. The Rock acted like one. Gal Gadot was wooden. I'm glad they previewed the sequel at the end. I'll expect it to be bad or worse. But, I'll probably watch it. And that's the point isn't it?

title: I watch movies so you don't have to
text: This is the classic generic spy movie that parents like, it's so meh, things happen so unnatural, the plot is boring, the dialogues are very expository, the movie jokes are so exaggerated, like why put so much joke about movies?? Like the Jurassic park one, the Pulp fiction clock or even Peter Quill taking down the Orbe, and what's The Rock's problem with jungles?? The only thing that stands out in this movie are the 3 main actors.

title: I've seen this somewhere before.............
text: The whole film is just a rehash of every movie cliche ever put on the screen, nothing was a surprise, every 'TWIST' was so predictable because you've seen it before a hundred times.I'm not even going to review the film because it just isn't worth it because it's just more of the same rubbish from Netflix Original Movies.Watch it if you really have nothing better to do but in reality it will be a just a waste of your time.

title: Too cliche and too many plot holes to be taken seriously, and not enough fun and too many flat jokes to be entertaining. Maybe worth 1 watch on a Tuesday with low expectations
text: I knew this was going to be pretty bad. But it doesn't matter necessarily that films like this are bad, they can still be entertaining. This unfortunately wasn't that entertaining. It is 2 stars below anything I would normally watch but I am a fan of Dwayne Johnson the person so enjoy supporting his films even though they are usually not great, but often entertaining. DJ was fairly good as usual, and Gal Gadot is always fun to watch. Ryan Reynolds was the weak link here, the goofy fool character doesn't work, and the jokes fall flat. It had its moments but there were too many distractions and plot holes to to be taken seriously, and not enough fun to be entertaining.

title: Predictable
text: Good: Themes and Tones, Cinematography, Production Design, Editing.Fair: Plot, Acting and Characters, DIrection, Score, Special Effects, Pace, Dialogue.Poor: x.

title: The perfect movie for the American public.
text: Ryan Reynolds ha a few good jokes. Not many, but a few. And that's pretty much the extent of the level of inspiration that went into this movie. There have been times in my life that I was more bored than I was watching this movie, but not many and certainly not recently. In a nutshell, this is a painfully formulaic, predictable, lifeless exercise in mediocrity and I cannot, in good conscience, give it anything but the lowest possible rating.

title: Formulaic and by the numbers
text: This movie plays like it was written and directed by a bunch of Hollywood marketing and data analysts.The plot? Asinine. The script? Somewhere between lighthearted and downright idiotic. The characters? This is probably the 4th or 5th movie in which I see Ryan Reynolds basically playing himself - and it's getting old fast. The acting? Mediocre across the board. And there's genuinely no chemistry between these actors.And at the same time, it's not a compete dumpster fire. It's just your typical, derivative and uninspired action flick with some A-listers. We'll all forget about this one in week.

title: So this is what 200mln$ budget movie looks like?
text: Just to remind you Lord Of The Rings Fellowship Of Ring budget was 93mln$. CGI is super amateur. Storyline is boring and, believe me, I have never seen Ryan Reynolds trying soo hard to be funny in his life. And 3 main actors, honestly, they could have done better at acting. Only Ryan get 7 out of 10 for acting. Rock and Gal. 3 out of 10.

title: Very bad script and funny story indeed....
text: What a jokes. There is not good story behind this movie. This not an action movie as well. At the the begging its creates quite hype by showing some action and camera movement. But gradually its become a garbage.You can figure out what will happen at next.I thought It will be a best one, but my rating 2/102 for those entry part 👾

title: B-movie with A-listers
text: Being a Netflix film I didn't have high expectations yet I had high-ish hopes. Unfortunately, it was a formulaic and low-quality movie:1) It was unoriginal. It copies from Mission Impossible, National Treasure, Indiana Jones and the Ocean's Trilogy among others.2) There are plenty of plot holes/oversimplifications just so the story can move forward.3) The characters are badly written/feel unrealistic. Most of the time Johnson and Reynolds play themselves teasing each other and at some moments they play their characters and become sincere with each other. And Gadot's acting was too poor to convince me.4) They try too hard to make the plot unexpected when it actually isn't.5) There are too many (bad) green-screen scenes - I can let some of them go, since they had to film it during the pandemic, but then why put so many? Green-screened prison, jungle, Paris...PS. It's such a bummer when you realize they've (chronologically) spoiled so much of the film on the trailer.

title: Not worth to watch if you like good content movie...
text: Stupid jokes and feels little bland story. You'll enjoy if you love comedy movie but you don't if you like good stories. Excellent star cast but the use of this amazing cast was just Meh for me.

title: Very bad movie
text: Nothing worth watching..like I'm watching cartoons..very bad performance. Very fake scenes.. very boring.. Waste of time.. as if I was watching a fantasy movie.. the events are not real. The first scenes are good, but soon the events seem not sequential.. A rather good representation.. I think the problem is in the events.. Everything is illogical and we do not know how the actions happen.

title: Kindergarten Pool
text:
The story is a spinoff of Ocean 12 with some echoes of Bond and some other action movies, but this is rather not a compliment.I suppose that the comedy element is included in one-liners , but these are delivered with the grace of kindergarten children,
that prompts an impression that the script has been written with some other actors in mind, as I don't find their performance very convincing.Still, if you are a fan of Dwayne, Ryan or Gal it could be the movie worth seeing.

title: Not for me
text: I'll acknowledge that I just don't enjoy movies where the main characters spend the entire movie insulting each other. I guess it's supposed to be friendly teasing but it didn't feel like Ryan Reynolds and Dwayne Johnson were actually warming up to each other at any point.This felt like a tacked on prequel to an existing show but no, it's just a first part to a trilogy, I guess we'll see if the main characters start synergizing better then.I guess that's all, the dynamic between the main characters was just immensely annoying to me. Still a fine watch if you don't mind that.

title: So predictable
text: Must have been written by a 10 year old. Terrible, predictable script ruins what could have been a good story. The only thing worse that the script is the acting- or - over acting.

title: Entertaining but ...
text: The movie has a good photography and edition , performances in general are good , Gal Gadot was great as usual and so was Dwayne Johnson , the plot is very good . The one thing that made me not to enjoy the movie that much was seeing Ryan Reynolds giving the same performance and portraying basically the same character over and over again.

title: It's like the owners of Netflix had a child and have that child a massive budget to write and direct a film
text: Bad writing, worse directing. Weird transitions between scenes, irrelevant naming of the film.Tries to act like a backstory film, setting up for a saga, which by the end of the film, beg isn't true.They obviously had A LOT of money to make this film.But a minimal amount of know-how.It's an okay attempt at a film, but the budget and cast, do not match the execution.

title: Has to be more!
text: A few witty one liners delivered by Reynolds which by now he does in his sleep but the ROCK really is starting to show his age...I thought he was going to pull a hamstring at one point...and the film was extremely derivative.

title: Dull
text: Simply everything is over done, like very flashy action scenes that don't really ptogress the story, or, using cliché after cliché like it's comedy but i just thing it's lazy writing. Twists are never really set up or at least not in a logical way. And apart from that quite dull acting from the entire lead cast made it a very blend and dull movie...

title: A typical comedy...
text: In general, the script is very cliché, it doesn't have anything original... The characters are also cliché, they don't have any interest... The jokes in this film are... Jokes are pathetic... And of course there were some jokes that made me laugh, but in general it's mediocre... Overall it was really fun, sometimes boring... That's why I put 5/10.

title: By numbers generic streaming movie
text:
Red Notice is what happens when a streaming giant (Netflix) just throws a stupid sum of money ($200 million apparently), at making a movie when they have A-listers but no script or plot worth a note.This is unashamedly a blend of everything all at once thrown together to see what sticks. As others have noted, the Rock plays the Rock and Ryan Reynolds plays Ryan Reynolds. Unfotrtunately I find both pretty annoying. Gal Gadot seems to be having a ball playing a character more on the wrong side of the tracks than is normal for her. And there we go.... the usual exocic locations and cities are visited for mere minutes just to tick them off. Lots of CGI and bad jokes.You can see the executives sitting around a table deep in Netflix HQ saying, "...yes but we have $200 million so we can make a spy movie AND a comedy AND an adventure film!" We even get generic looted Nazi treasure at the end in a blatant Indiana Jones rip off.It is not awful, you can pass some time with this movie, it is just amazing the money spent on it and the blandness of the result. This is what modern Hollywood now proudly delivers us as 'original material'.Disappointing
5/10.

title: an action family flick with not much sense
text: A humor action flick. Very long drawn out action scenes with lot of fake moves as expected.The characters were decent, but the plot sufffered. The plot twist was unexpected.It sets you up for the sequel.

title: Likeable cast, lot of flaws in the plot
text: Even though Ryan Reynolds' shtick is getting a little bit old, Dwayne Johnson's about as believable an FBI agent as Al Capone, and Gal Gadot couldn't act her way out the door, they were all likeable in this thrown-together action flick. Hard to hate anybody when they look like they're having a good time doing their job.Sure, the plot is goofy and makes absolutely no sense, but this isn't Scorsese, it's just a lark--a little escapism. So for what it is, it's okay.

title: Distinctly Average
text: The clunky script fails to make use of 3 solid actors. In fact, at times I'm sure I saw RR wince as the dialogue stumbled towards the end of a scene. It's the film equivalent of a bad takeaway pizza. You start off hungry but half way through you lose interest and start to feel the regret.

title: Meccano Movie
text: Underwhelming is my take on this film. Everyone's luvvie, Mr Reynolds, does his Ryan Reynolds thing...again, the Rock is, well, the Rock and Gal Gadot provides the eye candy filling to this bromance sandwich.Tiresome series of action set pieces that all look like they've been lifted from classics from the past.No blood so it's toddler safe, no character depth so you're not investing in their fates.Instantly forgettable pulp that just about merits 5 stars.

title: It's a bad movie
text: Not really much to say, the movie is bad in general, poor characters and a bad and meaningless script where nothing is justified and it seems that everything happens as if by magic.

title: Disturbing morality of cop killing as entertainment
text: I don't know how to rate this. It was entertaining, had great production values, acting - and a mostly clever script, with one elephantine exception. It is disturbing that the audience is meant to cheer for the art thieves in the course of their getaways as they murder dozens of innocent police officers for doing their job. I think that's a little vile and crosses a line ethically. It undercuts the humour and the pleasure. There is really no way to applaud the glamorizing and trivializing of cop killing as entertainment. This is a plot that should never have been written. How amoral are we becoming as a civilization?

title: Brings nothing new to the genre
text: Tries hard to be a Bond film, an Indiana Jones adventure, a heist caper, and a comedy with buff budget and top notch special effects but misses the mark.

title: Even a star studded cast can still make a flop
text: Unfortunately, there was nothing else to watch on Netflix. It was just boring, predictable, and not creative. Didn't bother finishing it and have no desire to. My wife finished it, told me how it ended. Made me glad I didn't finish it. Action sequences were okay. Typical characters from each star. Johnson was the hard FBI agent, Reynolds was the comic relief, and Gal was the sexy distraction. No real surprises in this movie. Lots of potential, but came up short.

title: Eh. It's been done much better
text: Johnson was stiff and it felt more like one of his first movies than one of his better movies. Reynolds was the same as he's been for a while, whether that's on TV promoting something or on the big screen, he's kind of becoming a one act guy. Gadot was almost believable as the bad guy, but she had zero chemistry with either of the guys. The plot was lame, the action seemed like a Lifetime movie trying to be Mission Impossible. Honestly the best thing and actor was the lady who kept trying to arrest all of them. The ending sucked.

title: Gal Gadot is sooooo boring.
text: It's a snooze. Definitely not worth watching.I can put up the Rock if the rest of the cast and plot are good.Poor Ryan Reynolds - he should have run from this project.

title: Hey I know everyone loves that cast....
text: Urghhhh I will leave it there. There are not 150 characters to display my upset at the performance made and especially from the actors involved. Superb film and great direction. Lacking in delivery however.

title: Watch the Aviation Gin label follow the camera.
text: They make a point to not show the AVIATION GIN label in its first appearance, after that, the label is always shown.The bottle rotates 180 degrees, its like magic. Following the camera.Label faces door.Label faces away from door.Label faces door.Label faces away from door.Label faces door etc.

title: Another one
text: Another fast action fast talking Ryan Reynolds action movie,...with Dwayne Johnson.Entertaining but ultimately forgettable and not in a 'watch again' way.

title: Meh
text: Channelled indian Jones and true lies.Gal Godot is a sexy goddess and great as wonder woman but she can't do Ryan Reynolds style comedy.Was just too loose, unveil was more 'oh about time!' than 'wow, never saw that coming'Good script writers have left the industry...now plots are.just pumped out randomly by a machine.

title: My 10 year old self probably would have love this.
text: I was so looking forward to this movie, however was really disappointed. It was so cliché, and did not have any new ideas or surprises. It is probably fun for kids, but for me, unfortunately, it was just boring.

title: A bit of guilty pleasure
text: Action thriller with a bit of comedy but lots of flaws. First of all, let us take the story of cleopatra's eggs for granted. But still, the nazi connection becomes too fictitious to be digested. The biggest question arose in my mind "how the hell Sarah got into the forbidden Russian prison!" Needless to mention that both Hartley (Johnson) & Booth (Reynolds) are no way inferior than superman taking leaps from almost thirty feet heights. So for watching these kind of pseudo realistic movies, we must not use our brains. So keeping all the rational views aside, an impostor (how much high profiler might be) can penetrate within the police. Still some queries remained unsolved about the true relationship between Hartley & The Bishop. And with reference to that, how Hartley had to risk his life when there was quite another smooth option of obtaining the third egg. Anyways, but for action lovers & twisting thriller fans, I'll surely recommend this movie. For one time watch only.

title: Below Average Sorry
text: Like many other people, I am a huge fan of Ryan Reynolds, and almost anything he touches is usually really good. As for the Rock, I can take or leave him in all honesty.This is probably the first time I have struggled to watch anything from RR.It was like a cross between White Collar, National Treasure, Indiana Jones & James Bond with the attempted humour of Deadpool (but just not upto par). Then to top that off, the far fetched-ness of the Fast and Furious franchise, with at least 10 different twists and turns through out the whole movie. For me personally it was a complete mess, and didn't gel together at all like it should have.The humour alone just felt too forced and try hard, and just became irritating rather than entertaining or even funny after a while. That coupled with the fact that RR and DJ argued like little children through out the whole movie, just made it less than enjoyable. And Ed Sheeran at the end???? It was just bizarre.I'm sorry to say, but they could have done way better, especially with the script. Didn't work for me. Very average imo.

title: Sweet Aviation Gin Hell
text: So... I really don't know where to begin. The Rock I understand, he just makes these types of movies. Gal Gadot.. I mean she hardly classifies as an actress. She's just a glorified model who plays WonderWoman and hollywood thinks she has to be "the strong female lead" in everything now. But Ryan Reynolds? Jesus what a sell out. This guy is literally just going to play Deadpool in every movies isn't he? Was this an excuse for him to advertise his Aviation Gin? Which i implore you all to watch that scene again and see the bottle label magically be turned to face the camera. Man oh man. Do movies even require actors to actually act anymore or do you just become a well known personality and do that on screen and get paid millions of dollars? The fact that the rock is a "nice guy" in real life makes everything worse because he will continue to get away with making these cheesy movies forever. Nevermind the absolute garbage CGI, the script makes 0 sense. I could go on and on about the details but I'd just be giving more of my time to this garbage.

title: Ordinary
text:
Films like *action movies with Rock* usually don't make any sense, don't inspire you to think about watching or some philosophical question from life, and don't have any realistic things. All enemies are so bad and fight with you 1 by 1, you have bullets in a gun exactly as much as you need, I can continue for ages. So this is just a picture with fighting and a trivial plot.This movie isn't an exception.And honestly, I wouldn't say I like how they created this movie. I saw a lot of scenes where the green screen and special effects were so bad, despite a huge $200 million budget. Plot logic is another topic, I expected a simple plot, but not a super simple one... There they even don't try to explain something, they just have it, as fact. Some scenes aren't necessary and create additional watching time.Also, I am not sure about the cast combined with the characters' story. They just took superstars and haven't thought about the script. Some of them are just not fit for their characters.I haven't noticed comedy, they tried to do something, but these jokes are pretty trivial and expectable. I have laughed a few times because of cringe.As a result, I can recommend watching this movie in several cases:
1. If you want to play something in the background
2. If you come from work or any activities, tired and don't want to think so much about what is happening here. Watch some fast screen slides.If you want something deep, I can't recommend it enough.

title: 3 people who can't act...
text: The premise was entertaining but found the acting and script lacked any real depth. Reynolds was the same smart ass he is in every movie. Johnson was the wooden, bulging eye candy he is in every movie, and Gadot was the voluptuous eye candy with only slightly better acting than the other two. Poor casting overall.

title: I didn't want this watch this but I did and I was just as disappointed as I thought I would be
text: Gal being the strongest and baddest character in this is so unrealistic it is hard to watch.I didn't want to watch this movie but my boyfriend begged me for months.Upon watching, I will never watch another movie with Gal Gabot in it.She's an awful actress and she ruined the movie.The movie was good until she came into it. She will not be getting my money for her cringy roles.

title: Dorky bromance
text: Lovable thieves fight over Cleopatra's eggs, three priceless antiquities that will fetch them unimaginable riches. That's it. The entire plot is about trying to get the eggs.It doesn't really matter because the two most photogenic and likable movie stars in Hollywood head the cast, make light hearted wise cracks and beat up bad guys while being done wrong by a woman.The violence is cartoonish, bullets don't make people bleed, and no one gets in real trouble. It's as if the two main characters are Bugs and Daffy, played by Ryan Reynolds and The Rock. They are lovable losers.Light fare for a mindless evening in front of the boob tube.

title: Hohum
text: Youve seen it! Youve heard the dialogue! Same faces but boring. Blaw blaw blaw no more words necessarry for this. Seen red? Tango and cash? Expendibles? Butch cassiday? Keep your opinion low.

title: Deduct five stars for Ryan Reynolds
text: Ryan Reynolds singlehandedly destroyed a great action film. Dwayne Johnson and Gal Gadot had are excellent action stars and they had good chemistry. Both were more than capable of providing all the comedic relief this movie needed without the fatuous stumble-bum antics that appear to make up the sum total of Reynolds's acting talent.So bad I actually wondered if the producers had taken pity on the writers who brought Jar Jar Binks to world of cinema and given them work.Otherwise, solid action film with good writing (if you factor out JarJar Reynolds's lines), and a credible plot line. Of course the action scenes are completely INcredible which makes it a 21st century action film.

title: When will this end
text: When will we stop shoving millions of dollars into actors pockets by watching such mediocre movies? When will we get fed up with these incredible stories full of "at-the-limit" situations?When will we learn?

title: Ryan Reynolds in one his funniest performances!
text: The rest was quite predictable.. taken from that Sean Connery & Catherine Zeta-Jones's entrapment storyline with a bit of twists here & there!Lots of unsurprising loose ends!

title: Silly, overrated
text: Although it did deliver on some little surprises that go against what you'd expect from something on this genre, also some good laughs but I expected a much higher calibre of zingers from a movie with Ryan Reynolds and the Rock.

title: Intricate ways to ruin a good movie
text:
For a guy who has seen many buddy cop action comedies, buddy criminals movies are just a go to genre indeed.There are a few pros likewise. Engaging storyline although nothing you havent seen already. Ryan Reynolds is a delight to ears just like, The rock is a delight to eyes
Afterall movie could have been far more commendable had it been a little plot driven, the characters are not so much as cliche as the action comedies demand. I can understand most of the action comedies ask us to not seek intense logic, but Red notice literally misuses logic almost to the point of convincing the viewer to give up on his expectations of amusing himself. Along pre-climax, the plot starts getting so absurd, actions scenes seems to get more funnier and it wont take a genius to guess how crappy and underwhelming the climax is gonna be.Upon enduring the whole film for 2 hours, the most disturbing aspect is you cant even dislike the film but certainly you shall be disappointed on a whole.Just skip it. Not worth it. It never is.

title: Disney crap
text: Great actors but the movie is horrible, new age National Treasure with a hint of Disney. Time after time Netflix movies are just awful to watch. Plot is something out of this world. It would be nice if they once start with a good plot and then make the movie, not get very expensive actors and write S***.

title: A new movie industry
text: Well, you know there is a movie industry for hot stars, overused scenarios, cliches and banging sounds.I put 3 stars because one is too little and three is too much.

title: Very predictable, you see every plot twist coming 10 minutes before it happens
text: Just another typical cops vs. Robbers story that is predictable and has a terrible ending. The 3 main characters are all extremely annoying and unlikable and by the end you just want them all to get caught and go to prison.

title: Ryan saves this movie
text: I was expecting a lot from this movie, but something is off. Maybe the script, but the truth is that only Ryan Reynolds is making this movie entertaining. Not a big fan of The Rock in general, but the two of them make a decentteam. It's watchable, but don't have big expectations. It's predictible...

title: All the meh
text: The product placement is more important than the story and characters. Tropes, clichés and low hanging fruit. Designed by survey, made by committee... This is a perfect example of why good movies are so rare today. There's thousands being made and almost none of them are good. Soulless.

title: Stop for one minute with the rubbish jokes!
text: I had to turn it off! Normally love Ryan Reynolds, but oh my how can one man ruin a movie so much! The unfunny jokes nearly every other line ruined it for me.

title: Now I understand the reason why some people didn't like it.
text: I thought I would like it but the plot twist just made me hate it, lol. I don't really look at the visual effects or what, I just want the storyline. We hate the girl bishop and we hate the plot twist in the end.

title: Very bad
text: Well, I am sorry but it was awful. It was so bad that it was awkward. I don't know what was worse: a total absence of logic, miserable jokes, bad acting or disgusting graphics. I won't even go into details like what kind of Russian prison it was.I must admit, once in a while it is worth to watch smth that bad just to have a reference point of a "bad movie"

title: Average action fare
text: I'd love to know where the $200m was spent on this. Presumably 85% on Dwayne, Ryan and Gal's salaries because this film is extraordinarily average. The plot isn't new and takes a large number of influences from far better movies from the 80s, 90s and 00s, for example Raiders of The Lost Ark, The Mummy, Thomas Crown Affair and Oceans 11/12. The visuals are poor, the camera work shoddy, action sequences are boring at times and the fight choreography is miles off something like The Raid. The dialogue has some funny moments but it's really all few and far between. Acting is standard from Dwayne, Ryan is probably the winner out of the three stars as Gal is sadly not great at all, being beautiful doesn't mean you can act! Overall worth seeing if you have Netflix and probably best aimed at families, but I'm sadly disappointed with this effort, perhaps the sequel will deliver something original and polished.

title: Cringe-inducing Gal Gadot cannot act!
text: Ryan Reynolds is his usual fun self but risks becoming a parody of.Dwayne Johnson is his usual strong, imposing self already a parody.Gal Gadot brought down the quality to the discount bin. She's all looks and no substance. Cringe-inducing to watch.The main faces aside it was a bit of silly fun and action in beautiful scenery.

title: Why, just why?
text: I saw Dwayne back to back in Jungle Cruise and then this. Jungle Cruise was fun, it had a Indiana Jones feelbyobit and the characters were likeable and believable. This movie on the other hand was none of that. I hope Netflix kills the franchise now because the only folks benefiting from it are the stars pay cheques.

title: Really disappointing
text: Couldn't finish watching the movie.turned it off about a third of the way ito it. Gal Gadot is beautiful to look at but is completely overshadowed by Ryan Reynolds smarminess.

title: Comically bad
text: Not worth a lot of analysis. This movie doesn't know if it is a parody of action movie parodies or just a bad action movie. In the end, it really doesn't matter.

title: All Icing, No Cake.
text: The script is so hackneyed it plays like a parody film with no punchline. It looks like you're watching famous people play a script written by an 8th grader who was told to write a heist movie. A chore of a movie.

title: Two hours of Ryan Renolds making quips and gags, not much more than that.
text: The film was ok, fun but not particularly good.To summarise, Ryan Reynolds makes quips and sarcastic one liners for a couple of hours while the two antagonistic heros pop up in various locations to do impossible stuff, get captured thanks to 'the bishop', then escape before popping up at the next location to repeat this process.The Rocks key role was to be antagonised by Ryan. I'm not convinced there was a whole lot more than that for him.Good film to watch near the end of sleepless long haul flights. Best not watched at other times when their is a risk you will remember it.

title: Famous cast but terrible script
text: The story had potential but it got lost somewhere during production. Boring film and as others have said, filled with cliches. The few good jokes from Reynolds' character stopped me from giving a lower score. I have the impression I am watching deadpool!Disappointing film.

title: Great cast, weak movie
text: As others have said, this wasn't the most amazing movie. Ryan Reynolds did make some funny jokes, and Gal Gadot did get some nice action scenes, but this movie is still pretty forgettable.My biggest problem with it is that the plot and character backgrounds were very surface level and not fully developed. For example, the Bishop seems like an urban legend in the beginning. But when we meet her, she seems more like a talented con woman who took some fighting classes. The Bishop just isn't that dangerous criminal or multi-layer character that I was expecting.The same goes for Booth and the Rock's character. While they are involved in some plot twists, they aren't really that complex or unique themselves. Booth seems like a Reynolds' character we've seen before. The most exciting thing about the Rock's character is that he doesn't fit the typical profile of a profiler.I truly enjoy each of these actors and value what each of them brings to the big screen. But this movie, or maybe just the script, seemed to take one or two of those strengths and use them in ways that weren't thought out or just didn't work.So it was fun to watch, but I probably won't recommend or watch it again.

title: cliché and predictable
text: The movie is completely cliché and predictable, including the great acting. Like eating junk food, but worth it as long as you know what you are getting.

title: What you expect from a netflix production
text: I think the director should really be ashamed. There are so much goofs during action scenes that it is annoying to watch. The plot keeps you entertained with a few twists and unexpected moves, but the entrance of a few characters like "the bishop" is the same every time and too predictable. It is like watching the same scene three times. However, the good acting of especially ryan who is fit just right for the role makes it entertaining to watch. Could have have been a 6,5 if it wasn't for the garbage action scenes (just look at ryan's stunt double there went 0 effort in making him look the same). I am also still waiting for a netflix film to have its cgi not look worse than some films 20 years ago. Despite the 4 rating, I recommend watching it if you have nothing else.

title: For kids
text: It wants to be interesting, but it's nothing but copy paste of other bad movies. Only about a dozen funny lines by Reinolds. That's it. Nothing interesting, no story, no plot or twists, just the few jokes.Just really makes me want to watch anything else. Like, anything.

title: A total none sense
text:
It's you are from the kind who use his or her mind,
my advice don't watch this movie , totally none sense, Gal Gadot must stop acting and start doing some modeling.

title: Comedy thriller that isn't funny or thrilling
text: Another movie where everyone is a wise ass, and tries to be hilarious every time they open their mouth.I couldn't even follow the plot because I was so distracted by the fact that every sentence anyone spoke was delivered as though they were a stand up comedian.

title: Less than mediocre
text: Unoriginal story, inane dialogue, cliché action sequences. 2 stars only because Gal Gadot is so beautiful. We made it almost halfway through before turning it off. Don't waste your time like Netflix wasted subscribers' money on this garbage movie.

title: was able to be 7 without Gal Gadot
text: Any movie with this ridiculous Zionism Gal Gadot (or any other Zionism actors, but specially Gal Gadot), can maximum get 7/10 for me.Her acting is even very bad.And the movie plot is so predictable.

title: More Dead Notice than Red Notice.
text: How is it possible to take 3 huge stars, a reasonable budget and a pretty good concept for a story and end up with this vacuous, bland excuse for a movie?Ryan Reynolds playing Ryan Reynolds is getting pretty boring now. He's just Deadpool without the mask in every movie he is in. Even back in the days of Blade Trinity he was just cocky, wise cracking, self deprecating fool. It worked in Deadpool and it worked in the Hitman Movies but it's time to move on, try acting for a change, you did a pretty decent job in Safe House.The Rock is actually making a bid for his worse performance in a movie EVER.......where is the beast from Ballers or the kid like enthusiasm from Jumanji.......even go to the weird and wonderful Scorpion King and there's something to see. Here the Rock is literally playing a rock or a similar inanimate object.As for Gail Gadot, Wonder Woman? Woman, I wonder what possessed you to climb on board. Maybe you read the script which probably in it s first iteration was decent.We're left with a mess. It's attempting to be 007 with the multiple locations but ends up more Johnny English than James Bond, perhaps the humor of Spy but unable to match the comedic timings of Jason Statham. At one point it shoots for the unmatchable True Lies but ends up way short and can only manage to truly lie about its intentions.In the end it is like watching a comic strip come to life, not a good one like TWD or Sin City but one of those free comic strips like Striker from the Sun Newspaper.It lacks style, class and charisma and feels like a patchwork quilt made from blankets stolen from the homeless. It'll keep you warm but you'd prefer to stay cold in a pinch.

title: Inspired by a 'B' grade Bollywood movie?
text: I judiciously gave it a 3 star while I was determined to not give it any. Considering the likes of Ryan and Rock and Gal, who would miss a movie with such a star cast. But then when you have a script and a storyline which is prepared just for timepass what else do you expect. Cant explain much but believe me, dont waste your precious time on this no brainer.

title: Red Action...The search for more money!
text: Sorry but my title says it all! Never thought I would turn off a RR and DJ movie...but my God...it must have been written by 10 year olds! So predictable with minimal acting.

title: Good writers left the room
text: Who writes these plots? There are TV shows and cartoons that have better storylines than this movie. It feels like a 12 year old had the assignment of writing a movie script and he watched all the popular action movies and copied the lines and the plots and mixed them in one chaotic piece. Jokes were dull, there were maybe 2 scenes where there was some funny dialogue, but it seemed forced. Totally forgettable.

title: High hopes...dashed
text: A waste of talent weighted down by an lumbering script.Hadith has the beauty but not the talent to pull on her character.The Rock and Reynolds's replay a pastiche of prior characters, mugging for the camera more than acting.

title: Don't watch this, go watch Great Pretender or Focus instead
text: This movie and its Netflix buddies trying to be big Hollywood hits just don't hit the mark. They're like fast food-easy to consume but leave you feeling empty. It's a bummer to see how entertainment has gone downhill, pandering to shorter attention spans and lower standards. Even folks who grew up on great movies aren't immune to this trend. Remember when movies had substance? This one's more like a sensory overload video for babies. If you don't wanna feel like your brain's on autopilot, it's best to skip it and find something that actually stimulates your mind. There's plenty of good stuff out there if you look beyond the flashy hype of this Netflix flick.

title: What a disappointment!
text: How could this movie with my favorite stars be so bad? No chemistry, No heart. For good Ryan Reynolds see Dead Poole or Free Guy, For good Gal Gadot see Wonder Woman or the Snyder cut of Justice League. For the Rock see Jumanji.

title: Only Gal Gadot
text: Only Gal gadot make me to put the ratings. Mainstream story was expecting more from netflix biggest released, Trying to do some "bro stuffs comedy" like other Dwayne movies. Not a big deals.

title: I couldn't finish it........
text: The lack of charisma on all three was the biggest downfall. The Rock playing the rock, Ryan playing Ryan, and Gal playing, 'I'm not sure.'call me old school but try and put some kind of production set together. The cgi was annoying.

title: Popcorn with crap CGI, wasted budget
text: For 200 million you would assume they could get a bit of a storyline and at least do some actual shots or proper CGI. Bit this has the simplest settings done in CGI when there's no need to. It looks like a 10 million movie. Lighting is off, it all looks too fake.Crap, but fun for a moment.

title: So silly and bad
text: One of the worest movie I have been watched,,,I couldn't have an capilty to watch it for end,,,, the story is so board and the end is so silly,,,, i think I will not watch any movies for daywn Johnson again.

title: Generic action comedy
text: It was worth the watch just for the jokes since I had a few laughs.The rest is garbage though. The most generic heist plot ever, the cgi looks like unreal engine 3 and even the action felt like a copy&pasted from some stock footage.

title: Botched the ending
text: Go watch it. It's a fun globetrotting rival-thieves story with charismatic actors, and a premise of coveted/lost "Cleopatra's eggs".Has great production, enticing camera work, average action, and reference-filled scenes for those that feel rewarded for knowing things.Personally, I think this movie works because of Ryan, which is a good thing for those that tolerate that kind of persona or find him charming and funny. His talent for being himself in every movie he is in, is astounding. His delivery of lines is agreeable and the primary reason why I enjoyed the movie. He has a way of making fun of things people normally take seriously that makes him a nice change of pace. Put literally anyone else around him, and it would probably have a similar effect!! But the Rock being the Rock (kind of a boring straight man) works with Ryan as a partner.Considering how the ending is a flat-line, and a second viewing is not worth it.. the convenience and pandering of most plot lines, it's amazing it isn't terrible.

title: Humdrum caper movie
text: Despite the combined talent in the leads, who I enjoy in other films, this hasn't got any chemistry between any of the three main leads. Looks ok, story is lacking any originality. Like a McDonald's meal, goes quickly and forgotten quickly.

title: Ehhh
text: I got really bored. Ryan Reynolds makes really bad jokes, and tries to be funny and it's ehhh. Not worth watching. Gal Gadot's outfits were my favorite part.

title: Good fun film
text: Was really enjoying this and would have given it a higher rating but unfortunately it was hugely let down by the inclusion of Ed sheeran,such a shame really as overall the film was very good.

title: It is what it is....
text: Not a bad movie to have on one afternoon or evening when you don't have much to do and are just looking to fill some time. Same formula as countless other comedic action flicks. The cast pulls it off most of the time. Like I said, it is what it is, mindless entertainment.

title: "Only gay actors should play gay roles!"
text: So this movie rolls around and where is the vocal contingent always yelling that only only gay actors should play gay characters? Reynolds plays gay here with a smirking cuteness that should drive any of them nuts. But I don't hear a peep. Apparently if you're hot enuf they'll put up with anything.

title: A generic world-class-thief movie with lack of sense
text: I didn't watch this movie when it first came out. I thought it might be the next Ocean's Eleven or Catch me if you can. I was wrong. The movie is just a generic kid's adventure with bad dialogue, lame jokes, clumsy CGI, and a very meh main story. I think most of all expected Netflix to become an HBO of online streaming services, but it turned out to be just The CW.

title: Meh
text: Just your standard thieves action movie.The Rock, Ryan Reynolds playing his goofy self as usual and wonder woman without her suit. Pretty ok.It checks all the boxes for an action flick: thieves, prison break, car chase, cons, dance sequence and even a bull quick chase.I kept wondering how they could just travel so much from country to country considering INTERPOL and everyone is looking for them.It leaves the door open for a sequel which I'm not going to bother to watch.

title: Entertaining and Empty
text: It's a good pass time movie. Nothing special about it.What surprises me the most is how these 3 "actors" basically play themselves in every movie.They are probably the 3 most single-facet actors in holliwood.Basically Gal Gadot plays Gal Gadot, Ryan Reynolds plays Ryan Reynolds and Dwayne Johnson plays Dwayne Johnson.If you watch a short dialogue of Dwayne Johnson in red notice, fast and furious or jumanji, or jungle cruise, rampage, baywatch or any other of his movies, you can't tell which movie it is. He's always "acting" with the same look and same attitude.

title: Watch it for Ryan Reynolds
text: Well, it was a good fun movie but the ending wasn't that good tbh I expected it to be better. Dwayne was just being Dwayne shooting up and kicking asses while gal gadot wasn't necessary for this film she's used as a glamorous magnet to attract viewers,honestly it was Ryan Reynolds who had to carry the whole movie and the movie is fun because of him so watch it for him otherwise the movie ain't that good... Too much budget to make an average movie.

title: At Odds with Itself
text: Red Notice darts between scenes with all the speed and fervor of a frenzied fish, but flounders when putting it all together. The movie is most enjoyable when taken as a campy action-adventure flick, but it's final twist requires taking the plot so seriously it spoils the effect. The cast is decent, but all have done far greater work, and the spectacle, in set and choreography, lacks any memorability. Go watch one of Netflix's other movies you've had on the backlog for months.

title: Big actors, big budget, bad writing
text: You can take this rating with a grain of salt because my wife and I couldn't stomach more than half an hour of this movie. The writing was so blatantly hammy that I was expecting it to be ironic, but then it wasn't.

title: Could have been more entertaining!
text: Love the Rock's and Ryan's performance as leads. As always entertaining! Screenplay was funny. Story line, although predictable, very pleasant and entertaining. What killed it for me was Gal's performance. I did not feel the chemistry, especially between her and Dwayne,and have a truly hard time buying her act. Unfortunately if there is a sequel will most likely pass. I couldnt watch the whole movie at once, I ended up watching it in three segments. The moment Gal appeared, it killed the movie imo and that was my first STOP.If your a fan of Gal and enjoy Dwayne and Ryan, then I'm sure you will enjoy this movie. If you are like me and do not see Gal as a class A actress, then you might get really disappointed.

title: Dumb, filled with plot holes and lots of fun
text: While there is nothing you haven't seen in this film a thousand times before, it's still very entertaining if you watch it out of the corner of your eye while mindlessly scrolling through Instagram. Can we finally admit that Gal Gadot is a decidedly mediocre actress? Loved her in the first Wonder Woman, but since then.... 👎. Johnson and Reynolds are Johnson and Reynolds and nothing more.

title: Worth watching
text: The movie is another repeated-to-death story but fun to Watch somehow. Ryan Reynolds is funny but water down version of his own Deadpool. Others acting find and doing their job, no more. Chris Diamantopoulos is not good as always, several steps below mediocre as always.Overall worth watching once.

title: 200 million down the drain
text: The most expensive Netflix movie also turns out to be one of the worst movies of the year. Almost everything here is bad - the script feels like it was written by a child (so many contrivances, it's actually painful to watch), the acting from the Rock and Gal Gadot was fairly atrocious. Ryan Reynolds played himself again, which may be the only redeeming factor. How did this cost 200 million, by the way? I guess a fat chunk went to the A-listers, but that doesn't mean the movie should look like an amateur college no-budget short. The green screen in Rome was so awful, it looked like my boy Tommy Wiseau on the roof all over again. None of the sequences stood out as exciting, none of the twists work if you possess half a brain cell. And the product placement, wow. If I didn't watch the credits, I would've thought Michael Bay directed this garbage. This is almost as bad as Olive Garden in the Sonic movie. Don't waste your time on this.

title: Ryan Reynolds save the day
text: Gal Gadot is one of my favorite actress, and in this movie she really gets on my nerves. Dwayne Johnson.... well, I think I don't need to comment... the only highlight of the movie was Ryan with his comedian act (as usual in every movie), and that is all. Half of the movie I was playing blockdoku...

title: Felt like if M.Night were to do a heist movie... while drunk.
text: It was pretty good at first. Dwayne Johnson and Ryan Reynolds were the highlight of this movie for sure. They had a lot of comedic exchanges and whatnot. That's where the good stuff ends.This movie made me realize how bad Gal Gadot's acting actually is. No--really. Her line delivery was almost The Room tier most of the time. And her character was a major pain in the ass.5/10. Wouldn't really recommend this. Kinda wish I steered clear of this movie to begin with.

title: Saved by Ryan Reynolds
text: The story is very basic and fast forwarded.Its basically "lets do this then this and not explain why". Characters feels very hollow and alot of scenes feel improvised on the spot. Some scenes has a "this hade to be done before we can reach our goal" but is skipped by other characters that just randomly appear. Ryan Reynolds carry this movie with funny dialog with some actual thought behind it. Several action scenes that feel unnecessary and just not part of the movie.Thankfully this is a "free movie" on Netflix, because its not worth a 15 dollar ticket.

title: seen it all before but better
text: I like ryan and the rock usually funny and not offensive for our family. Honestly afterward i couldn't really remember what actually happened, so probably shows how much attention this grabs. Sunday afternoon stuff really.

title: Typical Meh Netflix Movie
text: Ryan Reynolds is great as usual, but this could have done without the rock for sure. Gal Gadot was good as well. The other big problem is Netflix doesn't seem to have an actual budget to travel to any locations for filming. All the outdoor shots were cg, and not very good cg either. I didn't mind the story but you are constantly pulled out of it by bad cg shots and the rock, who seems like a very nice guy, but isn't a very good actor sadly. To me it is just another very so so Netflix movie. Seems like that is the best the can do, so so.

title: Reliably entertaining, and that's about it
text: Red Notice pretty shamelessly aims at cashing in on the mega-popularity of its three stars, Johnson, Reynolds, and Gadot. It's a heist/intrigue/spy/action thriller and pretty easy on the eyes. The predictably complex plot has all the twists and turns you can imagine wanting, with James-Bond-like exotic settings all around the world, snappy dialog, expensive toys, fight scenes. It never really drags. And the end, just as obviously, is a setup for a sequel.And of course, just like most such films, it's ultimately just entertainment. The surface is all there is. I thought toward the end it started to collapse of its own weight of double, triple, and quadruple crosses -- as classic reviewer Gene Siskel once said, if anything can happen, then who cares what happens? More isn't always better.Of the three leads, I thought Ryan Reynolds won. The scriptwriters gave him lots of clever dialog that fed perfectly into his talent for Deadpool-like offbeat snark ("Look for a box labelled MacGuffin" put me on the floor laughing). Johnson and Gadot were kind of underused, oddly. I'm not sure that these three actually fit all that well together, in the end.

title: Awful. Not sure how these movies get made
text: This movie wasnt just cheesy, it was horrendous and I'm very forgiving when it comes to movies nowadays. It felt deaperate. What a huge waste of talent and none of this "talent" could see this was a bust? Ooof.

title: Money and stars apparently don't guarantee a good movie.
text: Make a movie shot in international exotic locations. Mix in an over the top plot and spy movie style stunts and special effects. A pinch of humor. Don't forget to add the most beautiful movie woman in the world. What do you get? Unfortunately a turd of a movie. The Rock can only play himself, no matter what his role is. Reynolds is a great actor with a mask on but has the facial expressions of a mannequin. I love James Bond and can even stomach Fast and Furious movies. But this? It's a C rated movie with an A level budget.

title: Ed with Eggs at a wedding
text: This story with stereo-type characters has been done way too often. At each scene I found myself waiting for the actors to deliver gags which sadly, weren't quite funny enough to induce a smirk and all of their characters were unlikeable.
