For some strange reason the bad guy, Soto Voce was trying to sound like Richard Harris's Dumbledore and the lady cop was searching but not quite finding her inner Penelope Cruz. It was such a relief when it was over although the ending was unsatisfying - kinda like the rest of the movie.

title: Monumentally stupid
text: What an irredeemable, humourless hash of trite nonsense that was. Scene after scene you've seen before elsewhere, forced one liners, ludicrous plot filled with holes and children's comic book level science, it was an excruciating two hours.Also, why do people keep casting Gal Gadot? How is she getting work? A complete charisma void.

title: Big budget fail
text: It's another expensively made vehicle for a smirking, wise-cracking Reynolds. I don't think he will be able to act any other way. That is all he is capable of.

title: It is what it is
text: Nothing profound. Don't expect too much. Gal gadot looked gorgeous, Ryan Reynolds and The Rock were likable as always. My wife went asleep half way through the film.

title: OK direction, OK script saved by Ryan Reynolds and Dwayne Johnson
text: This is your standard art thief flick that is mildly entertaining, thanks to the sometimes witty repartee between Reynolds and Johnson. Can't say much for the actress; she's outmatched here. Despite her beauty, she's a bit of dead wood when it comes to acting.

title: Nonsense story
text: With all the security personnel and high tech security vault which of course the main characters failed to get out uncaught The owner simply brings the second treasure egg outside his home, way far from his place with only one security guard. What a stupid unbelievable nonsense act. Also included in the story another stupid explanation on how the antique cars got in the vault because the stairway entrance is way too small is by means of the mine tunnel. The end of the long tunnel is in the middle of the falls. So how will they put the cars in with deep water below and the entrance way up high?

title: Steeling Nazi loot is Crime!!.... its an Egyptian though 😅
text: Gal Gadot is just not the one for this role, its so obvious that she's trying so hard to do her best and it did effects her performance, so obviously she was not in her best days for this role....and one more thing about the ending, did the detective said "steeling Nazi loot is a crime !!!wtf is wrong with you people..it is an Egyptian Monuments for God sake just do your homework and read, we are in the 21st century and you still can't tell what is Loot and What Is Monuments that belongs to A country Called Egypt.This movie could have been sooo much better.....

title: It is OK..that is all there is...
text: I found just a couple of funny moments in this movie otherwise kind of boring. Too much green screen and CGI for my eyes. Too many heartfelt moments. Nice cast but it did not save the movie.

title: Nothing New
text: An Interpol agent and an art thief work together to steal an artifact before someone else does.There is a plot twist at the end of the film that makes it almost good - but the entire film is just a standard action flick. There really isn't anything too new here.

title: Predicable
text: An average action as usual climax predictable and childish. This movie is one time time pass movie. I won't be watching again. Such a childish movie for this 3 actor. It is fun and entertainable only one time though.

title: Adding that tonedeaf ginger was the biggest mistake
text: But yeah the Rock isn't very convincing either.Godot is beautiful, but not the greatest actress either.I rather like Reynolds, but his role is always kind of the same.Kind of easy brainless entertainment for when you're tired, bit nothing remarkable.Trying to combine a caper story like Ocean's Eleven with Indiana Joens was kind of nice though.

title: Hurry, you won't be happy
text: Boring, predictable, disappointing, and more boring. Ryan Reynolds's worst film that I've seen. Over acted by all involved . And did I mention- Boring?

title: Terrible and completely over the top!
text: A combination of over acting and extremely unrealistic scenes rules this movie. For someone who prefers well written and intelligent movies this is not for me.

title: Totally passable. Where is the script?
text:
I can't wait for Netflix to finally start hiring screenwriters. Because for now it seems like every Netflix movie is just one big cliche. Red Notice is no different. Ryan Reynolds is just another Ryan Reynolds persona. He seems to be the same guy in every movie. With the same jokes, the same "serious but funny, with a wink towards the audience" attitude. Dwayne Johnson is generally one huge muscle with some sensitive side (wow, that's really original), and Gal Gadot is just sexy, smart vixen (who really enjoys torturing men genitalia, that part is really creepy).It's not that this movie is bad. It's just mediocre. You just don't care about the characters, the plot makes you sleep, the stakes of the whole movie are just not interesti g. You can literally turn it off at any point and just go to sleep without wonderinf what happened next. Bevause you just don't care.That's because Netflix just doesn't want to hire good screenwriters. Or hires good screenwriters and forces them to write these crappy cliche stories. For example, the whole idea for every character can be sum up in two or three words (at maximum). Gadot: sexy. Reynolds: joker. Johnson: big but sensitive. There isn't a ythong more for any of these characters.It's just so strange that anyone can spend so much money for the movie that has every aspect average at most. The budget of this movie is estimated for 200 mln $ (and it's hard to say why so much, since most of the movie is shot on green screen). To put that into perspective, for this amount of money you could film Nightcrawler (8,5 mln),
Sound of metal (5,4 mln), Promising Young Woman (10 mln), AND Mission Impossible: Fallout (178 mln) That's just crazy! Please stop watcho g those cliche Netflix movies, so maybe one day they will try to make more ambitious movies. Like Amazon does. Or HBO. Or Apple.

title: Big dumb high budget popcorn blockbuster
text: I basically knew what this film was going to be and it didn't surprise. Big budget blockbuster with lackluster script and predictable throughout. Falls flat on its face pretty quickly even with the at times fun dialogue and decent action sequences. This one lays a fat egg for me. Give it a watch if you wanna be ultimately disappointed.

title: Don't waste your time; painful to watch
text: This is really bad which is surprising considering who is in.It's not funny, the characters are unbearably flat, one dimensional and seem to have zero common sense let alone any charisma. The storyline is lame, and the writing so bad I was glad when it was over. It is really bad.

title: Its more exciting watching paint dry
text: For three high level actors the acting at points is like watching cardboard cutouts.Deadpool is there at all times minus the burns and the outfit, the rock does what he always does by smashing things up followed by a witty comment, and Gal Gadot i'm not quite sure what she's meant to be doing throughout the entire film.There are some very funny moments but other than that it really isn't worth the £200 million budget.

title: Just to admire the beautiful Gal.
text: Funny moments but stupid scenario. Just to check out Gal in a bathing suit. The action goes on but we are royally bored.It just passes if and only if you have popcorn.

title: It's an ok movie
text: The transitions from one situation to another are ludicrous and point to poor writing. The movie is entertaining. It has some action, some suspense, some comedy and some deliberate twists that make hardly any sense. Ryan Reynolds is too good an actor and makes Dwayne Johnson look bad. I just felt this all the time. It's like they put two stars in the movie and it just didn't work very well. If they make another movie it might be better but the way the characters were set up in this film they just didn't mesh very well.

title: Autopilot much?!
text: Do I like the charismatic performances of Gadot, Reynolds and Johnson? Yes!Is it something new? No!Red Notice is that Friday evening movie you put on and have a good Netflix-chill. Yes, it had a few twists and great action sequences, but as a concept and story, it's nothing new. Actually I felt by the end, when everything unfolds, I was more interested in the characters and their future storylines.Red Notice 2 could deffo have some potential, if they play this smart - just a shame the actor performances and ideas are just too autopilot for me. Time to bring something new guys!

title: It's a movie
text: If you've ever watched Rick and Mortys Heist Parody episode (S4, E3) then you've basically watched Red Notice. It's filled with the same tropes as every movie before it. What's even more disappointing is that the stakes feel weaker than it's predecessors; heavy plot armor and poorly written motives.Also, all three actors play previous characters from other films; Gadot-Wonder Woman, Reynolds-Deadpool, Johnson-Jumangi. While their names and backstories are different their personalities on screen are one in the same.Overall this movie is just super meh.

title: Been done many times before......
text: 200 million of whatever currency is a lot of dough to spend on anything and i can's see where that money has gone on this sub standard piece of film making. The problem with this is that it doesn't offer anything new or different with the 3 stars all playing their usual type of character. It's a little too long too whilst the special effects are average at best, the bull for example. There is no character development with a routine plot, just a few gags and zero suspence. Sadly bound to be a sequel.

title: Worth Watching
text: Ryan Reynolds was excellent with his quick wit. The dialog in the script would of been lost without him. It had way to many chase and fight scenes and could of been cut down by 30 minutes. I guess the writer/director was trying to have the Fast and Furious look. The story was interesting , but I couldn't understand why they had to take so long in finding the egg. You did not really get a feel for the characters until the end.

title: Dumb writing , boring as hell
text: All these people giving good reviews to this movie must be either very close friends to the director or they have just came out of the cave they have been living in for all their lives and this is the first movie they have ever watched . Totally crappy story with lame jokes , not enjoyable at all. So please don't waste time.

title: A much younger audience maybe...
text: This was a fun movie all throughout. Some picks though.I love Ryan Reynolds but I feel like his becoming a version of Adam Sandler in the 90s... considering they are close in age it's clear Ryan's a late bloomer.Could I have done better ~ Absolutely not, the nazi references were a little too much for such a fun movie, the Egyptian wedding scene was like watching a bad rerun of married at first sight.The plot twist ~ that stood right out for me from the start which sucked as I had to wait until the final 20 min to prove my point lol.Would I watch it again ~ happily.Well done to the amazing cast on production.

title: Low aspiration
text: What happened to Netflix? After those pearls like "Bright" and "Annihilation", all they produce is mid-range mindless standard Hollywood fast food. Stars and budget can't compensate for flat plot, childish humor and really really bad fight scenes and CGI!

title: Dreadful
text: No pizzazz. Obnoxious Reynolds. Ridiculously stupid movie. I could not stop rolling my eyes during the one hour I watched this film. After that, I just couldn't watch this demasculinizing movie. My 4 star rating is only for the special effects.

title: Safed by the Rock and Reynolds
text: This would be one of the worst movies without the Rock and Ryan Reynolds.Luckily they safe it here and there so it's quite endurable.Even got me to laugh sometimes.Unfortunately the rest of the cast is most garbage.The story is decent but nothing special.

title: The vicious cycle of comedy
text:
Jackie Chan has retired but his action fighting style is still alive, this style of comedy is constantly repeated without any new creativity
A simple recipe to save a boring comedy, hire Reynolds, then give him the whole load of fun part, cut, now let's go sell!

title: Pretty stupid but fun stupid
text: The movie is stupid and predictable. Most lines are really pointless and the actions are visibility 3D but my expectations were really low so I didn't hate the film. It's just something to watch and while getting drunk.

title: Boring..
text: I think out of 250 million dollar budget..180 million went in pocket of 2 lead actors... Because there is nothing new to see.. Also does not look like 250 million dollar budget movie.. Look like max 50 million spent on it..I feel bad for Netflix.. As this is a total disaster.. Not engaging... Boring.. 😕😕

title: Well....uhmmm....
text: Perfect example of casting top actors does not ensure a hit. The story's twist was a bit of a surprise but all in all that's only what the movie has. Story is basically generic and the effects were what I usually expect from a big budget Hollywood movie. Watch it if you've got nothing better to do.

title: Red alert
text:
Lame as hell. Reeks of "we've got three big-name actors to pull a crowd here, who needs anything else?"
Plot is pathetic and predictable CGI pathetic, jokes lame. I lost interest with half an hour to go and then they mocked me even further by adding that idiot Sheeran. Give me a break! Don't waste your time on this.

title: Same Old, Same Old
text: Stop making same old movies all over again, PLEASE. It got Boring ten minutes in. These three actors are playing the same character in all their movies. Looks like this $hit was made for thirteen year old's.

title: Meh...
text:
It wasn't bad, but it wasn't good either, just meh...
I kinda thought the plot twist was predictable to some extent, and most of the jokes kinda fell flat.A star studded cast, but not entirely sure about the casting of them. Maybe some other people would have been better, typical roles for Ryan Reynolds and Dwayne Johnson.And it was way too long, could easily have cut half an hour or so.

title: Super Disappointing- Expected A Star Quality Movie
text: There were plenty of great moments here and there but overall the story arch was disappointing. The ending was one of the worst I have ever seen, and I watch hundreds of movies a year.The double, triple, and quadruple crosses got old after a while. I write thrillers and one of the best pieces of advice I have ever received came from one of my writer mentors.He said, "you are only ever allowed one coincidence in your first draft, and in the second draft you must remove it. Period!"I felt disappointed to see that much talent on screen with a script that was a disaster so the stars never really could shine.

title: Funny at times
text: Honestly I really felt like someone took an Indiana Jones plot line, added Deadpool trash talk, sprinkled in horrible scene transitions, and threw Wonder Woman into a typecast for a scene just for fun. All three stars felt typecast in this movie and it's too bad because individually I have enjoyed at least some of their body of work. The one liners were delivered well in many scenes, so at least there's that to look forward to. You could hard pass this movie and not miss much.

title: Just another netflix failure
text: Bad cgi with fake action... just awful. 200m???? HOW!? All locations are fake... and very obviously fake! Lazy filmmaking through and through. And the rock is back in his jungle! Lol.

title: More proof that Netflix/Hollywood the petri dish in which we bred our idiots
text:
Another example of the utter disrespectful way Netflix/Hollywood treat their paying audiences.This movie is mindless garbage packaged up as entertainment. If a majority of normal people thought this was entertaining then humanity is lost.Three mediocre actors in the lead roles and none of them seems to care how bad a performance they put in.Am prepared to Gadot a pass because she can't act to save her life so we expect her to be window dressing and nothing else, although she is running out of years to let her looks get her roles ...... and she has nothing
else going for her.Ryan Reynolds, same role different movie. Keep hoping he will produce something his usual one dimensional character but yet another disappointment. Read in the IMDB reviews of those raving about his performance it suggests to me that they are as one dimensional as Reynolds.The Rock. The very definition of one dimensional. This guy is starting to make Arnie look Shakespearian talent wise.The $200million spent on this garbage would have been put to far better use on sorting out environmental issues and/or world hunger. And no doubt far more satisfying.

title: Deadpool Part 6
text: First id have to point out that this movie was clearly laundering money with a budget of 200M 😂 Where the hell did the money go?Every Ryan Reynolds is just an extension of dead pool and its quite exhausting. The movie is a come and go... nothing to rave about nor that entertaining.

title: Not gonna watch it again
text: I love Gal Gadot so a star extra, 1 star for Reynolds stupidity , rest was for the whole story which didn't exist. Not sure Dwayne Johnson was needed in this movie, and really bad action sequences from him!

title: Copy Paste of 007
text: Copy paste of 007 with little difference in the story, even the music ! Why would they produce such a similarity. They should have changed the music at least! Even the house on the beach is exactly the same!

title: Why so much green screen!
text: This could have been a solid 8 if they didn't film more than half the movie in front a green screen like a made for TV movie. Great cast and perfect pairing with Dwayne and Ryan.

title: Hudson Hawk-like cartoon
text: There's something seriously off with direction of this movie. The three lead actors have all excelled in other roles. The actions scenes were competent if not particularly thrilling. There's humor. There's an art heist. This should have been a good movie. Somehow, it wasn't.It reminded of the old Bruce Willis movie the Hudson Hawk. That had a good cast, humor, an art heist. It should have a good movie. It wasn't.Both movies suffer from a Saturday morning live-action cartoon feel. It's too obvious they're actors being filmed on a movie set: nothing feels authentic. You can all but hear the director saying "action" and the actors asking "line?" as everyone is more focused on the craft services table than they are on the script. It's pantomime as the British would say.The usually reliable Rock needs to put his political ambitions down and work on his acting. He was the worst of the three big names. Ryan Reynolds played Ryan Reynolds, as he does in every performance, such is the extent of his acting gifts. Fortunately Ryan Reynolds is a likable persona, though woefully miscast here. He comes across as a likable dimwit, not some mastermind art thief. Gal Gadot has incredible screen presence, but her comedic chops are non-existent. Her jokes were well-written, but her timing is off and they landed with a thud. She should stick to dramatic roles.What I saw deserved three stars: one each for Johnson, Reynolds and Gadot. I gave it five stars because I turned it off before the end. Maybe it got better? I'll never know. It simply wasn't holding my interest. Five stars.

title: so bad to be a new benchmark
text: Relative to its huge capital investment, this movie can be said to be so bad that it can become a new benchmark.First of all, as a story, there is no innovation at all. It is just a few famous actors in a basic routine that Hollywood has been using for decades.Next, let's talk about performance. The characters have no self, they are all portraits. There is no tacit understanding between the actors, let alone hope for sparks! It's basically like a few familiar puppets reciting boring (or even embarrassing) lines there.Let's talk about scenes and special effects. Can anyone tell me the difference between watching this movie and watching any (very boring) 007 series in recent years?All in all, this is a mediocre work with no sense of existence in any aspect.

title: No competition for Indiana Jones, it is only "ok":
text: The producers tried very hard and it sure has some nice scenes and sets but all in all, I expected more. It's like a cheap Indiana Jones take-off but with a pretty lousy cast.I don't like egg-head Dwayne Johnson anyway. I think he is a terrible actor. I only watched this because of the rating here. Now that I am half disappointed I should have listened to my inner voice: No films with Dwayne Johnson in it!However, Ryan Reynold is good. Probably the only real good actor in the whole film.I fought myself through to the end but honestly, I have seen much better!!

title: A product of 2021 Hollywood
text: It's a painfully average heist movie with very predictable characters and plot twists that will leave you feeling like you didn't need to watch the film to see the twists coming. Staring at the poster for a few minutes will fetch you the same result. Also, Ryan Reynolds forgets to turn off Ryan Reynolds as usual. His "I can't stop talking" gimmick is tiresome in most movies outside of the Deadpool series but is exacerbated here by the terrible script. The humor is expectedly milquetoast as a product of 2021 Hollywood.The only good thing about Red Notice is seeing Gal Gadot in a stunning red dress. Do yourself a favor and watch the Ocean's trilogy instead.

title: Generic action/comedy movie
text: You have seen this movie a ton of times. The only difference it's with the Rock in the jungle and Ryan not as an npc.Mediocre, basic movie that isn't special at all.

title: I expected much more out of this movie
text: I had been looking forward to this movie for a long time. I was excited. Such a great cast and this movie had a lot of potential. Alas!! This movie had a lot of cringy parts. The ending could have been much much better. The Indian lady was annoying. CGI is horrible.

title: Worst movie I've ever seen, would watch again.
text: I just finished watching Red Notice and as the final shot panned over the Heros' next job, I had to project the drastic thought weighing on my mind: "This is the worst movie I have ever seen."Of course, this was a hyperbolic expression of my frustrations. The final shot itself looked gorgeous; a beautiful sunset, as a crane panned over the glass pyramids of the Louvre Museum. Of course this isn't be the worst movie ever made. Everything looks sleek, professional, and generally just aesthetically pleasing. It can't be the worst movie ever made. Maybe the stupidest. Maybe even that's an exaggeration, but my feelings towards the film, while exaggerated and humorously vindictive, were not disingenuous.I was appalled, outraged, and often couldn't stop myself pausing the film to outwardly express my baffled and perplexed questioning of how the film was so comfortable being stupid. Stupid in the sense that it just did not care about anything between the broad strokes of the story. Character actions, intentions, wants, and needs were crystal clear, but it was not in the interest of the film to leave space to ponder if they made much sense.To call the film unrealistic would of course be ridiculous. It is an action-adventure comedy after all. But as the film kept up a snazzy pace, bombarding forward in big, bold, cavalier steps, however clear, brash, and successful a currier of story and character information, I felt I had to put my foot down, pause the apple TV and scream "This is a cartoon!". I never actually did this. But after the credits had rolled, this was the thought lingering on my mind. The logic of the film was more cartoon-like than film.I've heard this criticism frequently and generally you get what it's trying to say. But I promise man, the movie is like a cartoon. In the same way watching a cartoon doesn't always require you to question the details of what's going on. It eases your ability to suspend disbelief. You're watching drawings giving the illusion of a world beyond the screen. Because it's a cartoon, an exaggerated, stylized, version of the familiar, you don't have to question the minutia of how a character's watch operates. Film props similarly take advantage of this as well, but in a cartoon it's simply a drawn representation of a watch. A drawing that implies the inner machinations within; ones that you don't need to see. You accept this drawn representation as a symbol and take it at face value. You recognize the symbols, tropes, and broad strokes a cartoon can imply, but you don't place the practicality, probability and feasibility of its world and characters under the same microscope you would use on reality. These fantastical worlds can create rules and machinations of their own; some unique and some that mirror, reflect, and pay lip-service to those found in the one we know all too well. To put these two worlds under the same microscope would of course defeat the whole purpose.Maybe this is the trap I fell into by allowing the world of "Red Notice" to affect me the way it did. Of course we understand the "Hollywood" representation of the world to be a fantastical one. Some films choose to faithfully depict reality, and some choose to "Hollywood-ize" it. Give it the pinch and dash of unique fantasy and heightened reality a "Hollywood" picture can offer its audience. Maybe I'm wrong to place expectations that clearly differ with the ones the film presents. And my outrage is simply as meaningful as battling windmills.Well, I reject your reality and substitute my own.The film does exactly what it sets out to do. It offers us likable, charismatic performances from a trio of two impossibly good-looking people and Ryan Reynolds. It casts this exaggerated team of "best-at-what-they-do" thieves and special agents on a fun globe-trotting adventure; with plenty of quick-witted banter and emotional character-informing scenes along the way. It generally looks very pleasing, with world-spanning locations, sexy costumes and a generous helping of golden beams, bathing and highlighting the sense of grandeur and adventure.It's a fun comedy action-adventure movie!But it's stupid! It's silly, it's ridiculous!It may look pleasing but always phony. Not real. Consistently sleek, well-designed, live-action cartoon fluff. I guess you could make this accusation against a lot of big-budget studio productions, but... no but. It's a fun ride with charismatic characters that depend on the charisma of the actors. As overly dependent on the stars as they are on their function in the story.I don't think it holds all that much weight.I want to compare it to another action-adventure comedy from what is now two decades back: Saharah. The one starring Mathew McConoughey, in a high budget, start-driven adventure production. Also globe-trotting. To be fair, you could cast a lot of similar accusations against this film. Criticisms about the substance of the characters and the tropes it indulges. But I recall this adventure with far more fondness and tangibility than I think a kid watching "Red Notice" would in two decades from now. Maybe not a perfect story or comparison and one that's seasoned with a big dash of childhood fondness and nostalgia, but a story that feels a lot more real than the quick-witted, sleek, phony facade this film puts up.

title: Very disappointing
text: Extremely disappointing. It's a shame that such great actors accept to venture into such a nonsense movie. I normally wait for movies from these actors. It was a real waste of time.I greatly value the actors who do not take on a movie unless it's good.

title: What is this
text: The best actor in this movie is Ryan Reynolds and without this actor no movie. Now we can believe and sure in that Ryan Reynolds is best comedian actor in this age.

title: Annoyingly watchable film with all it flaws
text: Trying to write a review is hard for this film. Everything i try to Write for its pros I get some cons straight away. But I still enjoyed it. WhyOh yes another gal gadot film with dodgy CGI that's my review.

title: Entertaining if you have nothing else to do
text: I like the cast, but the movie is predictable and unintelligent. Let's be honest, it's a children's movie. It's the first time, I didn't find Ryan Reynolds entertaining. The Rocks performance was ok and Gal Gadot need a few more acting lessons.

title: If only it would end
text: If there was ever a film that was too try-hard with camera movement, obvious plot lines and terrible CGI it's Red Notice.Drone shots can be interesting and can contribute to the story, they can also be incredibly tacky and irrelevant to the story and that's what happened here. I found myself laughing out loud when drone shot after drone shot were paired alongside each other.The film attempts to have the international feel of Jason Bourne but slapping the names of cities in big bold letters over yet another drone shot doesn't quite cut it to convince the viewer they're anywhere other than a studio or ironic location.Eyeing off the set in the prison scenes makes me almost smell the cardboard and spray paint through the screen.Casting was great, Reynolds nails the charisma as always and The Rock does what The Rock does best. Unfortunately Gal Gardot is treated a little too much like a piece of meat in this film, she doesn't need to be in a revealing dress or predictably skimpy swimsuit to be visible.Let's hope this kind of film is some sort of horrible joke that won't survive the next generation of creators.

title: Even Ryan Reynolds Can't Fix This.
text: I must say that I thoroughly enjoyed the different trailers and advertising put into this. However, the movie itself, quite disappointing. I was excited to see Rawson Marshall Thurber directing another film in his favourite genre. The basic Action/Comedy Genre that's been pulled through the wringer a thousand times with movies such as Central Intelligence. I can confidently say the man loves some Dwayne Johnson in his films! Does anyone remember Skyscraper? Yeah. Neither do I. However, I did enjoy the twist. Was it necessary? Probably not, but after watching over 40m of an uneventful heist movie, I thoroughly enjoyed it. Did Ryan Reynolds have some funny and witty lines? Sure. But that tactic hasn't worked for a while now. There has to be a solid and intriguing story with a strong theme, no matter the genre. A-list actors should not be your number one selling point. And my god, they're already teasing a sequel? Yikes.

title: Fast, fun movie, thrilling getaways - Mission Possible only in movies
text: RED NOTICE - for those who are on a 'sugar-free-no-kisses movie' diet after Christmas. This cop-n-bad guy-gal-team movie is like a mixture of Ocean 11 / Mission Impossible / Indiana Jones rolled into a giant pie pastry. Quite a tasty, meaty dish.It's a fast action fun thriller, but blink - and you'll miss a clue. Luckily, there is the rewind button. Enjoyable, slick acting, glam scenes, and unbelievable getaways.Mission Possible only in movies or if you had rehearsed all the stunts a 1,000 times with doubles, extras, stuntmen on the standby and you could 'edit out' any mistakes you made. In real life there is no edit/rewind button - only security dogs that bite.

title: One of the worst movies i have ever seen
text: Basic story overdone a 100000 times , while sometimes cliches done right can still hit , this one just gets boring . Also the female lead is better suited as a villain she has such sharp and exotic feautures excuding evilness .

title: Is Red Notice a copy of the Egyptian movie Les Baghdad
text: At the beginning, I must say the movie is really great and the comedy that brings together Ryan and Dwayne is very amazing, and I hope that other films will bring them together.Now let's go back to the topic I wanted to talk about, which is Red Notice imitating the Egyptian movie Les BaghdadThere is not much similarity in the story of the two films, which is to reach the treasure in the end, and certainly, there are many obstacles that face them, from other people who want to obtain this treasure as well and from traveling in many countries, and this is what made there a similarity in the two filmsYou can confirm for yourself if you watch the two films and compare themNow which of the two films was released first?Definitely, the Egyptian movie Les Baghdad released before Red NoticeBut the part that many people don't know is that the movie Red Notice was written before Les Baghdad but was not released at that time due to the onset of the covid-19 outbreak.

title: Slow and boring, Hollywood writing at its best
text: You can pass on this movie. It is slow and boring, all actors are one dimensional and uninspiring. The only thing going for it is Gal Godot. Nothing new, it's a classic post Covid Movie.

title: I did enjoy it
text: Some critics are always the same. People expecting an Oscar winning movie from an action romantic comedy.My opinion: I did enjoy this classic heist and everyone played well their roles. Quite a few turns with an expected but hilarious actuation.I know I rated this too high.. but I'll happy to see a media of 7.

title: Mixup of old stuff, nerv-wreking Reynolds - no thanks.
text: Well, I was unbiased before the movie, did not read critics and blogs here or elsewhere about this movie.But, one thing is for shure: Reynolds is not near as fun anymore with his role and jokes in a regular movie as compared to Deadpool - allthough the same jokes are used - it's utter boredom and ennerving - repetition and a complete waste of time.The plot is pretty obvious and the roleplay hollow, as are the under-paar effects and the pretty down mediocre CGI-stuff. Elements of well known movies are mixed togheter without any thought (Jumanji, DC-Verse, Indiana Jones, misc Heistmovies, DanBrownStuff etc.) - it's profanity in a loud and colorful sceme - Trash, with try-to-be classy wrapping.All in all, it was a waste of time, hollow, shallow and well, I will gladly avoid any movie with Reynolds in the near and far future.

title: Everything about this is tremendously generic
text: Don't give this movie more views please. Vote with your wallet that you deserve more passionate, personal stories than these soul-less, formulaic turds.If you are thinking of watching this, don't. You are not gonna be getting anything special and memorable out of it.

title: a divertissement with star power
text: Tongue-in-cheek action-comedy unites The Rock, Deadpool, and Wonder Woman so they can...well seemingly so they can get paid. As things begin an American fed who's an expert profiler is working abroad to aid Interpol in the capture of an elusive art thief, until the plot requires them to team up. Self-referential, with flavors of buddy movie, double-crossing, and espionage, but clearly pilfers from other films (ahem, Indiana Jones) and some too obviously unreal visual effects dilute the lush scenery. The banter between fast-talking Reynolds and muscle-bound Johnson frequently falls flat, but Gadot brings some heat as a masterful thief whose skill and savvy dwarfs their own. This would be really disappointing, but with all the comic schtick and conveniences of the script you never take it seriously. **

title: Crimetime
text: Casted with named actors with an over the top plot. What I find fascinating is the layers of special effect and the extreme use of them. I also wonder how much of the did the actors really have to be there for? Great little joyride.

title: Another typical Hollywood action wannabe-comedy
text: Not worth a ticket in theater. Good enough for Netflix. Good for people between ages 15-30 or low education. Not for people who are true moviegoers of 100+ movies per year. Featuring typical action fighting scenes of man that looks like closet but is blitz fast and model woman with extreme fighting skills and power. Same ol crap that we are seeing frequently for last 15yrs. Same formula for average Joe.
